description:
Kulkmann's G@mebox

The SPIEL '15 Games Convention at Essen / Germany

It was only made available as a free downloadable, print and play card.

This is a new public action card for Artifacts Inc.. The players can place a cube here, and if the player who has placed the cube still has the cube on the card at the start of his turn, he will gain a Victory Point.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Parched
description:
Parched is a coaster-based board game in which two competing players race to irrigate their hop or coffee bean farm. The octagonal, coaster pieces are reorganized by opponents through a card laying mechanic to create a blue line of waterway edges from the water source to their respective end coaster. Trick-taking card play is augmented by action cards allowing players set up large changes in the board state, and the presence of event cards introduces a small element of randomness. Whatever the methods, the goal is simple: connect your farm to the water source through a series of irrigation channels. How hard can it be?

What is a coaster-based board game?
Parched has dual functionality as a game and set of coasters. The game is housed in a wooden display case that is intended to live out on a coffee table or bar top, so that sealed, wooden game tiles are always within reach to hold a drink. This novel idea isn't a gimmick, though, the functionality is a logical offshoot of the story behind the game itself.

The Story
Reseco is a country with a rich history of brewing coffee and beer; however, recent drops in rainfall and redirection of water to a burgeoning kale and avocado industry are causing ripples across an increasingly arid landscape. The people are parched and so are their crops: beans and hops. Determining where the limited water gets directed is problematic, to say the least. Koffee Kings and Best Buds Hops find themselves at the center of the problem. They have come together to solve the issue using what they have on hand, drinking vessels and coasters, to negotiate the direction of irrigation channels on their overlapping properties.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Map Deformation, Network and Route Building, Trick-taking

name: Rhonin's Lore
description:
Rhonin's Lore is a tabletop board game for one to four players that will take adventurers on a journey to fight against a dark force of creatures from lore. Adventurers may choose to take on the monster lords claiming dominion over the different terrains of the region, defend the villages surrounding the kingdom's strongholds, or, for the bravest of mortals, or take on the might of the great Archons of legends. This game offers both cooperative and player vs. player game play experiences as well as mini scenarios to explore the map and adventurer backstories.

Adventurer's have been asked to help save Renwood from impending doom by defeating the monster lords. Adventurers have 15 days until the full moon rises and must grow their strength by defeating the creatures flooding into the land and acquiring upgraded weapons and armour. As the full moon nears, more powerful creatures will begin surfacing and the prophets of the kingdom speak of the monster lords entering the fight at the start of the 12th day. If the monster lords still live at the end of the 15th day, the realm is lost.

The game utilizes a hex-based map to identify different regions of Renwood. The map tiles may be rearranged to a players preference, but it is recommended to play the first game with the original map layout with later gameplay randomly placing the tiles within the region. Monsters will be summoned each night based on the summoning cards drawn by players. The summoning cards will identify the level monster (Minion, Legionnaire, Pendragon) that will be summoned based on the player's level and the space for which a monster will be summoned. The type of monster will be determined based on the terrain tile that occupies the space identified on the summoning card. Each player will draw one summoning card to begin each day of their adventure.

The first encounters recounted in Rhonin's Lore originate from the land of Renwood. Renwood is a beacon of hope and a stronghold for peace in a region known as home to many creatures of lore. A balance has existed in the land for centuries as those seeking peace have learned to be weary of the lands claimed by the monsters of their lore. Those who venture into the dark seldom return and the monsters that lie within would seldom venture out, at least until the shifting of the winds. A fog and a darkness swept in and with it, the unspoken boundaries of old have been broken and the villages and paths, once safe in the light of the southern sun, are covered in a dark cold mist. The creatures of lore and only seen in nightmares reveal themselves again in flesh as their sights are set once more upon those who drove them into darkness.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: Ath – Cité des Géants
description:
Official Monopoly game for the City of Ath in Belgium.

Properties include La Jardinerie de Beloeil, Chez Pauchea, Le Drink des Primeveres, La Jeune Chambre D'Ath, and Chez Loiselet.


La ville d’Ath est attestée depuis le Moyen-Age.
En 1166, le comte du Hainaut Baudouin IV fait construire un puissant donjon, la tour Burbant, au confluent des Dendres orientale et occidentale.
Peu à peu, une cité se crée et se développe.
L’église Saint-Julien avec son clocher caractéristique est édifiée au début du 15ème siècle.
L’hôtel de ville baroque remonte au règne des Archiducs Albert et Isabelle.
Enfin, au milieu du 17ème siècle, le maréchal Vauban fortifie la cité et en fait une des plus belles place-fortes d’Europe.

Mais aujourd’hui, ce sont des personnages gigantesques qui font la renommée d’Ath. Goliath et son épouse, et tous leurs congénères, sont les emblèmes de la Ducasse, reconnue chef-d’œuvre de l’humanité par l’Unesco.
Chaque année, le quatrième week-end d’Août, des milliers de visiteurs se donnent rendez-vous à Ath pour vibrer au rythme des Géants.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Dico Games, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Monopoly: La Louvière – Cité des Loups
description:
A Monopoly dedicated to the City of La Louvière in Belgium.

Made for part of the 150th anniversary of the city of Wolves.

There was a first run of 1500 and a second run of 1000.


En vous procurant l’incontournable jeu de plateau, vous pourrez arpenter les rues de la Cité des Loups et même y côtoyer la RAAL au cours de parties endiablées.

description:
The Mouscronnoise edition does not present streets with prestigious names but local businesses or organizations well known to Mouscronnois.

Walk in the city of Mouscron through the original drawings of Monopoly Mouscron, city of Hurlus designed by Jean Marc Krings.

Only 1500 copies made.


Venez vous promener dans la ville de Mouscron au travers des dessins originaux du Monopoly Mouscron.

L’édition mouscronnoise ne présente pas de rues aux noms prestigieux mais des commerces locaux ou des organisations très connus des Mouscronnois.

Houses and hotels are made of wood.
Gilded metal tokens.

name: Monopoly: Binche – Cité du Gille
description:
To mark the fifteenth anniversary of Unesco, the City of Binche had the idea to publish a Monopoly to his colours. 1,500 copies of this version was made and was a great success.

We know Binchou's love for their City of the Gille so everything has been thought of in this special version to flatter the nice Chauvinism binchois. Players can buy emblematic places in their city, starting from the newly renovated Chapelle de Bettignies to the Hôtel de Ville, the most expensive acquisition.

Even the banknotes are in the colours of the folklore, taking again the characters of the carnival. Attention to detail, the famous chance cards and community box do not escape the binchoise sauce. Depending on the pickaxe, your fat Sunday costume will be offered, you will receive money to buy mimosa or a new Gille mask.


Pour marquer le quinzième anniversaire de l'Unesco, la Ville de Binche a eu l'idée de publier un Monopoly à ses couleurs.
1 500 exemplaires de cette version ont été réalisés et ont été un grand succès.

On connaît l'amour des Binchoux pour leur cité du gille, alors tout a été pensé dans cette version spéciale pour flatter le sympathique chauvinisme binchois.
Les joueurs peuvent acheter des lieux emblématiques de leur ville, de la Chapelle de Bettignies récemment rénovée à l'Hôtel de Ville, l'acquisition la plus chère.

Même les billets sont aux couleurs du folklore, reprenant les personnages du carnaval.
Souci du détail, les fameuses cartes chance et boite communautaire n'échappent pas à la sauce binchoise.
Selon la pioche, votre gros costume du dimanche vous sera offert, vous recevrez de l'argent pour acheter du mimosa ou un nouveau masque de gille.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Arole Editions, Hasbro, Winning Moves France

name: Monopoly: Dendermonde
description:
Dendermonde, city of teeth and head meat fretters, is without a doubt the most beautiful city on the Dender.
Historic buildings in the city center, dating back to the Middle Ages, are complemented by modern architecture, art, culture and a vibrant atmosphere.

Monopoly Dendermonde is the ideal way to (re)discover Dendermonde in a different way.
Visit the City Hall, go for a walk in the city park, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, sell kopvlees or buy tickets for the Ros Beiaardommegang! This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Dendermonde has to offer.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Scrub's Center for American Medicine
description:
Everyone is Valued at SCAM! Players are business directors of specialized Wards in a hospital. Players compete to have the most profitable ward. In doing so, players will attempt to admit the most valuable patients to their ward, manage their Public Relations, and "get rid" of poorer patients from their wards by transferring them to other wards or simply letting the poorer patients "expire."

Players will first draft a hand of procedure cards that will allow them to cleverly manage patients in wards and in the waiting room. Players will then play these procedure cards to triage patients to their advantage and commit medical malpractice in the name of the almighty dollar. At the end of each round, players will bill the patients currently admitted in their wards and claim any PR bonuses.

The game revolves around a line management mechanic: Players will always admit the first patient in line in the waiting room, so carefully playing procedure cards to put valuable patients to the front of the line on your turn is key! Each player will also organize patients in their wards in five different rooms. Each room increases in the amount that you can charge a patient, so try to put more valuable patients to the right. However, if they go too far and must be shifted right, the patient will die. This lowers your Public Relations score, which lowers your chance at a bonus for the end of the round.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Line Drawing, Open Drafting

name: Mines of Goldstett
description:
Overview:

In the game "Mines of Goldstett" there are two opponent teams, Kobolds and Goblins playing against each other. Each team consists of 1-2 players and competes either for the gold reserves or the supremacy in the mines.

In short: "Mines of Goldstett" is a tactical, team worker placement game played on a modular, modifiable board, therefore every single match is unique. The game is designed to grant an easy access for new players, while it is hard to master it`s full tactical opportunities.

Story:

At a time when kobolds and goblins were still resident in Goldstett, a deep vein of gold was found within the local mines. Both parties heard about the good news at the same time. The kobolds were happy, as it was enough gold to bury it at the end of the rainbow. On the other hand the goblins would rather invest the gold to attend the "All-You-Can-Drink" event in their local pub... However, the fact that both parties had their eyes on the gold vein poses a problem for the opponents: the gold was not enough for everyone, and even though the kobolds and the goblins were equally good at digging and making tools, they were awful fighters. So both decided on their own to intimidate the rivaling party with elaborately crafted weapons and to chase them out of the caves...

Gameplay:

Each turn consist of 3 parts.
-The active player rolls the dice (2x 10d-dices)
Those indicate which tunnel plates yield resources.
Each player occupying the corresponding plates draws resource cards.
-The active player may then move his 3 worker on any tile that is attached to his tunnel system
-and perform one action.
Each worker may either:
1) dig to exchange the tunnel plate he/she is standing on
2) attach on unoccupied plate to the tunnel system of the
player
3)or frighten away a rival worker
To frighten away a rival worker the player needs to equip
enough resource cards to reach a suitable frightening level,
while the rival players may use their resource cards, to reduce the effect of the players invasion.

The team that either occupies the goldmine in the center
long enough to get 9 gold pieces or banishes on rival player from his/her cave wins the match.

Each player may support his/her teammate with resource cards at any given time.

If there are less than 4 players, players may also utilize the workers and cave from their "missing" teammate.

-description from designer
mechanics: King of the Hill, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Trudvang Legends: Lost Stories
description:
Lost Stories is an expansion consisting of all the Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goals unlocked for Trudvang Legends. It includes 13 Heroes, 20 Enemies and a Storybook with 10+ one-shot stories to add to any campaign as well as 200+ cards and tokens.

—user description
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Ni-ju-san
description:
To reach enlightenment you must find, follow, and complete your path, but you are not alone, there are others on this path. The path is not for the timid, if enlightenment were easy, everyone would attain it. It is ever changing, and there are perils to keep even the wisest from succeeding. Choose your actions carefully!

Ni-jū-san is a set-making and tile-laying card game where the play path is continually changing! The game is played in two phases. In the first phase players lay cards from their hand on the table to form a path. In phase two the players use the cards from their hand to move their tokens along this path. The player who reaches the end of the path and plays 23 (ni-ju-san in Japanese) wins!

There are numbered cards and special cards. The numbered cards are used to form the path on the table, but they are also the primary means to move tokens along the path. Players discard sets of numbered cards that match the numbered path card in front of their token in order to move forward. Special cards may be played to do many things. These cards can move players forward and backward along the path, reshuffle player hands, and most importantly: change the path. Cards on the path can be swapped out, and the path can be extended or reduced in size. It can also be split to form multiple ends.

-description from designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: La Réunion
description:
Travel to the island of La Réunion, east of Madagascar and southwest of Mauritius.
Famous for his 2 volcanoes, the Piton de la Fournaise is one of Earth's most active volcanoes, the Piton des Neiges is dormant.

The spaces represent businesses (private and public) of the island rather than the island heritage and local features
