description:
Includes four USA courses:

Baltus Roll Farm GC, Springfield, NJ
Empire Oaks CC (East), Pittsford, NY
Thousand Lakes Pro Course, Blaine, MN
Motown Crown GC, Detroit, MI
mechanics: Simulation

name: Overlay Strike
description:
Overlay Strike is a two-player turn based battle card game where players Overlay, Defend and Draw to reduce their opponents score from 100 down to 0 before your opponent does the same to you!

To Overlay you must stack cards of different ranks from your hand. You'll draw through your deck to get Overlay resources and defense cards as you race to get your opponents score down.

Overlay Strike contains two identical 56-card decks with 40 point cards, 8 draw cards and 8 defense cards. Games last ten to fifteen minutes with one to two rounds being played per game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, End Game Bonuses, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Upgrade Kit
description:
With the 30 enemy cards contained in Nova Aetas Renaissance: Upgrade Kit, you can insert the many enemies of the core Nova Aetas game, the expansions, and the stretch goals into Nova Aetas Renaissance.

Many missions involve the use of random enemies and scenery. Enemies can be spawned thanks to the draft cards and reinforcement points. These are particular scenic elements that modify the map, or from which one or more enemies can be deployed on the battlefield, at particular times within the missions.

When this happens, you will have to form an enemy deck with all the draft cards of a faction and randomly draw the enemy to deploy. For this phase, you can insert the draft cards from the conversion kit to add variability to your games and confront a wider variety of enemies!

Here is a list of the cards that you will find in the Kit divided by faction:

Rome

-Battle Sister
-Papal Guard
-Swiss Guard
-Caterina Sforza
-Lothar Basler
-Templar
-Cardinal
-Blacksmith

Venice

-Assassin
-Stratiota
-Witch
-Crossbowman
-Giovanni del Nord
-Cabalist
-Traveler
-Hunter

Fauns

-Centaur
-Faun Warrior
-Faun Musician

Mercenary

-Pigman
-Circe
-Head Cultist
-Scarface
-Obsidian Beast
-Cyclop
-King Vesuvio
-Lady of Fire
-Condottiere
-Mater Ignis
-Salamanders

You will be able to include these enemies in all missions that feature random enemies depending on their faction. Mercenaries are a particular category of enemies that can join multiple factions.

In addition to the enemies, this kit gives you access to some of the old scenic elements contained in the original game, with the following 6 cards:

-Well x1
-Inn x1
-Pine x1
-House x1
-Goods crates x1
-Chart x1

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Under Siege
description:
May 5, 1527, a day that will be remembered forever, for one of the bloodiest and most famous sieges in history, the Sack of Rome.

The Imperial army led by General Frundsberg and composed of the Landsknecht, ruthless mercenaries from Germany and Spain, are about to enter Rome to sack it and capture the Pope... Only you can prevent it!

Set years after the main campaign of Nova Aetas: Renaissance, in Under Siege you will find your favorite heroes to be more mature and engaged in an impossible mission! This new Campaign made up of 10 new frenetic Missions will see you engaged in the desperate task of resisting the Imperial assault and saving the Pope, before it's too late ... but you will have to be shrewd and brave, the enemy army is not composed only of humans!

Each Mission will be a race against time, always with different mechanics to manage the massive clashes between the defenders of Rome (including the miniatures of the core box faction of Rome) and the ruthless assailants!

In Under Siege, you will find 4 new Tiles and new scenic elements to represent Renaissance Rome, such as the spectacular Aqueduct/the door to the City/Passetto (an elevated secret passage)!

In Under Siege, you'll also find a new Hero, Brynhildr the Lancer, a warrior of German origin who came to Rome to help the Pope against his former compatriots.

Finally, Under Siege introduces the Allies to NAR! Allies can be added to your company and will help you with Missions. Giovanni dalle Bande Nere, the brave captain in defense of the Eternal City, will be able to join your group as a model in its own right and you can control him as if he were an additional hero, but with more limited rules.

Plus, you'll have fantastic new miniatures, new special items, and new rules to represent the German tide sweeping through the city's neighborhoods!

Get ready, the siege is about to begin!

-description from kickstarter
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Vesuvio
description:
Our Heroes will have to investigate the surroundings of the Volcano to find traces of the mysterious Cult of the Forge, a band of possessed who is making ferocious attacks in the area!
Members of this cult inflict terrible tribal mutilation on themselves to resemble the gigantic creatures they worship.

The Cyclops are the true protagonists of this new adventure. Master smiths, but also mighty warriors, led by their King Vesuvio are looking for ancient artifacts scattered around the slopes of their volcano, and to find them they won't hesitate to attack villages and cities!

It will be up to our Heroes to investigate and put an end to this threat, in an adventurous journey that will take them through the buried streets of ancient Pompeii, to the heart of the Volcano, where the Forge of Vesuvio is about to be rekindled!

This rich expansion will add a new campaign that can be played between the end of the main campaign and Under Siege and adds a new Faction, The Forge, made up of the Scarfaces, the Head Cultist, Obsidian Beasts (bigger!), Cyclops, and of course King Vesuvio himself!

The campaign consisting of 10 new missions (completely revised from the original), can be finished with 4 different endings and will take you to explore new fantastic locations represented by new 3D scenic elements (such as the semi-destroyed houses of Pompeii or the Obelisk of the Forge), and by two new Map Tiles!

-description from kickstarter page
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Catacombs
description:
Catacombs take Nova Aetas: Renaissance's gameplay experience to a new level by transforming it into a true Dungeon Crawler.

As you know Nova Aetas: Renaissance is a tactical RPG, where the Missions are real cooperative clashes with precisely written objectives to be met in order to achieve victory.

With Catacombs the game system will be adapted to live adventures in pure dungeon crawler style, with our Heroes busy exploring sites buried for centuries and now inhabited by creepy creatures.

Catacomb will offer players a new mini secondary campaign (3 Missions), which can be undertaken when, at any point in the main campaign, the Heroes are in Rome.

You will have the opportunity to explore the Domus Aurea, the ancient home of Emperor Nero, now buried for centuries. Entering its corridors in search of riches, you will have to face Nero himself (well at least what remains of him) and his horde of undead constructs, awakened by a dark primordial force, and ready to invade the city sowing terror and destruction!

But the potential of Catacomb does not end there! Since the vestiges of the Roman Empire are found everywhere in Italy, you can throw yourself into the exploration of other catacombs in any city that has the keyword "Catacomb", and face always different dungeons created with a simple procedural system.

The really super thing about this mode will be that you will also be able to meet other factions of Enemies within the Catacomb, representing other groups of tomb raiders, who descended into the dungeon with the same intentions as you!

Whenever you want, you can take a break from the normal Nova Aetas: Renaissance Missions and spend an evening in dungeon crawler style, throwing yourself into the Catacombs in search of loot!

Plus, Catacomb is perfect if you want to play Nova Aetas: Renaissance one-shot games without worrying too much about having to keep track of the Mission for the future!

Descending into the catacombs will give you a completely different gaming experience from the base game and will reward you with special loot cards and new recipes for creating powerful special items.

But you will not be alone in facing the hordes of undead legionaries, a new Hero: Luca "Skavino" will join your group and guide you through the maze of dungeons with his skills and taking advantage of the many relics of the past that he found in his underground forays!

A survival expert, and ever resourceful, Luca will be a very different Hero from the others and will use a special Relic Deck to help his companions or easily eliminate Enemies! Obviously, it can be used in any Mission and not just inside the Catacomb.

What are you waiting for then? Prepare ropes and torches ... the Catacombs await you!

-description from the Kickstarter
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Jockey & Grand Prix
description: Compilation of Jockey and Grand Prix.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil

name: EQUILIBRIX Project
description: Project is actually an extension of the game Connect, because it uses most of the material from it and develops the main game principles in depth. This time, however, it is a political game in which you try to build various geometric shapes together. But you also get points for encircling your opponent.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: It Really Ties The Room Together
description:
A game about replacing your defiled rug.

It Really Ties The Room Together is a postcard game to be played with a standard deck of cards, inspired by The Big Lebowski, released in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

There's a little tactical element of the placement of your cards, and there's also a cool card draft where you can just ditch the whole pile of cards and end the round, but at the heavy cost of going last next turn. All in all, a fun little game inspired by a fun little movie.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Closed Drafting

name: Farbiossis Vernissage
description:
“Farbiossis Vernissage” is a handmade wooden family game from 10 years up made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria. Who can best achieve the most points by cleverly collecting and swapping combinations of images?

The goal of the game is to get the most pictures into the own gallery.

At start every player gets 8 pictures on his sorting station.

In each round every player has to put at least 1 (max. 3) of this pictures on his paletts.
The pictures have 3 different characteristics: background, colour and motive. Collect pictures on a palett, that have at least 2 characteristics, that fit.

Then each player fills up his sorting station with new pictures from the reserve.

Every player looks, what picture he didn't need to collect a combination and puts that picture into the middle of the table.

Then everyone chooses pictures from the middle of the table for his sorting station.

If you have no picture that fits to the pictures on the paletts you must bring the pictures of one palette into the gallery and get points.

When the reserve is empty the game ends.

The player who reaches the most points is the winner of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Encore: Adrenaline Battle
description:
Encore can be played 1v.1, 4v.4, 2v.7 or even solo. Will you be the cool and determined team blaze or energetic and speedy team lightning? Draw from the center action card pile and your own time card pile to begin the game. As you do your workout hand, the other team rests, but watch out! If you are caught resting after the other team has finished their round, you get to go overtime.

Every game you play is a different workout, sit-ups for 60 seconds and then burpees for 90 anyone? Probably not, but in that case you can always take your chances by drawing a wild card. By adding or taking out different amounts of time cards and workout cards, you can customize your difficulty level. You can also decide to start adding victory cards before or after the 8 minute mark to change the level of challenge. Various game modes from True Victor to Team Relay are also included in the instruction manual.

Once a team’s total time cards add up to 8 minutes, a victory card is shuffled into the time card pile. Now they have the chance to win! For every consecutive minute, another victory card is added to the time card pile until one team draws a victory card. This team is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Interrupts, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Whisperers Faction Set
description:
This faction starter contains the cards and rules you need to bring the dangerous Whisperers group and their gruesome minions to the tabletop and your games of Call to Arms. In addition, bonus cards are provided for the All Out War miniatures game.

description:
These gruesome minions will swell the ranks of your Whisperers, striking fear into the hearts of your opponents in your games of Call to Arms. In addition, bonus cards are provided for the All Out War miniatures game.

name: Monopoly: Brugge
description:
The Monopoly Brugge edition of the game remains true to the original concept but was given a Bruges look in terms of content and graphics.
All locations are filled in with well-known streets, squares and sights of Bruges.

Not only the locations, but also the graphical design radiates Bruges.
The box, the board and the properties are given a Bruges look & feel.
Also, the Community Chest and Chance cards have not only been changed in terms of look and feel, but are also interspersed with numerous Bruges references.

Only 4000 made.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Heath Booster
description:
Heath is an intensely intelligent member of the Alexandria community. While he often comes across as aloof, or even cynical, he is utterly dedicated to the protection of those around him. He often plays the part of a naysayer, but is not afraid to take up arms and fight when the need arises.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Heath & Spencer and cards

Card included are:

Heath and Spencer Character Cards for All out war and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Knapsack, Balisong and Rope.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Equipment Cards
description:
As the name suggests, Call to Arms represents larger scale conflicts. The lone travelers struggling to survive in what’s left of the world have now formed communities, built walls, and gathered arms. However, the harsh conditions outside their walls have led these groups to fear the outside world. They see other groups as a threat to their very existence — no longer are the dead the only ones to fear.

This pack contains cards for a wide variety of weapons, armor, and other equipment that are exclusive to The Walking Dead: Call to Arms.

These can be used to upgrade your survivors and arm them to suit your strategy in battle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Lawful Faction Cards
description:
As the name suggests, Call to Arms represents larger-scale conflicts. The lone travelers struggling to survive in what’s left of the world have now formed communities, built walls, and gathered arms. However, the harsh conditions outside their walls have led these groups to fear the outside world. They see other groups as a threat to their very existence — no longer are the dead the only ones to fear…

This pack contains all the rules and stats you need to use any member of the lawful factions – including the Atlanta Camp and the Greene Family.

Contents: 48 Character Cards and 12 Equipment Cards

In the Lawful pack, you’ll find rules for the following characters:


Rick Grimes Atlanta Camp Leader
Rick Grimes Prison Advisor
Rick Grimes Disfigured but Determined
Carl Grimes Cynthiana Survivor
Carl Grimes Defiant Son
Lori Grimes Cynthiana Survivor
Shane Jealous Cop
Andrea Skilled Sharpshooter
Andrea Prison Sniper
Amy
Dale Atlanta Lookout
Dale Prison Advisor
Glenn Atlanta Scavenger
Glenn Prison Guard
Maggie Greene Prison Defender

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Ruthless Factions Cards
description:
This pack contains all the rules and stats you need to use any member of the ruthless factions – including Woodbury, the Prisoners, and the Hunters.

Contents: 45 Character Cards and 12 Equipment Cards

In this deck, you’ll find rules for the following characters:

Brian Blake The Governor
Brian Blake Mutilated and Merciless
Brian Blake Trophy Collector
Gabe Harris
Bruce Cooper
Martinez

name: Racing Line
description:
Feel the tension and excitement of races in this tactical racing board game where players take full control of their cars.
Get the most out of your cars’ capabilities, optimize your trajectories on the tracks and overtake your opponents !

Racing Line is a game in which players become drivers during a car race. They will have to manage the speed and the trajectory of their cars while limiting as much as possible their risk and damages: beware of the collision or the exit of track!

At each turn, players simultaneously plan their next move, then they all apply their move in the race order and finally resolve special situations such as slipstream, loss of control, collision or run-off.

The cars' movements are inspired by real-life physics: each movement influences the next one. As in real driving situations, drivers must anticipate their movements, take into account elements such as inertia or acceleration in order to optimize their speed and trajectory. The more the drivers exceed their cars capabilities, the more they risk losing control, which can cause accidents and impact the driver's strategy. But the victorious drivers are also often those who have flirted with the limits to overtake their opponents!

In the standard game mode, all drivers' cars have the same capabilities.
The Pro Driver mode increases the strategical aspect by introducing :
- Management of weather conditions
- Qualifying phase played by auctions
- Unique car capabilities (up to 20 different cars, each one having its own characteristics)
- Obstacles and Dirt on the racetrack
mechanics: Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Programmed Movement, Race

name: getKanban
description:
The game is played in teams of four to six people, one game per team. Each team has a playing board representing a Kanban task board, and a collection of story cards representing work to be done. Teams compete to maximise profit by optimizing the flow of work.

During the game the teams construct charts based on data from the game including a Cumulative Flow Diagram, a Run Chart, and a Lead Time Distribution Chart. Simulated events occur throughout the game to challenge the teams and require them to make various system design, prioritisation, and resource allocation decisions.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Race Royale
description:
Race Royale is a fast-paced racing, party game where teams of two compete to out-race, out-wit or blast their opponents off the track! Last car on the track is the winner!

Inspired by retro top-down racing video games, this board game adaptation lets teams of two take the wheel of a fast and furious, bustling bluffing bonanza. Because the theme of the race is "top-down" the drivers can't really see where they're going and must trust in the collective movement of the pack. Just follow the leader, but does the leader know they way or is he/she just trying to trick you into driving off the road?

Out-smart your opponents, or collect power-ups, weapons to use against them. It pays to be in the lead, but as soon as you stop trusting in whoever is in front of you, you must slow down to have time to react, and before you know it, you'll fall behind!

This bluff filled party game plays well with an even number of players, from 4 to 10. You can help your team mate by passing them information when they need it the most, or prevent them from crashing at a crucial moment by clever card play. As the race goes by, the road becomes more predictable and players may be tempted to take their chances in order to gain the much desired lead. Since the track is randomly generated, the finish line could come suddenly. In order for you (and your team mate) to win, you must be the first to cross the finish line, or have the last car on the track!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: 20 Dreams
description:
20 Dreams is a storytelling card game where each player has a set of 20 emotion cards differentiated by colour. There is another set of white emotion cards in the centre along with picture prompt cards.
On a player’s turn, they take one emotion card and three picture cards from the centre. They then have to tell a story that uses the picture cards to express the emotion on the white emotion card, which is to be hidden from the other players. The game is themed as if you are telling the group about a dream you had, so the picture cards contain many common dream themes like flying and teeth.
Once the player has told their story involving the 3 picture cards the other players have to guess what emotion was being expressed using their own emotion cards. Those who are incorrect have their corresponding emotion cards taken away (placed in the penalty box), and those that were correct give their cards to the storyteller, the person with the most cards at the end is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Monopoly: Macau Edition
description:
The properties are from streets and landmarks of Macau and are from Go onwards:

Calcada da Barra - Community Chest - Avenida de Amizade - Income Tax (Pay 10% or $2,000) - Ferry Terminal - Estrada de Cacilha - Chance - Rua do Almirante Costa Cabral - Rorte de Mong Ha - Jail - Avenida Dr. Sun Yat Sen - Macau Electric - Estrada Do Altinho De Ha Ho - Estrada da Penha - Macau Bridge - Estrada Lou Lim Ieok - Avenida de Kwong Tung - Estrada Nordeste da Taipa - Free Parking - Estrada de Seac Pai Van - Chance - Avenida da Praia Grande - Estrada de Cheoc Van - Taipa-Coloane Causeway - Estrada de Hac Sa - Taipa Pequena - Water Works - Taipa Grande - Go To Jail - Avenida Infante D. Henrique - Vila Coloane - Community Chest - Guia Hill - Macau Airport - Chance - Ruins of St. Paul's - Salary Tax and Macau Casino.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Victory at Sea: Tribal-class destroyers
description:
Often called the Afridi-class, this destroyer began the tradition of gunnery over torpedoes.
However, the class had a frightening lack of anti-aircraft defences, especially against dive-bombers.

The Tribal destroyers were the Royal Navy’s most advanced escorts of the time and saw action in nearly every theatre.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Belfast
description:
Launched on St Patricks Day 1938, HMS Belfast was one of ten Town-class vessels and the first vessel of the Royal Navy to be named for a Northern Ireland town. She initially operated as part of the British Naval blockade against Germany in 1939. In November of that year, she struck a German mine and spent the next two years undergoing extensive repairs. In November 1942 she returned to action with greater firepower, armour and radar capability.

She escorted Arctic convoys to the Soviet Union in 1943, and later that year was in the Battle of the North Cape, contributing to the destruction of German battleship Scharnhorst. She subsequently assisted in the Normandy landings as part of Operation Overlord and ended the war as part of the British Pacific Fleet. She would go on to see service in the Korean War.

She is now moored as a museum ship on the River Thames in London, operated by the Imperial War Museum.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Impact: Will you survive?
description:
We go back to the time where the landmass of the earth was one. This landmass, called Pangaea is where our story begins.

At the same time, in the far far distance of our Galaxy an earth disaster is heading our way. The famous asteroid that hit the earth over 65 million years ago. When this asteroid hits the earth, the game will end and we will see if the ancestors to mankind where able to survive allowing us humans to rule the planet as we do today.

During the game play, Pangaea will change, continents will rise and fall, opportunities to survive will come and go, are you lucky enough? Are you strategic enough?

Dinosaurs will make your changes to survive more difficult and volcano eruptions can happen any time, covering everything in lava.

Earthquakes and Tsunamis are mother nature’s forces that will challenge you. Are you able to outsmart your fellow players? It´s survival of mankind but it better be your offspring to rule the world, or perhaps nobody shall survive!?

This game is a typical hex-tile and worker placement. Tiles will also be stacked/unstacked on the board during the game.

Each player starts with 4 cards at hand, visible to all.
From the 4 cards you select 2 (or 3 for experience gamers) to represent in order:

a number of tiles displacement of the event-locator,
an action that will take place at that new location and
(optional, based on chosen game play) the range, i.e. number of tiles, that is affected by that action.


Played cards are discarded and new cards are added to the players hand for a next round.

The event-locator, positioned on the board, points out where the action as given by the card will take place. Possible actions are land-rise, land-fall, climate change, earthquake/tsunami or dinosaur placement. Depending on the game-type, more than 1 tile can be affected.

Each players meeple walks around the continents to harvest points or to place shelters (up to 3) but they are continuously in danger due to the effects of the actions that can happen to the continent (or tile) the players meeple and shelters are on. As player, you can chose to work with your fellow players or work against them, finding an alliance or break it again.

Not all land-types can support players meeples or dinosaurs, but you can buy evolution cards that can give you a bit of help, but it will cost you points.

Not all land-types are suitable for shelter building either or you shall choose between scoring points and harvest or not to harvest and move to a better spot to be able, in your next turn, to finally build your shelter. Can you build and keep your shelters on the board and earn the most points along the way? Shelters that you can keep on the board start earning points for you as well.

Only if at least 1 of your shelters survives the end game when the famous asteroid impacts the earth, then and only then will you have a change to win the game. During the game-play the asteroid is triggered and will move closer to earth from the starting place you have chosen. This determines (more or less) the game length. The speed in which it approaches is different each game, making it hard to predict how much time or turns is still left in the game. But when the asteroid reaches the earth, the end game begins.

Simply stated, ensure your ancestors survive the impact and earn the most points during the game, that will make you the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, End Game Bonuses, Events, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: Baltimore Edition
description: Now's your chance to take control of Baltimore as you buy, sell and trade the city's most prized properties in this classic Parker Brothers real estate trading game. With one roll of the dice you can own the Orioles, Obrycki's, the Babe Ruth Museum or the Preakness Celebration.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Great Cities: Washington, DC
description:
Great Cities: Washington, DC allows two to four players the ability to explore 150 years of history, culture, political intrigue and urban development in our nation's capital.

The game begins in 1871 and is played over eight 20-year generations (ending in 2030). Each generation, players receive income and draft development cards. Then players building housing for increased population, pay and play development and culture cards, and otherwise build out the city.

After eight generations, players score their buildings, cards and secret agenda cards to determine a winner.

-description from publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Territory Building
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Instant Words
description:
Fast paced game of word categories. Players compete to be the first to correctly call out a corresponding word in the current category.

On each game turn, the games master calls out a word category, all participants are to listen and respond as fast as possible with a correct example of the mentioned category.

Before beginning the game, the players agree on required number of cards for a winner to emerge based on how long they want to play for. The game ends once a player attains the predetermined number of cards.

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monopoly: SCP – Sporting Portugal
description:
If your admiration for Sporting exceeds the limits of the pitch, consider yourself summoned to play this version of Monopoly !

Contains: 1 board, 8 pawns, 28 title cards, 16 place cards, 16 visitor cards, 1 Monopoly money pack, 32 benches, 12 stadiums, 2 dice and 1 quick dice
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Borders of Blood: Wargaming the Paraguayan War 1864 -1870
description:
Fronteiras de Sangue / Borders of Blood is a system of wargame rules focused on the greatest war in the history of South America, the War of Paraguay, or War of the Triple Alliance, or, still, Guasú War (Great War).

The confrontation was fought between Paraguay and the Triple Alliance, composed of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, and extended from December 1864 to March 1870.

Features:

Battalion level rules for 6 to 28mm minis
Action dice to randomize number of actions that troops can take each turn
Action card to randomize events each turn
original combat system
army list (including generals) for the 4 belligerents
2 scenarios
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais
description:
Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais is bigger and believe it or not, faster than regular Monopoly.
What makes it bigger is a larger board, Train Depots, Skyscrapers, 9 new Properties.
It is faster because of a new speed die and Bus cards.
Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais can be played in 1½ hours with more fun than ever!

The massive game board has 12 additional spaces.

Buy all the properties of a group, build your houses and hotels, and then keep on going by building Skyscrapers for a chance to earn mega rents.
Good news: you can build houses and hotels once you own three out of four properties in a group (or two out of three in the smaller groups). You can even build a Depot on a railroad to double its rent.

Roll three dice on your turn: two regular dice and the special "Speed" Die. The Speed Die gives you a chance for free trip to the next available property. (Later in the game the Speed Die could send you to the next property you owe rent on. Ouch!) From time to time you'll earn free "Bus Tickets." Use them to go where you want to go, but beware: they expire! The Speed Die and the Bus Tickets make the action speedy, intense, and sure-fire fun!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: A Taste of Victory! Scenarios for 1676 to 1693 Beneath the Lily Banners
description:
A 116 page book containing 18 scenarios for Beneath the Lily Banners. Each can be played on a table between 6 x 4 and 6 x 6 feet in size over 2-3 hours.

The period covered by these scenarios is 1676 to 1693.

The theatres are: Skane Wars, Great Turkish War, Morean War, Tangier, Sedgemoor Rebellion, Jacobite Wars in Ireland and Scotland, Nine Years War in Flanders, Rhineland, The Caribbean and North America.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: ATS: Ridge Runners of Toktong Pass
description:
Along the road between KOTO-RI and HAGARU-RI, KOREA, 29 November 1950: As the head of Task Force Drysdale fought its way through to Hagaru-ri, a miscellaneous assortment of British and American soldiers found themselves cut off, stranded in Hell Fire Valley for the night. As Marine air and artillery support tapered off at dusk, the remnants of the convoy now consisted of two large perimeters and three splinter groups, stretching over a distance of 1,200 yards. In the containment were 52 British Marines from the 41st Independent Commando, 190 men from Company B, 31st Infantry Regiment, and about 150 Marine service troops. There was no ammunition on hand for the 60mm mortars, and no heavy weapons. The Chinese took their time, probing and scouting before finally setting up one mortar on the right flank, and another on the left. Luckily, their fire wasn’t accurate, as the British and American positions were hardly advantageous to the defense. Major J. N. McLaughlin and a veteran Marine MP, Warrant Officer Lloyd V. Dirst soon rose to the occasion, the former gathering the men in the northern group into a tight defensive perimeter and the latter striding about, smoking his pipe, and barking out orders. Later in the night the valiant MP was hit by a mortar round, suffering a serious head wound. Twice the men led by Major McLaughlin drove the Chinese from their mortar positions, only to have them return. By 0200 Hours, no grenades remained and orders were issued to fix bayonets. At one point the major called for the enemy to surrender. In the brief lull that followed about 100 men of the southern perimeter managed to escape. As daybreak approached the Chinese withdrew to the hills, providing an opportunity to evacuate the wounded. Among them was Warrant Officer Dirst, who survived only to die of his wounds a year later.

We heard what you wanted and here it is AND then some. Areyou ready for a completely new take on Toktong Pass? Winterized, new retro terrain, Then you are ready to get your mittens on and join your fellow Frozen Chosin Marines and prepare for the next enemy attack.

You receive a brand new Winterized map, 10 scenarios that all play on the winterized map, in color format, plus BW 3-hole punch color special rules!

—'description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Monopoly: Crooks & Castles
description: Joining forces with Hasbro and USAopoly to recreate a board game classic, Crooks & Castles has released a collector’s edition of Monopoly. Revamping everything from the game board to the cards, Crooks & Castles’ design input is spread across the board’s most intricate elements, such as the tokens and currency, to the exterior packaging of the game box itself. The Crooks & Castles edition of the game also recreates classic Monopoly imagery with current day streetwear essentials, such as replacing the classic boot token with a retro sneaker and the top hat token with a fitted cap. (Publisher blurb)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Monopoly: Swansea City AFC
description:
A Monopoly about the Welsh football team of Swansea City AFC.

Swansea City became the first Welsh club to reach the Premier League when they clinched a thrilling play-off final victory over Reading at Wembley Stadium in May, 2011. It completed a remarkable rise for a club that had found itself fighting regulation from the Football League less than 10 years earlier.

Moving from the lovely, uglu, old Vetch Field to a new luxury home at the Liberty Stadium helped spark a footballing revolution at the Swans' unique tiki-taka style look took the Premier League by storm and secured the club their first major trophy with the Captial One Cup.

-description from the back of the box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Swansea University
description:
Produced for 100 years of Swansea University in 2020.

Tour Swansea University for the hottest properties, sites, halls of residence, and bars are all up for grabs. Invest in houses and hotels, then watch the rent come pouring in. Make deals with other players and look out for bargains at auction - there are many ways to get what you want.

-description from the back of the box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Würfelkitschen
description:
A dice action game in a wooden box with a felt carpet in it. Target of the game is to get as much point after 12 rounds by throwing dices in the wooden box to manipulate own dices and dices of all other players.

There are special rules for single player game or 2 player game, too.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Digest No. 1 for Ultra Modern Army Lists and Organisations
description:
Includes:


Complete update for the Ultra Modern Army Lists
18 New Armies
Complete points values for Challenger Rules
Clarifications for Challenger Rules
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Arena
description:
StarArena is an action-packed Who-Gets-To-The-Top-First_Wins!! and the physical Battle-Arena (Board-Game) to the gratuitous web-published CCG (Card-Game). What might look like a unadventurous roll, spin and move board-game on the surface, is actually an instant timeless classic due to the multiple-levels that rotate around a game-axle. This 'game-mechanic' alters the Arena-Area and Battle-Conditions, therewith things can go from Bad to Worse in an instance while the Game-Gods favor the current player, ...or not!?

The StarArena_Board-Game follows the Rules-Of-Conduct, these Area-Rules are printed on the back of the board so that they may never-get-lost! After it is decided who starts the game by 'Jan-Ken-Pon; A Game-Turn is always started by the roll of the dice! The D8 outcome gives you the amount of 'Actions' you may perform during your turn, divided into 'Turning' and/or 'Moving!'

If the Game-Gods favor you? You can use the larger number of actions gained, to turn the game board into 'Color-Advantage' and 'Level-Up' towards the Top from 'Own-Color-To-Color' without having to do: Card-Battle. If your actions are limited; You should consider spending them on forcing the next-player into Card-Combat? Since the rule is: to Enter the game _from base 'into' the arena_ you must Insert-Coin onto the top-square of the game-board named 'Sanctuary; The first player to reach the top in Card-Battle takes home the Treasure!'

Knocking other players off the game-board back-to-base in card-combat, makes them have to Re-Enter the game and Insert-Coin again, thickening the plot and pot. Thus-far the focus has been on the ROC, the surefire way to Level-Up is; Win in Card-Battle! When you boldly claim a battle with another player, your actions are paused and the Rules-Of-Engagement are set into effect. Win your battle: You may continue your Actions +1 Level-Up! If you fail to be victorious, you loose your actions, your turn ends and your Hero remains on the last location, which could prove precarious in the next-players turn...

It is a deceptively simple game and you have to make the best of each situation, the aim of the game is: Reach Sanctuary First! Just remember; You are not the only one in the Arena with the eyes on the Prize!?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Game System, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move, Sudden Death Ending, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Ten Break
description: Ten Break is a card game that simulates a single or doubles tennis match
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Corsican: Wargaming the Napoleonic Wars
description:
MAIN FEATURES
1) Rules developed for different scales, from 28mm to 6mm, at the Regiment level.
2) An original mechanism - using Action Dice - that randomizes the actions that each troop will be able to perform in the turn and gives the commander in chief (the player) the responsibility of distributing these orders with or without privileging certain Troops.
3) An original mechanism - called Action Cards - that, by means of a deck of printable cards, randomizes random events in each turn, granting bonuses and penalties to the armies involved in the combat.
4) An original combat system, which uses randomised dice rolls to determine the outcome, while maintaining a high level of reality in the confrontations between Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery.
5) Lists with the main Generals, with quality grades for each of them (for use in-game).

WHAT DO I NEED TO PLAY?

Dice - The system uses 6-sided dice (d6)
Measuring tape - Measuring tape is used to determine movement distances, weapon range, etc in centimetres.
Miniatures - Miniatures represent your army. We suggest using miniatures on scales from 6 to 28mm.
Action Cards - We provide a deck of Action Cards that you will need to copy and print.
Scenarios - These are designed to match the real terrain on the battlefields. You can use your own ideas to build scenarios.
Opponents - Invite friends to a fight over the dinner table. You will become generals for a few hours.


—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: The Lost Clans (fan expansion for Age of War)
description:
Lost Clans introduces 5 new clans to the game, with a total of 12 new cards. These clans add more difficult combinations and allow for a better experience with 4+ players. The clans are as follows:

Utsunomiya - 1 card (4 pts) - 4 flipped
Saito - 2 cards (3 pts each) - 6 flipped
Otomo - 3 cards (2 pts, 3 pts, 4 pts) - 11 flipped
Kuroda - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 3 pts) - 9 flipped
Anegakoji - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 2 pts) - 7 flipped

All clans use real Japanese family names and crests, and have been designed to match the original style.
I ordered my cards from https://www.printplaygames.com/
- Custom Size Rectangular Cards #1
- Matte Premium Black Core
- length and width 2.75 inches

Front and back templates are attached.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Kill Steal

name: Hacked
description: When famous Valley Falls hacker, Fluk3, infiltrates the computer database of The Will Street Detective Agency, the act doesn’t follow the usual pattern of anarchy and rebellion. After discovering information in a cold case that relates to the murder of a relative, it becomes necessary to make amends and enlist the agency’s services. Now offering assistance instead of resistance, Fluk3 offers to be the eyes and ears on the web in exchange for helping bring closure to this unsolved mystery.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Behind The Wall
description: Fairmont Estates is a tightly-knit neighborhood in the heart of Valley Falls. The residents are all white-collar and well-to-do, and any of the homes could be featured on the front of any picture postcard... except the one on Bradford Street. That house has been tied up in probate court after the previous resident passed away and has been vacant for the last three years. The house, understandably, has fallen into disarray and been vandalised on occasion by some of the neighborhood teenagers. When a family is finally able to purchase the home, the first thing they do is begin extensive renovations to return the place to its former glory. As demolition and construction are both underway, the owners are shocked when the remains of a reporter that has been missing for the past year are discovered behind one of the walls. Even more chilling is the fact that she seems to have been interred while alive which is confirmed by one final message she wrote that begins: “To whoever finds me, the Fairmont residents all have secrets. One of them did this to me...” .
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Prison Break
description: Brutality, violence, an attempted prison break, death….or, in other words, just another day at Valley Falls’ most infamous correctional facility. In a place filled with criminals and guards who are just as vicious as the inmates they supervise, anyone could be a killer. The only question is who is responsible for the newest murder...and why did they do it?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Storytelling

name: Usurper: Claim to Power
description:
Welcome to Usurper, a fantasy role playing game of adventure and storytelling.

Usurper is a fantasy adventure game of quick, light-hearted adventure. Using a simple table to resolve actions on, the game allows for various degrees of success, random events and unexpected outcomes without any complicated math.

Characters are described in plain English terms rather than lists of numbers and modifiers and can be created to taste in a matter of minutes with a notepad or through a random generation system if the player prefers to use that.

Usurper is meant to scale from street-level to epic campaigns deciding the fate of kingdoms.

Emphasis is on providing as many tools as possible to generate worlds, cities and adventure ideas, allowing pick-up games with as little preparation work as possible.

The rules cover the following aspects:


Resolving actions with no math.



Two character creation systems, one driven by the player and a random system.



Narrative combat system.



A game system that will result in your characters changing unpredictably as they adventure. The person that comes back to their home town is never going to be the same person that left.



Tables covering ill fortunes such as physical injuries, gruesome deaths, mental trauma and sanity loss.



Follower and henchmen rules, including loyalty, morale, recruitment.



NPC's and monsters will fit on an index card.



Random NPC generator, including motivations and relationships.



World builder with random generators for world history, city factions, quests, terrain and dungeon themes.



Travel and random encounter tables.



Tables to conduct a living, unpredictable campaign with random events and outcomes.



Adventure system that adjudicates the progress of the heroes when fighting to bring down an enemy, overthrow a system or change the world.



Random monster and magic item tables.



Narrative magic system.



Random deities with an active interest in their followers.



Lead armies into battle, treating each unit as a character in its own right.



Rule a domain.



Be eaten by a monster.



* * * *


The random generators are of value to players of any roleplaying game, even if they do not use the Usurper rules and are made to be as generic as possible, permitting their use in a wide variety of fantasy adventure games.

Likewise, this is well suited for cooperative and solo players due to the wide range of randomly generated content that can be generated.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Próba Ognia
description:
Próba Ognia (The Trial of fire) is a cooperative game with One versus Many mode. Players work together as a group of firefighters trying to overcome the Disaster.

Base game contains 3 different scenarios - one full cooperative (against Electricity) and two in One versus Many mode (against Fire and Flood).

During each of their turns, firefighters play two cards that allows them to perform actions: Move, Help, Scout or Fight. Firefighters move around the city, find dangers and victims and try to fullfill scenario goals, whereas Disaster plays card to give them stress, destroy buildings or kill victims.

Base game contains 90 cards for firefighters in 6 prepared decks, but also allows players to mix them up and create their own custom decks. More cards are going to be available in upcoming expansions and distribute during series of local events.

Game is based on real firefighters actions and was made in close cooperation with Orlen Foundation, that helps local volunteer fire deps.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Sagas: Bretland
description:
We are in the 800s. The Anglo-Saxons of Bretland are living peaceful lives, unaware of the imminent danger that is coming. Hundreds of Warriors and Shield Maidens from all over Scandinavia are sailing for the mainland, setting foot for the first time ever on English soil. Led by the most powerful Viking leaders, they set about raiding and pillaging everything in their way. Their goal is simple: Gather as much wealth, land, and fame as possible to become the next Great Viking Leader.

Sagas: Bretland is a game for two to four players where each player forges their saga as they raid Bretland in search of wealth, land, and fame.

Starting with a small raid party on the shores of Bretland, each player will explore the land, expand their colonies, gather resources, and raid Anglo-Saxon settlements while battling any other Viking leaders that may stand in their way.

At the end of the 8th round, the player with the most victory points wins Sagas: Bretland. These can be earned by building new Viking villages, raiding existing Saxon settlements, raiding other player’s settlements, and completing specific objectives.

Who will be the next Great Viking Leader?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Tile Placement

name: Star Arena: Arcade Chess
description:
Arcade-Chess is a Game-Of-Generals, invented to teach New-Players how to 'Move over the Maps' within the StarArena_MetaVerse and get you acquainted with how to Operate the Battle-Clones in Close Quarters Combat.

The working theory is: "Having practiced and getting good at this Battle-Simulation will give you Strategic-Advantage when playing Missions on Larger-Maps!"

If you are a fan of Abstract War-Games? This could very well give you hours of Table-Top~Fun and keep you entertained for Years to Come!

(Will extend description later when approved)
mechanics: Force Commitment, Sudden Death Ending

name: Star Arena: Cyber-Combat Card & Boardgame
description:
StarArena_The Card Game is an Outrageous & Gratuitous Web-Published Cyber-War Collectable-Card-Game (CCG) featuring #GodsViciousBabies!

The Card Game is a collection of random War-Stories converted to Battle-Cards that take place in the StarArena_MetaVerse. You are required to build an Attack-Stack (Game-Deck a/o Data-Base) with the prime-directive to 'Destroy' all other opponents Data-Bases!




= = = = =
When Played with MODEM:Your mission for the base-game is to 'obliterate' the other player(s in card-combat, and the win-conditions are divided into 2 types of counters: Lives & Wins.

You have to think of it like; Playing an Arcade-Game!
Lives are Lost in Card-Battle and gained by Insert-Coin into the pot, 1 Coin gives you 3 Lives. Losing a single Card-Battle, means you Loose A Life: -1. The counter is the set to -1, when you loose your last Life; You are Out-Game and the Victor in that Card-Battle has just gained a Game-Win! And that players Win-Counter is set to: +1.

The first Player to reach 6 Wins on his/her counter gets to Chant:
Whois the #GunShin? #軍神? ...And is the War-Hero/God of that Game!!

Taking home the'Treasure' _ie: Game-Coins_ that has/have accumulated in the pot during Game-Play!!!

When the Players are not done with game-play for the day or night?
All Data-Bases are reshuffled (random-access-memory) and Counters reset to Minimum and a new Game-Session begins with the target to: Reach 6 Wins First and become the next Gunshin!!

Each player who wants to participate in Battle: Must Insert-Coin (Maximum stakes are 2 Coins, giving 6 Lives) into the Pot and draw a Hero-Card from hand and place in Modem (or Active HW Location) at the beginning of their game-turn.
StarArena is a Multi-Player Collectable-Card-Game and is best played with 4 to 8 Players and the higher the chance becomes to reach 6 Game-Wins and proclaim to be the Gunshin!



= = = = =The 'Only' really important thing you need to know before building an Attack-Stack is:
There are 2 Types of General-Cards: Hardware-Cards & Software-Cards!

Hardware are your Hero-Cards and have: Dual-Hard-Drives and signify your Download-Capacity & Battle-Values. (Blow through these in Card-Battle and you suffer Defeat!

Software are your Battle-Options and have: A Download-Cost, Free-Space needed to Activate SW a/o APP. (These Battle-Cards Make-Or-Break your chances of Victory!

A Deck may contain a maximum of 64 cards and no-less than 8 game cards.
For the nitty-gritty on Card-Battle-Rules read: ROE, Rules-Of-Engagement.

Oh, ...and did I mention; It is a !!FREE!! Print_And_Play game?
Check-Out the link below and Build Yourself a Bad-Ass Data-Base.

And Become A Man Amongst Babies!
Just Don't Tell Your Mom?
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Sudden Death Ending

name: The Industrial Revolution in the Southern New England Area 1830 to 1889
description:
The board game The Southern New England Manufacturing Game is a turn based economic game set in the 19thc Southern New England and Hudson Valley NY area. The game includes 1 map of the Southern New England 36” x 48” at 4.85 miles to the inch, circa 1880’s A. D., 3,040 number counters to record your sites, 172 pages of commodity charts listed by product, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various industrial sectors providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of each industry of the 19thc in Southern New England. The price of the game does not include shipping costs. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Investment, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Cançons de l'Antàrtida
description:
When the autumn comes and ice gets thicker, the emperor penguins go inland to mate. After partnering, the female lays one single egg. Worn out by the effort of laying the egg, the penguin mothers set out to sea to regain her strength and nourish, while the father takes care of the egg during the cold Antarctic winter.

About two and a half months later, the chicks will be born, hungry, waiting for their mother, who brings food, while their fathers provide them with heat. Soon the mothers will arrive with their belly full of fish, that will be used to feed their chicks. The fathers will now be able to run to the sea to feed after about for months of fasting.

This game is setted up at this point, where the mothers are arriving in large columns from the ocean to find their partners and chicks and feed the young and let the manes run for the fish.

To represent that, we will have a big pile of "father and chick" cards at the center of the table (grouped together to avoid the cold of the antarctica), and each player will have a bunch of "mother penguin" cards. To recognize each other, the penguins sing the songs they sang during the mating. So, to pair the couples, you will have to find which ones are singing the same song (this is: they have the same notes with the same order and color). The twist here, is that to simulate the chaos of the mothers arriving, every player will be looking for the matches at the same time in the central pile of cards!

The first player to match all his/her mothers with the partners and chicks, will win the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Music, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Physical Removal, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game, Slide/Push, Turn Order: Random

name: Space Kittens
description:
Space Kittens is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players from the creators of Alien Puppies. Colonize Kittengard without losing 9 lives. Each player is assigned a character that has unique abilities and powers to help you win the game.

Your objective is to colonize the planet by setting up five bases that consist of three elements - Dome, Cat Tree and Farm.

Set up:

Place the Board in the center of the table within easy reach of all the players.
Shuffle the Character cards and deal 1 to each player.
Shuffle Area Tiles FACE DOWN, draw 5 tiles and randomly put them FACE UP on the Board in the respective circles on Kittengard planet.
Separate the tokens by type (Domes, Cat Trees, Farm, Cat) and place them near the board in separate piles.
Place the Cat Token at at the bottom part of Lives section.
Shuffle the Environment Deck and place it FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board.
Shuffle the Resources Deck and deal 5 cards to each player, then place Resources Deck FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board. If any player has Distraction cards, return that card to the Resources Deck and give that player another card from the top of the deck. Then Re-shuffle the Resources Deck and put it FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board.
categories: Animals, Civilization, Humor, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Samoorganizujmy się!
description:
In XIX-th and at the beginning of XX-th century in many places in Poland people decided to set up cooperatives. Some of them gathered farmers, others bakers, milkmen and weavers or gathered people of different jobs.

In Samoorganizujmy się players set up their own cooperatives, employ workers, build common buildings, meet famous social activists and participate in bigger projects, that onvolve many cooperatives.

All cards contain historical photos and illustrations and most of them show real historical people, places, institutions or projects. Game gives players not only fun, but also real historical knowledge about history of cooperativity in Poland.

In each turn players simultaneously play one card from their hand and add it to their tableau, finally they pass all cards remaining in their hand to the player on their left. Blue and red cards improve their production (which allows them to play more expensive cards), green cards raise morale of their cooperativity, pink cards allow cooperation between players and yellow provide instant actions.

At the end of each round (after seventh card being played) player with most cards with their arms and player with highest morale - get victory point. At the end of the game players resolve all cards with "End of the Game" effects and score for them. Player with most victory points, wins the whole game.

Game was produced for Fundacja Wspomagania Wsi (Rural Development Fundation) to promote their projects and to develop historical knowledge in small towns.

-description from designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection

name: Magician's Market
description:
Created for the 2020 Children's Game Print and Play Design Contest, winner of the Best Educational Game category.

Magician's Market is a Print and Play educational game for children and families that teaches colors and color mixing in a fun and exciting way.

You are magicians, trying to make potions to sell at the market. There are limited ingredients available. Rolling two colored dice determines what options you have available to draft each round. You can split or combine colors to make new ingredients, or buy a new recipe card to try making a different potion. The game ends when one player completes a certain number of potion cards (dependent on player count). The player with the highest combined potion values is the winner.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Arkna: Sed de Poder
description:
Arkna: Sed de Poder ("Arkna: thirst for power") is a Chilean trading card game were players take the role of powerful leaders of an army of fierce and unique races, commanding his units strategically towards the victory.
In this exciting game, the ability to take strategically decision each turn will make the difference.

To play Arkna, both players will need a deck of 50 to 60 cards. In each turn you can play a Gnosis, a card that represents a sort of energy from Gods. Using this energy, you can summon cards, like warriors. You can choose different kind of warriors: melee, ranged or mage.

In the field, there is a vanguard zone and a rear zone, depending on what zone do you play your warrior they will have different skills. You will also find a zone for structures, where you can play cards to build your fortress and help your warriors to improve their skills. Are you ready for power?

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Player Elimination, Take That

name: SaintCards: Base Game
description:
SaintCards is a ground-breaking "true fact" card management system that helps players get to know facts about the lives of Catholic Saints. In a fun and interactive match-making, turn-based game, players vie to collect as many Treasures as possible before the end of the game.

The game begins with the dealer dealing a fixed number of cards to each player. The number of cards varies depending on the number of players. The remainder of the deck is placed face down to form the draw pile with the top card turned face up next to it to start the play pile.

In turn, each player aims to match at least one attribute of a card in his or her hand with an attribute of the top card in play. Players gain treasures (also called jewels) which are collected from the Storehouse of Treasure, with each additional matching attribute earning a player an additional treasure. Treasures take the physical form of game pieces of varying size and color, each corresponding to a different value and so function as the point scoring system for the game. On a single turn, a player may play a second card only if at least 3 matches between it and the card previously played can be identified.

Alternatively, or if a player is unable to find any matches, that player may draw a card from the draw pile instead.

Play moves to the next player in turn once a player says pass.

The game ends after one player has played his or her final card and the dealer has had a final chance to play. The player who has gathered the most treasure is the winner. That player then collects all the other players' treasures and lays them at the feet of Jesus, i.e. next to the Jesus Card. SaintCards Expansions add more saints and fun twists and turns to the gameplay.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Religious, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Dungeon Crawler: Scenario Packs
description:
What ARE the Scenarios?

The Scenario Packs are 4 distinct and specific Events-based adventures of epic difficulty and challenge for the players. Not for the faint of heart. The Events can not really be used in a Standard game as they are very specific. Standard cards from your Delve or Expansion Packs are used to build the Dungeon decks and then the 10 Event and 1 Character from ONE Scenario are mixed with those cards to form the 80 card deck.

Fell the Colossus is a brutal challenge to destroy one of the rare Dreadlander Colossus constructs as it rumbles its way across the land. Billowing a cloud of smoke, it strides towards its intended target to deploy the army it holds within, to wreck havoc with its own powerful weapons, or even it's bare metal hands! To get in you must climb the legs, run up along the arms, or fight through the horde in its chest when it opens to ascend to the castle and defeat its pilot: a Doom Caster!

Hell Gate uncovers an evil cult within your own lands that seek to unleash a true horror from beyond! Will it be Abaddon, or another demon prince? There's no time to waste as you unmask their hidden members, seek out their lair and eventually break into their inner sanctum to put a stop to their evil plans! It's going to be an epic challenge as Dread Lord Vorlaat has come down from his tower at the Black Wall.

The Cursed tells of a land haunted by a horror, where the very members of someone's household may have become an infected terror that plagues the people. Locking themselves in, they pray for salvation, as the night brings unholy terror. The Vampiress features in this scenario, and she won't go easily as you face her Brood, discover her identity, and unravel her final resting place where she hangs between worlds.

Legendary Hoard is more of what you might expect from a typical adventure; find the map, get to the location, enter it's foul trap-laden tunnels, and find the treasure... however, this one is guarded by an Ancient Ruby Dragon! Nothing will be easy about this battle as the dragon introduces the new Attribute "Titan" outlined on the new Rule card card included in the box!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monopoly: Jura
description:
The classic Monopoly with elements from the region of Jura, in Switzerland.

Bankrupt the other players and win.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: Monopoly: Vaud
description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the canton of Vaud.
You dreamed of owning the Chaplin museum, building a hotel on the Glacier 3000 ?
Players can buy the golf course of Villars, the towns of Nyon, Montreux or Vevey, or even the castle of Aigle. Be careful to avoid the Bois-Mermet prison though!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: JigStars
description:
Let's play JigStars! Grab the best jigsaw pieces and build the best puzzle. The player whose puzzle is worth the most points is the winner.

JigStars is a speed game for 2–4 players. Each player starts with a large double jigsaw piece in front of them. This is the beginning of their own puzzle.

Players take turns to reach into the bag and pull out a random handful of jigsaw pieces and then drop them in the middle of the table. Everyone races to grab a piece they want, and then adds to their own puzzle.

When all the pieces have been used up, players score a point for each complete coloured diamond they created and for each star on corner pieces. The player with the most points wins.

Contents:

4 large jigsaw pieces
48 small jigsaw pieces
1 drawstring bag


-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Monopoly: Die Schweizer Schlösser
description:
Monopoly, the famous real estate transaction game, takes you in this edition to discover many Swiss castles.

Incredible adventures await in the castles and fortified castles of the national association les châteaux suisses! They offer tours, events and shows and are ideal for excursions and relaxation. Whether as a hiking destination, as the final stop on a boat trip, as a highlight of a city tour or simply out of a thirst for knowledge, a visit to a castle is always part of a global experience. These monuments are located in idyllic settings: they sit on top of hills, stretch out by a lake or embody the symbol of a city.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: Monopoly: Neuchâtel
description:
Neuchâtel is a French-speaking canton, located in French-speaking Switzerland. It can be represented in four major regions. Along Lake Neuchâtel is the region called Littoral. The city of Neuchâtel is established on the right bank of the lake. To the north, passing through the Chaumont, is the Val-de-Ruz.

West of Neuchâtel, still in the Littoral, is the alluvial cone of the mouth of the Areuse. The valley narrows further to the west in a narrow gorge and then opens onto the Val-de-Travers. The Canton of Neuchâtel is also the cradle of the most prestigious watch brands.

Don't forget, like in any other Monopoly, do not get bankrupted to win !
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: Monopoly: FC Basel 1893
description:
On November 15, 1893, eleven interested readers of the Basler Nationalzeitung met to be shoe makers in the Basler pub of the guild, including members of a rowing club, academics and a sports journalist (who translated the football rules from English) and decided to found the FC Basel. The club colors were kept in red and blue. Just eleven days later, the club's first game took place on the freshly set up Landhof sports field.

In 1953, FC Basel celebrated the first championship title in the club's history with just one defeat out of 26 games. In the Benthaus era, FC Basel won 7 championship titles and 2 cups. In the Benthaus era, legends such as
Karl Odermatt and Othmar Hitzfeld.

Many unsuccessful years followed, including relegation to the NLB in 1988. After rising again, FC Basel gained new strengths under the presidents René C. Jäggi, Gigi Oehri and Bernhard Heusler and has dominated Swiss football since the early 2000s and enjoys great international recognition.

Experience FC Basel in a new way with the first edition of Monopoly FC Basel.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: Sancak Taşı
description:
Sancak Taşı ("Banner Stone") is a chess like boardgame, goal is capture your enemy's flag and bring it to your banner-stone.

Each player has 17 figures. (4 footman, 2 hunter, 2 archer, 2 elephant, 2 cavalery, 2 wall, 1 necromancer, 1 banner and 1 banner-stone)
Player as a commander try to defeat his/her enemy with the help of 94 action cards and a d4 dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Monopoly: Tarn-et-Garonne
description: Limited edition (1062 copies) of the classic Monopoly game themed on the department of Tarn-et-Garonne in southwestern France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks
description:
The object and rules of the game remain the same.

Bankrupt your mates, buy up big and the last man, woman or child standing, or at least holding the cash, wins.

It’s the game of Monopoly as we all know it.

But the difference is, this is Sharks Monopoly where players from the Sharks Team of the Half Century are there for the buying and selling, the travel spaces represent Sutherland Shire transport, you can be forced to pay membership fees and you accumulate grandstands and stadiums rather than houses and hotels.

The age-old board game has been ‘Sharkified’.
Sharks legends such as Ettingshausen, Rogers, Miller, Bishop and Pierce are represented, alongside current stars Fifita, Holmes, Lewis and Graham.

It’s the Monopoly you know, with a distinct Sharks look and feel.

- description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves Australia Pty Ltd

name: Guns, Grizzlies & Naked Grandmas
description:
Guns, Grizzlies & Naked Grandmas is a game where the main suspects of a horrific crime franticly try to save themself from ending up behind bars!

In order to avoid prison they must either “solve” the murder mystery by making up a believable story or frame the others! Each player must therefore divide their attention between both “solving” the murder, while also defending against being framed for it! In other words - the player closest to unravelling the mystery, could also be the one closest to being framed for it!

For a player to “solve” the murder and win the game, they must find a Naked Grandma card, as well as collecting the 3 Story cards shown on their secret Masterplan, which is drawn at the beginning of the game.
But nothing is easy and with tons of action cards designed to both assist and destroy, the road to freedom will be difficult! And with the constant threat of a player (or even players) losing the game if they have too many Framed cards in front of them when a Random Police Inspection card is drawn, no one will ever truly be safe!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Single Loser Game, Take That

name: Foibles
description:
Foibles is a thought-provoking party game. You'll need to convince others that you have the best Foibles; Or at least someone else has worse ones than you. How you play is up to you, but you have only one goal: Don't. Get. Voted. Out!

A game of Foibles revolves around a random, quirky scenario. Scenarios are always 3 rounds. Each round, you collectively vote 1 person out. After the 3 rounds, the scenario is over and the remaining players have won.

Before a scenario is played out, each person is given 3 facedown Foibles: one that they gave to themselves and two others given by their neighbours.

The chaos happens during each round. Each round, each player must reveal one of their facedown Foibles. The revealed Foible(s) are traits that define this person. They will have to convince everyone how these Foible(s) relates to the scenario, and hopefully, in a positive light or else they risk getting voted out by the group.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Voting

name: Itékiya
description:
In Itékiya the players act at the same time, using one of the options available on the cards shown, throughout twelve turns they will try to perform combos to be able to complete the missions and maximize their scores. It is a game designed so that novice players can play alongside more experienced players, which can take unique challenges that will make a complex gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Death Ride Kursk: Sud-Front, Russland Staff Limited Edition
description:
This game is the total collection of the Death Ride Kursk series of games showcasing the combat near the Kursk Salient on the southern shoulder.

Staff Limited Edition unique series package
A wooden box in the form of an 88mm ammunition crate
3 pockets within the box, one for each DRK game set (XLVIII, IISS, AD Kempf)
A hinged top with hasp for proper and secure stowage
A piece of Red Army memorabilia
A piece of German Army memorabilia
Death Ride Kursk – Gross Deutschland
Death Ride Kursk – 3 rd Panzer
Death Ride Kursk – 11 th Panzer
Death Ride Kursk – XLVIII Enhancement
Death Ride Kursk – Totenkopf
Death Ride Kursk – Leibstandarte
Death Ride Kursk – Das Reich
Death Ride Kursk – IISS Enhancement
Death Ride Kursk – III Panzer Korps
Death Ride Kursk – Korps Raus
Death Ride Kursk – Armee Detachment Kempf Enhancement
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: ATS Leningrad I: Brandenburger Bridgehead
description:
The time is summer, 1941. Operation Barbarossa is in full swing, and action on the northern front brings the German 6th Panzer Division on the scene in a headlong rush for Leningrad ... the prize of Armeegruppe Nord.

This is a monster game with a brand new map bisected by the Luga River. This is ATS' first significant treatment of early-war armour on the Eastern Front featuring Pz35 and Pz38 tanks duking it out with the likes of Soviet T-26, T-37 and BT-5 tanks, among many others

Contents:
12 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
6 countersheets providing German and Soviet infantry, weapons and early-war armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Monopoly: Biel/Bienne
description:
Go on a journey of discovery with the MONOPOLY Biel / Bienne

Biel / Bienne is the largest bilingual city in Switzerland and the second largest city in the canton of Bern.
