Biel is the regional and economic center for both the Seeland and the Bernese Jura and parts of the canton of Solothurn.
It also has several universities of applied sciences.
Bienne is the most important center of the Swiss watch industry, ahead of Le Locle, Grenchen and La Chaux-de-Fonds.

All spaces are in French and German and the game is supplied with two packs of cards, one for each language.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: SCF: BUTTON MASHERS! – Pocket Edition
description:
BUTTON MASHERS! is a fast-paced, pocket-sized card game for 2 players! Combo punches and kicks while trying to avoid your opponents attacks!

Great to take on the go or for a quick break between larger games, your luck and guessing skills will be put to the test! Guess correctly, and avoid damage. Guess wrong, and you'll take a foot to the face! Don't let your health reach zero!

Variable rules make it easy to adjust the game for all ages! Make it a simple guessing game, or change it up, and make it a game about reading your opponent's moves, or make up your own rules!

Players each have an identical deck of various punches and kicks. After deciding who goes first, the defending player guesses whether the next card to be revealed will be a high(↑), mid, or low(↓) attack. If they guess correctly, they take no damage and become the new attacker. However, if they guess wrong, they take the damage listed on the card and must guess again until they make a correct guess.

For more player control, have the attacking player select which card to put face down instead of just flipping the top card of the deck.

Players start with 25 life. First to reach 0 loses and gives their best cry of defeat!
Ready... FIGHT ON!!!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Chaining, Deduction

name: The Art of War: Card Game
description:
The Art of War: Card Game is a fantasy tabletop card game in which the player will lead one of four factions and challenge up to three opponents for the title Ruler of Midlands. The game can also be played in military alliance mode, where two alliances of two factions are fighting each other.

The Art of War: Card Game is a great classic card game suitable for playing with friends and family. One of the distinguishing features of this game is support for simultaneous play for up to four players. Simple rules will allow you to quickly get used to the game and play it without any additional means to keep track of game states. And the non-collectible aspect of the game will allow you to start playing it immediately after purchase, without wasting time and money looking for rare and expensive cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Demon Castle Mononoke
description:
Demon Castle Mononoke is a cooperative bluffing game where players take the role of heroes defending a cursed castle from bizarre spirits of Japanese legend. As night approaches over the castle, only one hero at a time can take watch and see the spirit approach. Only they know the spirit's strength and whether it is friend or foe, and it's up to them to rally their allies... or lead them to their own destruction.

Using a unique real-time simultaneous combat mechanic and partial information about your enemies, Demon Castle Mononoke is a parable about trust and teamwork. If the castle falls, no player can win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Hidden Victory Points, Prisoner's Dilemma, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Travelers: The Game
description:
A full rework of the original Star Travelers game, including a new starting board, more player interactivity, and less space punishment!

Players begin the game with a pass-draft to recruit crew members and upgraded ship parts. You will then set out into space in one of twelve directions, revealing tiles by using your ship's radar to discover planets, face aliens, and encounter random events along the way. Throughout the game, your actions will earn you rank marks that will determine the winner. Played on a modular board that is built as you play, Star Travelers combines classic mechanics with modern, modular components to keep game play fresh every time you play. Based on the sci-fi book series by author K. E. Knights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Monopoly: Croatia
description:
The goal of the game is to buy property, rent it, resell it, gain as much money as possible and by the end of the game become the only player on the board.

The Monopoly Croatia lets you buy Zagreb sights (the building of the Croatian National Theater and the Museum of Arts and Crafts), Pula Arena, the enchanting islands of Hvar and Brac, the Plitvice lakes, baroque Varaždin, Dubrovnik, Rovinj, Rijeka...
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Satisfy
description:
Sexual communication is an extremely important part of any healthy relationship.

Satisfy is a game where two players act as partners, each trying to satisfy each other’s needs by following clues and trying their best to finish as simultaneously as possible.

The players each have a set of increasingly difficult secret Goals that they want to try to satisfy before their hand or the Stimulation Deck runs out of cards. These goals represent different arrangements of the markers on the Shared Experience board.

Inspired by such games as Fog of Love and Codenames, Satisfy will exercise your empathy and understanding by putting both of you in a vulnerable and often hilarious place.

Gameplay

In Satisfy, both players will take turns moving markers along the Shared Experience Board. Each column on the board represents a different aspect of a sexual encounter:


Voice
Touch
Mouth
Genitals


Both players will be moving the four markers up and down these tracks to match the increasingly difficult goal cards in front of their partner. There are five levels of goal cards, and once one is matched it is replace by one of the next higher level.

To move these markers, the players will take turns playing Stimulation cards. These cards indicate two colors whose markers will be pushed. As you play the card, you describe to
your partner what you’re doing to them. Played cards are handed to your partner who adds them to their own hand.

When you match your goal, your partner will draw an Action card. These can be used assist you in your experience. When a final goal is met, begin discarding your Stimulation cards in a race to both finish as close to the same time as possible.

Inclusivity

All pronouns used in the game are non-gendered. This is a game for couples of any orientation or persuaion. The art on the cards features gay, straight, lesbian, and non-binary people.

It is intended for any couple willing to explore how they communicate with each other and are willing to have a fun time.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
description:
Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
The National Federation of Firefighters of France honors firefighters at the heart of the famous Monopoly® game.

In this special edition, the aim will be to bring relief to the population during everyday incidents as well as during major events.
A new fun opportunity to familiarize yourself with the world of firefighters, with family or friends.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Outpaced
description:
Storyline:

Scientists now knew it was the end of the world. They predicted that a scourge of natural disasters would hit the earth getting increasingly more dangerous until they wiped out all life on earth. The nation's government leaders came up with a solution to build a giant government facility larger than any structure on earth capable of withstanding these natural disasters and producing all the energy they needed to sustain human life. Taxes rose drastically that year as the nation's people raced to outpace the disasters and finish the massive project. It was finished with almost no time to spare but, that was when the government announced that the citizens who paid for the construction were not allowed to stay in the bunker. The now corrupt government even kicked citizens out of the main city and built a wall protecting it so that the government could hoard the cities valuable resources. You are in charge of a small group of survivors that were kicked out of the city and the disasters start tomorrow. Your only chance to survive the end of the world which is happening in only a few weeks is to break into the government facility and overthrow the government. In the meantime, though you will have to build makeshift bunkers using resources to protect yourself against natural disasters, get valuable provisions to keep your survivors alive, and repair weapons, vehicles, and tools to improve your chance of survival and help you defend yourself against other groups of survivors looking to overthrow the government before you do. This is Outpaced.

Gameplay:
Each round is split into three phases. Exploration, Fortification, and Catastrophe.

In the exploration phase players have 1 minute indicated by a timer to quickly roll dice that allow players to move around the city, collect resource cards from various locations, destroy gates that allow players to access more of the map, and make it back to their bunker before the timer runs out if players don’t make it back to the bunker in time they lose 1 of their five lives and all of their resources from the natural disaster that occurs in the catastrophe phase.

In the fortification phase players take turns spending their resources to fortify their bunker, buy more dice, and/or craft builds like weapons, vehicals, and tools to gain an advantage in the game.

In the catastrophe phase players draw a disaster card. The disaster card weakens players bunkers and destroys various locations on the map effecting gameplay in the next round. If the disaster destroys your bunker you will also lose one of your 5 lives.

Disasters will get increasingly harder every round until all players die or a player destroys all the gates on the map and breaks into the governments bunker in the center of the map.

If more than one player makes it to the government facility it turns into a battle where the player that rolls the most combat dice wins the game.

-description from designer
categories: Civilization, Electronic, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Events, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: Châteaux de la Loire
description:
Monopoly Châteaux de Loire: the classic board game where the goal is to be the last player not to go bankrupt.

This edition lets the player buy some of the most famous Châteaux of the Loire Valley (Chamborg, Chevreuil, Amboise, Chenonceau, Saumur, Angers, Blois...) of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Plantel
description:
In Football Season, players take on the role of managers of a football club and need to control various aspects of the team such as hiring players, lineup, training, medical department and also taking care of the team's image. Over the course of 4 seasons the teams will dispute the national championship and fight for the title, but the opponents are not easy and it will be necessary to invest in the right areas to have the best team of all time.

Choose your starting 11, face the best teams in the tournament, but watch out for injuries that can take your ace off the field. Invest in a good coach or improve your training conditions, send scouts to attract new talents and even compete in the Cup for chances to increase your income. In the end, the best manager will be the one who has achieved the most success with his new club.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Market, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Capture the Flag: Battle
description:
Capture the Flag: Battle is a 2-4 pvp round-based-strategy game. Where you have to fight against your friends and family to see who gets the flag first!

Every round you place 1 flag in the middle of the board. If a player gets the flag and goes through the portal, he won the round. The first player that collects 2 flags, wins the game!

Every player has one life-point, if he get's attacked,he dies and goes back to the Starting-point.If a player has the flag while he gets attacked, he drops the flag on the last tile he was standing.

You can attack other players by using Attack-Cards or collect Item-Cards that will help you in the battle.

At the beginning of a round, the player must decide whether to use a card or not. After rolling the dice, the player is not allowed to use any cards. So use them carefully and wisely. Every player keeps his collected cards for the next round! If you know you can't catch up to the player with the flag, it would be wisely to keep your strong cards for the next round.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Race

name: Monopoly: New York Yankees Collectors Edition
description:
Mr. Monopoly hits one out of the ballpark in the Yankees Collector's edition of the Monopoly Game. With 39 American League Pennants and 26 World Series Trophies under their belt, a record in both cases, the Yankees set the bar for every other ball club in Major League Baseball.

In this completely customized MONOPOLY game, fans of the Bronx Bombers can buy, sell and trade all-star Yankees players like Derek Jeter, Mariano Rivera and Alex Rodriguez - as well as some of the newer Yankees players like Robinson Cano and clean cut Johnny Damon. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: Yankees cap, batter, pitcher, ball in glove, World Series trophy and catcher’s mask.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Monopoly: Orlando Edition
description: Monopoly with a Orlando, Florida theme.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: The Bear Game
description:
The Bear Game is a comedically styled card game inspired by Battle Royales, Russian Roulette, and our other favorite party games. It’s got bears that attack, bears that defend, and bears that kill you. It's got it all really.

Players must either outlast their opponents or be the first to obtain 12 cards. But you must beware of the Evil Bear cards. If drawn, you’ll have to face the deadly consequences or hope someone (including yourself) can save you with a Bear Mace card. The other cards included will allow you to gain more cards, attack your opponents, hurt yourself, switch up the physical setting, and even accuse opponents of cheating! While playing you’ll run into familiar characters, but with a fun and cartoonish art style. This 2-6 player game can be strategic, chaotic, and most definitely fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Ready or Not: The board game that could save your life.
description:
What if the Red Cross joined with the creators of Trivial Pursuit and Dungeons & Dragons to make a family board game?

This game lets a family have fun while learning how to be safer. What would you do if you found ET or Casper the ghost in your home? Does everyone know how to turn the gas or power off to the home or what to do in case of an earthquake or tornado.

The game combines trivia questions with what if questions to see if the family knows what to do. Is the family Ready or Not in the Real World.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: The Medium: a Marshall McLuhan Board Game
description:
Inspired by legendary Canadian philosopher and innovative media thinker Marshall McLuhan (1911-1980), this board game gamifies Laws of Media. The New Science (1988), developed by Marshall McLuhan and his son Eric McLuhan (1942-2018). Also known as “McLuhans’ Tetrad”, the Laws of Media reveal the four constant rules that govern all human innovations, four questions that can be asked in order to understand the implications that will inevitably result from any medium.

An entertaining and educational board game that stimulates players’ cooperative, innovative, and creative thinking skills.

Educational and hilarious for the novice and expert alike, The Medium is fast-paced, engaging and brainy fun that will have young and old laughing... as they learn out loud.

This game is played in teams of two or more players. Each round, one team member tries to get their team to guess the medium on the card. Clues take the form of answers to the four questions of The Laws of Media. Teams move along the board when a medium is guessed correctly, pulling themselves out of the Maelstrom.

Use The Medium to analyze an artifact or human innovation from the past or present, and enjoy being the first team to escape the media maelstrom!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting
publishers: (Self-Published), The Estate of Marshall McLuhan & the McLuhan Foundation

name: Cold War Combat: ACM
description:
Cold War Combat is a miniature wargame based around the Cold War.
The initial entry in the series, Cold War Combat: ACM focuses on fighter jet combat.
The game features a streamlined ruleset that makes it easy for beginners to pick up and play, with additional advanced rules that can be applied to add layers of depth to the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: The Machiavelli
description:
The king has died and with only the twin princes remaining, both have claim to the crown, which means its time for internal war!

The Machiavelli is an abstract two player board game where you must place and then move your pieces to either form a lign of 5 of your 6 pieces or flank the enemy prince with two of your pieces in order to depose him and become the new king.

This game is one that may be quick and simple to learn however through gameplay you may find it's difficult to master due to the verity of different play styles and combinations you can experience in the quick yet intense matches you play against your friends and foes

Inspired by many ancient games such as nine men's morris among others this game would not be out of place amongst rowdy tavern goers or stern military generals and soldiers.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Twin Realms
description:
Twin Realms is a complex dungeon crawler.

Players will be controlling elemental spirits that protect the world from an army of demons. Each quest is unique and many of them have specific objectives. They are not only limited to "kill all that moves".
The combat is played in turns on a board (different for every quest) divided into squares and players will be able to perform actions using a deck of ability cards unique to each elemental spirit.
The distinct feature of the game is hinted in its name. You will be playing in two realms. Physical, and spiritual. The playable characters as well as enemies have 2 forms with different abilities in each realm. The movement will be different in each realm. And some board elements will be different between realms (imagine walls that you can pass through as a spirit but not in physical form). The combat and gameplay will be guided by the fact that you will have to switch between realms to optimize your combat abilities, to avoid enemy attacks etc.

All characters will be developed by levelling up from 1 to 10. Apart from regular upgrades to health and your ability cards you will be able to choose additional perks and choose your path in the game. You can focus on passive abilities, special system of attack modifiers, additional boosts to your cards or special rage cards. You will not be able to maximise all of the perks so every player will be able to build their character in their own way. You can build a character with a very strong set of cards less reliable on attack modifiers. You can build a character that has no upgrades on the cards but most of the attack modifiers are critical hits, burn targets, disarm them or add other status effects. You can build a character that does not focus on any of that but instead generates a ton of rage and exploits various bonuses of the rage deck.

Each character will be able to fulfil a specific role in the company based on its abilities and its build. The roles are the usual set of tanks, assassins, mages and supports. However, that only applies to the physical realm.
While in physical realm each character will try to fulfil their assigned role, in spirit realm all characters are the same, which means that in spirit realm you will share the responsibilities of dealing and taking damage. When you kill enemy spirits, you will be gathering their essence and taking over their actions to create interesting combat situations.

The game takes place in a unique world not long after its creation. There are no humans, dwarves, elves or any other races yet in it. The elementals and the demons are being led by primordial forces of good and evil. As you progress through the game you will learn more about the mythology of this world and what role you play in the history of things.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Chaining, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid

name: Jerusalem: '48
description:
Jerusalem: '48 is a module for the Arab Israeli War of 1948 focusing on the battle of Jerusalem, from December 1947 to 18 July 1948.

GENESIS II is needed to play this module.
It offers larger hexes, lay-flat, hard boards.
4 scenarios are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Rally Point Volume 14: The 1940 Campaign in the West
description:
Includes ASL Scenarios from The Tampa ASL Group (2017). Action in Belgium, France & The Netherlands.

RP 131: Boot's Scoot and Boogie
RP 132: Probe Toward The Hague
RP 133: The Recapture of Ockenburg
RP 134: Von Sponeck's Woods
RP 135: The Outpost Line
RP 136: La Riposte Vaine
RP 137: Chateau Gandelu
RP 138: The Chivres Shivaree
RP 139: Mauled at Merdorp
RP 140: Warwickshire at Wormhouldt
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Hungry Bunnies on Parade
description:
Welcome to Carrot Meadows - a town where the bunnies love to put on costumes and parade about. As a good bunny owner, you will help them to do both. Oh, and they also love to eat. So don't forget to feed them some tasty treats along the way!

In this fast-paced game, players compete to have the most victory points at the end of the game by collecting the best combination of cute costumes, tasty treats, and long bunny parades.

Hungry Bunnies on Parade is an adorable and competitive card-and-dice game for the whole family. Push your luck to reward bunnies with food, strategically collect bunnies, costumes, and treats, and then compete for the most points and best parades!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Market, Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Ingredo Dinos
description:
Hatch and collect dinosaurs. Find the right habitat for your Dinos and be the first to become a Dino master. Ingredo Dinos is a family friendly easy to learn card game. There are 3 ways to play all from the one deck!

To win a game of INGREDO DINOS you must be the first to hatch 10 Dino cards. There are 8 unique Dino cards (4 copies of each) and 10 unique Habitat cards. There are 3 special cards: Pickaxe, Egg Lab and D-fence cards. Pickaxe cards when discarded let the player draw 3 cards. Egg Labs and D-fence cards can be used as any single Dino or habitat card respectively. Each Dino card requires at least 4 habitat cards in hand to hatch a Dino card. Except for carnivorous Dinos which only need 2, as long as there is prey to eat!

Players start with 6 cards in hand and choose to draw 1 card from a HABITAT deck or from the top of a recycle pile each turn then discard 1 card into the recycle pile.

There are 3 modes of play: ZOO, CHASE, and WILD. In ZOO and CHASE, players draw from a HABITAT deck which only has habitat cards, Dino cards are separated. In WILD mode players draw from a WILD deck with both Dino and habitat cards mixed together.

ZOO: each player is given 10 Dino cards in a face down Zoo deck and must hatch the Dino cards in the given order. First to completely hatch all their Dinos wins.
CHASE: each player competes to plant a common Dino card, first to hatch gets the card, first to get 10 Dino cards wins.
WILD: by drawing from a WILD deck each player must now have both the Dino card and the required habitat cards in hand to plant. First to hatch 10 Dino cards wins.

Game can be shortened or lengthened by decreasing or increasing the winning number of Dinos in each mode. Also all mode can be played as single or paired teams.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Prehistoric
mechanics: Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Matching, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Race, Simulation

name: The First Interstellar Empires
description:
The First Interstellar Empires is a game of space exploration, colonization, and conflict. It is set in the first decades of humanity reaching out to the stars. The game board is an accurate map of the space around our own solar system, a cube 25 light years on each side with our Sun at the center.

Each player takes the roll of a nation on Earth (or Mars or the asteroid belt) that will be active in exploring the stars. In his turn a player takes actions such as: Explore a star system, that is, determine if it has useful planets and how difficult they will be to colonize. Build a colony. Invest in a colony, that is, increase its production. Form an alliance with an independent colony, or try to break up an alliance between another player and an independent colony. Research to improve your technology. And of course, invade another player's colony and attempt to conquer it.

Each nation has a "competence" in each of four areas: military, economy, diplomacy, and science. These determine your efficiency in each area. For example, if your science is poor, you may devote huge resources to research and still not get anywhere.

Each turn a player draws an "event" card. These can be good, bad, or depend on circumstances. Events include things like leaders who improve your competence and corruption that reduces it, economic problems, attrition in colonies with harsh environments, rebellions and civil wars. But you don't have to play a card right away. You can hold on to good cards to use them at just the right moment -- like play a "great military leader" just when another player attacks you and turn the tables on him. You can hold on to a bad card in the hopes of preparing to cope with it ... or at least, kicking the can down the road.

Players can advance their technology in four areas: Starships, which increases the range at which you can operate; Colonization, which determines how difficult it is to establish colonies, build new "starbases", and such; Terraforming, which lets you make harsh planets more suitable for human life; and Weapons, which increase your capabilities in war.

Winner is the player who has the greatest production at the end of the game. This can be achieved by building many colonies, by growing your economy and making your colonies rich, or by conquering other players. Or by destroying other players' colonies: you might still be poor but they'll be poorer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Z: Lost Trails
description:
Inspired by the historical legacy of Colonel Percy Fawcett, Z, Lost Trails is a strategy deck-building card game with both competitive and cooperative game modes. The game progresses through 3 stages as you prepare your finances in London, gather a team and resources in South America, and finally embark on an expedition through the Jungle. This game is designed to challenge your ability to plan ahead, out-maneuver, and survive one of the most legendary quests the world has ever known.

Deep in the dark jungles of the Amazon rainforest, lies hidden a lost city known only as Z. It may be in the center of a nearly impenetrable forest, along an undiscovered black river, deep in some snake infested canyon, or on top of a lonely, craggy peak, guarded by denizens from a forgotten time. This archeological marvel only awaits discovery from a courageous and intrepid explorer such as yourself. Many have gone in search of it, but few have returned to regale their friends and colleagues with the tale of their sufferings and defeat. This game allows you the opportunity to be a turn-of-the-century explorer; taking you from your living room to the dark and dangerous recesses of South America. Combat poisonous snakes, deadly spiders, tropical diseases, murderous savages, and untimely mishaps on your quest to find the lost trails to Z, a city of great riches, personal bliss, and just possibly the answer to your most profound questions and desires. Select your character and fulfill their dream. But remember, you need to embark properly outfitted with porters, mules, weapons, supplies, and medicines, if you are to have any chance of finding the clues that can insure your survival and, just possibly, success.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Exploration, Horror, Travel
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Investment, Lose a Turn, Race, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Renegade Legion: Centurion
description:
Centurion is a tactical tabletop miniatures game, where the 75th Century grav-tanks of the mighty human TOG Empire battle the interspecies alliance of the Union and the rebellious, ex-TOG Renegade Legions.

With pre-painted miniatures, a dynamic and intuitive altitude system, and flexible unit management, the ever-shifting battlefields of the 75th Century are yours to command right out of the box. Players new to tabletop wargames and tabletop veterans alike can quickly engage in high-risk, high-reward combat with fresh mechanics that provide clarity and depth.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Random, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Birdie
description:
In Birdie, play as a silly bird-golfer with a unique ability and jump on to the golf course!

Create your own terrains using brilliant modular tiles or play on over 18 different premade terrains. Select your clubs wisely or push your luck to complete the courses in the fewest strokes possible! Beware of sand pits, water ponds, and many other natural obstacles if you want to avoid any penalties!

On your turn, play a card from your hand or push your luck with the first card of the deck. Then, add any card with the same value to boost your stroke even further. Caddies will let you add another card to the mix, and wedges will help you get out of the sand. The higher the value of your stroke, the further your ball will go! With trees to bounce off your ball, hills to change where it lands, and other golfers messing around the course, each game creates its own story.

Choose the game length by playing 6, 9 or 18 holes and test your skills to elect the new champion!

Play with 4 others concurrents, in teams, or simply try to beat your own score in solitaire. Birdie offers a simple and quick gameplay that truly lives up to the experience of Golf.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Campaigns of Ozz
description:
Campaigns of Ozz recreates the battles and campaigns for the control of the post apocalyptic Land of Ozz. While Campaigns of Ozz is designed to be played as a stand alone board wargame, it is fully compatible with the Wars of Ozz miniatures game system by John “Buck” Surdu and the miniatures figure line as each counter represents a regiment of miniatures.
Players control the armies of the four main nationalities of Ozz including Munchkins, Quadlings, Winkies and Gillikins plus a wide variety of mercenary units.
This is not your parents land of Ozz but rather a much darker and more dangerous land where the threat of invasion and conquest is ever present. This is reflected in the wide range of historical battles and campaigns included which chart the blood soaked recent history of Ozz.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Minimap Resolution, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: AbsoluteZero
description:
AbsoluteZero is a 2 player card game from Japan.

Summon monsters and use magic and skills to defeat your opponent! This is a TCG-type card game using a common deck of cards!

You can summon higher-level monsters by sacrificing (discarding) monsters, including those of your opponent! Summon one monster per turn and you only have life of 10 HP! There's a lot of counter-magic, so your tactics are the key!

モンスター召喚と魔法・スキルを使って相手を倒せ！山札共通型TCG風カードゲーム！
相手モンスター含め生贄（召喚時に対象捨て札）に捧げられる上位モンスター召喚がある！
召喚は1ターン1匹、ライフはたった10！対抗魔法が多めなので駆け引きが肝！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Interrupts, Variable Player Powers

name: A Kingly Fight: The Battle of Bouvines, July 27, 1214
description:
“The knights and the auxiliaries, armed and arranged into ordered echelons, prepared in all haste for the battle. The horses’ bridles were tightened by the auxiliaries. The armour shone in the splendor of the sun and it seemed that the light of day was doubled. The banners unfolded in the winds and offered themselves to the currents; they presented a delightful spectacle to the eyes.” –comment by the author of the Relation Marchianensis de Pugna Bovinis on the French army’s preparation for battle.

Following the Third Crusade tensions among the monarchs of Western Europe was at a new high. Otto IV, King of Portugal and newly crowned Holy Roman Emperor was facing revolt in the German provinces, many of whom were actively supported by the French King, Philip II, The Emperor had also garnered the enmity of Pope Innocent III soon after he was crowned when Otto claimed the Kingdom of Sicily, which he then attacked in 1209, which caused the Pope to excommunicate him. English King, John, was also involved with a growing conflict with the French, who were steadily taking lands along the border with Normandy. Indeed, John had only recently assumed the thrown following the death of his older brother, Richard (the Lionhearted) during a siege to retake one of the castles the French had captured earlier while the English king was on crusade. Tensions boiled over to outright war when the Pope authorized King Philip to launch a crusade against the upstart Holy Roman Emperor and his allies. The Battle of Bouvines, fought near the city of Tournai, was one of the largest ever fought in the Medieval period, and its outcome would affect the course of history for centuries.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: The Art of Boxing Clever
description:
Theme
The Art of Boxing Clever simulates almost all aspects of the real-life boxing match into a highly specific and player controlled, intense decision-making match experience. Aspects recreated in the board game include the stance and style of the boxers; boxer initiative, 10 attributes of the selected boxer; head/body area target selection; punch type selection, defence move selection; damage resistance attributes, increasing damage tracking; judge scoring, knockdown count sequence. In essence this unrivalled boxing game mechanism creates the feel of the real ebb and flow of a typical boxing match and the unpredictability of ‘one punch can make all the difference’.

Goal
The goal is to outthink and outmanoeuvre your opponent to consistently inflict damage by exploiting their weaknesses, whilst protecting your own. Damage is realised by the depletion of the opponent’s card hand until either the hand is completely depleted, or a KO or TKO is achieved through a visible damage tracking system.

Gameplay
The game centres around a timely selection of appropriate punch / defence cards from a tailored hand of cards specific to each fighter to inflict damage to selected areas of the opponent’s head and body. Damage is tracked and consequences are specific to each fighter.
Players select their boxer depending on style, stance and attributes.
For each match-up a predetermined hand of cards is dealt representing the attributes of the boxer.
A 10-round match with 3 scoring judges.
Each round takes the form of 5 mini-rounds which involves 5 turns of attacking and defending. Each turn includes 2 potentially defendable attack moves, one to a selected area of the head and one to an area of the body. The selection of the cards and target area is critical to achieve damage. Any damage inflicted is tracked on the gameboard and consequences to the opponent’s hand of cards is realised and the judges scoring is revealed.
The play sequence thereby creates poker style opportunities for bluffing and counter bluffing, minimizing ‘Chance’ to maximize player control, creating a high sense/degree of anticipation.
The variety of the cards provide multiple ways and exciting combinations to out manoeuvre your opponent. The highly player controlled mini rounds are countered by an unpredictable judge scoring system, potentially influencing player strategy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Imposters on Mars
description:
Are you a fan of Imposter or Murder Mystery games? Then Imposters On Mars is the perfect game for you. It turns your house (location) into a real-life game board — a colony on Mars. Beware, an Imposter is sabotaging your hard work. Complete jobs and work together to repair the colony. Keep a close eye and figure out who the Imposters are. Vote and cast them out. But be careful not to vote for the wrong person.

Beware, an Imposter is sabotaging your hard work. Complete jobs and work together to repair the colony. Keep a close eye and figure out who the Imposters are. Vote and cast them out. But be careful not to vote for the wrong person.

Your house is now a real-life game board. The rooms in your house (or location) are the game board's spaces where you’ll complete mini-games. These mini-games are called Jobs. Every Player starts with four cards. The first choose a Player’s color. The Player then takes their matching color Vote card. The third card determines who the Imposters are. Finally, every Player chooses a Career and their Job order.

Every room is set up with a mini-game (matching, math, memory, etc.). These mini-games are called Jobs. Players complete Jobs and share proof of completing them. Playing as the Imposter gives you the ability to sabotage Jobs. Imposters are randomly selected. Imposters sabotage Jobs and force Players to freeze their gameplay for a period of time. This allows the Imposter to make a move and kill or deceive players.

Step away from the table and turn your house into a real-life murder mystery party. Turn off the lights and Bring Your Own Flashlight (BYOF) if you dare to play in the dark.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Math, Memory, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Voting

name: SYNK!
description:
The new, fast-paced card game that combines wordplay, trivia and a dash of deception!

Each round begins with a player selecting a card which will give them a secret word. They must then reveal the first letter of the word to the group.

Players then begin thinking of words beginning with the revealed letter. Anything goes! The aim is to come up with clues that other players will be able to SYNK with you without the cardholder figuring it out. When you've thought of your SYNK! word propose the definition to all players. If another player thinks they know you lock eyes, countdown from 3 and... SYNK! If the two players guess correctly then the next letter of the secret word is revealed. Now all players need to think of a word that starts with the first AND SECOND letter of the secret word. However if the cardholder also guessed the SYNK! word then it's back to square one. The game continues until a player thinks they know the secret word.

If a round comes to a halt with players struggling to figure out the secret word, then the cardholder must reveal its definition. The first player to think they know the answer must then shout “SYNK!”. If a player is able to either correctly SYNK! the secret word with another player or guess the word from the definition they win the round. If players SYNK! or guess incorrectly the cardholder wins. First player to win three cards is the victor and gets full bragging rights - until the next game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Deduction, Layering, Matching, Memory, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Wilderness Dice: Bring Your Own Dice
description:
Wilderness Dice is back! This time as a ‘Bring Your Own Dice’ edition. This version shares all the classic gameplay of Wilderness Dice, but comes without the 12x 6-sided dice. Being the most common type of dice, it’s our hope that players will be able to go into their collection and snag some dice to play with.

Players who are concerned about having enough dice on hand, we have a 12-pack of dice available.

Wilderness Dice pits two players in a battle to claim dice before their opponent. Each player has a single action to either claim a die or modify it. Players must carefully decide when to modify dice, and when to claim them. Players may also sacrifice dice, keeping any player from claiming them.

The game is played in a series of three rounds. The round ends when there are no more dice to claim, either because players claimed them all – or some have been discarded. Each round players refill their hand back up to six cards, meaning any remaining cards in a players hand hang around until they can eventually claim a die to get rid of them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Monopoly: Crna Gora
description:
A country of miracles and a treasure chest full of the worlds most wonderful jewels. It is as if the legend is true, that God's bag really did tear apart when he was providing gifts of nature, and beautiful things like the mountains fell out of the sky over Montenegro.
Geographers say that, although not large, this area in south Europe and the Balkans is unique for its diversity, and was created in ancient times by strong forces of nature.
Whether created by the forces or not, it has turned into something beautiful, unusual and magnificent!
If you enjoy spectacular nature, absolute relaxation and recreational activities, Montenegro is a place where you can experience a joyful energy. The country is great fun, providing adrenaline filled adventures and competitive thrills. You can find long and protected sandy beaches, providing thousands of kilometres of hiking and cycling trails as well as fast flowing rivers ideal for rafting and kayaking and superb ski paths.

Key Features

The world's best family board game brings you another exciting edition
Choose your favourite token, tour your favourite sites and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy
Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Freeform Skirmish Referee
description:
Freeform Skirmish Referee is a wargame where two or more players are in control of a force of combat focused units.

The players give the orders for their units to an adjudicating referee who interprets the outcomes of these orders in the game world.

The referee then presents these outcomes to the players.

It is different from most wargames in that the players do not need to know any of the rules of the game (in fact there are none - the entire game depends on the adjudication of the referee).

The players simply need to know what type of fighting force they would like to play and to tell the adjudicating referee the actions they would like that force to take.

Guidelines are presented in this PDF for running the game, creating units, providing orders and adjudicating turns.

Additionally, d6 tables for action resolution and a page of sample units are provided.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Sinosphere: Global Conflict
description:
Sinosphere: Global Conflict is a d100 retro-style mass combat wargame based on the modern and near future (2020 - 2034) predicted war in the First Island Chain and South China Sea.
You will play as a number of global and regional superpowers, as they battle for their own set of ideals and alliances.

This game allows the players to visualise the incoming conflict.
China has already told the world it wants to take Taiwan by any means and eyes longingly other islands in the first island chain.
America has not confirmed its defence of the island.

However, Japan has, with its own islands at risk from the waking dragon.

The game is intended for 28-32mm minis

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Crime International
description:
You, as a criminal, will have to compete with other criminals (other players), in order to commit your assigned crimes and win.

As the game proceeds, you must gather objects - items, that are described on your mission card. Once you've gathered the required items, then you will have to travel to the destination city, described on your mission card as well, and then try to commit your crime.

On your turn, you always have to travel towards a city. When you enter a city, you can draw an item card and interact with other criminals that you met inside the city, or in some other cases, you may interact with someone who is currently far away from you.

You can shoot another criminal, or hire a professional to do it. You can steal from another criminal, you can spy on them with your surveillance kit, you can use your anesthetic spray to immobilize them, you can force them to quit on their mission and get a new one, or you can set a trap for them. You can even get to drink with them in a bar, or fight them out in the streets.

The winner is the first one who will manage to complete a minimum of 3 missions. But this is up to you. The game is designed so that players may keep on playing for as long as they like and it allows a player to join in at any time!

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Memory, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Mindwalkers
description:
Mindwalkers is a social deduction game in which players have the powerful ability to hijack the minds of their opponents, forcing them to do their bidding.

The game takes place over five days and four nights. During the day, players travel around the magical city of Elysia to work towards one of two main objectives: accumulating energy at The Origin, or banishing opponents from the council. Both are accomplished through voting, so securing the trust and cooperation of other players is key to victory. Players can also draw and play spells or magical artifacts to gain a strategic advantage.

At night, players further their agendas by Mindwalking one of their opponents. Mindwalks are issued by passing written commands to the victim, hidden from their opponents' view. These commands are open ended and completely up to the player's imagination!

The game ends when a player or faction completes their hidden win condition. Will you be the one pulling the strings over the council, or will you end up dancing to someone else's tune? Control your opponents. Control destiny.
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Grabbelbox
description:
A chaotic tactical family game. 2 to 4 players do not try to throw their pieces into the box, as they end up getting them out of it again under difficult conditions.

The game is played in 3 rounds of 2 phases.

Each player picks stones of a single color. In the first phase, players stand around the box and try to throw everyone else's stones in the box. This phase ends when all the stones of one player/color are in the box. Players get a point for each of their stones in the box.

At the start of the second phase, someone chooses a handicap card and everybody tries to pick their stones out of the box with this handicap at the same time. This round ends when one person has removed all their stones from the box. All the other players get 1 point per stone left in the box.

After 3 rounds, the game ends and the winner is the player with the least total points.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: After School Adventure: The Game
description:
After School Adventure is a go anywhere adventure game where players bypass difficult encounters and obtain wondrous treasures. ASA has 4 unique adventured players can embark on. Each adventure has its own unique challenges. The adventures include; The Old Mansion, The Spooky Forest, The carnival and The Caverns.
Adventurers start with a specific set of skills. Skills help determine the ability of adventures to bypass encounters. Skills can be enhanced or hindered by treasure object obtain throughout each adventure. All skills accumulate from adventure to adventure. Each players skills change depending on the treasure objects found. Players can obtain special trinkets that can aid then throughout the adventures.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Cemetery
description:
Shovels and Tombs, rotten Corpses and Zombies, the life of an undertaker is plenty of dangers.

Keeping your cemetery in check is a challenging job!

First, you need to bury corpses, then you need to keep them buried!
You can’t rest a minute.
Tombs are scarce and you may just think to bury corpses in any tomb, but don’t be fooled, these are the corpses that will haunt you! As soon as you think you may keep your dirty deeds in the ground, someone could just exhume a corpse and let you end up with a zombie in your cemetery!

It’s a dirty job, but someone has to do it!

The Cemetery is a cynical fast-paced game, easy to learn and fun to play where you cover the role of an Undertaker and your job is to bury corpses 3 meters under.
Each corpse has a value and until their tombs are sealed you need to watch out! Your opponents can exhume your corpses and rise a zombie in your cemetery!
All corpses in sealed tombs are your Victory Points.

Every card holds an ability, choose which to bury and which to use to support your plan and undermine your opponents', Developments can help you find the finest strategy to achieve victory.

Strategically intriguing for the savvier players, The Cemetery with its minimalist design is suitable for everyone thanks also to the alternative easy setup for the youngest players.

Beautifully illustrated by Agni Sen (has worked on Disney and Nickelodeon animated shows), The Cemetery comes in 2 versions, “original edition” and “Pet edition” that combined can be played by up to 8 people.

Your dream finally comes true… You are now in charge of the afterlife!

Grab your shovel, start digging, and build the most fun Cemetery in Town.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hidden Victory Points

name: The Ur Variations
description:
This hand-crafted artisanal gaming set combines four new games with four ancient games. The new games include a devious abstract strategy game (Oasis), a crazy version of Senet in which you move both forward and backward on every turn, and can move not only the pawns but also the spaces on the board itself (Sand), an ultra fast and exciting push-your-luck game that plays in under 5 minutes (Caravan), and a 4-player multi-species strategy game (Ostriches and Alligators). The ancient games include the Royal Game of Ur, the Advanced Game of Ur, Senet, and Aseb.

All games are played on a modular wooden gameboard into which different tiles are inserted in a different pattern for each game. Some games make use of a modular "board extension" that consists of an extra two spaces for tiles. Most of the games make use of throwing sticks as randomizers, though one game, Oasis, involves no luck at all. Playing pieces include hand-painted wooden discs as well as pawns cast in resin from clay sculptures and then hand painted.

The Ur Variations is the third and final entry in game designer Zach Horton's "Ancient Games trilogy," following re-creations of Mehen and Men.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Dos Rollos
description:
Dos Rollos is a fast, easy, family-friendly dice game! players take two turns rolling both dice each time trying to roll a total dice sum matching one of the three face-up cards!

Match a face-up card! keep it, placing the card face-up in front of you, adding the point value listed on the card to your game points total! but watch out for those special & symbol cards that allow you to:


Steal a card from another player!
Return a card back to the draw pile!
Keep a card safe from potential thieves!
Blow up another player's cards making them lose all their game points!
Win all three face-up cards in a single roll!


The goal of Dos Rollos is to be the first player to accumulate or exceed 100 total game points!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: LAN ZIN  CARD GAME
description:
As a tactician amid the chaos of the warring states period, deploy Samurai you've enlisted and make battle formations with them.

Completing formations boosts Morale and Rewards. As your Morale rises higher, you can summon more soldiers, also call your support unit and strategists. Even with samurai soldiers sent by others, win as many Rewards as possible and lead your military to victory.

By placing Samurai cards with the same crest or number in a specific arrangement, players can complete a formation. Each completed formation provides you with Morale and Rewards. Morale, your military spirit, enables you to enlist more soldiers and strategists. It also allows you to acquire one row or column that can potentially provide Rewards according to the number of cards placed at the end of the game.

Earning more Rewards than the other players is the main objective of this game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Forts & Forests:  The War for North America
description:
In Forts & Forests: The War for North America, you command one of the 18th century’s great superpowers in a struggle to control Canada, the American colonies and the vast wealth of the continent beyond.

But the French & Indian War is only part of a greater global conflict, so resources are limited and must be allocated with care. Militia is easily raised but unreliable. Regular forces deliver power and strength under fire, but they are expensive and must be transported across an ocean. Then there are gifts to the Indians, whose speed and fierce ambushes can turn the tide of the war, but only if their pricey allegiance can be maintained.

Forts & Forests begins with the British poised to launch an ambitious four-pronged attack to bring the war to a speedy end. They have greater numbers, naval superiority and secure ports, but much of their army is made up of untested colonial provincial forces. The push inland from the Atlantic coast will be difficult, and the support of the powerful Iroquois is tepid at best.

Though outnumbered, most French troops are battle hardened regulars recently arrived from Europe. They are supported by fearsome hordes of western tribes who have been convinced to take up the hatchet against the English invaders. New France also has a geographic advantage; troops and supplies can be moved quickly along the St. Lawrence and Great Lakes with relative ease. But the connection to France is tenuous, especially if the bastion at Louisbourg were to fall!

Forts & Forests’ unique combat system captures the challenges and uncertainties of the wilderness war. Over 300 historically accurate unit cards capture their differing combat, ambush, break, and speed ratings. No battle is a sure victory regardless of numerical superiority!

It will take strategy, determination, and a bit of luck to conquer a land of Forts & Forests and win the War for North America.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Dice, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Eternam
description:
This time you won't be the usual unblemished hero, but the great infernal ruler, master of demons and dragons, summoner of divinity, loved and respected by your cult and feared by the greedy governments of the world!

Eternam is a solitaire dice and cards game. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the monster cards you play. You must choose carefully your demons and dragons, because the stronger the monsters, the more souls they will require of you, and souls are the resource you need to win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: 2020: The Board Game
description:
A game designed for those that wish to leave 2020 behind! Create your circle of friends to help you survive the financial hardships of 2020. Do whatever it takes to survive this year above the rest but remember: Problematic players lose their jobs, sponsorships, friends and sometimes even money.

In 2020: The Board Game, players will use their turns to acquire friends, earn income, and avoid the harrowing pitfalls of the real-life disaster that was the year 2020. On each turn, the player will roll the dice, and move their piece the corresponding number of spaces. They then draw and resolve a Social Media card that will present them with a unique real world event that happened in 2020. After drawing the card, players then must resolve the space they've landed on, which may mean acquiring a new friend to help you through the game, or gaining money and/or paying off debt they've accrued.

Players gain survival points based on the cards that they play, and when a player has acquired ten survival points, the end of the game is triggered. At the end of that round, players count their money and the player with the most money wins.

2020: The Board Game provides players with a chance to look back and laugh at the monstrosity of 2020.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Monopoly: Club Brugge
description:
The largest club in the country celebrates its 130th anniversary and can be discovered shortly via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every centimetre, exciting matches that go back and forth, the insane goal that falls from the sky or the repulsive comeback: experience the most beautiful moments of Club Brugge with family and friends!

Club Brugge is and remains the biggest football club in the country. This has not changed in recent years, quite the contrary.
Dribble through Club icons from past and present.
Discover the best Club players, create your own ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Club Brugge is the ideal way to relive the blue-black's finest moments.

Bluvn Goan - We Are Bruges

The Limited Fan Edition has a stylish hand numbered sleeve. Only 1891 pieces of this edition are available.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Belgian Red Devils
description:
Discover the most famous national football team in the world now via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every inch, captivating matches, the last minute goal for which everyone is holding their breath: experience the most exciting Red Devils moments with your family and friends!

This generation of Devils is the strongest our country has known. Both of them have experience in the best European competitions. Dribble through the national team and discover the best Belgian footballers. Lukaku, De Bruyne, Hazard, Witsel, Vertonghen, Courtois, ... put together your ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Belgian Red Devils is the perfect way to relive the best moments of this golden generation. See you at the final?

This game is bilingual NL-FR. With the English version we add maps and rules in English.

The limited edition gold comes with a hand-numbered gold leaf outer box and certificate. From this box, 1895 pieces are available.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Hasselt
description:
Hasselt has it: its own Monopoly!

Hasselt, provincial capital, trendsetter and ideal base for the province: Limburg begins here.

Historical sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere.
Monopoly Hasselt is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Walk through the rich history and culture of the city, but make sure you don't end up in jail!

Visit the cathedral, build a hotel in the TT district, take a stroll in the Japanese Garden, go to the Jeneverfeesten or run a stall at Pukkelpop! Hasselt is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace one another.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beautiful things Hasselt has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Hasseller, or Hasselt lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Ieper
description:
Ypres, City of Cats, City of Peace and Pearl of the Westhoek.

Historic sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere.
Monopoly Ypres is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Stroll through the rich history and culture of the city but beware of ending up in prison!

Visit the cathedral on the Vandenpeereboomplein, buy a hotel on the Vismarkt, take a stroll on the Fortifications, go to the Ypres Rally or join the Kattenstoet!
Ypres is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace each other.

This Monopoly-edition takes you to all the beauty that Ypres has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Ypres-lover.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Oostende
description:
Ostend, the queen of seaside cities, the most beautiful on the Belgian coast, has its own Monopoly.

Historical sights are combined with modern architecture, art, culture and a lively atmosphere.
Monopoly Oostende is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Visit the Sint-Petrus-en-Pauluskerk, buy the stadium of KV Oostende, build a hotel on the seawall, take a walk on the picket fence or treat your friends during the Paulusfeesten.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Ostend has to offer. This unique edition is the must-have for every Ostend or Ostend enthusiast.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Ensor Edition. Only 160 hand-numbered copies of this edition - in honor of 160 years of Ensor - are made. The box will have a unique sleeve with James Ensor's self-portrait and will contain 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, in Belgium.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Arlon
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Arlon, in Belgium.

Administrative town where all the ministries are represented, military town housing an infantry school, educational center which welcomes many students from neighboring countries, cultural, commercial and industrial center, Arlon has also become a sought-after accommodation center.
With a certain charm, the pretty city combines traditions, folklore and leisure activities in a quality environment. Think of the essential Maitrank festivals

– partial translated description from back of box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Discotheken
description:
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the most beautiful and enjoyable that Belgian nightclubs can offer.
They are ubiquitous and spread across the entire country.
Already for decades they have been an important part of the outing possibilities.

Via Monopoly Discotheken-Discothèques, you will discover the iconic temples of dance, past and present.
Just think of the legendary nights at La Bush, H2O or La Fuse.
Confetti cannons, moving dance floors, fantastic light shows,…
It's all part of it!

–description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: UNSW Edition
description: Challenge your friends to a very special version of your favourite board game! The official UNSW Business School Monopoly features prominent campus locations for some UNSW-themed fun. Let the games begin!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Loads of Roads
description:
You are the city planner over a large construction site. Show your friends that you can build the best city by earning the most victory points in 1 year (12 rounds). Earn victory points by gathering resources to construct buildings, catching fish to show sustainability for large populations, utilizing warehouses to create jobs, gathering gold to speed up production, and connecting major roads to complete road plans. Whoever has the most victory points at the end of the 12th month wins the game!

Do you like building things? Are you a creative person? Do you enjoy solving puzzles? Loads of Roads combines the joy of being creative with the satisfaction that comes from solving an intense puzzle. Whether you are a game geek or the casual player, Loads of Roads has something to offer. A beginner will walk away feeling proud of the city they built, while an intense gamer will stay awake at night thinking about their next strategy. It is very easy to learn, but nearly impossible to master because of the clever game setup. No two games will ever be the same.
mechanics: Multiple Maps, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: KO Memo
description:
The game is based on the memory palace technique, which consists in remembering elements by associating them with known spaces. In this game there are 40 cards set in 8 different rooms of a house. Each card has an out of context object placed in the given environment. Each room has 5 points of interest.

The aim of the game is to remember in sequence the "out of context" object of each tile. The player is facilitated when associating the objects to be remembered to the various rooms and points of interest in the house.

Challenge mode. Each player takes a coloured scoreboard card. The picture cards are shuffled and equally distributed to each player. The remaining cards are set aside. The players place their cards face down in a horizontal row in front of them. The youngest player starts by turning the cards over in their sequence and carefully observing the "out of context" objects for 30 seconds. Then they turns the cards face down again and begins to remember the sequence out loud, naming the objects from left to right and then turning the corresponding card face up for verification, and so on until the end of the row of cards. Each guessed object is worth one point. At the first mistake the player will have to stop and pass the turn to the next player in clockwise order who will play in the same way. At the end of the round, the game goes on until one of the players reaches 20 points (always waiting for the end of the round, so that all players have completed the same number of turns).

Knockout mode. Arrange the cards in a row in the center of the table in multiples of 8, from one to five rows depending on the desired difficulty. All players observe the series for 30 seconds. At the end the youngest player turns the cards face down and begins to remember the sequence, naming the subject on each card and then turning the card over for verification. At the first mistake, the uncovered tiles are turned face down once again and the second player begins. The first player who remembers all the objects wins.
mechanics: Memory

name: iNZects
description:
New Zealand has native creatures found nowhere else in the world, including some interesting insects.

Roll and choose your dice, draw insect tracks to connect the insects to their homes.

A roll-and-draw, print-and-play game with no downtime!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building

name: Animals and Legends Card Game
description:
Animals & Legends is a clever new card game created by a father and son team. This is a deck-building game with a twist that allows from 2 to 4 players to engage in friendly competition with the winner being the last one with their collection of animal cards.

The essence of Animals & Legends is to create a team animals an mythical creatures and then pit them against your opponent in battle. All players can create teams filled with fun, exciting creatures and duke it out using a little luck along with enough strategy to keep the interest of kids and adults alike. You win the game by destroying or stealing animal cards that are held by opposing players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guardians of Fire
description:
Guardians of Fire is an immersive combat exploration game for 2-5 players set in mythological ancient Persia.
It challenges 4 Heroes in chronicled adventures against the Angra Mainyu, the source of all evil.

The game system is an RPG / Dungeon-Crawl. There are six missions, and after each event, each player can improve their abilities and get more gifts.

At the end of each chronicle, 2 events will take place, and they depend on which side wins the game. The time for completing each mission is about 60-90 minutes.

Each game involves an action-packed fight where two sides face off. One of the players assumes the role of the dark side and controls the army of Ahriman. The remaining players take control of the Heroes, who must work together as a team to stop the darkness. Each side takes turns, pitting their strategies against each other in order to achieve their objectives.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: MadSoccer X Touzani
description:
In MadSoccer, every player will be responsible for their own national football team, making sure to tactically defeat the opponents. Everyone has action cards (including attack, defence, penalties, etc.) with different characteristics, and has to properly and thoughtfully use them in order to win. For the game to end, the participants have to manage resources and eliminate the defenders, midfielders and strikers of the rival teams.

How To Play:

Choose your favourite football team! (Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, France, Germany, Portugal, Turkey, and England)
Put your players in the right place and take out all opponents!
First, defeat their defenders - midfielders - forwards and score a goal to kick your opponents out of the tournament.


Defeat your opponents by using attack cards to take out their players. With the action cards, you can bully your fellow players by, for example, taking their cards, having them skip a turn, stealing a player and even more 'nasty' bullying cards! Of course, you can also defend your players in this game with the defence cards (blocks the attack card) or the offside card (blocks the action card). There are also 'super cards' in the game, each of which has a special power. If you really quickly kick your opponent out of the tournament, throw up the 'Penalty' card to take out multiple players immediately. Each team also has a Coach and can be used against the most dangerous attacks to defend you from the other player's attempts to score a goal.

—description from the publisher

Met MadSoccer breng je de spanning van het EK naar je woonkamer! MadSoccer geeft jou de kans met jouw team de rest van de andere teams te verslaan en zo de competitie te winnen.

—description from the publisher (Dutch)
mechanics: Take That

name: Cat Go Nirvana: Awaken Question Battle Game
description:
This game is racing to slow down. It's a good game for practicing to ask powerful question.

The game invites you to think, analyze, consider to slow down your points. Be with yourself for longer to win the game.

With game mechanics the player who slow, the more people want to question you. More good questions from friends who playing together.

Today we try to get the answers that are in front of each other quickly. But it doesn't mean the answer is yours. The answer that is most suitable for you or The answer that maximizes your potential.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cartabad
description:
The little brother of cartaping :-)

Cartabad is a Badminton card game.

The goal is to win the match which is played in two winning sets of 11 points.

Player plays cards in his turn. There are 4 type of cards in this game:

Red cards impose a particular constraint to the opponent.
Green cards increase the possibilities of their owner.
Violet cards change the game for both players.
Orange cards change the other cards


Each card has a name, a particular effect, and acts for a specified period.

On each card are shown:

The effect of the card: "what"
To whom it is addressed: "who"
How long it will work: "when"
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stadt Land Unseriös: XMAS-Special
description:
XMAS-Special of Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös with 72 different and innovative categories for great christmas time.

--

Das XMAS-Special von Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös mit 72 unterschiedlichen, innovativen und weihnachtlichen Kategorien für eine großartige Weihnachts- und Adventszeit.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: El Ñandú
description:
El Ñandú ("The Rhea") is a competitive game, where each player represents a rhea (a kind of bird) in search of on food.
It’s a game of negotiation and speed. Each player starts with 8 cards and in one turn
Simultaneous, in real time, players must exchange their cards among themselves and collect 8 of a certain type to win, or failing that, realize when to stop, not to lose.
Multiple rounds will be played until at least one of the following rounds is fulfilled

Conditions:
Whoever manages to win 5 rounds will be called the fastest Rhea and thus win the game.
Or whoever comes last in 5 rounds will be called the slowest Rhea,
losing and ending like that, the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Navio Pirata
description:
In Navio Pirata ("Pirate Ship"), the player must go through the islands of the board to collect cards and exchange them for the cards that will form the "pirate ship". The winner will be whoever manages to collect the 6 cards first and form his pirate ship.

—user summary
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Talinghaga
description:
Talinghaga is a Filipino word game inspired by Baybayin, an ancient Filipino writing system. Players combine cards with letters and syllables together to create words. The goal of the games is score the most points by creating, stealing, and collecting words.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Spelling

name: So Sus
description:
So Sus is a social deduction game, with the Impostor mechanism. Players begin with hidden roles, either Impostor or Evil Empire, the Evil Empire must complete tasks and uncover the Impostor to win, Impostor players must eliminate all Evil Empire players.

Older players (like me) will recognise the mechanism from the classic Mafia and younger gamers will be understand if they have played Among Us (aka Space Mafia). The unique thing about this game is the way in which it merges real life RPG actions with the board game. essentially the players are immersed in the game and how well you stick to your role will determine how well you perform.

The game comes with a board, a buzzer (for calling emergency meetings), 5 categories of tasks, dice and even a meta game. The Meta Game involves multiple rounds point scoring and in real time Super Powers. such as 'Time Stop' or the 'Impostors Apprentice'.
