And you can add on 'vision-restricting' goggles to make being the Impostor even more fun.

The game has plenty of depth, especially when it comes to the meetings, (the part where you can talk) all sorts of bluffing negotiation and strategy comes in to play here. The intellectual level will always depend on who you play with.

Who is going to Sus the Impostor?

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Real-Time, Role Playing, Three Dimensional Movement, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Finders Creeperz
description:
"Finders Creeperz" is a uniquely clever and challenging game that requires a combination of strategy, luck and killer instinct. A plethora of different gameplay scenarios will unfold giving a different outcome every time and fun for all of the family. The aim of the game is to trick and capture your opponents with the help of your CREEPER, action cards and traps (pre-game traps and on board traps) leaving you in the clear to get around the board and take the win. It's high paced from start to finish and you can be called in to action on anyone's turn. Just because your go is done, you are most certainly not safe. The attack/question cards are hectic and full of twists. Those who you think are your friends often turn out to be enemies and you are all but guaranteed to have to choose between one friend or another. We take no responsibility for any arguments that follow. Do you trap your kid or let your partner win? Will you put yourself in a trap just to send your best friend back to the start? OF COURSE YOU WILL! Be ruthless. Be bold.

Yes, we know that the vast majority of games claim to be equally as fun for parents as it is for kids but this one actually is... Trust me, as a parent there is little I enjoy more than the look on a kid's face go from joy and smugness when they think they are going to win, to despair and anger when they slowly realise they most certainly are not. It's like a fun punishment. "Funishment," if you will... After all, they'd most certainly do it to you! Life isn't fair and they will soon realise this.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jigsaw Monopoly: Lancaster PA
description:
Jigsaw Monopoly features a 100 piece puzzle of the game board which adds to the fundraising selling point, but does not actually affect gameplay as a paper copy of the board is included should players not wish to complete a puzzle in order to play the game.

The game plays similarly to a traditional game of monopoly but features art of local businesses and landmarks to the Lancaster PA area. Jigsaw Monopoly does include new rules and features that differ to standard monopoly such as:


The option to play the stock market at the end of a players turn
The option to gamble money and properties against the bank for big payoffs which can change the game at any given turn and allows players with poor luck to turn the tide of a game.


—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Kings of War: Shadows in the North – 2 Player Starter Set
description:
The Nightstalkers have come. Having slithered past the Northern Alliance's defences, an army now marches towards the fortress city of Chill with a terrible, insatiable hunger.
The desperate patrols of the Northern Alliance must hold them back at all costs, or risk losing their homelands and the secret at the heart of the city that they have sworn to protect.

Kings of War is a mass-battle fantasy wargame set in the world of Pannithor.
Rank upon rank of soldiers march into bloody combat, while winged demons battle fiery dragons overhead.
From launching devastating bombardments of artillery, to tactically out-flanking your opponent's forces, Kings of War is a game of exciting, expansive fantasy battles.

This starter set contains two great plastic starter armies for Kings of War (the foul Nightstalkers and the noble Northern Alliance), a softback book with the full game rules, complete army lists for 14 different factions, and a getting started booklet to help you with your first games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Care
description:
In the absence of the Villains, an ancient dungeon is the place where "Dungeon Care", a mysterious organisation, provides special services. They gather the children of the Villains, little Villennials, so they can safely await their parents' return, and at the same time do not break out to the surface to wreak havoc and destruction...

You will play as a brave Adventurer who will descend deep into these dungeons with a special task - take the role of a caretaker of this place, who survives until the next dawn and won't hurt any of the monsters inside!

Occasional looting of the dungeon is accepted.

The little Villennials, however, will not make things easy for you. They will set traps and throw a variety of challenges at you. Their pets will try to tear you up, and their dark moods will threaten your mental health.

Your role is to be patient and not get stuffed. The good part is, that the energy and ideas of the little Villennials are not limitless. At some point they will simply fall asleep...

On the other hand, if your entire party will drop dead from exhaustion or lose their temper, thus falling into a berzerk - your career and adventure in Dungeon Care will be over...

Throughout the game, players will play their individual skill and equipment cards together with those found while searching the dungeons in an attempt to overcome the Challenge cards posed by the little Villennials. The key is to keep your Endurance and Patience stats up while trying to avoid stacking the Dark Mood tokens on the Villennials cards. The game ends when the deck of Challenge cards is exhausted and if any of the Adventurers are conscious - they are victorious!

Dungeon Care is a 1-4 player, fast paced, cooperative fantasy card game. It gives you a mixture of classic RPG's, semi-cooperative competition and crazy party game.

The game offers different gameplay modes such as: freelance (solo mode), one-night adventure (default game scenario) or corporate career (kind of campaign with the character development and expanding dungeon).

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bedlam, the Board Game
description:
Bedlam is a turn based game that employs versatile tile placement and card management.

Tiles will produce resources (gold and armies) and are the main mechanism for gaining points. Object of the game is to amass 10 points.

There are three categories of cards. Move cards enable you to relocate and gain valuable resources. Action cards are used to hinder or counteract your opponents game play. Instant cards are used at any time to help or hinder opponents and also contain secret points to assist in the objective.

Players are limited to 1 attack phase per turn and this mechanic is a basic 1-1 exchange. There are cards that can be used to eliminate armies without an attack and also to add to defense during an attack.

The game is not played on a set board, but is built by adding tiles during gameplay so each game will be different than the last.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Hidden Victory Points, Resource to Move, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Iron Horse
description:
A diverse team of outlaws have assembled for the gold heist of the century. Leveraging your unique skills and abilities, send your gang out into the territories to complete side objectives to help your efforts and fight off the Sheriff and Deputy as you try to steal gold from the train. You must act quickly, though! When the train reaches its final destination, your time to steal the gold is over, and you'll fail your mission.

Iron Horse is a fully co-operative, press-your-luck, dice roller featuring six unique characters. These characters all come with their own special abilities and unlockable upgrades.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Idea!
description:
Draw an original and convincing idea starting from two random stimuli: here is a real collective challenge to unleash creativity in a crescendo of laughter and blows ... of genius!

The aim of the game is to find creative ideas and present them through a drawing. Two cards belonging to the "name" and "action" categories are drawn: The players have to draw an object or an idea by combining the two words.

The red stack (actions) and the blue stack (names) of cards are placed side by side and covered in the center of the table. The slates, markers and scorecard are kept at the players' disposal.

Starting with the oldest player, one competitor challenges all the other players one at a time. Competitors who do not participate in the challenges act as judges. An action map and a name map are drawn from the stacks and placed face up in the center of the table.

In a predetermined time, for example one minute, the current player and the challenger must draw a new object (a new idea) starting from these two stimuli (see example on the back). At the end of the time (or as soon as the contestants have finished drawing), the challengers present their ideas and the other players vote by majority on the best idea. The winner of the challenge earns one point. In the event of a tie, one point is awarded each. You keep one of the two maps and change the other, repeating the game in the same way. The game ends when all players have challenged all opponents respectively. The winner is whoever has the highest score at the end of the game.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge

name: Jump!
description:
Are you more logical or creative?
Here is a very original party game that tests your problem solving skills, stimulating lateral thinking: the winner is the one who finds the most solutions using unusual tools and unleashing ... genius!

The player whose turn it is draws 4 instrument maps, placing them face up and side by side. Then he draws a situation card and reads aloud the text corresponding to the color where his placeholder is on the board. At this point each competitor, within the time of an hourglass, must find an effective and brilliant solution using the greatest number of tools discovered. Solutions must be written on the slate. If the current player is on the pencil box, the competitors will have to describe the solution only through the drawing. In this case the player whose turn it is reads any problem from the drawn card. When the time is up, the players present their solutions and calculate the scores. The game continues with another round: the new player on duty draws an instrument map and replaces it, at his choice, with one of those already active on the table, then draws a situation card and proceeds to a new game. . Scoring and end of the game If a solution is not considered valid by the majority of the players, it is discarded. The players who find a valid solution advance one square for each map-tool used. If a competitor has found a different solution from the others (original solution), he doubles the score. The winner is the first to finish 3 laps of the board (or more or less, at the choice of the players at the start of the race).
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Paper-and-Pencil, Track Movement, Voting

name: Who's there?
description:
In the middle of the Arctic, a group of scientists research a strange object that supposedly came from space, until a disaster falls upon the base: During a severe storm, all communications are cut off, and one by one, members of the research group begin to disappear. After checking the security cameras, everyone has a shocking revelation: an otherworldly creature is killing the scientists and taking their place. Now its a race against time to identify who the impostor is, before it's too late...

In "Who's there" the players may take one of the three roles: A scientist, the traitor or the creature. The scientist's goal is to complete the research and discover who the creature is, or try their luck and incinerate any suspicious members in hopes to find the creature under their skin, while the creature try to kill everyone in the base. Meanwhile, the traitor will try to sabotage both, in search of his own goal.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: A Noble War
description:
A Noble War is an area control game with a unique take on courtly intrigue for 2 - 4 players. As the head of a noble house, you’ll scheme, plot, and battle for dominance as war breaks out between two rival kingdoms. With family members stranded on each side of the conflict, you’ll have to play both sides to end up on top by the end.

As the head of your household, you’ll pull strings and twist arms to accrue wealth and prestige. During each game, you will wield influence and muster armies as you climb up the ranks at court. Each action has deep consequences as it shapes the economic, military, and religious power of a kingdom. Of course, you’re not alone in these noble pursuits. Each House has its own ambitions... and secrets. Be vigilant, as a well-timed accusation may bring your enemies to their knees.

Greatness comes at a high cost… if it comes at all. Will you rule with an iron fist or a silver tongue? Are you willing to extend an olive branch or do you prefer a dagger in the back?
The choice is yours, but only one family will win at the end of A Noble War.
categories: Civilization, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Political, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Contracts, Hidden Victory Points, Negotiation, Take That, Tug of War

name: Monopoly KHL
description:
Feel like a high-flying trader in the fast-growing world of professional hockey.

Play Monopoly KHL to get new property - teams and conferences.
Invest in stands and stadiums and get rents!
Make deals with players, follow deals at auction - there are many ways to get what you want. Be creative because there is not enough room at the top for everyone.
Bankruptcy Trade is your way to success - you can get it all!

It's time to put on your skates and grab your hockey stick on your way to the world's most exciting and prestigious game!

The Kontinental Hockey League, formed in 2008, is one of the elite hockey leagues in Europe. The KHL consists of 24 teams, divided into two conferences: East and West, and consists of 4 divisions, which are named after legendary players and coaches: Arkady Chernyshev, Anatoly Tarasov, Valery Kharlamov and Vsevolod Bobrov.

The teams compete for the highest award - the Gagarin Cup.
Do you want to follow the path of champions?
It's time for you !
Become a professional in the Monopoly KHL !

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alliance of Powers
description:
Through battle by land, sea, and air combined with diplomacy and ever-shifting alliances you attempt to become the most powerful leader in an imaginary world. The goal of this strategy board game is to achieve the highest score after five "game years." (Players are rarely eliminated from the game because winning does not require total conquest, but simply the highest score.) Battles are settled by various combinations of dice.

The initial set-up phase of the game randomly changes the map features every time you play, so it's always a different world and thus impossible to fall into predictable patterns of play. Each scenario will require vastly different strategies.

Characteristics of the game include being loud and raucous (rarely a quiet and contemplative atmosphere because there is too much diplomacy always in progress). The game is full of deal-making, back-stabbing, trash talk, etc.

Some fun features of the game include friendly fire, surrendering forces, escaping P.O.W.'s, non-conventional warheads (nuclear, biological, and chemical), war crimes that may or may not result in a final point penalty, killing civilians or using your own civilians as a human shield, etc. Every member of the game is a member of a council similar to the United Nations in which they will vote on various resolutions brought before the council during the course of the game, such as charging a given player with a war crime, permitting the establishment of International Defense Forces, etc.
mechanics: Alliances, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Seven Galaxies
description:
Of the plethora of galaxies in the universe, seven of them are primordial. In them are found the Seven Stones of Creation, responsible for all existing power, providing the energy, vitality and balance necessary for everything to exist. The greed for possession of these stones corrupts villages, fuels wars and smolders the sense of justice of those who protect them.

Seven Galaxies is a card game with the theme of intergalactic wars that brings with it new experiences and infinite possibilities, in a universe never seen before. Each player assembles his army in his own way and has the objective of destroying the opponent's fortress to win the battle. For this, there will be several creatures and other auxiliary cards, thus being able to neutralize the enemy and reach its objective. Plays depend on two things: level and energy. Level is what will be used for summoning cards and energy is basically used to activate effects.

During your turn, you will rise your level up, summon creatures, evolve, equip, activate your creatures' abilities to attack your opponent's troops and fortress. The first player to completely destroy the other's fortress wins the game, becoming the most powerful clan in the universe.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: The Sotavento Campaign: Resistance and Counterguerrilla in Veracruz, 1863-1865
description:
To Mexico, the decade of the 1860s led to a convulsed period characterized by the despotic government of Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna as well a devastating civil war, called “The War of the Three Years”, tollowing "The Mexican Adventure" or The second French intervention in Mexico.

The game begins right after the battles of May 5th in Puebla and the action of Cerro del Borrego in Orizaba,
and continues throughout the campaign in Veracruz, until the withdrawal of French expeditionary troops in 1866.

The French player needs to ensure a line of supplies for his troops, establish garrisons as well as conduct operations to
locate and neutralize the Mexican resistance strongholds and encampments. The Republican player (Mexican side) needs to recruit forces within the local population, establish military training camps, carry out ambushes and disrupt the French communication lines as much as possible.

The security of this route became an issue of strategic importance for the circulation of war supplies and of the different military forces that would march inland; patrolling and keeping it open was a task for different special units, like the Sudanese Regiment and the Foreign Legion.

The Guerrilla war would begin, led by veteran officers: Their mission was to maintain a war of attrition, all the time and in the most effective ways possible; a state of harassment for the French invasion and their Mexican allies.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hidden Movement

name: Don't Steal My Cow, Man!
description:
Beef loving invasive aliens have landed and circled your farm with crop circles! Marking it as a landing site for an all you can eat beef buffet!!

One team controls the farmers and one controls the aliens! Farmers seek to wrangle their cows back into the barn and put a few pieces of buckshot in the unknown cow thieves. Meanwhile the aliens seek to capture the cows, mind control pesky farmers and lead the cows back to their UFOs!

Whoever gets 4 cows first, wins.

NOW ON KICKSTARTER!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: Hype Tag
description:
Return to the nostalgic (and sometimes painful) schoolyards of youth to battle it out at recess in a cutthroat game of tag.
Hype Tag is an innovative, addictively re-playable strategy card game for 2-4 hipsters ages 13 and up.

To win, be the first player to get up to 10 on your hype meter, flip it over, and then go back down to 1. You gotta GET HYPED by making impressive tags and creating mischief on the playground... but then you need to have enough self-control to SIMMER DOWN and go back to class!

Hype Tag features the unique interaction of two different decks of cards. The HYPE deck has the strategic depth of a trading card game while the TAG deck has the simple fun of a classic card game. It's like if Magic and Uno had a baby.

A unique aspect of Hype Tag is the hype mechanic. Each HYPE card has a number in the upper corner and you must at that number (or higher) on your hype meter to play the card. Many cards also have a bonus, granting an even more powerful effect the higher you get. But... when you flip your meter over and start moving back down, your dwindling hype prevents you from getting bonuses and eventually makes some hype cards unplayable. So you have to be crafty and a little bit cutthroat to win. The game ends when the first player gets back down to 1.

Be sure to manage your hand carefully because you have to play a tag card to tag an an opponent at the end of each turn. If you can't, you have to call a time out which rewards the other players. In 3 and 4 player games, Hype Tag has a unique non-standard turn order which gives players a choice about who to tag. And this choice carries strategic implications.

The game also include "Sass" cards that block and copy the actions of others, trait bonuses that reward certain styles of play, and Older Kids - special character cards you receive when you reach 10 on your hype meter - that grant powerful abilities aiding your descent back down to 1.

It is great casual fun that also stands up to very intense tournament style play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: On The Nose: The Fast and the Furlong
description:
Race night is about to begin and the horses are ready at the starting gate. Over the next five races of the night, players will attempt to gallop their own horse along the furlongs and leap the hedge jumps whilst also slowing their opponents as best as they can.

Attempting to win the highest amount of cash and trophies by the nights end, players will judge their performance each race as the night proceeds and expertly manage their prize money. Do they risk money to give their horse a speed boost or save it to their total winnings?

Players take turns to play one card from their hand on to one of the three card positions of Race Row. Comprised of three cards placed horizontally, Race Row will move all shown horses. Horses in the lane matching the shown symbol of the left Race Row card are moved forward one space first, the centre and then the right card follow.

Further action cards, speed boosts and hedge jumps will all play a part in the race results. The player with the most winnings after five races, is the race night champion.

—description from the description
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Movement Points

name: Ecowlo
description:
The first cows who fart and poo... BUT who pay their carbon tax!

Ecowlo is a tabletop game for 2 to 4 players. It is a strategic fun game for players ages 14 and up.
Players take on the role of crazy cows wandering in a not-so-static field and trying to conquer as much green patch of land to graze as freely as possible.

In the rivalry that exists between cows, you want to be the first to poo or claim a green patch of grass, and fart as much as possible to slow down the other cows. But don't forget to pay your taxes for your methane abominations...

Some lucky cows can get occasional help from goats or donkeys, while others prefer to fool around with bulls and proliferate to increase their family power.

All the ways are good to get the biggest space to graze!
Hard to say what the funniest strategy to win is... should I poo everywhere? Or work hard to double my production of carrot? Hmm, should I maybe copulate? Maybe I'll just fart and fart again...

So... ready, set, cow!
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Clan Starter Set
description:
In the years following the Dragon Wars, the Shiho name was rarely mentioned. Recently, that name has started to be spoken again with increasing enthusiasm and excitement as it seems that the only known member of that once-proud clan has returned to the Isles of Jwar.
Shiho Hiroto is back to conquer his many foes and destroy the Takashi Clan by any means possible. He is leading a secret war taking place in the rice paddies, jungles, and thickets of Jwar. Shiho Hiroto is choosing to hit-and-run, steal, destroy, and disrupt the vital lines of supply and communication that the Takashi clan need so desperately to rule Jwar.

Box contains five miniatures supplied with 30mm bases and eleven full colour cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Keita
description:
Keita was old, even at the Battle of Sagoya, and even though he wished to stand and die with his clan, his orders were to protect the children so that the Shiho clan stood a chance of surviving. Keita has honoured that final order every day of his life by keeping them safe with his blade and teaching them the finer points of swordsmanship as they grew. Yet, there is something to Keita that makes people want to bow even deeper in his presence. Perhaps it is his lordly demeanour and inherent nobility? Whatever it may be, he is a welcome and stalwart asset to the Shiho clan in the fight to throw off the yoke of the Takashi imposters and usurpers.
Keita helps the warband in many ways; if you buff his poor melee skill, he can be a viable fighter. But even without any melee exchanges, he offers Virtue Tokens with a wide range of effects that boost the Shiho’s inherent talent for unpredictability. In addition, his Deference Ki Feat can keep him safe from some attacks, which is helpful for a supporting model that needs to be close to the action.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Maki
description:
Maki is overjoyed at Shiho Hiroto’s return to Jwar and believes it is only a matter of time before there is a change in the Prefecture’s leadership. Maki is well versed in killing and ambush and moving with stealth over and under the land. Her family were soldiers for the Eagle, and she has been raised with them, fighting the guerilla war since she was old enough to hold a knife. Out of sheer necessity, Maki learned to fight with two blades instead of one. This would have been unthinkable in the past, but current circumstances dictate that the Shiho samurai have had to be more flexible in their teachings. While it would still be unthinkable for her to wield the Daisho, her Tachi are a suitable replacement.
Maki offers the same unpredictability as her fellow Ashigaru with her Hold the Line! Ki Feat. Her Unassailable Ki Feat allows her to remain on a flank fending off multiple opponents then using her Sidestep to free herself from being locked down.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Loyal Yarimen
description:
The Shiho’s Ashigaru were once the pride of the Jwar Isles and made up a small but significant part of the Imperial armies that the Emperor relished taking into battle. But that was then, and this is now, and right now, the Takashi Ashigaru are considered the best-trained troops, patrolling the Jwar Isles keeping order for the Prefecture. Still, the Shiho’s fighting men have been together since the usurpation, and the loyalty they show each other is matched only by their commitment to the fallen Eagle Clan.
On the table, these Yarimen can move to assist other Ashigaru, meaning any attack on one soldier is potentially an attack facing two or more! Moreover, the enemy will never know the line’s strength and weak points as it constantly moves and changes.

Blister contains two miniatures, 30mm bases and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Heimin
description:
The Heimin class consists mainly of farmers, artisans and merchants. But these peasants know the true lords of the prefecture and follow them still when they go to war. Being below the notice of most Samurai and living far from the cities of Jwar, most villages are unaware that the Shiho no longer control the prefecture, while others are still loyal to their old Shiho masters regardless. Those loyal to the Eagle remember the days before the Tsunami, before the masked dead, before the Savage Wave, before the Takashi went to war to usurp the Shiho. But they know, deep within their hearts, and in their prayers, that the Eagle will rise once more victorious, covering Jwar with its wings.
As you may expect, peasants in-game are not very impressive, but the Uncloak Ki Feat means that any of them could have been a Shiho Samurai all along! Now you die! Surprise!
So by fielding three of these, opponents are forced to play as if all of them are Samurai until they uncloak, and you can decide during the game which, if any, are Samurai and which are harmless peasants. Combined with the Shiho Samurais’ ubiquitous Flank trait, this is a powerful way of controlling where the fight will happen.

Blister contains three miniatures supplied with three 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Tanaka Kazuo and Heir
description:
After Tsuki led her Open Rebellion out of Tsumaga and against The Prefecture, the Takashi family became wary of their neighbours. To ensure a loyal Wolf clan for the next generation, the Dragon offered to foster the Tanaka heir, Nobuko’s son with the Takashi family at Eddo. Fostering is an old tradition and it is a great honour for a clan to have their children taught the ways of the samurai by their liege lords. This strengthens the ties that bind the clans together and creates very loyal vassals for the greater clans. Such an offer cannot be refused without causing a diplomatic incident or even war. The Tanaka heir was sent with his uncle Kazuo to Eddo, the seat of the Dragon clan but they simply traveled to Ryu and stopped. The fostering had been agreed so the Takashi had no cause to call out the Tanaka but the boy studied in Ryu under Wolf clan tutors and learned his family ways, not those of the Takashi. They were just always “On the way to Eddo”. Honour was satisfied. Not all were happy with this however and a Prefecture official saw the boy and his uncle and tried to have them escorted to Eddo by an armed guard. Incensed by the lower ranking official trying to force his hand, Kazuo refused. None of the Prefecture ashigaru survived his refusal. Knowing this would not be accepted, Kazuo took the boy and fled. Lord Nobuo had no choice but to declare Kazuo an outlaw, claiming he kidnapped his son or the Dragon would have cause to declare that the Wolf Clan were disloyal. Now with nobody to help, Kazuo not only teaches the boy the wolf ways of sword fighting, their loyalty to the Shiho and the ways of the samurai but also must protect him from the Dragon and any who would take their coin for the bounty they offer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Nightbreak
description:
Nightbreak is a medium weight competitive hero-based fantasy card game that features a fixed turn count, a day/night resource system, spatial positioning mechanics, and push your luck mechanics.

Players choose three Heroes from their faction and enter a battle with a duration of two in-game days. During each player's turn, that player gains at least one Blessing Point from their Goddess. Blessing Points are resources used to activate Hero powers. These resources also allow Heroes to escape from the battle undetected, or allow Heroes to pray to their Goddess for further blessings on a future turn.

As the battle progresses, Heroes take damage and eventually become overwhelmed forcing them to temporarily retire from the battle. When a Hero becomes overwhelmed, a new Hero from that player's Hero deck arrives to the battle. The player who overwhelms an opposing Hero gains favor from their Goddess. At the end of the two-day battle, the player that earned the most favor from their Goddess is the winner!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Holy Animals
description:
Holy Animals is a social deduction game about a group of Animal Gods coming to your village. Players acting as villagers must take turns serving the right food to Animal Gods appearing each round. However, food is scarce in the village, so you might not always have the right food to serve. You must sometimes sneak in other things in order to live another day. If you get caught by other people you will be punished, but if you catch them lying you will be rewarded. It's a game of deception, bluffing, and survival.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Animals, Bluffing, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Deduction, Income, Open Drafting, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Altenor Secrets
description:
Altenor Secrets is a game of competitive clashes. Guilds of adventurers and champions compete in the depths of a tower in perpetual motion. To win, you have to manage several parameters. This board game has a well-developed lore, integrates video game dynamics and characters worthy of miniature games.

You play in circular sections within a level of the endless tower of Altenor, you control a team whose purpose is to defeat the opposing player’s team by bluffing, gaining access to key areas and controlling magical artifacts, called atoriums, to your advantage.

The sections have been converted into arenas by guilds and dynasties but are still in motion during the game. Beware, the rings you are on will be moving!

Each ring is composed of 8 areas representing grand halls with specific rules. The board center is occupied by a NEXUS, a node of power deep in the tower of Altenor.

Each player moves their characters alternatively. You activate a character to bring him to life and perform regular and free actions. Each of your 6 characters has a specific role to play that comes with advantages and drawbacks.

Move through grand halls each with their own surprises. Be clever when taking everything into account and try gaining a tactical advantage towards victory.

There are 6 different ways to score points, and 4 rounds for you to overtake your opponent. The player whose team scored the largest number of points at the end of the game wins the match!

Your guild is relying on you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: Bank of America Toy Bank Edition
description:
Monopoly game with different tokens, properties, money design, etc. Each property is a picture of a rare, collectible "Penny Bank" from Bank of America's art collection. (From the back of the box.)

Contents:
Bank of America Custom Bank Money
ATMS and Banking Centers replace Traditional Houses and Hotels
Piggy Bank, Vault, Money Bag, Armored Car, BofA building, BofA logo tokens
Custom title deed cards feature case iron toy banks from Bank of America art collection
Custom cards replace classic Community Chest and Chance Cards
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Medieval Genius
description:
Overview
Explore a game of Science, Technology, & Engineering in a world of Mushrooms, Monsters, & Magik. It is always your turn in this 4X, War-Mongering, Empire-Building, Real-Time-Strategy Board Game. There are 4 ways to win:
1st - Collect 6 Matching STEM Points
2nd - Muster 6 Mushroom Forests
3rd - Control 8 Trolls On the Map
4th - Get All Of The Battle Tokens By Taking Home Bases

The Game "Optimized For MAXIMUM Fun!"
Finally, a game with minimal waiting, where players take their turns simultaneously together "First-Come First-Serve." Choose from a range of characters (minorities/women in STEM)! Explore a new map every game! Harness magik from Mushrooms around the world to make your character magical, or make investments that allow you to build a mighty empire or conduct research to refine your STEM skills, or recruit armies to defend yourself against both humans & monsters!

The Scenario
Based on the book, "The Art of Good Magik," The Black Sorcerer’s quest for omniscience threatens destruction of all life in an Enchanted Land of Medieval Fantasy & Magical Mystery. Scientists & Engineers from Modern Earth awaken in this hallucination, and here you are, walking in their footsteps! Will you survive? Define how Magik, Military-Strategy, & STEM might aid you in your rise to greatness!
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Pieces as Map, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Card-Z
description:
A gritty, realistic zombie survival card game set in a suburban neighborhood. Plays 1-4 players in 1-4 hours depending on the scenario. There are 8 scenarios: Home Run, Rescue 911, Survive, Civic Duty, Mission from God, Pub Run, Horde Annihilation, and Zombie Count.

You start with 2 characters; each with a heroic action, loot, pawn, & a backpack organized using your player mat.

The neighborhood map is dealt into 1 of 3 patterns depending on the scenario.

A game turn is one "day". It has 3 action phases–dawn, day, night–and 1 reckoning phase when survivors must eat food or starve.

Players scout locations by rolling for encounters & battle them on a hex-based universal battlefield. Clear cache locations to win rewards, or win fresh food fishing, hunting, or trapping on terrain locations. Be careful, though, because if you are forced to retreat from a battle, you must clear the location you retreat to or die trying.

The game ends when you meet the end condition of the scenario, or if your survivors die.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Pest Control: A Conservation Race
description:
Pest Control is a map building race game for up to 5 players. Players place cards to create a map which then acts as the board for a race to collect tokens.

Custom dice allow players to move other players and "pest" characters around the board to hinder other players.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration
mechanics: Map Addition

name: Covid Deniers: A truly viral party game
description:
Covid Deniers is a party game that puts you at the center of the fight against fake news and conspiracy theories about the coronavirus. Become a Good Citizen and defend the public order of your village – or destroy it with cruel lies and accusations!

Covid Deniers offers an exciting political spin to award winning games like Werewolf or Mafia. Intense debates, dramatic tension and fun for you and your friends are guaranteed.

To start playing Covid Deniers, every player draws a secret role card. The game begins at night. All players are asleep. Only the Deniers are free to open their eyes. Now it‘s time for conspiracy. Each night, they can put one Good Citizen into quarantine. One round at night is followed a daytime round.

At daytime, the Good Citizens try to find out who among them is a Covid Denier. Within an open group discussion, they decide on one player to be tested for his or her true identity. In the end, either the Good Citizens keep their majority in the group — or the Deniers take over.

Additional roles, such as the Superspreader or the Virologist, come with special abilities and turn Covid Deniers into a viral experience!

Covid Deniers is a social deduction game for adults, and a must have for any party game collection!

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction

name: Paradise Ride: Travel Tales
description:
Travel Tales is a unique conversational card game for travellers where you share your favourite travel stories and relive your epic adventure moments. With 100 unique questions and prompts, Travel Tales takes you on a trip down memory lane. Made to feed your wanderlust, champion social connections and highlight the stories we carry with us.

Perfect to bring over to your friend's house across the street or on a backpacking trip around the world. Choose your own adventure in this epic storytime for travellers with hours on hours of entertainment. Made for everyone that travelled internationally or domestically, one time or thousands of times. Remember, Retell, Relive. May your memory serve you well.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Storytelling, Voting

name: SPACE TREK: A 1-Card Mission
description:
SPACE TREK - A 1-Card Mission is a one player space adventure game "influenced by Star Trek - The Dice Game" where you are responsible for the safe return of your crew and ship the "Explorer" to Star base 259. After getting separated from the Battle fleet during a major encounter, you find yourself deep within the neutral zone. As you try to make your way back to the Star base, your Starship will be traveling through enemy zones and asteroid fields. Your mission is to get your Starship back to the Safe Zone and to Star base 259 by turn 21. If you loss too many crew due to your Starship taking too much damage, you lose the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Al Masjid
description:
Unlike other business games, this game does not reward players for stacking wealth, but rather for the accumulation of good deeds.

The winner of this game is the first player to build a mosque, which requires a lot of donations.
The victory is celebrated by all when the winner builds the mosque in his place.
In the midst of all this goodness, players walk through the places implicitly and explicitly mentioned in the Quran.

This game is a fun way for children and adults to learn about the history of the places mentioned in the Quran.

Goal of the game
The object of the game is to build a mosque. The first player to complete the construction of his mosque on one of his places wins.

– Translated description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Religious
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Catholic Trivia: Traditional Version
description:
Two decks of trivia questions focusing on traditional aspects of Catholicism.

Contains 500 cards - 1,500 questions in total - in six categories:
• The Baltimore Catechism (C)
• The Latin Mass (M)
• History and the Liturgical Calendar (H)
• Popes, Patron Saints and Other Pious People (P)
• Ritual, Symbol, and Doctrine (R)
• Et Cetera (E)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Threat Level: Emergency Response
description:
Threat Level: Emergency Response is a 2d6 narrative wargaming system, with plenty of game options.
The game is based in the modern (2010 - Present) British emergency services as they battle the horrors they face every day.

Play as the Police, Ambulance or Fire Brigade while they battle against the tides in different missions with more missions on the way.
The game has an AI system which plays as the public, profiles and Antagonists.

–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Crowkeeper
description:
Crowkeeper is a take-that hand management game for 3-6 players.

Each player starts with a small murder of 15 crows and a stash 15 bits. On the board, there are rows of action cards that these players will roll dice to gain. By playing these cards, crowkeepers can grow their murder, attack others, defend themselves and gain wealth. The crowkeeper with the most crows at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Shipwrecked!
description:
Shipwrecked! is a semi-cooperative survival game for up to 4 players. Taking control of ‘Brains’ and ‘Brawn’, players will explore a mysterious island inhabited by pirates, dinosaurs and monsters.

By working together and combining their skills, Brains and Brawn can craft useful tools and weapons that will help them defeat the toughest enemies, and survive long enough to repair the ship and escape. But temptation and betrayal is never far away…

The goal is to escape before the unstable volcano erupts and destroys the island, but the ultimate winner is the one who makes it out alive with the most treasure. It’s survival of the fittest...and richest!
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Scrape
description:
In West Africa, facial injury has been used to identify ethnic groups, families, individuals, and also to denote beauty; wounds were thought to beautify the body. It was also done in girls to mark the stages of life: puberty, marriage, etc. These scars helped women to make men more attractive because they appeal to looking as well as scars, as evidence that women can withstand labor pain. It is believed to bring people good luck and protection from evil.

In Scrape, the rules within the tribes will determine the rules of the game and the symbols will determine the meaning of the game. While playing, you will both have fun and experience the difficulties of the tribal life.

The player whose turn it is opens from the symbol card on the playing field and finds the symbol on the playing field according to the color of the card. Whoever finds it first gets the symbol.

The player who gets 12 symbols wins, starts the next game as the chieftain with 2 symbols.

All parts are prepared by hand.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: United States Visiting Forces Supplement for Threat Level: Emergency Response
description:
This product is an extra to the main rulebook.
The main rulebook is required to understand this product.

This book contains keywords and stat cards to make the game easier to understand.

Threat Level:Emergency Response is a battle system focused on British Police, Paramedics and Fire Brigades.
With This supplement, it adds United States Air Force in Europe into the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Peanut Club: A dedication from Lord Henry Mac Fly promo card
description:
A promo card for Peanut Club, Distributed at the Cannes International Game Festival (FIJ) in 2019.

It's a place reserved for an autograph or a drawing by the illustrator/creator of the game.

This card is played as the other cards. It is worth a luxury object and an antique object.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: Ophelia: Histories Collide Expansion – Atlantis
description:
Winning is more satisfying when you win on your own terms, and with your favourite heroes of the multiverse. With this expansion, rock your opponent's boat with the brave and swashbuckling Atlantis!

The Atlantis faction is built around a new kind of card, a Unique Turning Point named Treasure. The Atlantis character collect Treasure in different but familiar ways, whether that be by defeating characters or winning games of Liar's Dice with the Bilge Rat!

You can play the Treasure turning point early to gain an edge in combat, or hoard it like a true pirate and reap the escalating rewards.

The Atlantis faction adds a fourth faction to be played in the Faction Format, and can be included in the Draft Format as well. This adds 3 new combinations of factions for the draft format to explore!

This expansion requires Ophelia: Histories Collide to be played, or at least an opponent with an Ophelia faction of their own.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Quantum Flux
description:
Quantum Flux is a miniatures agnostic, highly tactical and ultra-customizable skirmish game, in which you build a small team of one to ten unique models, and out-smart and out-maneuver your opponent.

The game is designed to avoid any "Gotch-Ya!" moments, and is instead about using a deep but not overly complicated ruleset to allow you to play tactically and be rewarded for doing so.
It also allows you to fully customize your army, making it uniquely yours.

And it's super fun, and free!

Find a friend, grab some miniatures, and have a blast!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The Sands Games
description:
Board game in which up to four players compete in the Sands Games, which comprise 38 events in 27 sports. Win Gold, Silver and Bronze medals.

The rules are very simple but are different for every race. Some games use dice rolls ; others use dice and Tactics (event) cards to win the race. The board is double sided, providing different venues to emulate the various events.

Medals are worth different points and are hung on a board and tallied at the end. The player with the most points (based on their medal count), wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Track Movement

name: Inferno TCG
description:
Inferno is a trading card game, where every player is a powerful demon that lives in the Inferno (a corrupted and distorted dimension). They battle other demons for the supremacy of the Earth.

Players build a deck of 50 cards and 1 demon card (avatar) and duel against an opponent's deck. Each deck has a combination of Allies, Objects, Weapons, Scenarios, Ritual and Resources; from the demon's path or neutral cards.

There are 4 path you can choose from: Chaos, Madness, Death and Power. Each path has it's own play style and abilities.

A match of the game ends when a Demon has no more cards in its deck. Every time a player get damaged, discard cards from his deck go to the discard pile (named Inferno).
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Chat Pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem
description:
Chat pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem is an expansion for Chat pardeurs.

After the arrest of the kitthieves in San Franciscat, Supercat decides to follow the lead of the criminal organization that he thought was ruled by Al Chapone. His investigation leads him to Meow York, and with the help of Feline Girl, he discovers that there are also many dangers on the East Coast.

Chat pardeurs: Meow York Mayhem Expansion adds new gameplay.

4 players: superheroes can team up and face 2 kitthieves (2 vs 2).
A bunch of new kitthieves with new abilities.
New game mode using locations.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion I – New Markets
description:
With the Expansion New Markets players can generate a completely new distribution of merchandise. Instead of using the merchandise printed on the map players will now place the merchandise token by random principle over the map. We included a couple of options. For example a completely open distribution and the option of placing the merchandise face down. So, players know they have to have a trading post with silver to be allowed to develop the banking system. But you need to first find silver before you can create a trading post.
There will be an optional rule that heavily favors the powers who have well developed their fleet. So, players quickly need to find and explore wood and wool to develop their fleet.

This expansion brings a lot of variety and fun to the three games of the series. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion II – Pirates and Barbarians
description:
“Sail in sight!” calls the sentry on the tower. To whom do these sails at the horizon belong? A homecoming merchant ship that has a fully loaded hold of gold or salt? An enemy ship with a diplomat on board to negotiate peace? Or are these the black sails of the feared pirates that don’t negotiate but come to plunder and burn down harbors and warehouses?
With the expansion Barbarians and Pirates players can add a new party to the game that will challenge the players for sure.
The playing pieces of the barbarians and pirates are brought into play by the players and will then be played by AI. Players place them but can’t control them. So, a player needs to be careful what he wishes for. To call for the barbarians and pirates at first might seem like a call for help to threaten your opponents but they can turn their attention quickly towards you.

If not opposed right away the hordes of barbarians and pirate fleets can become a real threat to your empire.

This expansion brings a lot of variety and fun to the three games of the series. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points

name: Trato Monstruoso
description:
SALE OR DEAL?
WAR IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD
Halloween night is approaching and the neighbors compete for the most terrifying group of monsters, bribing the rest with succulent candies.
Buy, sell and make deals to win.

——-HOW TO PLAY:——

Preparation: Deal 2 monster and candy cards: (2-0) (4-1) (1-5) to each player.

On your turn:

1- Draw 1 monster card from the deck

2- Change if you want monster card Discard 1 scarecrow if you have 3 in hand and draw a new card.

3- Do one of the following:
SELL MONSTER: Put in auction a monster card from your hand, accept the winner's candy or keep the monster and pay
you their offer. Give out candy before sale if it had a basket in order of appearance: 10-5-20-50.
MONSTER DEAL (Trato Monstruoso):Advance a monster from your table to the center, force the rest to do what
same if the monster matches. Offer candies and the one who gives the most will be the monster with the least.

Score: Horror Points x No groups.
Winner: The player with the highest score.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Henry's Feast
description:
King Henry VIII’s trip to India cannot successfully conclude until he gets a taste of the best Indian food the King of India has to offer. The Indian King has commissioned some of the finest chefs to compete for a chance to cook at Henry’s Feast. He has asked his Head Chef to arrange the competition.

Henry's Feast is a competitive, family friendly, appetizing, cooking board game for the hungry. A balanced but deep strategy game where players are constantly challenged to think ahead and work with limited resources to cook King Henry's favorite dishes.

The game consists of a personal kitchen in the form of player board that each player will use to cook their dishes. The kitchen also has a pantry with a limited space and can only store so many ingredients. Players are forced to choose between using their stations to start cooking, and therefore, revealing the dishes they want to cook or store them in the pantry for future use. However, the empty space in the pantry will determine how many ingredients you can take in the next round. In the middle of all the players, lies the Stockroom that is quicker to get to, but has a lower probability of finding the ingredients you need. The Market has all the ingredients but is farther and requires more time (an extra round) to utilize.

The Recipes (50 of them) tell you all the ingredients you need to cook various types of dishes. They can be Easy, Medium or Hard to cook, and also lets you know the course of the dish. The recipes for the Feast create a race to the finish line and determines who ends the game first. But the Chef's Corner will provide you with those extra recipes that will let you get ahead of the competition and win it.

Not that fast! Winning doesn't come easy and the multitude of strategies come from the Chef's Bonus. Stations, Satchels, Hand Limit and Pantry all give you an extra edge throughout out the game. At higher bonus levels that edge becomes larger but getting the bonuses isn't an easy feat. You will have to choose between when to go for the victory points or when to get the bonuses. They all use the same resources, and maintaining that balance while controlling your heartbeat as someone visits Chef's Corner to steal the recipe you have been working so hard to cook is where Henry's Feast will test your limits.

On a players turn they will perform one action to take the available ingredients or steal recipes. Using these the player will Cook dishes which will earn them victory points or bonuses. Victory points may also be earned from making combos of dishes or making the most number of dishes.

The game ends when a player cooks all the feast recipes and announces Last Call. This sets up the last round. After the last round is done victory points are counted and the player with the most victory points wins the game.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Nectar
description:
The goal of Nectar is to have at least ten nectar points in your own honeycomb. To achieve this, the bees have to collect nectar tiles and turn them into their honeycomb without being attacked by hostile bee colonies.

The player whose turn it is has to role the dice.
The dice number indicates which nectar tiles are placed on the board.

If a bee stands on a nectar field, it covers it and prevents the formation of new nectar plates there.
After putting the cards on the board, the swarming begins.

Each player can move all three bees one space forward. If a bee lands on a nectar tile, it carries it under the game piece. In this state it is vulnerable to enemies.

If an enemy bee moves onto the field of the transport bee, it takes over the load and returns the stung bee on one of its three honeycomb fields.
mechanics: Chaining, Movement Points, Static Capture

name: Monopoly: Vikings
description:
Follow the stories of one of the most famous Nordic heroes, Ragnar Lothbrok, his wife, the shield maid Lagertha and his brother Rollo, along with many other characters.

Enter the mysterious world of the Northmen: war, power and fraternity. You can become one of them in this game!

Choose one of the special characters, collect your favourite characters and kingdoms and build boats and longships. The Odin and Valhalla cards can bring blessings or curse. But be careful! In order not to displease the gods, you will have to make sacrifices.

Are you ready for this adventure.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Göbeklitepe Ancient Board Game
description:
Göbeklitepe, which has a sacred consciousness, bears the traces of productivity culture. In addition, it is the oldest known cult building group with its beliefs about death and rebirth, the belief that there is life after death, and compositions applied on stones.

My work is an ancient board game consisting of t-columns, animal drawings, figures and the mythical meanings of symbols, which play an important role in the building art of this sacred area.

The game starts from the starting points (A, B). The first player to remove all of the player's pieces from the playing field (C) according to the chosen action plan wins the game.

Player stone and dice are hand modeled with polymer clay.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Civilization, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Göbeklitepe Ancient Board Game
description:
Göbeklitepe, which has a sacred consciousness, bears the traces of productivity culture. In addition, it is the oldest known cult building group with its beliefs about death and rebirth, the belief that there is life after death, and compositions applied on stones.

My work is an ancient board game consisting of t-columns, animal drawings, figures and the mythical meanings of symbols, which play an important role in the building art of this sacred area.

Reaching the Central Zone of the game with the T-Column, obtaining the Central T Arm and being the first to reach the U-Stone Gate again.

The first player to enter the buildings from the Building Entrances and obtain the Central T-Column in the Center Area and return to the U-Stone Gate wins. Or, the first player to return to the U-Stone Gate by making mandatory entry to all structures, obtaining the Central T-Pillar located in the Center Area, wins.

Figures, T-Pillars and Center T-Pillars were hand modeled in polymer clay as the closest miniature replica.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Red Traitor: 401k
description:
Thank you for showing interest in our second game release. These “veteran game mechanics” have been adapted to a “universal” rule set to play a variety of time periods. This book is a stand alone product that does not require any other purchases from us to use your own miniatures collection. Everything you need is right there to play without days of making up your own stuff.

These mechanics been a fun and quick way to play Science Fiction and Modern games with our friends since 2005. We even adapted it to work well in a Victorian “Colonial” setting with a few tweeks. These rules ARE NOT an exact replica of the weapons and equipment of any Era, nor a Hollywood enhancement, but rather to provide a reasonable simulation for enjoyable gameplay.

Quickly about the mechanics... Each figure has a certain number of “actions” each round – in addition they can also react during the enemy’s play. This produces a less static game, but also one that is not so fluid people are never sure where things stand.

This book contains all the Rules you need to play on 4 page large font handy flow chart. As well as a comprehensive Weapons Chart from Spears to Fusion Cannons. In addition are Generic Unit cards you can copy out - or download from our website or facebook - to slip into a standard playing card sleeve for east reference. Not to mention sample Army Lists, Scenarios, and so forth to keep you busy for a little while.

Our goal is to provide you enough material to actually play with, so you do not have to make things up on your own. Our website will contain other fan made products to official support for the game. IE: More scenarios and unit cards.

Thanks to modern publishing techniques, we will be finishing up the following OPTIONAL "Setting Books". Each will include our own world "fluff", specific Unit Cards tailored to the era, Scenarios, and even some old school Terrain tips and Miniature suggestions:


Our "Victorian Era" setting book will cover my favorite Era of play. From 1870 thru the 1930's across those various Historical periods up through World War 1. Even a dash of information if you prefer to play Victorian Science Fiction. It will contain some of my unpublished materials from the "Battlefield: Evolution" book that would have covered this topic.
Our "Science Fiction" setting book will cover man to man, and man to alien, combat in the near and far future. Scenarios and ideas to cover our own Universe, as well as suggestions for your own.
Our "World War 2 to Modern" setting book will cover from World War 2 up till the 1990's. It will handle both the Historical needs of those games, as well as, the ability to play "Pulp" action around your favorite stories and comics with lots of blue and red lasers. Including a cross over of our Solo play and Co-Op play material from "Zombie-a-go-go" before the Tidalwave of Zombie games.
Our "Cthulhu Mythos" setting book will go hand in hand with the "Xothic Wars" products that I co-designed. Each chapter will cover each one of the races covered with Unit Cards, Scenarios, and suggested miniature ranges.
Our "Ancients and Fantasy" setting book will cover things like my favorite Roman historical period, to any range of Fantasy settings and variants.
Our "Black Powder" setting book will cover Samurai, Pirates, and from the Seven Years War up through the American Civil War. It will feature my campaign for the 1860-1962 skirmishes in the American Southwest.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: ¡Ay, Corona!
description:
In this fun card game you try to survive the corona pandemic together. Or everyone just looks after themselves.

In chaotic game rounds you switch cards back and forth and try to avoid the virus. Collect toilet paper, become a conspiracy theorist and determine national strategies.

The goal of the game is simple: survive! There are two ways the game ends: either there is only one surviving player left or all cards have been drawn at which point the pandemic is over.

In each round you have to first draw a card and then play an action card. If you pickup a virus card, you're infected and can potentially die. Every players has a risk value that increases by picking up negative status cards. From time to time all infected players have to roll their dice to see if they die. The lower your risk value the higher your chance to survive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Hot Potato, Take That

name: Cryptodome
description:
Cryptodome is the most popular game show set in a future where technology has exploded in countless directions. Salvagers find creative ways to use these technologies to build upon their suits to help navigate an underground magma chamber on Planet Varcob. Play as a salvager, each with a unique ability, as you make your way around the Cryptodome.

The object of the game is to be the first to collect three Power Cores that are located around the outside of the board. Players start at the center and use move cards to make their way to one of the outer edges of the board to collect an artifact or power core. Once collected it's kept for the remainder of the game and the player is teleported back to the start. Artifacts give powerful abilities, but do not contribute to winning the game.

Players get to choose two actions for their turn. They can choose any combination of placing a tile, using a move, and/or drawing a card. Placing a tile allows players to change the path to their advantage or to block their opponents. Using a move can only be done if the corresponding paths are connected. Drawing a card can result in a move card or an ability card.

Cryptodome is a free-for-all game for 2-8 players ages 14 and up that can be played in about an hour. Three types of cards allows for a simple risk/reward system that players can strategize with as the game goes on. Games change in dynamic based on the number of players and the strategies that players tend towards. Players tend to collect up to two artifacts near the beginning of the game and then use them to collect three power cores more effectively.

Kickstarter pre-launch page is up! Follow here for all the updates!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jacobvarrogames/cryptod...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Maze, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Layering, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers

name: Hold the Line: Excalibur, The Battles of King Arthur
description:
This game takes the myths, legends, and history to tell the tale of Arthur and his battles as they might have been.

Now you get to refight the battles that were or might have been using an updated and deepened Hold the Line system....

The game comes with 3 campaigns of linked scenarios, with 8 total scenarios:

Campaign 1: SCENARIOS 1 - 3 “THE MATTER OF THE NORTH” (Roughly 490 AD)
Campaign 2: SCENARIOS 4 - 6 “PEACE OR NONE” *Roughly 10 years later (Around 500 AD)
Campaign 3: SCENARIOS 7 - 8 “THE WINTER OF THE KING”

Scenario 1: The River Glein
Scenario 2: Old Trimontium
Scenario 3: Cat Coit Caledon
Scenario 4: A Sleepy Village
Scenario 5: The Outskirts of Londinium
Scenario 6: The Battle of Badon Hill
Scenario 7: Treachery at the Stables
Scenario 8: The Battle of Camlann

Anyone familiar with the HOLD THE LINE system will quickly pick up the changes.

DETERMINE ACTION POINTS (AP): In each scenario each side in a turn is given a set number of action points (normally 3 to 5), and then roll a die to receive a random number from 1 to 3 of additional action points.

SIDE A PERFORMS ACTIONS: The currently active player spends up to his total action points performing the following actions with individual units. Each unit must complete it's action before the next unit begins it's actions:

1 AP - Activate a unit to move up to its movement allowance
1 AP - Move or attack using 2 adjacent Coastal Raider units
1 AP - Attack an adjacent unit
1 AP - Leaders may rally 1 hit on a unit they are stacked with
2 AP - Cavalry type units may perform a cavalry charge against non-adjacent enemy units
2 AP - Gesith infantry units may move 1 hex and attack enemy units
2 AP - Berserkers may perform a berserker charge
2 AP - Pictish Chieftains may cavalry charge enemy infantry type units only
After Side A spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, then Side B Performs Actions.

After Side B spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, the Victory is checked. If neither side has won a victory, and it is not the last turn of the game, then a new turn begins.

Some of the highlighted system changes are:

Greater unit differentiation in hit/combat ability
Special Leader Abilities
Coastal Raiders group movement and combat
Berserkers
Cavalry Charges
3 Armies - Romano-British/ Saxons/ Picts
Optional Rules for Merlin and Morganna with special magical abilities

Victory is determined by eliminating opposing units and capturing terrain
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Family Boom
description:
Family Boom is a groundbreaking new card game that combines several activities into one small box! You’ll never be bored with the variety of different challenges and prompts.

Everyone can play Family Boom! The rules are simple: draw a card, read it, and follow the directions. All generations, young and old, will want to play this kids card game!

Sore losers stay away! Anything is fair in Family Boom board games...as long as it stays friendly enough. Cheaters will have to take the consequences, but only if they get caught!

—description from the publisher

Players participate in different challenges, presented on cards. The winner of the challenge keeps the card. At the end of the game, the player with the most cards wins the game.
mechanics: Action/Event

name: Together
description:
A conversation starter game that will help couples discuss together !

This couple card games is designed to be an awesome conversation starter dating card game for adults to have various fun or deep topics around family, yourself, the future, dating, or bed : the conversation cards for couples will help both of you open yourselves up and deepen your relationship

Listening, talking, and debating are key for couples, our 3 cards categories trigger these essential skills: draw a card from the deck and answer the question yourself, ask the question for your partner to answer or answer together for deep and meaningful conversations

Play for fun or each round give the cards away if the player has answered successfully: The winner is the one who knows his beloved best and has the most cards!
mechanics: Action/Event

name: Girls Fever
description:
This party game for girls night out has 6 fun categories to make confessions and hysterical laughter inevitable: Have You Ever, Vote, List, The Most Likely To, Would You Rather, Dare. Nobody can slip through the net of this girl talk game: so it's time to confess, and have a great time :)

Each card will get awarded to a player; at the end of the game, the player with who gained the most cards, wins the game.
mechanics: Action/Event

name: Ghost Story Dice
description:
Revive the art of storytelling using these nine beautifully illustrated wooden dice to create ghostly stories.

Construct your own spooky adventure tale with an array of creepy characters such as vampires, headless horsemen and decapitated knights. You can use your cloak of invisibility to escape from the dungeon in the haunted house, but beware of the creaking staircase! Once you’ve made it out, will your getaway car break down in the spooky forest under a full moon…?

This is the perfect family game that will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike. Ideal for playing by a log fire. But beware: this box glows in the dark!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling
publishers: Laurence King Publishing Ltd, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Monopoly: Ruthe-Edition
description: It is a Monopoly Edition with graphics from the german cartoon artist Ralph Ruthe. With characters like sheep Thorsten Dörnbach, Barry and Sting, Pete and some others.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Don't Look Back: The Curse of Oak Hill Expansion
description:
In the early 1800's miners in the North Hills blasted into a large open cavity deep underground. Inside, strange images were scrawled on the walls and hundreds of items littered the floor. The miners stared at the objects, some strange and some recognizable. Most were made from carved stone, wood, and even gold. Not sure what they had found, the miners quickly divided up the items. Over the next several months the miners began to hear strange voices and some went missing. They would claim the items they had found would wander from room to room, showing up in unexpected spots. It wasn't until children around the camp began to vanish that the miners decided to act. Declaring the items cursed they returned them to the chamber where they had been found and blasted the entrance closed.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 Father Gabriel Hero miniature, 1 Demon Killer miniature, and 1 custom scenario to the base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Faction Pack
description:
One of the safest places left in the known world, the Kingdom is guarded by well-trained and well-equipped cavalry. These stalwart soldiers are led by the Kingdom’s chief of security and Ezekiel’s right-hand man, Richard.

Contents:
1x Resin Richard Model
1x Resin Benjamin Model
2x Kingdom Guards
19 All Out War Cards including: 4 Survivor Cards, 13 Equipment Cards, 2 Veteran Skill Cards
15 Call to Arms Cards including: 5 Survivor Cards, 1 Faction Rules Card, 9 Equipment Cards
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Homo Vivo
description:
Homo Vivo is a board game for 2 to 5 players where the players manage a tribe and have it evolve from australopithecus to homo sapiens sapiens.

The first player to reach the stage of homo sapiens sapiens is the homo vivo, the surviving man, and wins the game.

Rules in Dutch/Flemish. Player boards in English. Resource cards and board are language neutral.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Critical Mass: 5 card Promo Pack
description:
A collection of 5 promo cards - some released previously.

Distortion Field - The text on the card is "Target enemy mech’s weapons now have -1 firepower"

Missile Defense - The text on the card is "Disable this card to prevent any missile attack"

Plasma Drill (Dice Tower KS released 2019)

Reinforce (released 2019)

Power Transceiver (released 2019)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Totem
description:
Totem is a one of a kind card-and-counter crucible – an all-out scramble for 2 - 4 players. You’ll compete to construct magnificent totems – and to ruin your enemies' chances of doing the same. Unleash a pack of wolves, find strength in a colony of ants or take shelter under the eagle’s wings. The aim is to finish the game with at least 5 completed totems scoring the most points. In the deck there are six unique animal cards, each with their own distinct ability. The cards allow you to collect tokens which can be used to build totems and score you points.

You can build a totem with whatever you want, lie if you have to, just don't get caught! How you build your totem will affect how many points you can score. Bears and Wolves tear down other players' totems, Moose maximise a totem's point value and Ants score more points when they stick together. A totem is only safe if there is an eagle on top of it to keep a look out for hungry predators.

Featuring stunning original artwork and simple, flexible rules which adapt to your group size, Totem is different every time you play.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Keep Your Sanity
description:
There are four stacks of cards. Act, Chance, the double-sided Sanity/Debt cards, and a smaller stack of Quarantine cards. Each player takes turns rolling the dice on their turn. Depending on the number rolled, you gain, lose or swap cards.

The game ends once someone reaches twenty Sanity cards or when the Sanity deck runs out. The player with the most Sanity then wins.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling

name: Ticket to the North: Canada
description:
Canadian eh! Then Ticket to the North - Canada is the game for you! Travel across Canada by Highway, Mountain Pass & Sea Route to complete your Route Tickets. A 4-player game with large six-fold gameboard, playing cards, route tickets, playing pieces and player tokens.
