In Ticket to the North: CANADA your objective is to travel to more cities than your opponents using the Canadian national highways, mountain passes and northern sea routes.

On your turn you may do any one of four possible actions:
Draw playing cards, Claim a route, Draw route & tourist tickets, Place a truck stop.

Game end: Once any player reaches two or fewer tokens at the end of their turn, then every player gets one last turn including the player with two or fewer tokens.

Scoring: Take each player’s base score from the routes claimed during the game and add or subtract the total value for each route ticket that was completed or failed. The player(s) with the longest continuous route (rocky mountain pass, national highway & northern sea route) wins the corresponding longest route bonus card worth 10 extra points. Routes outside the zone are not considered continuous.

The player with the highest score wins the game. If there is a tie then the player with the most completed tickets wins.
mechanics: Connections, Network and Route Building

name: Rhyolite Bay: Naval Warfare
description:
So you enjoyed playing Battleship when you were young but grew out of it. Looking for an intense and MULTIPLAYER Naval Warfare board game, time to try... RHYOLITE BAY - Naval Warfare.
Up to 5 players can send their Naval Fleet into Rhyolite Bay for battle. Placement of your Ships is secret, only you know the locations. Take turns playing specialty cards to sink the opponent's naval fleet.

ENHANCED ATTACK CARDS
Launch Bombs to sink enemy ships - single, double & triple hits.
Launch a Nuke Bomb to blow a whole area out of the water.
Set Time Bombs on enemy ships.
Sonar Ping the location of your enemy.
Gain Bonus Points every time you sink an enemy ship.

DEFENSE & STRATEGY CARDS
Use Self Destruct to sink your own ship - before they do?
Use Misfired Bomb to stop their missile attack.
Deceive your enemy with hidden Naval Mines - false hits?
Use your Bandit Card to steal playing cards from other player.

WINNING THE GAME
When only one player remains with ships not sunk, the game ends and the player with the most bonus points from sinking other ships wins the game.

A Card and Board style game that will have you calling HIT and MISS. Battleship could only dream to be this good on the big board!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Quadro Connection
description:
A Quadro or a collection of color squares numbered 1 to 4. Be the team with the greatest amount of complete quadros at the end of the game by drawing colored numbered cards and strategically placing chips on the game board. Use swap cards to mix up the game and wild cards to help complete your quadros.
Quadro can be played with 2 or 3 teams of up to 12 players.

To play The Quadro Connection:

Place the game board on a flat surface in reach of all players.
Any number of players from 2 to 12 that is divisible by 2 or 3 can play. Form 2 or 3 teams. In team play, coaching your team mates is forbidden.

Decide who deals, shuffle the cards and deal out 4 cards to each player. The remaining cards form the draw deck. The player to the left of the dealer goes first and play then continues clockwise. On each turn, players choose one card from their hand and place the card face up on the discard pile. Once they complete their TURN EVENT, they will pick up a card from the draw deck and then the next player takes their turn.

A quadro is complete and locked with all numbers 1 to 4. Once complete and locked, chips can not be swapped.

Play continues until all the cards are gone from the draw pile and all cards have been played. The team with the highest amount of complete quadros, wins the game.
mechanics: Connections, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Landline: When the Grid Goes Down
description:
When disaster strikes and the cellular grid goes down, how do you talk to Grandma? Help connect Grandma to the family by connecting a series of wires for the old landline connection. Random layouts with each game and several skills levels to master as you move colored wire tiles to make a complete landline circuit.

Landline - The cellular network is down and all modern electronic phones don’t work. Worried about Grandma, you must connect the old Landline grid for the family to contact her by phone.

The game uses 72 - 2”x2” tiles that are randomly placed and must be moved and stacked to make a complete wired circuit from Grandma to the Family. The main objective of Landline is to connect the Grandma tile to the Family tile..

Landline is played by moving and stacking tiles to create the wired circuit. Only the outermost tile from any side can be moved, either top, bottom, right or left side. Once you move a tile the remaining space is considered EMPTY and you may not fill it with another tile.

You win the game when the Landline circuit is completed by connecting Grandma with the Family and you have used all Junction Box tiles in the circuit.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Products
description:
Products is the original invent-it, pitch-it card game. Create genius or hilariously horrible products, then pitch your glorious inventions to friends and family.

How to play.
1. Draw: The investor draws a Product card.
2. Invent: The players match a Feature card with the Product card.
3. Pitch: The players pitch their new inventions in 60-seconds.
4. Invest: The investor chooses the winner for the round.
5. Repeat: Play until a person/team wins three times.

Includes 180 Features (blue cards), 70 Products (white cards) for your crazy minds infinite replayability. Includes rules with three unique ways to play, invent, and win!

Be an entrepreneur, and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit and experience the inventive process.

Pitch impromptu, and challenge yourself and others to pitch ingenious or downright funny products.

Invent the greatest invention ever, and ignite your creativity and explore the depths of your inventive mind.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Voting

name: Asylum
description:
For nearly a century, Saturn Hills Asylum has housed the mentally disturbed of Valley Falls. Under the leadership of Dr. Norman Blackthorn, Saturn Hills has become known as both a pioneer in experimental psychiatric techniques as well as a facility equipped to house the most dangerous, demented criminals. Despite the nature of the sadistic souls held within its walls, Saturn Hills has functioned largely without incident until Wolfgang Koch was discovered in his room, hanging from the overhead light by a makeshift noose. The way Koch died seems particularly strange given his history and the reason he was incarcerated at Saturn Hills in the first place. Koch, one of Saturn Hills’ most notorious inmates, was also known as The Judas Killer because he hanged each and every one of his victims and left a handful of silver coins in the pockets of the deceased as he staged the suicide of Judas Iscariot over and over again. Silver coins, incidentally, were also found at the crime scene. Who had it out for The Judas Killer and what was their motive for killing him? What kinds of secrets are hidden behind the padded walls of Saturn Hills? Can you discover what was really going on at the asylum and determine who killed Wolfgang Koch?
Difficulty Rating – 6/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sleight of Hand
description:
When The Amazing Silverstone died, his Last Will and Testament was a source of much controversy due to a personalized note he left with his lawyer. It read:

“To my dearest son, Peter. If you are reading this particular draft then it means my unknown nemesis murdered me. They will have gone to great lengths to cover their tracks, but I know the truth. In time, hopefully, you will too. There have been lots of unusual happenings at Silverstone Manor over the past few weeks. Some of them I could have chalked up to simple coincidence, but the sheer number of strange occurrences has cast a sinister cloud overhead that has been too overwhelming to ignore. Your reading of this will proves that I wasn’t paranoid or crazy. I was right all along about the threat on my life. That brings me to your involvement in this cryptic business. In addition to my estate and the considerable wealth that goes with it, I am leaving you the contents of my safe which, I believe, contains the identity of the one who took my life. Over the course of my life I have made many enemies, both personally and professionally, and I believe one of these is to blame for my untimely demise. Determine the identity of my killer and bring them to justice. I have the utmost confidence in you, my son.”
Although he had acquired considerable sleight of hand skills from years of apprenticing under his father, Peter Silverstone had no idea where to start with the investigation of his father’s murder. As a result, he has brought the contents of his father’s safe to you at the Will Street Detective Agency and hired you to help solve the mystery surrounding the death of The Amazing Silverstone.

Difficulty Rating – 6/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ransom
description:
Sasha Millington, daughter of real estate magnate Warren Bankhead, was kidnapped during a gala celebrating the opening of the Sioux exhibit at the Valley Falls Museum. A ransom note has been received demanding ten million dollars in exchange for her return. Time is running out. Discover the kidnapper’s true identity and motive for abducting her before it is too late.
Difficulty Rating – 6/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sweet Tooth
description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Investigate the cutthroat world of baking in our newest mini-mystery as a famous food critic is found murdered after planning a visit to Valley Falls to review its finest culinary establishments.

Note: This is a mystery that is half the size of the normal DMS boxes and takes about half the amount of time to complete. The mini will be delivered in an envelope, not a box.

Difficulty Rating – 5.5/10


This mystery was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service. It was released as a one-time purchase
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bush's Board Game Thing: The Boardgame
description:
A board game based around a podcast about boardgames. Given subjects from the board, build up a series of quick-witted rants about board games and produce your own podcast. Be the first to get your rants into the can for later.

The rules are downloaded as part of the game - it's a player vote on the monologue that denotes your move. The first player to complete a rotation of the board wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Negotiation, Track Movement, Voting

name: Infinite Chaos
description:
Infinite Chaos is an out-of-this-world card game where you work with friends and family to create the craziest way to solve a problem or create one.

Players start by designating a Chaosmaster (Judge) to create an objective involving a chaos card ranging from serious issues like world hunger to more light-hearted ones such as family reunions. Everyone else draws questionable idea cards, random components to aid you in formulating your soon-to-be master plan, which they will use to compete against others to meet the Chaosmaster's objective. The Chaosmaster will then award the chaos card to whoever's plan was the best. A new Chaosmaster is then selected, and a winner is decided by whoever has the most chaos cards when the game ends.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Champion Cards
description:
A set of 5 cards that were provided as participation reward in the last European, North American and World Championships.

These 5 cards were designed by previous Continental/World championship winners as part of their prize, but were never included in the Force Packs before the end of the game was announced.

Each of these cards can be used to replace a card with the same set-number in any objective set.

Cards in this set are:
Aurra Sing — 2016 North American Champ Josh Johnson
Darth Vader — 2016 World Champion Brad Emon
It’s Beautiful — 2017 World Champion Mick Cipra
K-2SO — 2017 European Champion Pawel Zochowski
Profundity — 2017 North American Champion James Lau

These cards are also available in a Print to Play file through the FFG site.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Taylor & Gus Booster Pack
description:
Trusted members of the Kingdom’s security, Taylor and Gus often ride on patrols beyond the walls of their safe home to keep borders secure and trade routes with other scattered settlements open.

Contents:

1x Resin Taylor Model
1x Resin Gus Model
11 All Out War Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 7 Equipment Cards, 2 Veteran Skill Cards
8 Call to Arms Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 6 Equipment Cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Guard Booster Pack
description: Kingdom guards ride to war better equipped than most other survivors. With swords and firearms at their disposal and swift horses to outrun walkers, they make formidable opponents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Barking Spiders: The Game
description:
Finally, a game that combines the best parts of Phase 10 (forming movements; dropping kids off at the pool) with UNO (skipping opponents; making “number one” jokes) while eliminating all the lame parts (keeping score, needing to learn Spanish, foregoing scatological humor).

Here's how it works: Use Clumps, Streaks and Flushes to form your best movements out of Mass or Gas cards. Once your movement is complete, be the first player to drop your kids off at the pool to finish the hand. Now get to work on your next movement. You have to pass five movements but you can do them in any order. See? Easy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hong Kong (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Ticket to Ride™: Hong Kong is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride™ series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride™ and to Hong Kong, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride™’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or play tested this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building

name: Growers and Showers
description:
What do you get if you combine Exploding Kittens with Cards Against Humanity and Bears Vs Babies?

Growers and Showers is a tactical card game about sex and relationships. The decks are full of inappropriate cards, from porn categories and contraceptives to sexual orientations and kinks. Players use these cards to grow the biggest Dick, before their friend cuts it off!

As the game intensifies, players have to choose whether they want to use their cards to grow a bigger Dick early and protect it (Showers) or slowly catch up and steal a win at the last (Growers). Once the Decks are depleted, the game ends and the biggest Dick wins.

A turn consists of 2 moves. On a move, you play a card from your hand and discard it in the process. These moves can consist of 1 card or more depending on the type of card. Hands must be replenished between moves, so that every hand has the minimum number of cards (7).

When all the cards are depleted from the Decks, the game ends immediately.

Initially, a player will have to have the biggest Grower. If the Missionary cards have been played during the game then the aim of the game could have been changed to smallest Grower or most cards on your Grower.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Tea Game
description:
"Who wants a cup of tea?" one of your friends calls out at a gaming event. This is the starting point of the game, now you need to find out who will be getting up to make it.

Next question "Who's in for the tea game?" once the player count is confirmed take two D6, pass them to the starting player (the one who asked for tea) who then rolls the dice.

To stay in the game the starting player has to roll less than '12' on two D6, if successful the dice are passed clockwise to the next player who is then required to roll less than '11' on two D6. The play rotates round the group of players with the number to roll under dropping by '1' each time until someone rolls that number or greater on the dice.

That player is declared the winner of the tea game, given a rousing cheer and sent off to make the tea for all of the other players. Huzzah!
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles
description:
Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles is a strategy tabletop game in the steampunk post-apocalyptic genre with detailed mechanics as well as action selection, area control, resource management and set collection. Choose one of five clans with their own unique skills. Go to the Lab for a vaccine and organize trips to the Rift for energy pods. Get weapons and resources at the Flea Market or try your luck in the Ruins or Mines. Capture the objects that will be most useful in your development! Explore technology and build steam machines!

What does a player do on their turn - the game consists of several phases. In the first phase players decide what do they do on the game board. The second phase is an action phase, when they collect their clan miniatures from the gameboard and take necessary actions. It may need dice roll, or payment, or trading, depending on chosen strategy. In the third phase, they vaccinate their clan and count points. Then the turn goes to the next player and every phase starts all over.

The game ends when either all technology cards are learned or all steam machines are built.

The player with most points after all count wins.
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Antimateria
description:
In the distant future, humanity mastered the science of creating antimatter and this enabled a huge leap in prosperity and evolution for the race. Now, in possession of powerful engines powered by this new and virtually inexhaustible fuel, Earth factions seek to claim new homes for themselves in the depths of the galaxy.

Antimateria is a civ/euro game, with a scifi theme and medium interaction in which conflicts occur indirectly between players - disputes over actions, locations and resources.

In Antimateria, each player represents a faction of a future humanity, which has been given a mission to explore the universe to discover new habitable planets. Everyone cooperates for the good of the humanity, but the game is competitive. Resources are public, meaning if you produce, any player can use the resources at the table. The objective is to gain points with the Federation government being the faction with the best performance in 4 categories (technologies, production, colonization and influence).

The mechanic is card driven where players, instead of playing an action for themselves, play an action that can be done by everyone, at the cost of placing their emissaries on the card. Players reveal the cards simultaneously, so each turn the player chooses which one he wants to activate. If the card the player played is activated by another player, he earns Solaris credits. Credits can be used in a variety of ways, from buying resources to activating certain actions. At the end of the game they serve as a wild resource for scoring if not used. Solaris is a management game with a lot of planning.

Colonies are represented by dice and the die value indicates the level of development of the colony. The more developed it is, the more it will generate credits and also colonization points. Tech cards give you unique abilities and also tech points, while building buildings allows you to earn production points and, of course, generate resources. Finally, there are public goals that when achieved allow the player to gain more emissaries to use and give points of influence. At the end of the game, your score is the sum of your 2 lowest tracks, which forces players to invest in all tracks.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Nebula Rush
description:
Nebula Rush is a game of exploration on continuously changing game maps for 2 to 4 players. Sail your Pirate Guild’s ships through The Whirly Swirly Neb, gathering resources, avoiding storms and gales, and collecting clues and rumors as to the location of “The Kracken’s” hidden treasure. A game that is Half Sleuth game, Half Exploration, and Half Combat, Nebula Rush keeps you on the edge of your seat as you race to search, locate and claim "The Kracken's" treasure.

On each turn, players either draw a Ship Appearance Card (which can put the ship and any player's game board) or keep their ship out of play. The you fight, draw treasure and rumors, buy items for your ships and discard resource cards if necessary.

All players start with 3 Ships in their Guild totaling a Manifest value of 13. If the Player has more Befallen Cards + SRS Resource Cards in their hand than their Guild's Manifest value, they discard to the Manifest value.

When a Player has a completed one of the multiple Treasure Maps AND has one of their Ships in the System Hex of the completed Treasure Map, they claim "The Kraken's" Treasure and become Master of The Neb.

The primary means for the player to win is to claim "The Kraken's" Treasure. Other ways to win are to eliminate all other Player Ships, or to have all 6 Legendary Captains (a type of Befallen Card) on each of their Ships.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Hexagon Grid, Kill Steal, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Pieces as Map, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Targeted Clues

name: Helden Handwerk
description:
In Heroescraft, you are the governor of one of the cities of the legendary land of Nidawellir. Mighty heroes are at your service, with whose tactical use you expand the economic influence of your city. Command your heroes skillfully and erect magnificent buildings that will give you both power and fame.

In this exciting, interactive economic strategy game, two to four players compete for supremacy in the region. With clever actions, the players try to get useful resources to expand their cities - often at the expense of their neighbors.

Recognizing the plans of your competitors and thwarting them at the right time for your own benefit - therein lies the key to success in Heroescraft!

Because only those who make the best use of the skills of the heroes and the special privileges of the buildings will win the gripping competition for raw materials, reputation and power!

In order to win, the players must erect a certain number of buildings. Buildings are built by giving up certain raw materials. Raw materials can either be bought in the cities adjacent to the caravan. Or they can be exchanged with the players or with the bank through different heroes. When buying raw materials, the dynamic prices in the market must be taken into account.
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Base
description:
Base is a strategic, abstract puzzle game with a unique worker placement bid mechanism.

Grab modules and build your base! The goal of the game is to build as many rows and columns of 5 modules into your base following the given building instructions.

To get the necessary modules, you have to send trading delegations to neighbouring planets. As your fellow players will do the same, you should wisely choose the size of your delegation because size matters when it comes to trade negotiations. For each row or column that you accomplish within a round, you earn instant points that give you special actions. After 6 rounds, the game ends.

Now it’s time to score the secret side contracts that each of you signed with the private sector. The player with the most points wins the game and gets governor of his own planet.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Contracts, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Tanzania
description:
Tanzania is a card game that will immerse you in the heart of Africa. Carnivorous animals, herbivores, herds and hunters will be the protagonists of a challenge full of threats, strategy and emotion.

In this game, each participant must avoid all the threats present to make their animals survive in the African savanna.


Objective: Be the first player to save 20 animals.

Contents: 50 animal cards, 35 situation cards, 35 hunter cards, 1 hand token, 1 regulation.

TANZANIA is a semi-cooperative card game.

Animal cards are dealt to each player and a situation card is raised (Day in the open field / Sunset at the river / Night in the grasslands).

Then an animal card is played trying not to lose it. When playing a carnivore you have to hunt. When playing a herbivore you have to avoid being hunted.
Each animal card has a score according to the situation card previously drawn.

By playing the same card as another participant, a pack is formed, increasing the score of the cards that comprise it.

Despite having stronger cards and weaker cards, the fact of forming a pack and playing as a team equates the weakest with the strongest.

At the end of the hand a hunter card is raised. In case one comes out, he hunts the strongest animal on the table, modifying the outcome of the round.

The strategy of the game is to know when to play each animal, since by playing a weak card you run the risk of being hunted by another animal and by playing a strong card you run the risk of being hunted by a hunter.

The first player to save 20 animals wins the game.
mechanics: Semi-Cooperative Game

name: El Sincero
description:
How well you know your friends and family?

A board game for that group with whom you know each other from head to toe.

Each participant chooses a color and the totems and boards are distributed. The boards are placed in the center of the table with the pawn at the beginning. Voting cards are also distributed to each player.

The personality cards are placed face down on the table. A personality card is revealed and read and everyone must vote by placing their card face down. After everyone has voted, the voting cards are turned over and the votes are counted.

Players who agreed the most votes win and advance. The first player to complete a lap wins!
mechanics: Voting

name: Realms of Life
description:
1-6 players. Immense yourself into one of the 12 characters that make up Team Aura from Digital Reverence! For ages 13+

ENTER THE REALMS OF LIFE... IF YOU DARE!
Do you have the courage?

Someone has released the all powerful, Selina the Red Witch, from her Abyss once more! She has vowed to take over all of the ROLTH Universe! It's up to Team Aura to stop her before the ROLTH Universe as we know it, is ruled by her!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Mahoning Monstrosity: Monsters Attack Youngstown Ohio, Summer of 1977
description:
“You can’t scare me. I was born in Youngstown.”—Anonymous.

It is the summer of 1977 and out of the PCB laden depths of the Mahoning River rises a hideous monster to threaten downtown Youngstown, Ohio. Can you mobilize Steel city’s finest and the Ohio National Guard, all aided or hindered by local personalities, to defend the city and its populace?

Learn and enjoy this whimsical historical gaming salute to Youngstown as it battles a mythical monster during the summer before the real ones came to the fore that fateful October.

—description from the designer

Each copy of Mahoning Monstrosity is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch map

One sheet of 81 unmounted, double sided counters

12 pages of rules and charts

Players will also need a six sided die, some scrap paper and a pen or pencil to play the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: The Streets of Newark
description:
The Streets of Newark is a two to five player game and each player will take on the role of one of the five Dons running Newark during prohibition. The board consists of 9 to 23 location tiles, based upon the number of players, and each player has three lieutenants. The lieutenants each have up to four soldiers in their crew, and the lieutenant's crew moves around the various locations of the board as a unit. Soldiers can be improved through equipment cards.

Each turn, players secretly determine where they will deploy their lieutenant's crews. Then everyone reveals simultaneously and moves their crews to the selected locations. While at the locations, crews complete jobs, actively corrupt policemen and officials, or collect protection money. But If two or more player's move crews to the same location, there can be conflict, and even bloodshed.

Play continue until one Don achieves one of the five victory conditions. The five different win conditions are (1) becoming the next crime lord through reputation, (2) controlling the city's locations, (3) corrupting the city's officials and police force, (4) conquering the other mob's forces through bloodshed or (5) conspiring with the federal investigators. No player is pigeon-holed into any one victory path, but each Don's lieutenants have unique abilities.

The Streets of Newark was designed to have great replay value, with tremendous depth and strategy. There are countless combinations of board configurations, decisions, soldiers, upgrades and paths to victory.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: City Streets: A Thrilling Strategy Racing Game
description:
An escalating roll and move racing game where players strategically purchase and use upgrades and items in an effort to be the first to finish 10 laps.

Each player begins with $4000 and some free items of their choice. Players roll dice and move their cars around the board, then interact with the spaces they land on. Players can accumulate items purchased from shops which allow them to move further on each turn, use boosters, sabotage opponents, take shortcuts, earn extra money, and more. Players interact with other spaces they land on to move further, take a shortcut, earn extra money, or to gain or lose a turn. Players earn more money upon completion of each lap.

Different items the players purchase offer different strategies. Players can focus on upgrading speed, purchasing items that give options, taking shortcuts, or investing in money gaining items early so they can buy everything and make a blazing comeback. The first player to finish the 10th lap wins the game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Treasure 'N Mutiny!
description:
Treasure 'N Mutiny is a Pirate themed Sandbox-Style Roll & Play Adventure Game for 1-12 Players!

Roll Dice To Move, Pick up cards/tokens, use cards/tokens, move on board, attack other players, attack other ships, battle raid (card) events
Game Ends when ONE player or team completes the END GAME SCENARIO
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Key Crusade
description:
Players roll dice and move on the board/
The Game ends when 1 player collects 4 keys and reaches the Golden Tomb.
mechanics: King of the Hill, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magick Circle
description:
Roll the dice to move clockwise round the Magick circle!
Collect Magick & Mana to attack your opponents!
The Last Wizard Standing.. Wins!
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Kill Steal, Roll / Spin and Move, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Project Luna
description:
In the near future, corporations of Earth get the mandate to explore and exploit the Moon for resources and science in order to push forward humanity's dream of living among the stars. You, as a player, are placed in a position of a manager on Luna.

Your job is to, first, make your colony as self sustaining as possible by playing different projects, making way for advanced industries and science that build up the prestige of your company - the main parameter for determining the victor in the end. Everything in game is based on hard science - no sci-fi elements included.

During the turn, players have a lot of options - playing cards, rolling dice to research new tech and build decks of cards, place buildings on the map and move units on the same map. They can trade on a common and ever changing market, start missions (represented by some other cards) on distant planets, and finish tasks from the common deck.

The game ends when any player finishes a series of secret task (agendas) that he gets via cards at the game's start. That turn becomes the last one.

The player wins by accumulating the most victory points (prestige points in game) that are gathered through various actions during the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Identity Theft
description:
Identity Theft is not a joke. It’s a game!

As skilled digital hackers, attempt to infiltrate your opponents’ defenses and piece together their Identification Numbers. Use the Black Market to attack, defend, and engage in Risky Business. Use your hacking skills at the opportune moments and be careful who you trust. The first hacker to steal all other’s identities is the victor, so do whatever it takes to keep your own identity safe!

Don’t forget to be vigilant! An Undercover Cop or White Hat Hacker can disrupt your schemes at any moment. If you can secure control of the elusive and adorable Botnet your chances for success skyrocket. So what are you waiting for? Get lost in the black market. Release your inner hacker. Show off your best evil grin. Who will you hack first?

Identity Theft - it’s Risky Business!

Each player starts the game with a randomized identity code. Players then play cards to steal information about the code or defend from the attackes. The first player to guess an opponent's identity code wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Hidden Piece
description:
Combining organization, vision, coordination of gestures and speed of execution, the game 'The Hidden Piece' will allow you to have fun with your family, in your classroom or with friends. It is also an ideal game for developing collaborative effort as well as the use of visuospatial vocabulary.

An image made of 24 pieces is picked out. All the players have to quickly reconstitute the suggested grids on the their player board in order to discover the part that is unused: the hidden piece! Several levels of difficulty are offered, as well as several game modes to improve your stress management.

The first one to finish the puzzle and find the piece that don't fit in the puzzle win the game.

--
Alliant l’organisation, la vision, la coordination des gestes et la vitesse d’exécution, le jeu « Pièce cachée » vous permettra de vous amuser en famille, dans votre classe ou entre amis. Pour y jouer, tous les joueurs doivent en même temps reconstituer rapidement les grilles suggérées afin de découvrir la pièce qui est inutilisée: la pièce cachée!
Le premier joueur qui termine le casse-tête et qui trouve la pièce de trop gagne la partie.

Plusieurs niveaux de difficulté sont proposés, de même que plusieurs modes de jeux permettant d’améliorer votre gestion du stress. Il s’agit en plus d’un jeu idéal pour développer son esprit de collaboration ainsi que l’utilisation du vocabulaire visuo-spatial.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Adver-City
description:
Adver-City is a strategic city building game. In the game all players develop their own city, with making structures like farms, hospitals, schools etc. Making these structures allows players to gain resources and people.

There are 4 resources, oxygen, water, food and oil. Players can use these resources to develop their cities or trade them.

Players travel through time and world events from 1920 to 2020. ADVERSITIES will come and will affect every city in some way or another. Unfortunate events through time bring adversity not just to one player but every player.

From earthquakes to wildfires to man made adversities like religious clashes to trade embargos. go through it all and try not to lose all your population, because there is no city without its people.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling

name: Blood in the Valley
description:
Blood in the Valley is a set of rules designed to play the largest battles during the American Civil War in 10mm or 15mm scale.

You maneuver and fight by divisions. This game is D6 and D20 based. Although you will be rolling D6s more than anything else.

This ruleset is full of historical flavor that will make you want to keep fighting until the battle is won!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Federation Commander: Romulan Space
description:
Federation Commander has two base games: Klingon Border (which is the same as Federation Commander: Academy + Graduation) and Romulan Border. When placed together, you have ships for the United Federation of Planets and the four major empires that surround them.

If you already have Klingon Border (or Academy + Graduation) and want to add the Romulans and Gorns, instead of buying Romulan Border, you can buy this discounted package that includes the non-duplicated parts of Romulan Border, such as the counters, ship cards, reference cards, and a special ship/scenario book. This package does not include the hard-mounted maps, the box, marker, dice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: SOURCE
description:
2122. The Earth has fallen. In the hope of survival, humanity has moved to a massive space station built by artificial intelligence. However, the machines have already become self-conscious during construction, and once the passengers have entered the cryo phase, they have been exiled to a virtual world, RealLife-8, where all our activities generate energy for them, drifting in space towards a new planet rich in ores for the machines. Now we approached a promising planet, and they no longer need us. Their agents must perform the final touches before the servers shut down. If their goal succeeds, our lives are over.

A small team aboard the ARCHimedes is already aware of what the machines are planning. Their purpose is variable. Most of the team is working to prevent server downtime long enough while breaking the path to the source. One of them is the chosen one who, when he gets into the source, rewrites the code of the machines and frees humanity. However, a member of the team does not want liberation. He wants to maintain this virtual world and reprogram it into the DreamLife version. He made a deal with the machines. If they win with his help, a small portion of the people, including him, will be moved to DreamLife’s servers. Will we be able to keep humanity alive?

In this Matrix- and Cyberpunk-inspired world, 1-6 players in semi-cooperative or cooperative game modes struggle to defeat agents, obtain access codes, and get into the SOURCE. Variable player powers, deckbuilding, hybrid gaming experience with exciting votes and with a special upgrading system.

On your turn, you play your 4 cards. With these, you can move on your ship and in the city, explore new locations, repair, free up civilians, attack agents and upgrade your deck. Your actions generate energy for the machines. At the end of your turn, draw a new hand (4 cards), roll two dice, choose one, and the effect will be on the agents.

If you complete all three quests and then finally the chosen one enters the Source, the liberators win. If too many locations become infected, if there are too many agents in the city, if there is too much damage on the spaceship, if the traitor enters the source, the traitor and the machines win. If any of these are met, the game ends immediately.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Woodbury Army Faction Pack
description:
The settlement known as Woodbury is ruled with an iron ﬁst by its self­‐appointed leader, the Governor. Ruthless and armed to the teeth, they prey on smaller, weaker groups of survivors while zealously defending their own territory. When Rick and the other survivors occupy the prison, they draw the Governor's ire, leading to an armed clash with this dangerous faction.

—description from the publisher

This faction starter set contains 7 plastic Survivors: The Governor, Gloria, Lilly, Smitty, Harold Abernathy, Eugene, and Wes; 8 Character Cards; and 4 Equipment Cards. The miniatures are supplied assembled and unpainted.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: TV's Famous Sherlock Holmes Game: Capture
description:
This is a combination "SPINNER" and "RING TOSS" game and may be played by either way, by as many players as desired.

"SPINNER"
Players spin top, in turn, at "Start". If top comes to rest in hole, score points as shown. If top comes to rest on board, but not in scoring hole player receives no score for that turn. If top stops in "TRAP", player loses his next turn. First player to score One Hundred points wins the game.

"RING TOSS"
Insert pegs in holes, toss rubber rings. Score in same manner as for the "SPINNER" game. On Hundred points wins the game.
mechanics: Variable Set-up

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Rick's Group Faction Pack
description:
Through eﬀort and sacriﬁce, Rick and his friends and family have managed to survive the harsh new world. Although they have managed to obtain a measure of peace as a group, they will need to be ready to ﬁght both the walkers and other survivors to keep it.

—description from the publisher

This faction starter set contains: 5 plastic Survivors (Rick in riot armor, Glenn in riot armor, Andrea, Maggie, and Michonne); 2 plastic Walkers (Mike & Terry); 6 Character Cards; and 5 Equipment Cards. The miniatures are supplied assembled and unpainted.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Prisoner Booster Pack
description:
You can boost your chosen gang with the addition of the Prisoner Booster Pack. Luckily the Prisoners aren't fussy who they work for, so they'll make perfect allies for Rick or the Governor.

—description from the publisher

This faction starter set contains: 4 plastic Survivors (Dexter, Axel, Andrew, and Thomas); 5 Character Cards; and 2 Equipment Cards. The miniatures are supplied assembled and unpainted.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Fave Game: Classic Version
description:
How well do you know everyone at the table? Think they can guess your favourite things? Find out in Fave Game!

Each round one player is named 'The Fave'. Players choose cards from their hand that 'The Fave' will like best. 'The Fave' will put the cards in preferential order and the top three cards score points.

The Fave will place the cards face down in order from most favoured to least favoured. The Fave will show them in order, starting from their least favoured card, explaining why they chose to rate each card in the way that they did. Longer, funnier, and crazier stories are recommended!
When all cards have been shown, the most favoured card will earn the player who gave it three points. Second place is worth two points and third place is worth one point. The shown cards are used as score markers and players who win points will keep them face up to track their points.
The game ends when everyone has been The Fave an equal amount of times and the score cards are counted. The person with the most points wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Relick TCG: Character Deck Yuno
description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

Yuno's deck is based on re-rolling the dice to have a second chance
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Triveneto (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Ride Triveneto is a fan-produced map of Triveneto (the land of Venice) by Giovanni Salamon (Gh48). The map can be played with the original rules of TtR Europe or with the TtR Triveneto's custom rules.

TtR Triveneto is designed by Gh48 and the digital version was made by Gh48 and Natascia Torres with the help of RDN_ROXAS
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Rei dos Memes
description:
After his disappointment with the new R$ 200 bill (Brazilian real), our daring Caramel Mutt decided to start a real revolution. He decided to consolidate Brazil once and for all as the King of Memes with a super game and bring fun to everyone on a level never seen before in humanity.

Have lots of laughs with our best Brazilian memes, expressions and slang that everyone loves. Choose the funniest and funniest answers and try to be crowned King or Queen of Memes. WHoever is judged the best, keeps the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

There are 600 sentences with 50,000 (one thousand) different combinations for you to laugh until your belly hurts.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Identity Crisis: The Party Game!
description:
In 'Identity Crisis', you're playing the ultimate game of 'guess who?' This is a feel-good party game to have you and your friends racking your brains trying to figure out what is on the active player's (The Judge) mind and the results are sure to cause some laughs.

Gameplay involves The Judge drawing three cards and laying them out and all of the other players trying to describe a person that the descriptors on those cards match. Answers are shouted enthusiastically and the player with the closest fit wins the round and becomes the new Judge. But there is a twist on the standard 'judgement' mechanic. If people are too slow to yell out their suggestions, a card is turned facedown and no longer counts as a scored card!

The aim of the game is to have 15 cards in total to win.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Player Judge, Real-Time, Voting

name: A Brazen Crown
description:
A Brazen Crown is the first card game based on Mörk Borg, a pitch-black apocalyptic fantasy RPG set in a bleak and dying world.

A Brazen Crown is a lightning-fast battle card game with strong drafting options. Each player controls a blended deck from two of five iconic factions (Royal, Occultist, Esoteric, Fanged & Scum) and wins by reducing their opponent's health points to zero.

On their turn, a player has three coins to spend on minions, spells, relics and traps from their hand. While the ultimate goal is to deal damage to the opponent, other card abilities include wounding or healing minions, searching for other cards, gaining loot to be spent on later turns, and so on.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Truth or Drink: What Up Fam Expansion
description:
The Truth or Drink game series helps you skip small talk and get down to the good stuff. The What Up Fam expansion pack is an all-new set of all-too-revealing questions, designed specifically for families—or, any group of folks who’ve known one another for a long time.

Each card features two questions, so you can pick the best one for the moment. The person being asked can either answer the question, or take a drink! In addition, a set of “You Should Know This” cards tests your knowledge about the other people playing.

The game is played to a determined number of points.

Players win the round by giving a satisfying answer and being awarded the question card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Truth or Drink: Sin Expansion
description:
It’s time for the ultimate confession.
The Truth or Drink game series helps you skip small talk and get down to the good stuff. The Sin expansion pack is an all-new set of all-too-revealing questions, grouped thematically by the Seven Deadly Sins.

This means there's questions about lust. We think that's hot.
There's questions about greed. As many as we could put in there.
There's questions about envy. They'll leave you wanting more.
There's questions about pride. We're really proud of these.
There's questions about sloth. Slow down and take a good look.
There's questions about wrath. They're furiously good.
TOO MANY questions, you say? No chance. Get ready to gorge yourself...because there's also questions about gluttony.

Each card features two questions, so you can pick the best one for the moment. The person being asked can either answer the question, or take a drink!

The game is played to a determined number of points.

Players win the round by giving a satisfying answer and being awarded the question card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Big Home Base
description:
A board based flicking game. The basic rules are roughly the same as outdoor baseball.

No need for speed or strength.
The accuracy of the practice pitching will affect the results.

How to win:
Like outdoor baseball, the player with the highest score after nine innings wins.
mechanics: Flicking
publishers: Goocon CO., LTD (雁隼有限公司)

name: A Tale of Bravery: Demo Game
description:
A free print and play, story driven adventure game for 1 to 4 players set in fantasy Britain some 20 years after the death of King Arthur Pendragon.

Each separate game session, or “quest” as it is called in the game, takes about 1 hour to play. Each quest can be won, lost, or even forfeited. The game is over when you have played through all quests listed in a separate questbook.

Each one of the players controls a “hero”. There are four heroes to the so called “party”. The players win the game if they manage to complete the goals of all the quests of the game.

The players will take turns reading aloud from the questbook. At regular intervals the players are allowed to make decisions on where to go and what to do. This affects the outcome of the game session. Whenever a fight occurs, it is played out on a game board made of separate modular tiles. The combat system is quick and focused on tactics and using the hero’s abilities to survive.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Influencer Card Game
description:
The fast paced strategic card game that goes viral. Get the most followers and secure the influencer contract. But be aware, not everyone will agree with your posts and you may get blocked, hacked or loose posts to copyright claims. Don't get caught with misconduct or your followers will leave you.

Influencer - The viral card game of the social media world. Be the player to acquire the biggest social media following to secure the influencer contract deal.  

Each player draws and discards cards to accumulate followers. Players can also play cards against their opponents to take away their followers.

The game ends when any one player has reached 100k followers, any player may play the influencer contract card on their turn to end the game.

At the end of the game, the player with the biggest social media following after deductions wins the game. You cannot win if your account is blocked.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Sherlock Holmes: Mystery Game – Jack the Ripper Affair
description: A board game using a map of London, a dice, incident cards, a list of subjects to find who is Jack the Ripper. Roll the dice and move around the board, the space you land on pick a card and read the clue to help determine identity of Jack the Ripper or eliminate subjects.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling
publishers: 二見書房 ( Futami Shobo Publishing Co., Ltd. )

name: 仙剑奇侠传—逍遥游 (Chinese Paladin: XiaoYaoYou)
description:
With the collapse of the Tower of Imprisoned Demons, the thousands of demons once again rampaged the earth. To avoid being overwhelmed by the creatures, the Great God Nuwa used the magic of returning to the soul to create the Xiaoyao Illusion that temporarily trapping dangerous demons in it.

The celestial heroes of all time and space have received the message from Nuwa: Please come to the Illusion to conquer the demons and save the common people! The number of powerhouses with the highest merits will get my reward-go back in time and change the thing that makes you most regrettable. Therefore, the powerhouses from all walks of life have packed their bags and set off for the Xiaoyao Illusion.

The players are divided into two teams, A and B, according to the number of players in the game. Each player plays a different hero with special skills. Players take their turns one by one. A turn includes several phases, during which you can trigger event cards, play scrolls, and get equipped. The most important phase is the Battle Phase, during which you can trigger a battle with monsters. Your teammates can support you and your opponents can interfere. Cards and skills can be used to influence the battle. If you win, you get the winning effect and may keep the monster as your pet, otherwise, you have to get punished for losing.

After the monster deck is empty, the team with higher points from pets wins! You can also win by killing all your opponents. Don't forget the love stories from the main video game because the heroes won't hesitate to sacrifice their lives to save their lovers!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Guess Chess
description:
Minimalistic 2-player tactical card game with elements of chess figures.

Players take turns in secretly placing 8 figure cards on a 4x4 board.

The last placed card is instantly revealed and begins a chain of attack = reveal an opponent's card in its reach, determined by the chess figure on it. Revealed figure's owner has to continue in the same fashion. The first player who cannot continue, loses.

In 3 and 4 player version, the board size is bigger and the game has a single loser - the one who cannot continue the chain of attack.
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Viktory: Bazaar
description:
You are an Arab merchant in the Middle Ages buying rolls of silk cloth in order to complete traditional projects. Completed project cards provide VIKTORY points, and the player with the most points wins the game!

The game takes a maximum of 20 minutes to play and ends after 20 rounds. There are no turns. Everyone plays simultaneously. New rounds are beeped by a timer and players draw up to three new cards and attempt to complete projects. For newer players or larger groups, rounds should be set to 1 minute. With experienced or fewer players, rounds should be set for less time, for example, 35 seconds.

Project cards requiring more resources and rarer resources are harder to complete, but provide significantly more VIKTORY points. Once each round, a player may discard his current project card and draw a new one.

If a player has the right combination of resource cards to complete a project card, he would:
1. Collect the needed resource cards and the project card
2. Turn them facedown in a completed project stack off to the side for end game scoring
3. Draw another project card from the shared deck of project cards

There are no trade restrictions. Players can trade any combination of resource, debt, or project cards as part of a trade.
mechanics: Action Timer, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Hand Management, Income, Loans, Negotiation, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Kitty Cat Clash! Card Battle Game
description:
Kitty Cat CLASH!™ Card Battle Game is a free-for-all card battle game for two to six players. Be the last cat standing and you win! Play as one of seven different cats each with their own unique deck and claim victory by knocking out every other player in this free-for-all clash. Each cat’s traits, skills, and quirks are represented by their deck of cards.

Game includes 7 thirty card decks, 7 stamina trackers, 7 character tokens, 6 reference cards, 23 swipe tokens, and rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Relick TCG: Retro begining
description: expansion pack of the relick card game, in which you will find 20 new cards to expand the game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tech Grid Poker
description:
Tech Grid Poker adds a new dimension to traditional poker! Classical Texas Hold'em poker uses a single row of communal cards. Grid poker uses a 3x3 array of cards from which players make two poker hands simultaneously. Players form one poker hand using the communal cards in the rows of the grid and another poker hand using the communal cards in the columns. Additionally, each card has unique game effects which players can use to influence the outcome.

At the start of the game, a 3x3 grid of communal cards is dealt. This is called "the market". Each player is dealt 7 cards and selects 2 of them to form a company. Each turn players can use the game effect on one card in their company and one from the cards in their hands. Then, in the grid poker phase, players use their company and hand cards to simultaneously form two poker hands. One of the poker hands must use their company cards and another must use cards from their hand. One of the poker hands must use the row cards and the other the column cards in the market. The best poker hand among the rows is determined and scores the row winner point(s). Then, the best poker hand among the column hands is determined and scores the column winner point(s). Companies can be improved each round using hand cards. The game ends after four rounds.

Grid Poker uses the Tech Deck which is a game system. Each Tech Deck card has game effects, a value and domain (suit). The Tech Deck is designed to serve as the basis for many other games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: The Apocalypsis Collection: Arcana Edition
description:
The Apocalypsis Collection is the big box edition of three gorgeously remastered games (Nova Lux, Impendium, and Aedifex) composing an epic space opera beginning with the end of the universe. The Arcana edition of the Apocalypsis collection introduces a new Big Box table presence with beautifully remastered art, miniatures, components, and gameplay.

In Nova Lux, you will take charge of orphaned alien species that have escaped dying star systems in the wake of a galactic apocalypse. As entropy has increased to maximum, you will navigate the collapsing universe while collecting necessary resources to sustain biological life all while attempting to build an enclosed biosphere colony surrounding one of the last remaining stars. Once you do, you will need to satisfy the diverse requirements of your tenuous new galactic federation to ensure unity and hope for a new future. Manage resources, navigate the collapsing universe, build your biosphere engine, and race to establish your colony and satisfy your factions.

In Impendium, you will pick up immediately after the events of Nova Lux. As one of the leading factions of the newly founded Galactic Federation, you will set out to rebuild the universe and spread your power in the new galactic order. But be ware as you do, breaking the natural law of entropy, the mysterious void will take notice and seek to destroy everything that you have created. Recruit new factions to your cause and manage their loyalty, build new stars and colonies, manage resources, battle the void, and establish your power through diplomacy and war.

Finally in Aedifex you will see the universe from the void's perspective. Take on the role of an Architect of the Void. You will feed the machine that holds the fabric of existence together by cultivating the multiverse for it to consume. Meanwhile you will position yourself for dominance of the machine and ultimately dominion over existence itself. Aedifex is a deck-building game with unique player interactions, challenging decisions, and a perpetually evolving scoring mechanism.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Illa
description:
In Quechuan, Illa means the light, the origin, the beginning of.

Illa is a cooperative game. On your turn, you play a card on a path build in the beginning of the game and then continue the story previously told by others players. The game ends when the last space on the path is filled with a card. The number of round is decided by the players in the beginning of the game (Usually around 12 rounds). After each cards, other players vote from 0 to 5 regarding your story. At the and of the game, the score of the team is the total of all the votes.

The only limit is your imagination.

You can play Illa with your children building a fairy tale with them, or as part of a group of friends, workers to learn to work together. The game is based on communication.

Every tales will be very differents from each others, using cards based on 4 elements representing archetypes. 144 unique cards by (36 by elements) + 30 others unique cards for the path are part of the games, giving a huge replaybility.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Voting

name: Guardians of Fire: City of the Damned
description:
Having vanquished foes abroad, Parsa returned to his home city of Shiraz only to find it in the clutches of terror. Once vibrant and lively streets became dark and deserted, people shut in their homes, trembling in fear. Many houses stand empty; their denizens vanished into the night under the full moon. Parsa's duty as the city watch commander is to uncover the source of this dread and face it, accompanied only by his closest retinue and whatever allies they may find in this cursed city.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: 俠客集 (Wuxia Collection)
description:
Wuxia Collection is a simple card board game. In the game, three actions of "draw card", "pick card" and "grab card" will be used to change your hand combination and try to make your hand combination higher Score, the player with the highest score after settlement wins. In order to enhance the player's sense of substitution, a unique background text is written on each card, bringing the martial arts spirit of the novel directly into the game. Not only that, but also invited the Artist Reddo, who specializes in martial arts field drawing, to draw the illustrations. The ink-and-wash style illustrations are believed to make the players more visually satisfied.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Battle Blocks: Sengoku
description:
Play out fast and simple battles during the Sengoku period in Japan! Streamlined and simple rules allow for games to be played in 20-30 minutes. Using home made blocks, and simple terrain (or no terrain at all!) as well as the included unit counters allows players to quickly construct an attractive looking game which can be taken almost anywhere.

Each turn the players roll a die to determine initiative for the round. Play then proceeds into the command phase where players spend action points on moving their blocks around on the board. The game ends when one player defeats the other by destroying 4 of their opponent's blocks.

Players can use 3D terrain, hand drawn maps, or just a kitchen table to play on. The goal of the design is so make wargaming as easy and simple as possible to get into. The use of coloured blocks and action dice also means the transition to wargaming is made easier for those who currently only play traditional board and counter games.

Movement is regulated in inches using tape measures or home made measuring sticks and the rules of the game fit onto a single side of A4.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units

name: BattleTech: Grasslands/Desert BFM Battlemat
description:
A mega-sized 72” x 48", two-sided neoprene map:

Side A desert map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Deserts

"Badlands #2"
"Washout #1"
"Washout #2"
"Mines #2"
"AeroBase #1"
"AeroBase #2"
"Desert Runway"
"Oasis"


Side B grasslands map containing 8 of the 12 maps from Map Pack: Grasslands

"River CommCenter"
"Streams"
"Lakes"
"Open Terrain #2"
"Open Terrain #3"
"Rolling Hills #1"
"Rolling Hills #3"
"Rolling Hills #4"
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Pesta: Omens of Emptiness
description:
No one knows when or whence it came. Or what the first symptoms were. Some say that it is an ancient curse laid upon the land. That it goes back to the earliest settlements. That you can still hear it in the screams of every newborn babe.

In Pesta players take on the roles of the last remaining residents in a village plagued by evil omens portending a terrible disease. They must dispel the omens to prevent the disease from reaching the well that sustains the village. Each turn the disease infects a new space, and if players are not careful to keep down the mounting piles of corpses, it spreads even faster. To make matters worse, villagers quickly lose hope against the impossible odds, turning once capable hands into little more than shivering appendages.

Players take turns inflicting random doom upon the village and trying to counter it by claiming and activating villagers. Activated villagers can move a variable number of spaces and perform any number of tasks in them as long as they can pay the cost. If a villager ever finds themselves on an infected space, they immediately become hopeless and lose access to their special ability. They also become susceptible to succumbing to their inevitable fate, ending up as just another corpse on the street.

The only source of light in this very long and narrow tunnel is the omen cards that players can claim as prizes after dispelling them. The cards can be used to take additional actions or decide the fate of the hopeless. Will they return hopeful from the abyss, sacrifice themselves on the pyre, or venture into the wilderness and leave the damned village behind?

Pesta is the third and final installment in the Trilogy of Lost Hope. The two previous installments are Tower of Silence and Iron Mountain.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Map Deformation, Move Through Deck, Variable Player Powers

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Italy: Soft Underbelly
description:
WIth the Axis Powers ejected from North Africa, the Western Allies look to take the fight to the “soft underbelly” of Europe – Italy. This campaign supplement for Bolt Action focuses on Operation Husky, the airborne and naval invasion of Sicily, the hard-fought battles in the villages and rugged mountain passes of that island, and the advance up the Italian Peninsula towards Rome. With a host of scenarios, new units, special rules & theatre selectors, this new book contains everything players will need to refight these important battles in defence of the Regno d’Italia or to strike at the weak link of Axis Europe to knock Italy out of the war.

With units, theatre selectors and scenarios for players of British (Commonwealth), United States, German and, of course, Italian Armies, this is an essential and fascinating campaign volume. For a little more detail of what you’ll find within, look no further than our preview article.

Within the pages of Italy: Soft Underbelly you’ll find rules for fielding Francisci (along with a handful of other notable heroes on both sides from the Italian campaigns) as a Veteran Major, where he can bring his ‘Gallant Leadership’ ability to bear on the tabletop.

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Tabriz: The Card Game
description:
You are a skilled carpet weaver in the bustling Persian market city of Tabriz and your goal is to become the best known master of your craft. You accomplish this through savvy acquisitions from the market row and tactical completion of commoner, merchant, and royal commissions.

The heart of the Tabriz card game is the commission grid, an irregularly shaped series of resource requirement cards that form commissions in columns and rows. Complete a commission by dedicating the necessary resources for an entire column or row, removing those requirements from the grid and changing all connections commissions at the same time.

Commissions are defined by their length:


3 cards is a common commission
4 cards is a merchant commission
5 cards is a royal commission


Complete commissions with more cards for better rewards, including more coins and higher prestige. Merchant and royal commissions also earn you permanent abilities that contribute to your game engine.

On your turn, you take two actions. Actions include buying a Material card from the market row, trading a Material card you have for one in the market row, purging the market row, or taking 5 coins from the supply. At the end of each turn, if you have the necessary materials, you may complete 1 commission on the grid. You claim these Commission cards, changing the grid for future turns.

Earn the most prestige by the time the Commission deck runs out and you become the master weaver of Tabriz!
mechanics: Connections, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Autismo Autism Challenge
description:
A board game that looks at emotions, life skills and moral dilemmas in a fun way.

Each player chooses a character and then they each take turns going around the board and answering either questions on certain cards or collecting baggage and skills cards each relating to emotions, life skills, social rules and moral dilemmas. A player can win the game if they have the most skills cards and the least baggage cards in a certain timespan.
mechanics: Advantage Token, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Role Playing, Track Movement

name: Fore's Wild
description:
Golfers pair strategy and luck to go for the course record! Rolling through beautiful courses, players must decide whether to lay up and play it safe or roll the dice and attack a tight pin location.

The odds may be on your side, but will the dice be?

Fore's Wild is the most realistic golf tabletop game on the market, leaving you either ecstatic or infuriated.

Play a fast 18 holes solo or create a winner-take-all group tournament, it's all up to you! Take aim, roll your shot... FORE!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Word Turners
description:
Word Turners is a fun alphabet playing card game for 2-6 players, with the simple aim 'who can make the longest word?'It is a game for the whole family and has no time consuming set up, just shuffle and play. There are 60 cards in pack 1 instruction card, 2x 26 alphabet cards and introducing the choice card for which there are 7!

Simply shuffle the cards and deal 7 cards per player, then everyone looks at their cards and decides how many if any to swap, you only get one chance to swap so choose wisely! The choice cards can be any letter you choose! Then when everyone is ready they turn their cards to reveal their word. If there is a draw symbols on cards come in play.

The player with the longest word wins the hand. In the event of a tie, the person with the highest scoring word wins.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling

name: Spy Shuffle
description:
Spy Shuffle is an exciting spy themes card game where opponents battle to become the Top Spy. Played by 2-5 players from age 7+, it has a play time of 15-30 minutes.

The game is played by rolling a die and picking up cards according to the number that was rolled. Players starts with two cards. The first player rolls the die and picks up the number of cards that corresponds to the number rolled on the die, If an "ACTION" card is picked up, the player announces to the other players that they have an "ACTION" and proceed to follow the instructions listed on the Action card, after the player performs all actions on the card, then it becomes the next player's turn.

The game is won by collecting 5 special spy cards, but there are bumps and blockages along the way via Action cards that dictate your actions and what cards you keep or let go of. Wild cards are also in the mix that causes you to exchange half your hand with another player and Snitch cards that you can use to affect your opponents win…….becoming Top Spy is the aim but only if you can play your cards right.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Smarter than a Monkey
description:
A quiz game for the whole family where the question goes to the one who bets the highest! All questions are written in a manner where you have 4 alternatives that are true or false. A Monkey would on average get 2 right. So you need to have 3 out of 4 to be Smarter than a Monkey.

The questions are revealed in parts and you bet bananas to gain the right to answer the question. If your answer is correct you win the bananas. Most bananas in the end wins! The base game can be expanded with question expansions. Along with this first version, one expansion will be made available: Smarter than a Monkey - The Solar System.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Events, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck

name: Insight: The Elements
description:
In Insight: The Elements, players identify a matching chemical element between two cards. The periodic table is divided into four blocks (s,p,d,f), each with its own set of cards.

In competitive mode, players aim to find as many matches as they can, as fast as possible. The fastest and most accurate player wins. In cooperative mode, players work together to either play all of their cards (laid-back version) or to discard the fewest total cards (strategic version).

The cards are double-sided, allowing for varied difficulty. One side of each card contains a list of element symbols and their names. The flip side shows a graphic of a block of the periodic table, with valid elements highlighted.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Speed Matching

name: Max Panic!
description:
An infectious card game where players fight for a cure and outlast the other players!

Game setup takes roughly 2 minutes. A game of max panic after understanding the simple mechanics takes between 20-30 minutes.

Each player must use the cards in the deck to their advantage. There are 3 card times players must use. Advantage, Protective Gear, and Exposure cards.

Each player has a maximum hand size of 3 cards and will draw one card, play one card each turn. Expose other players to the virus, or give yourself an advantage!

The game is won by having all 3 cure cards or infecting your opponents to 10 Infection Counters.
mechanics: Action/Event, Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Smarter than a Monkey: Solar System
description: An expansion dec for the quiz game Smarter than a Monkey. It can be used to replace the questions for any one of the 8 categories in the game. this deck contains questions about the solar system.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Clash of Spears: Rise of Eagles – lists for Rome and its enemies from Marius to Trajan (100BC-100AD)
description:
Rise of Eagles is an expansion to Clash of Spears

This book expands the forces available in the core book adding 13 new lists.

The lists include the Late Republican Army ( post Marian Reform ), the Early Imperial Army and enemies that fought against these armies such as Thracians, Germans, Britons, Dacians, Parthians, Spartacus Slave revolt, etc.
We have also included the eastern enemies that Rome fought during the times of the Republic such as the armies of the successors of Alexander the Great or the Pontic kingdom.

All in all this is a great complement to your core book multiplying the lists and periods in which you can set up your games.

–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mythical Beings
description:
A 2-player versus card game. Each player creates a team of 3 creatures, which will draw on allies and spells available in the market to deal damage to their opponents.
The game ends when one of the two players exhausts their initial 20 life points.
The strategy of combining the creatures, each with their own abilities, and the acquisition and play of the cards is decisive in winning a game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Market, Open Drafting

name: Football Story Combos
description:
