Football combo story is a football-themed game that can be played alone or with two players in confrontation.

A match takes place over 2 halves during which you will have to resolve 8 phases of the game: 4 offensives and 4 defenses.
It's up to you to manage your workforce well to meet the objectives to defend or score goals.
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion III – New Armies
description:
With this expansion players will replace the wooden playing pieces in the three games by wooden blocks that will provide a huge amount of fog of war to the game. Fully coloured stickers of Ships and Legions are put on top of the blocks. On the back there will be stickers of their strength. Information of strength will only be revealed at the moment of combat.
This expansion give the military aspect of the game a complete new approach. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ToT Dice
description:
It's Halloween, and it's time to go trick-or-treating!

The aim of the game is to get as much candy as you can, while running away from grumpy neighbors. The game consists of 13 dice — 12 white (treat) dice and 1 orange (trick) die. There are 6 different kinds of candy to collect that fall into 3 types; chocolate, lollipop or gummy.

A player's turn involves repeating two phases — rolling and collecting — until all the dice are set aside. When the dice are rolled, you must first set aside all Grumps. You can then choose any number of Runs to set aside, keeping in mind if there are more Grumps than Runs at the end of your turn, you get 0 points. You then choose any amount of one kind of candy to collect, each worth one point. On the orange die, a Double Trouble must be set aside and requires two Runs to escape. Tricks are worth nothing and can be re-rolled. If you roll a Mystery Candy, you choose at the end of your turn which candy it represents, as different combinations of collected candy get you bonus points!

The first person to get 23 points triggers the end of the game, and the person with the most points at the end of that round wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Ski Jumping
description:
In this game emotions, tension, but also joy and well-being await you, just as you like it during real races. In the game you will start training the physical and mental qualities of your jumper. You will manage its energy, which will be important in racing. Of course, you will jump from a ski jumping hill with a realistic-looking jumper figure.
As in real jumps, you will solve not only the length of the jump, but also the style and point evaluation of the judges. Your jumps will also be affected by the wind and also the equipment in which you will jump.
The aim of the game is to place as best as possible in the individual races of the cup tour and become its overall winner.

At the beginning, each player slides the jumper's figure from the hill, and based on the distance determined by the rollers, we determine the order in which the player's cards are selected. Each of them have certain predispositions such as psyche, speed, technique, etc. Once we have chosen the player's card, we go to choose the flag of which nationality you want to represent. There is also a card draw on which hill we will jump. They are shuffled, then turn. So let's say it's going to be Japan, for example. This card is placed on the 3D hill and indicates to us what nation we jump in. Based on that, the home jumpers will benefit from a better meters rating simulating crowd support. And then the size of the hill is randomly selected by turning over the top card of the bridge and finding out that we are racing on the K90 hill, for example. Then we can go into the training of our ski jumper (players cards). Based on the different predispositions of individual jumpers, we can improve individual training skills, which happens in specialized rooms in gyms on the board and therefore we can choose which ability we want to improve. They are on special cards. This gains points on the player's card, but we lose time and energy while we train. And as we lose time, we gradually get closer to the day of the race, and as soon as we get to the seventh day, we can go jump from the hill. Before the race starts and we go jumping, we calculate the points we have gathered in training and then we will find it on the spinner table. According to the hill on which the race is held. And if we had the same nationality as the flag on the hill, we would get more bonus meters. Which is like fans support us. So, after entering the values, you can jump. Jumping is made by putting your plastic figure down from the hill. At the edge of the hill there are two rollers which are triggered by the plastic figure and there have plus and minus symbol and numbers. These rollers simulate so-called random weather factor such as the Wind, or the current mental state of the jumper, etc. If we jumped +1 point. We will write down all those things in a notebook and in the final evaluation of the jump, in addition to the points gained in training, the place where the jumper finished will also be recorded. We have different point areas. The possibility of falling is incorporated into the game. If the jumper does not reach the point area or fall, he will not get any points. But he also has another way to get points for style as in real, and these are the cards that represent the points we know from ski jumping. The points work by dealing 5 cards to the player, he does not look at them. Another five cards are dealt in front of him, and after turning the hourglass, which has a limit of 30 seconds, the player tries to find the best possible numbers in order to get the best points for style. After matching the cards, the highest and the lowest value is deleted, as it works in real races. The remaining three values ​​on the cards are summed up and written down in a notebook. All entered values ​​are then summed up on a special designed notebook so you don't have to remember all you data and the winner gets one of the trophies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Matching, Race, Real-Time, Variable Player Powers

name: Master Minds: A Game of Deduction
description:
MasterMinds is a GAME OF DEDUCTION where in order to determine who the MasterMind is, what they're like and where they are, you need to make your way around the board and ask the right questions of the other players using your deductive reasoning skills and the process of elimination, trying to be the first to solve the mystery of who and where the MasterMind is and climb their steps to knock on their door.

In a standard game, each player holds three cards, Description, Character and Place. The remaining 3 cards for the round are the MasterMind's cards. With the occasional advantage or disadvantage of Bonuses and Penalties players make their way around the board Asking Questions and Taking Notes using their Solver Pad until they're ready to Climb The Steps to Make Their Guess and find out if they're at the MasterMinds Door!

Is the MasterMind a Lonely Zombie In Your Closet, a Kind Grandma At The Grocery Store, a Frustrated Time Traveler In The Woods???...It could be anyone, anywhere, IT'S TIME TO PLAY AND FIGURE IT OUT!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Momentum: A Strategic Dice Game
description:
You'll need to roll the dice for sets and runs for the chance to move your pawns and go for the win...will you take chances, will you play it safe, do you feel like you can get some momentum and go for that big streak!?!? No score pad, no pencils! Have a strategy, weigh the risks and hope for a little luck!!

Momentum is the STRATEGIC DICE GAME where you choose your roll type, FOCUS (best of three rolls) or MOMENTUM (unlimited amount of single rolls until you can't move) and try to be the first to move your four pawns to the center using SETS and RUNS of the dice to advance your PAWNS. The first with their four in the center wins!

Time to warm up those dice and and see if you can get some MOMENTUM!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cinematic
description:
Cinematics is a card game in which players, in the role of director, make various films and participate in international film festivals and win various awards.
Players can use famous superstars to improve the quality of their movies, edit their movies or promote them in various media.

In Cinematic, players must purchase the plan (shot) cards through the special rules of the game to make a movie and then, they must put together genres or matching Kelakets based on the rules, so they can finally create a sequence.
No dice are used in this game and the winner of the game is the one who gets the most points based on the opinions of the jury mentioned in the festival card.
In addition to the main prize of the festival, other players can also win prizes in categories such as “best actor”, “best director”, etc.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Market, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Rapture: New World Order Starter Box
description:
That individuals with special abilities exist was discovered by Adam Weishaupt early on. He recognized the potential of his discovery and began to systematically track down the victims of witch hunts and provide them with a safe place to go into hiding. A secret society soon evolved from this undertaking, which Weishaupt called the "illuminati" and used to manipulate the balance of power in Europe to his advantage.
When the Templars became aware of him, however, he saw himself forced to find a new place of refuge in North America, which was still shaken by the Civil War. Due to the change in government and the general unrest, it was much easier for Weishaupt to set up the secret society there that covertly intervenes in world affairs. Through the foundation of the "Council of 13", the New World Order was born.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Line of Sight, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Ferner Osten DDR Würfelrallye
description:
Players are divided into 2 groups, and each group should have an equal number of members with GDR knowledge. Each group starts with a "Trabbi" for a race, where by answering questions about the GDR, lucky coincidences, successful acting, etc. the journey can be accelerated. The winner is the group whose Trabbi reaches the finish line first.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Magiska monsterjakten
description:
You and your friends must free your pets from the monsters!
Monsters have robbed your pets of your city. The adults have not been able to stop them, but now you and your friends have decided that it must be enough! You have figured out a way to disguise yourself as a monster and go into their villages to save your pets. You have to dress in the right color combinations - then the magic locks open!

The one who saves the most pets wins the game round and becomes the biggest hero in your city!

You start the game with 1-3 masking parts and changes / develops during the game by acquiring different parts: head, wings, tail, feet and so on. During the game, you may want to change the color combination on your masking parts depending on what colors the different magic locks to the villages have. Masking parts are placed in special squares on the board where you have to go to collect them.

If you have enough masking parts in the right color combination, you can open the lock to a village. For example, if one lock to a village have two red and one yellow square, you can get into that village if you have at least two red mask parts and at least one yellow masking member. You must hit the dice high enough to reach up to the red dice mark. You stay always on the red dice whether you have more steps left, then roll the dice again and move corresponding step into the village or castle. Each box has a number with plus or minus: add up all the numbers from the boxes you pass and land on - the sum is the number of animal tokens you can pick up.

Then to get into the castle, where you have a chance
To free most animals, you must have five masking parts with at least one part in each color (yellow, green & red) to get inside. This is the hardest to do, but you can also save the most pets here.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Castle of Mind for Kids
description:
Castle of Mind for Kids is the little sister of the Castle of Mind board game, designed to be played with kids from preschool and challenge even older ones. It's an exciting two-person strategy board game in which players are the first to try to get their lion to the cliff in the middle of the board by controlling various animal discs. Its rules are easy to learn, the gameplay is fast, the playing time is approx. 5-15 minutes. Perfect for an introductory strategy board game.

The game board indicates where in the starting position the two players can place the discs for each animal. Once each animal disk is in place, the starting player moves one of their animal disks to a neighboring space. Players cannot move diagonally with their animal discs. Any animal can enter any field, but only a lion can enter the middle red field. Players take turns moving their discs, and if the animal moves to a square of the same color (corresponding to its habitat), it can chase an opponent's animal that is on a square of the same color.

There are several ways to win: players get their lion to the cliff, or chase the opponent’s lion. Or, if our opponent can’t take a valid move, we win.

Players need to be very forward-thinking and attentive, keeping an eye on the entire board to protect our animals while moving with them and our lion. It is an enjoyable logic-strategy board game that can be taken out again and again, which perfectly develops logical thinking, the ability to plan ahead, the ability to combine, the concentration of attention and social skills.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement

name: Men
description:
Men (Egyptian: Mn) is a 5,000 year old game from ancient Egypt. It is roughly contemporaneous with Mehen and Senet. One of the most mysterious of ancient games, only two partial boards have been discovered by archaeologists, along with a detailed tomb painting depicting the board layout and playing pieces, and one sculpture depicting players playing it aboard a ship. Game scholar and designer Zach Horton recreated a speculative version of the game and it was released in two versions by Pandora Games: as a deluxe boxed Kickstarter set with Mehen and later as a standalone game. This modern reconstruction closely follows the ancient evidence and produces a unique game with a trading theme wherein players send ships out on trading missions and wager on when they will return, while manipulating them en route in an attempt to fulfill their own predictions and foils their opponents'.

The game utilizes a unique three-dimensional board, enabling playing pieces to be placed both flat on spaces and upright in grooves. This aspect has been re-created in the modern version utilizing a handmade wooden board.

On their turn, each player chooses on their turn from a number of different options, from gaining sticks to throw to obtaining movement banks that can be accumulated for later sprints, to sending a new ship off on its journey. No player “owns” any of the ships. Any player may move any combination of ships however they wish. Victory points are obtained by performing certain actions (setting sail, picking up goods, bringing goods home), as well as by correctly predicting how long a given ship will be at sea. Every time a ship sets sail, all players mark their prediction on a simple, but hidden, ledger. When a ship returns, predictions are checked against the actual results. Meanwhile, all players manipulate conditions on the board to try to make their own predictions come true!

Any number of ships can be sailed in a game, but only 5 can be on the board at any given time. Only 5 cargoes can be picked up and returned to port during the game. Once all have been picked up,
ships can continue to sail, but do not pick up any cargo on the Foreign Port space (though they must still pause there).
Once all 5 cargoes have been returned to Port, the game ends. After scoring that ship, the player with the most Victory Points wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Trading

name: Safety Ranger Game
description:
Safety Ranger Game is designed to allow children 9 – 12 years old to learn about unsafe situations and the behavior of suspicious persons who are dangerous in daily life through the Monster. Children will take the role of a Safety Ranger (a hero who can use child power, knowledge, wisdom and courage) With assistant from people around them to defeat these Monster.

The game is creatively designed with a way of playing that encourages children to think, plan and not focus on competition each other. But children need 100% cooperative to defeat the Monster. It encourages children to use what they have to create unity in cooperation and see opportunities is the people around them and turn that people into great helpers in daily life.

Players pick a card and get the resource shown on the card, planning action behind the scenes, 3...2....1. Players open the player scenes at the same time, see the result, defeat the monster or the monster still rampant in the next round..

The players will play for 5 Rounds to challenge their teamwork to gain victory points after defeating the monster for each round and accumulate the highest score in order to write the names in the Hall of Fame.

Game Developed by Facebook Page “Learning From Board Game” (Board game designers for learning in Thailand) Partner with Awakening Creative and funded in research and design by Partage through CPCR (The Center for the Protection of Children’s Foundation) in Thailand. Thai Edition for Universal Children’s Day.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: The Center for the Protection of Children's Rights Foundation

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: March of the Legion Booster Pack
description:
The fourth normal World of Warcraft TCG set, named March of the Legion.

From his seat upon the Throne of Kil'jaeden, Doom Lord Kazzak raises his sword and calls the fel host to battle. Infernals march from the Deathforge of Shadowmoon Valley to bolster demonic armies across the shattered realm of Outland and to crush all those who stand in their way. The Burning Crusade is upon us. The March of the Legion has begun. Heed the call!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gump: Pes, který naučil lidi žít
description:
The family game Gump will tickle your cerebral threads and you will experience unforgettable adventures. During the game you are trying to make the dog Gump and and his human friend Bedřich meet again on the same tile before you run out of playing cards. The game contains a large number of traps to stop you.

Players win if the two are reunited.


Rodinná hra Gump pěkně potrápí vaše mozkové závity a zažijete nezapomenutelná dobrodružství. Při hře se snažíte, aby se psí kamarádi Gump a Bedřich opět setkali. Hra obsahuje velké množství nástrah a úskalí, která budete muset překonat a bude jistě bavit celou rodinu.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites
description:
Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites is an apocalyptic survival board game, with an engaging balance between luck and strategy. All players start off as Human and explore the board to be the first to survive 12 months of the Apocalypse. However, the Zombie City and Vampire Graveyard is out there and players who discover these locations become those fearsome horrors. And if that’s not enough to make you fret, then have fun dodging the pesky meteorites that continually change the course of the game!

At the start of a player’s turn, they roll the 6-sided Movement Dice and move that many spaces. If they land on an unexplored space, they pull at random a location and build the map. Locations can consist of Elements, Villages, Mountains, Zombie City, or Vampire Graveyard. Then, for a Human player, they decide how to use any collected Elements to work toward Survival Points or decide to attack another player before ending their turn. On a Zombie’s turn, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 less than the number rolled, but can control up to 6 Zombies in a single turn. Their turn ends when all movements and attacks are used. For the Vampire, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 more than the number rolled, and decide whether to Suck Blood for Energy or Attack a player using Energy to obtain a Coffin. Their turn ends when all movements or attacks are used.

In the scenario a player rolls a SURVIVE! on the Movement Dice, they immediately roll the two Coordinate dice to determine where a Meteorite or Supply Crate lands on the board before concluding that player’s turn automatically.

The Game ends when a Player achieves the requirements to survive the apocalypse. For the Human, it’s collecting 12 months of Supplies (a combination of Elements, Supply Crates, and Defenses). For the Zombie, it’s Replicating in each Human Village and returning all 6 Zombies to the City. And the Vampire must obtain Blood Drops and all 5 Human Coffins before concluding their turn in the Graveyard.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters
description:
Ancient Blood - The Order of Vampire Hunters is a cooperative story-driven game for 1 to 4 players that can be played as solo mode, as standalone games, or as a campaign. Choose a story and begin your journey. Be brave and wise, as every choice you make along your path will impact the game world. The wrong choice could awaken your most hidden fears. Fight side by side with your fellow hunters like never before using combo attacks, get help from locals using your skills, and find all the clues that will lead you to the master of each Vampires' clan, The Elder Lord.

Ancient Blood is a prequel to The Order of Vampire Hunters. It features some game mechanics inspired by the old game, but it is a new game. It is not compatible with the previous one, since Ancient Blood is a story-driven game in which your decisions will influence how the game develops and the end of the story. The new game features exploration, crafting, resource management, and leveling up. This time your decisions will change the story of the game, so be prepared to deal with the consequences of your choices.

Can you defeat the Elder Lords?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Mask of Shame
description:
The tower and its monsters stand between your ninja clan's rightful place of rule. You must use every fiber of cunning in this push your luck battle.

Draw seven weapon cards and use them to fight your way to the top. Be careful though, not having the right weapons means a long drop to the foot of the tower.

Weapons are made up of 3 colors (red,blue, and yellow) and 2 types (basic and legendary). The Blue Swords, Red Spears, and Yellow Magic Staffs. The legendary weapons also come with powers.

Each level of the tower has one of 7 different monster types. Discard the matching symbol weapons to advance. Your hand size will continue to shrink as you climb the tower thus making it much harder to have the right weapons.

Other clans are also battling their way to ensure they too are noticed. Play through three rounds of cumulating victory points. The player who is in last in between rounds receives the Mask of Shame - A Legendary Item that makes its holder immune, but at great cost to one's honor.

Will you climb your way into the Halls of Honor or be stained with the Shadows of Shame?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Square play-on
description:
Square Play-on is a name re-defined based on the shape
This is also called Indian LUDO sometimes. It is one of the oldest board games extant. (Don’t know the Origins of the Game) It is played in many homes of India (particularly in the south part of India even today still being popular and known to everyone. There are references to this game in some ancient Indian epics like the Mahabharata.
The most common names are Chauka Bara (Kannada) Ashta Chamma (Telugu) and a list of various names and regions are given below
Chouka Bara , Katte Mane ,Gatta Mane - Kannada - Mysuru region
Chakaara or Chakka - Kannada - North Karnataka
Pakidakali , Kavidi Kali - Malayalam - Kerala region
Ashta Chamma - Telugu - Andhra Pradesh/Telangana
Daayam or Thaayam - Tamil - Tamil Nadu
Atthu, Kanna Kauri ,Chunga ,Cheeta ,Chanda —Hindi -Madhya Pradesh and central India region
Champool/ Kach kangri - Marathi - Maharashtra
Baji ,Chomal Ishto,Kaangi chaala - Gujarati
Changa po - Rajasthan (source: Wikipedia)

This Game is a two- or four-player board game, Usually written by chalk on the floor as and when required. This game is an example of a fully observable positional system of pawns that has an element of chance introduced by the roll of cowry shells and an element of strategy (The strategy being the pawn the player decides to move after the roll ). While traditionally played with 4 or 6 cowry shells, Dice in particular Stick dice can also be used.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Alliances, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ascet
description:
Ascet is a minimalist playing card game with roleplaying overtones that encourages diplomatic, mnemonic and maths skills with the use of simple mechanics that use cards, a d8 and a d10 dice (included in the deck as a card to cut, fold & paste). Inspired in the popular medieval theme of the ascetic monk that withdrew from society in search for enlightenment which has caught the imagination of master painters like Hieronymus Bosch, Salvador Dali, Albrecht Dürer, Max Ernst and Cezanne to name a few. Players will take turns to interpret an anchorite while the rest of the players take the role of demons seeking to lure him with
Gameplay:

Each player will have 4 virtues: Compassion, Humility, Faith and Temperance. The Virtues have numerical values between 1 and 10. Additionally, players have in their hand temptation cards corresponding to the 4 virtues.

Players take turns playing their Ascet while the rest play the demons. Each demon presents a temptation card to the Ascet, and the Ascet chooses one of the presented temptations to overcome. They roll an 8 sided die for minor temptations and a 10 sided die for major temptations. If the result is equal or lower than the corresponding virtue, the Ascet overcomes the temptation and ascends one step in the Stairway to Enlightenment. Otherwise, the demon who proposed the temptation receives an additional card. Afterwards, all demons receive one card, regardless of success or failure.

if the roll was a 9, regardless of success or failure, the Ascet gets a Revalation, which may allow them to increase one of the virtues by 1.

The first player to ascend 5 steps on the Stairway to Enlightenment wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Go Pop!: Hexo
description: On a player's turn, they select a line and press down any number of bubbles on that line. The opponent then presses down any number of un-pressed bubbles in a line of their choice. The player left to press the last bubble on the board loses the round.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Macomb School of Magic
description:
Only you and your friends can save the Macomb Park District from the terrible Afflictions that have befallen the park. As the Afflictions have grown, brave magical houses have emerged to defend our precious parks. Choose your magical house, wield unique spells, visit our parks, Dispel the affliction and join the Macomb School of Magic!

A co-operative board game in which players visit local Macomb park locations, attempt to dispel negative afflictions with wild magic and ultimately collect the gem of each magical house and make a final stand against the affliction.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Exploration, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Pieces as Map

name: Пираты Голицына
description:
This game was invented and drawn back in 1934! Its author is Vladimir Mikhailovich Golitsyn from the famous Golitsyn family. In his youth, he was a sailor and sailed in the northern seas. Later, the sea became the main theme of his work. This version of the game has been significantly improved and made in a new graphic design (by KoTdeSigN).

The game uses both currents and wind force and shallows with rocks. From 2 to 9 people can play at the same time.

The players are divided into 2 teams: the Spaniards, whose task is to transport gold from South America to their homeland. And the pirates, whose task is gold, respectively, to take away.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Movement Template, Race, Square Grid

name: H.D.P.: Lo mejor del A.T.R.
description: Micro expansion with 10 white cards, adapted from the lighter game of the same family, A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: WAU
description:
Adopt puppies and be an ever-loving owner! - it is the slogan of the WAU which draws attention to the importance of adopting shelter animals and of being a responsible, loving owner.

In the game, players adopt puppies from the shelter and then trying to protect them from other players. Puppies need to be loved in their home as it is in real life, therefore, this way you can protect them from any upcoming danger. If you have 5 puppies in your little garden AND you prove that you are a responsible dog owner (aka you belove them with loving cards), you win the game. However, you should be careful and suspicious with the neighbours!

It is a fun, easy-to-learn, confrontative card game with the cutest dogs recommended for families and friends.

—description form the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Hellmouth
description:
A famous writer has gone missing, last seen heading into the hills in search of the fabled Hell Mouth rumored to reside in the dark depths of the local mines. Now the Heroes have been hired to find him and bring him back alive. But the dark tidings foretold in his recent stories have begun to bear an eerie resemblance to reality, building toward something sinister.

This limited edition, deluxe resin terrain piece depicts a massive eruption of stone and a swirling portal of darkness – the Hell Mouth, an all-new piece for Shadows of Brimstone, plus a new Mission - Through the Mouth of Madness - themed for the new piece!

The Hellmouth acts as a gate for enemies or the void by doubleing the encounters, attacs or growing dead on the exploration token and adding enemies to fight.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 4.20 Game
description:
In this cannabis-themed party game for adults, each player has to take a card and pass the indicated test. A test is like a challenge, for example, "guess a movie by doing mimic". If you pass the challenge correctly, you earn victory points.

Game ends when there are no more cards. The player with most victory points wins.

Think green and play responsibly. No plants have been harmed during the creation of this game.

ESTE JUEGO DE MESA NO PRETENDE FOMENTAR EL CONSUMO DE SUSTANCIAS NOCIVAS PARA LA SALUD, SIMPLEMENTE OFRECE UNA ALTERNATIVA DE OCIO CREATIVO PARA CONSUMIDORES HABITUALES.

4.20 Game está pensado para amparar la igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, utilizando un lenguaje inclusivo y visibilizando de manera igualitaria la figura del hombre y de la mujer. Para ello las dos mascotas del juego son: “CLARITA LA SEMILLITA Y ANTOÑÍN EL COGOLLÍN”.

Por otra parte en las pruebas que hay que superar se ha considerado la posible diversidad física que pueda presentar cualquier participante. Se trata de un juego inclusivo en el que cualquier persona con movilidad reducida puede participar.

Para finalizar esta presentación es necesario mencionar que durante la creación de este juego no ha sufrido daño alguno ningún vegetal.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting

name: Elephant in the Room
description:
Elephant in the Room is a fast paced party game for 4 to 8 players.

Each round two players take on the role of speakers and draw a card from the deck. They must have have a conversation about the secret topic on the card while the other players listen in and attempt to guess the key words!

The other players try to guess the topic and if they get it right and they score the card and are the speaker next round! Guess wrong and they have to wait for another player to make a guess before they can try again!

Score enough elephants on your cards to win the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Water of Life Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo card for donatin to Extra Life 2019

Text on the card:

Water of Life
Drink Event
You may pay 2 Gold to the Inn. If you do, gain 2 Fortitude, then each other player pays 1 Gold to the Inn, then each other player gains 1 Fortitude.
A bit of Extra Life for everyone!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlefields
description:
Battlefields is a tactical combat game between two armies of heroes from the Catacombs universe. First, players spend points to draft their army of heroes, then they place their chosen heroes on the hex-based neoprene playmat. Different heroes have different movement rates and attacks. Combat is resolved by either dexterity (dice flicking) or non-dexterity mechanisms.

The game provides a variety of units for both the Heroic and Lich Lord forces and supports two players. It also features a solo mode.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Flicking, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Mushroom Shaman
description:
As civilization raged on, it spewed pollution and litter behind. Species died. Food dwindled. Depression and anxiety rose.

One day, explorers ventured into the last remaining jungle, searching for the mythical Mushroom Shamans. They came eager to find meaning, solutions, and happiness.

You are one of these legendary Mushroom Shamans. Spurred by the enthusiasm of your new followers, you embark on a mission to grow your cult and save the planet.

You will race against your fellow competitors by sending your followers out to forage, grow, and consume mushrooms to heal the earth and fight inner demons.

You must hurry because increasing pollution and destruction will damage your foraging grounds. However, you must be cautious. Inexperienced mushroom consumers may face severe consequences.

Mushroom Shaman is a worker placement and engine building game for 1-6 players where players forage, grow and comsume mushrooms to heal the earth and fight inner demons.

Players allocate followers to complete various tasks to achieve victory points. Tasks consist of foraging and visiting 6 locations on the shared game board: cave, forest, market, plains, river, and village. Additional tasks are located on individual grow chamber boards. Here, followers can grow mushrooms, create medicinal tinctures, and colonize grain.

The goal is to reach 8 victory points, with victory points representing the success of your cult. The game immediately ends when a player reaches 8 victory points. That player wins the game and crowned the greatest Mushroom Shaman.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Exploration, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Cryptopia!: A Blockchain Board Game
description:
Cryptopia is a fast paced blockchain asset building & trading game where players collect development, influence and funding and invest it into their blockchains. Player's will leverage strategy cards that can improve position and attack other player's asset. Cryptopia involves strategy, wits and a bit of luck!


Collect funding, development and influence assets cards inspired by actual events relating to crypto
Use strategy cards to remove, steal or trade other player's assets.
Strategically invest assets cards to improve position
Watch out for attacks from other players


Choose your blockchain and reach market dominance

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Score-and-Reset Game

name: I Quit!
description:
Have fun while you learn about personal finances which you can use in real life in this 1 to 4 player game.

Players race towards financial independence in a shared game world. You will reach this goal by investing in stocks, real estate, businesses and maybe starting your own part-time business.

Each round starts with a global event occur affecting the shared game world, and players draw player event cards which only affects the player who drew it.

When a player has reached an investment income which is at least double their pre-tax expenses the game ends, or at the end of round 20.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dice & Towers
description:
Dice & Towers is a push-your-luck polyhedral dice game for 1-6 players.


Roll the special "Die Die" to determine which dice to stack next (example: rolling a 12 means stack the D12).
Stack dice to build a tower as high as you choose - but don't let it fall!
Roll the dice from your tower to earn points.
Win by earning the most combined points in three turns.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing

name: What's the Story? Story Telling Cards
description:
What’s the Story? invites children to retell and create stories with playful animal characters and adventures. There are endless ways to use these cards. The publishers include many suggestions and you can develop your own.

The game includes many rule variants, with differing win conditions including some requiring a certain number of cards to win.


description from publisher **
mechanics: Set Collection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Sherlock Holmes Le Grand Quiz
description:
A Board game and Quiz game all in one. Each team of players/individuals choosing a playing piece, and rolls a dice to determine direction to move on the board. Then a question is answered from 2 choices depending on what space you land on.
The questions are either about Sherlock Holmes or Arthur Conan Doyle.
Game continues until one team or player collects all clue 6 cards i.e. weapon, footprint, pipe, magnifying glass, hourglass to win.
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Arsene Lupin contre Sherlock Holmes
description:
You have been recruited by Arsène Lupin to participate with your friends in three major burglaries: find the treasure of the abbeys, take possession of the fortune of the kings of France and steal the blue diamond from the crown! But beware! Because, among the burglars, a surprise guest has managed to infiltrate: Sherlock Holmes, master of disguise, has integrated the band around the nose and beard of the great Arsène Lupin.

In addition to solving the enigmas which stand on the path of your burglaries, you will also have to identify Holmes, and his friend Watson, before he sabotages your plan. Will you manage to thwart the artifices and pierce the disguises of each other to identify who, among you, embodies Sherlock Holmes, or Watson or even the champion of dissimulation, the great Arsène Lupin in person?

Read the murder mystery, collect the clues, use decoder with cards to determine the crime, and if Arsene got away with it or Sherlock caught him.
Player or team wins when crime is revealed. If neither team guesses correctly play continues until all is revealed and one team claims victory.

—user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Memory, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Describing Movies Badly
description:
Are you naturally bad at describing movies? Don’t know actors names? No problem. Can’t remember the plot. No sweat!

Can you describe a movie badly enough where your team can guess the movie but bad enough where the other team has no clue what you’re talking about?

This is a funny game where you challenge your friends movie nerdiness by reading a bad description of a movie and they have to guess the movie from your bad description.

--For solo play--
Cover the name of the movie.
Guess the movie by the bad description only.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Move Through Deck, Team-Based Game
publishers: Hook Duck Games, Twice Alive Games

name: Der Fluch des Waldes III (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

There was a great uproar in the camp as the village was overrun by the sheriff's guards raided, the forge burned and Father Egbert had been taken prisoner. Robin, John and Will talked about what to do next. But Marian was still deep in thought and firmly convinced of the name to have heard Alatar before. This man had created the curse and this calamity brought about them. Then she saw the smith's wife sitting on the forest floor, crying.
But there were far more important things to think about than the past. Marian was blown away torn. What should she do?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: SPYBAM
description:
In SPYBAM, the different players (CEOs) compete with each other to gain control of the world. You can buy properties or campaigns on each continent and negotiate mergers between players, but ... beware of spies!! Their goals are dark, and they will try to screw you up.
The setup begins by randomly delivering a business card and a different famous character card to each player with their own missions in order to win in SPYBAM. Even so, there are players who will have to go on a different side: the spies. They go together and win together. There will be a spy leader who knows the rest of the spies and the latter do not know the rest of their guild, so the spy leader must try to organize them without being discovered.
At the beginning of each round, an extraordinary event card will be raised that benefits or affects depending on how you have your properties located on the different continents. Be prepared as these events can change your plans.
Then each player's turn begins. Each one has 3 steps to perform:
1) Steal an Advantage or Disadvantage card depending on the die.
2) Draw a Property, Campaign or Fusion / Absorption card, choosing whether to activate it (paying its price) or save it in your deck of cards.
3) Negotiate one of the following 5 options: activate a card from your deck, auction a card from your deck, forcibly buy an active property (from another player) paying double its price, move your headquarters or buy an advantage card to the bank.
At the end of the turn of all the players, each one must invest in security the amount he considers, putting the money he considers in the security envelope. After this, all the players close their eyes and it is the spies' turn: one by one they will attack whoever they consider, leaving a token in front of the player. At the end of this dynamic, each player will look at the number of spy tokens received. If the number of millions invested is less than or equal to the spy tokens received, he will lose an active property. After this, each player receives the income from his properties and other cards before starting the next event or round.
The objective of each player is to complete the missions assigned to their character as soon as possible. But if you are a spy, your goal is to fulfil the common spy missions, leaving aside those of your character. Spies win as a group.
At any time during the game, a player can accuse another of being a spy, if he succeeds, he eliminates the spy from the game, but if he fails, he must compensate that player with a payment of money. Although if the accusation is carried out with an "absorption" card in its possession, if the accusation is correct, it takes all the spy's (Active) cards to its inventory (Not activated) in addition to eliminating it, and if it fails there is no penalty.

—description from the designer

En SPYBAM, los distintos jugadores (CEOs) compiten entre ellos por alzarse con el control del mundo. Podrás comprar propiedades o campañas en cada continente y negociar fusiones entre jugadores, pero… ¡¡cuidado con los espías!! Sus objetivos son oscuros y trataran de fastidiarte.
El setup comienza entregando aleatoriamente una carta negocio y una carta personaje famoso distinto a cada jugador con unas misiones propias para poder ganar en SPYBAM. Aun así, hay jugadores que les tocará ir en un bando diferente: los espías. Ellos van juntos y ganan juntos. Habrá un espía líder que conoce al resto de espías y estos últimos no conocen al resto de su gremio, por lo que el espía líder debe tratar de organizarlos sin que le descubran.
Al comienzo de cada ronda se levantará una carta de evento extraordinario que beneficia o afecta según tengas situadas tus propiedades por los diferentes continentes. Prepárate puesto que estos eventos pueden modificar tus planes.
Después comienza el turno de cada jugador. Cada uno tiene 3 pasos a realizar:
1) Robar una tarjeta Ventaja o Desventaja según el dado.
2) Robar una carta de Propiedad, Campaña o Fusión/Absorción, eligiendo si activarla (pagando su precio) o guardarla en tu mazo de cartas.
3) Negociar una de las siguientes 5 opciones: activar una carta de tu mazo, subastar una carta de tu mazo, comprar forzosamente una propiedad activa (de otro jugador) pagando el doble de su precio, mover tu sede o comprar una ventaja a la banca.
Al finalizar el turno de todos los jugadores, cada uno deberá invertir en seguridad la cantidad que estime, metiendo el dinero que considere en el sobre de seguridad. Tras esto todos los jugadores cierran los ojos y es el turno de los espías: uno a uno irán atacando a quien consideren dejando una ficha delante del jugador. Al final de esta dinámica cada jugador mirara el número de fichas espías recibidas. Si el número de millones invertidos es menor o igual a las fichas espías recibidas, perderá una propiedad activa. Tras esto, cada jugador recibe los ingresos de sus propiedades y otras cartas antes de comenzar el siguiente evento o ronda.
El objetivo de cada jugador es cumplir las misiones que tiene asignado su personaje lo antes posible. Pero si te ha tocado ser espía, tu objetivo es cumplir las misiones de espías en común, dejando de lado las de tu personaje. Los espías ganan en grupo.
En cualquier momento de la partida un jugador puede acusar a otro de ser espía, si acierta elimina al espía de la partida, pero si falla deberá indemnizar a ese jugador con un pago de dinero. Aunque si la acusación la realiza teniendo en su poder una carta de “absorción” si acierta la acusación, se lleva todas las cartas (Activas) del espía a su inventario (Sin activar) además de eliminarle, y si falla no hay penalización.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Deduction, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Alliances, Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Closed Economy Auction, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hidden Movement, Hidden Roles, Income, Investment, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trading, Traitor Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Bakemono Mask Promo Card
description:
Bakemono Mask - Forbidden Fortress Artifact - Promo 457

Once per turn, when you kill an Enemy model, gain D6 x $10.
You are immune to the Enemy ability Fear.

This was available from the holiday 2021 sale at the Flying Frog webstore for orders over 100$.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crystallia
description:
Boulogne-Billancourt International Contest Finalist 2022.
Ion Award Finalist 2023



You are among the chosen descendants of one of the world’s ancient civilizations who meet on a remote island once a year to keep the world in balance. In an underground temple, you must use the Board of Opportunity by placing stones with powerful crystals that will determine what the future holds. However, summon too many crystals of one color and bring horrible luck upon your people.

In Crystallia, each descendant duels for the good fortune of their people by drafting stones from a pyramid and strategically placing them on the Board of Opportunity, which they will create from 6 of 16 different pieces at the start of each game. Activate stones by creating lines of crystals of the same color, taking advantage of free crystals on the board and use powerful abilities that change the board-- and the turn order. Patience and self-control are needed as these stones can unlock special powers like the ability to rotate stones, move stones or even earn another turn.

Stones can only be drafted from the pyramid if no other stone is on top of them, so picking the right stones can be challenging. If you create a line of four of the same crystal, you must take another turn. Do this at the right time and you could find yourself collecting the crystals that bring you closer to victory.

With an advanced variant that has unforgiving consequences and rewards perfect timing, Crystallia will have you asking yourself: do you have what it takes to navigate the Board of Opportunity?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Fruit Frenzy
description:
The Game Crafter Semi-Finalist 2020 (ProtoATL Contest)
Ciutat de Granollers Semi-Finalist 2024



In Fruit Frenzy, each player is a caterer from a rival catering business competing for the fruit they need by collecting cards from a shared market. They will layer and reposition the cards they collect to enhance their plate with the best collection of fruit for their customers.

Each turn, you must choose to swap a card from your hand with a card from the Fruit Market or discard a card from your hand to take the top card of the deck. Then, you must play a card so that it covers 1-3 fruit symbols on cards already played. If you play fruit cards with 3 or 4 different types of fruit, you can take your pick of powerful abilities that allow you to break placement rules for one turn, swap with the discard, clear the row or get a bonus for claiming a specialty fruit. Snatch up the special abilities before your rival caterers, using the powers to get the cards you need to make the perfect plate.

Balance your desire to choose from the market with the strategy of keeping valuable fruit from your rival caterers.

Fruit Frenzy is a simple & addictive pattern building game that uses dynamic layering to create a challenging puzzle for any gamer. With very easy to teach rules and satisfying choices, Fruit Frenzy delivers endless entertainment with a sleek table presence. Win this addicting abstract puzzle game by building large sections of fruit because you only score if you don't have the least in each of the six types of fruit.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Layering, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Sythopian Wars
description:
Sythopian Wars is a brand new, science fantasy, tabletop wargame.

Players take control of unique armies made up of terrifying miniatures, each with their own distinct rules defined by their lore in this original setting. This fast-paced, brutal wargame rewards tactical play over dice rolls and your ability to act, and react to your opponent's moves, turning the game into a tactical dance as players shoot simultaneously, dive into cover or charge into the enemy before they can unleash their firepower. Beware however that there are pros and cons to every tactic, as reacting to everything leaves you constantly playing second fiddle to your opponent. With alternating activation, immersive combat and quick to learn basic rules, Sythopian Wars should appeal to both hardened wargamers and newcomers alike. Sythopian Wars, in the beginning, the world ended!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: King's: Cards & Creations
description:
King’s: Cards and Creations is a Tabletop Card Game Engine that uses the customizable Core 135 Creation Card set to make and play different games; each with alternate and/or additional rules - letting players also customize their game play. Players are able, and encouraged, to write and/or draw on their Creation Cards.

The Core release, between website and rule book rules, contains 5 different games; Kingdrin, Minkingi, Fwords, Creca, and Pazuuru.

In Minkingi, 2 (or potentially more) players use Creation Cards to battle on what is known as the Active Field, vying for the most board control by the end of the game. Players take turns placing one of their cards into an open Active Field space, rotated in any direction to fit the orientation of the space, then declaring battles with other spaces. The player who controls the most Active cards at the end of the game, is the winner.

Kingdrin, however, plays completely differently! 2, 3, 4 or even 5 or more players pool their Creation Cards to one pile, then everyone draws 7 cards. Players take turns declaring and playing cards on top of the Ditch, matching different symbols or numbers to the top ditch card, drawing when they can't. Things get intense when players add 'The Kingdrin Speed Rule' card; and turn order is replaced with players playing as fast as they can! The player who runs out of cards first is the winner.

Creca, while similar to Minkingi, is a much deeper dive into player engagement. Deck and drafting construction, Skills and abilities, as well as heavier gearing towards Card Layouts and new Fields. It uses the Active Field as well, but instead players are racing to control the first five Active Cards at the end of a turn. Creca also implements longer player turns, with different steps in each turn, giving players more choices (and hard decisions!) to deduce optimal plays from.

With player made content (on cards or in games), different games running under one engine (and many more in the works!), and expandable content through Card Layouts like Alt Rule Cards, Source Cards, and Token Cards; the potential is actually endless.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deduction, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching

name: Hook-up Break-up
description:
In the game of love, there are many obstacles to overcome—from the influence of other people to infidelity. Do you think you have what it takes to make your relationship successful despite temptation and the negative influence of others? Can you overcome those barriers and live with your partner happily ever after?

Hook-up Break-up is a game that focuses on you, your relationship with your partner, and the people around you who will either positively or negatively affect that partnership.

On their turn, players roll the dice. This will determine whether they move forward, backward, draw a card or take action (influence a relationship, use a wild card to his favor or against others)

The winner is the player who reaches the end of the relationship meter before others. It's where he reached the maturity of his relationship and considered married.
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Darkstar: Tactical Starship Combat in the 26th Century
description: Darkstar is a tactical war game postulating naval combat in a “science faction” universe set five centuries into a troubled and uncertain future. Players take command of warships serving in the new “black water” navies of reborn empires of old, struggling for control of shipping lanes, resources, and colonies. Ships maneuver and fire in fast-paced combat, with survival not only of the players’ fleets at stake, but perhaps their nation and all of humanity as well.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Chibi Army of Doom
description:
Once upon a time there was a country where justice reigned, there was no poverty and power was actually in the hands of a capable person. That land was Syntharia, which was ruled by King Rorik. After he died, the country sank into Chaos and a new king have to be found. So the people started a tournament for the best, strongest and wisest people of Syntharia, this tournament is called Chibi Army of Doom.

Chibi Army of Doom is a game in which you can choose one of ten different characters and then have to eliminate all other players in a battle royale tournament. Each character has its own deck consisting of 30 cards and thus individual skills. Tthere are a variety of skills that can be used on opposing turns to protect yourself or to prevent other players from their actions.

Each player chooses a character. Then all player places up to 5 Obstacles from the box on the Table.

Each player takes in turn and resolves all turn effects, draws cards, and takes actions and calculate damage. Each character has 20 life points and is kicked out of the game when it reaches 0. The winner is the last player standing.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Galaxy Junkers
description:
Galaxy Junkers is a 2 to 5 player sci-fi strategy game. With excellent replay value, this innovative game is fun for the whole family! Add a new swashbuckling spaceship adventure to your board game collection, and begin your quest to see who can survive the dangers of deep space.

You are galaxy junkers searching for valuable space artifacts from the ruins of an ancient space station. Unfortunately, the wormhole portal collapses, and your ship's engines and power core are severely damaged. You are stranded in deep space. You must salvage the ancient space cubes, power crystals, and power core and use them to escape. Beware: other galaxy junkers are right behind.

Objective: To win, collect the space cubes and power core indicated on your Ship Diagnostic card, and be the first player to reach the center of the wormhole. You may also win by destroying all opposing ships.

Play Time: The play time varies depending on the number of players.

3 Players: 30 minutes, 4 Players: 60-90 minutes, 5 Players: 90-120 minutes

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement

name: Fir
description:
The object of Fir is to assemble the most legendary band of loggers in the Pacific Northwest. To win, players must shrewdly manage their timbermen and homesteads to earn the most myth points (mp) over five rounds.

During the game, you task your workers with all manner of awe-inspiring labor, from felling fir trees and driving logs to milling timber and stoking steam donkeys! To succeed, you must put your workers in harm's way. Bumps and bruises will take their toll and send many loggers to an early grave. But do not despair! Injured workers will enter trade buildings where they become foreman, freeing you up to recruit day laborers, flip flapjacks, or moonlight as an impresario.

Players who move timber along the supply chain and compete in logging games will earn valuable resources that will help them improve their homesteads. Will you tend to corn and chickens, build bunks and barns, or furnish the river with bridges and rocker boxes? Your chore list is as tall as the day is long! A trip to the trading post will pay huge dividends, while a visit to vaudeville might strand you on skid row.

So grab your axe and pike, muster your morale and might, then marvel your fellow timbermen with exploits of mythic proportions!
categories: American West, Economic, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Market, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Supply and Demand
description:
In Supply and Demand, you play the leader of a country balancing the needs of production and consumption within your borders.

Unfortunately, the world does not have an unlimited surplus, so you will need to efficiently manage your resources to protect yourself from collapse and chart a new future.

Supply and Demand is designed for exclusively 3 players. Each round, players will receive production capacity through an "I Cut, You Choose" mechanism, and then will take turns selecting actions on an action matrix. Players produce goods and sell them across their territory to their opponents, which effectively functions as an attack.

The game ends when a global supply of points is depleted to the level of a player's supply of points. The game ends, and a winner is determined after repayment of loans.

Supply and Demand is a game of interconnection, and all that entails.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Commodity Speculation, I Cut, You Choose, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men Rise and Fall
description:
The X-Men are no stranger to struggle, but some foes will rock the entire GALAXY!

Based on the critically acclaimed story Rise & Fall of the Shi’ar Empire, this HeroClix release has everything! Vulcan is out for revenge against the X-Men, the Shi’ar, and their allies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tech Exchange
description:
Tech Exchange is a multi-player, real-time trading card game for 2-6 Players. It uses a modern deck of cards called the Tech Deck. Each card in the Tech Deck represents stocks in companies that players trade. As players trade cards and use card abilities, the stock market gains value. Each stock card has card abilities that players can use during two turn-based effects rounds. Players score victory points based on the value of their final hand after all trading is completed. Players are trying to collect sets of triples, quadruples and a flush (cards that share a domain/suit).

REAL TIME TRADING – The players trade cards from their hands between each other in real-time. There are no turns and trading happens simultaneously between players following a few trading rules.

USE CARD EFFECTS – When a stock stack hits a value of three or no one wishes to trade anymore, trading pauses. Then, players take turns using effects on the cards in their hand. Trading continues. After all trading has completed, there is a second use effects round.

STOCK SCORING – After the second use card effects round, players tally up victory points based on the value of card groupings in their hand and the value of the stock market.

WINNER – After three rounds of play, the player with the most points is the winner. If tied, players share the victory.

TECH DECK AS A GAME SYSTEM - The Tech Deck is a modernized deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker, Tech City which are other games that use the Tech Deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Matching, Negotiation, Real-Time, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Golden Annual Number 1: Infantry Attacks – Black Mountain
description:
Infantry Attacks: Black Mountain is based on the 1914 Austro-Hungarian campaign against the tiny but belligerent kingdom of Montenegro. The Austrian mountain brigades had the advantages of numbers and firepower, but fierce Montenegrin resistance kept the kingdom unconquered until January 1916.

Infantry Attacks: Black Mountain includes 88 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, including Austro-Hungarian and Montenegrin troops, leaders and weapons plus the markers needed for play. There’s an 11x17-inch map (on heavy rigid stock just like the other Infantry Attacks or Panzer Grenadier games), and a booklet with ten scenarios and historical background for the campaign.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Jane Austen: Zombie Killer
description:
Regency skirmish gaming amongst the unwashed and the undead.

Jane Austen: Zombie Killer is a tabletop miniature game for one or more players and is based loosely on Seth Grahame-Smith's 'Pride and Prejudice and Zombies'.

Jane Austen: Zombie Killer is a 48-page, A5 softback rulebook which presents a Regency Period England wherein the undead are a constant threat. For 28 mm miniatures and uses D6 dice.

Players control a Hunt - a small band of leaders and commoners who hunt Zombies. They face off against slow moving Droves of Zombies.

Players must destroy zombies before all the members of their hunt are turned.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultra Werewolf 2.0 Playing Cards
description:
A combination of a upgraded Werewolf game and Waterproof and Anti-folding Playing cards.

It's a Werewolf game with more characters in different situations and more varieties and conditions to win.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Dead Man's Curse
description:
In Dead Man's Curse, 2-4 players can battle individually, or as teams, to conquer their opponents. Magic, specialty powers unique to your faction, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks are only a few of the powerful mechanics that augment the classic title into something completely different and exciting; Dead Man's Curse! 30+ unique factions exist in the game so far with more to come!

Players on their turn will roll a D6 to see if they can draw a boost card (attaches to a figure and changes how it moves or plays), Draw an Epic Card (these are powerful game-changing events), or in some cases use their factions ability. Regardless of what they do they move to the Battlefield phase where they draw a card that will allow them to move up to 2 pieces if not more plus they also can make a normal move with any piece. All figures move just like normal chess figures would but that is the only tie to Chess. Don't fear getting your King into the battle as they are your most powerful fighter and can devastate the foe and losing it doesn't lose you the game.

Throw out any pre-conceptions you know about classic Chess, because new moves, accelerated gameplay, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks on each and every combat sets Dead Man's Chess far apart from its predecessor. Strategy is not enough; Luck is not enough… you will need both to win!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Unlimited Brunch
description:
You and your tablemates arrive at brunch and have "two hours" to eat and drink as much as you want. Unfortunately, sh*t happens. You all must work cooperatively to ensure brunch was worth it for all Brunchers.

Unlimited Brunch is a cooperative card game for 2-8 players, with an available solo mode. Each player selects a unique Bruncher to play as, with each Bruncher having a special ability.

Over the course of "two hours" from "11am - 1pm" or 8 rounds, all Brunchers will order items (food, alcohol, hydration), may share those items with their fellow Brunchers, resolve event cards, and try to avoid vomiting from consuming too much! To win, all players must end the end of round 8 (1pm) in the green ideal zones in both food and alcohol as noted on each Bruncher card.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Shota
description:
Having perfected the martial art of Kyudo that allows an archer to fire their bows with uncanny accuracy, Shiho Shota has become a legend in his own time. He even managed to fire an arrow throw the circular centre of a silvermoon that was thrown high in the air while blindfolded! But Shiho Shota is far more than trick-shots and showing off for the crowd; he has dedicated his entire life to mastering the bow, so much so that it is not an instrument in his hands but an extension of his body and fierce fighting spirit. The years have been hard on Shiho Shota, always hunted and on the run from the Dragon usurper, but such is his resolve; he has never let this wear him down. It has only doubled his will to fight now that the Black Eagle has flown home!

If you wish to run a Shiho warband with a ranged element, Shota is the perfect addition. He can reliably shoot anything. While his ordinary Dai Kyu shots are excellent, his ability to ignore LoS (Line of Sight) while shooting pushes him to the next level! However, the cost of an additional reload marker makes this a complex trade-off. His melee ability is average for Shiho Samurai, but he can benefit from an Enhancement Equipment weapon card. His melee ability is good enough to finish off the enemy models he has already damaged with his bow.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Crimson Ridge
description:
Crimson Ridge is a strategic two player card game in which heroes battle each other to capture arenas for their faction by spilling the blood of their enemies. Players play cards face down and reveal them simultaneously to resolve battles. The strategy comes from knowing what your opponent has left in their deck and forecasting their next move. Winning a battle captures an arena for your faction and earns you Victory Points. Crimson Ridge captures the strategy, speed and brutality of melee combat duels in a card game that can be played in ten to fifteen minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tug of War

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Arpagone Old Promo
description:
Promotional Figure with a unique card profile for the Krosmaster: Arena game. A greedy Enutrof that can pay extra Kamas to make her spells stronger.

Note that this minor expansion comes with its unique rule set (profile card) for a new character. Arpagone included in the original "Brotherhood of the Forgotten" expansion has a different rule set.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Domesday, The Norman Conquest 1066-1106
description:
King William…reigned over England, and by his capacity so thoroughly surveyed it, that there was not a hide of land in England that he wist not who had it, or what it was worth, and afterwards set it down in his book. The land of the Britons was in his power, and he wrought castles therein…and extorted from his subjects many marks of gold, and many hundred pounds of silver, which he took of his people, for little need, by right and by unright.

Anglo-Saxon Chronicle, 1087

King Edward the Confessor of England did not prepare well for his death, to avoid trouble he promised his kingdom to King Magnus Olafsson of Norway (a claim inherited by Harald Hardrada), King Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, Duke William of Normandy, and Earl Harold Godwinson of Wessex. When Edward died on the fifth day of January 1066 these four powerful warlords raised armies to back their claims by force. William the Conqueror won the crown but had to defend his new kingdom from fresh invasions and rebellious barons. To formalise his control of the kingdom after twenty years of conquest he ordered a Great Survey in 1085, a record so final and unalterable that it was named Domesday.

Domesday is a card driven game depicting the Norman Conquest of England from 1066 to 1106. The players control Normans, Barons, English, Danes, Norse, Scots, Welsh, and Irish, playing cards to resolve Events or use Marks to activate their units. Players win by earning the most victory points through controlling, contesting, or plundering areas, building cathedrals and towers, and making their leader the King of England.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Fire for Light
description:
The villagers of Summer's End are preparing for the coming of Malwinter — a strange and legendary season with the harshest snows and deadly cold. Take control of a new generation of explorers, the most valued members of Summer's End who go out every day in search of food, materials, or other resources that the village uses to survive:


Narii, who believes there's something in the nearby mountain range that can help the village survive.
Narii's sister Iris, a village guard who helps fend off the bandits who steal valuable resources and materials.
The apprentice blacksmith, Jasper, who has been trying to build something impressive enough for his teacher for seven years.
Or, finally, Ouop, a mysterious robot who assists the villagers but can communicate only by saying his name.


Fire for Light is a campaign-driven game played out over at least fifteen chapters. During each chapter, you set up a new scenario with new enemies and objectives. Most importantly, players are given choices that will change the outcome of their games and give them access to different rewards or shape future chapters differently.

A chapter is played over several rounds, each culminating in daylight progressing to darkness. Fire for Light uses a unique "Awareness" system to determine which characters (both friend and foe) activate. When an explorer takes their turn, they utilize actions they have available from different sources such as item or ability cards, their explorer mats, or other scenario-specific actions. These allow the characters to move, attack, gather resources, explore the wilderness, or countless other effects. When an enemy activates, they follow behaviors from top-to-bottom and roll a number of dice whenever they move.

Make your choices and uncover the mystery of this snowy world in Fire for Light!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Gundalow Kids
description:
Get ready to set sail!

Gundalow Kids is a simpler (but no less enjoyable) version of the Gundalow board game. Kids and parents will sail back into historical New England as captains of their own gundalows - flat-bottomed sailboats historically used for transporting cargo.

Players start the game in one of six towns in the Seacoast region near Portsmouth, New Hampshire. Each town has its own unique market of available and wanted goods, drawn from a deck of market cards. Players load goods onto their gundalows and then roll a die to sail to other towns. Event cards come into play when players land on the event squares on the game board. Event cards offer new challenges, opportunities, and rewards to players, as well as potential changes to the town markets.

Players earn money by successfully delivering goods to the towns before the other players. Exotic goods, such as spices and cotton, are worth more than locally-produced goods, but players need to make the long journey downriver to Portsmouth to access the more valuable commodities.

The objective of the game is for the players to deliver the goods needed by each town, and the game will end when each of the wanted goods spaces in the town markets is filled. The player who earns the most money wins the game!

For advanced players, the game also includes variants, including an option that provides honorary titles to the players who deliver the most of each good. With the rich variety of market and event cards, each game of Gundalow Kids is unique. The game provides an enjoyable window into the rich history of the Seacoast region.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Flip That House The Board Game
description:
Flip That House The Board Game takes its players through the journey of real estate investing, also known today as "house flipping". The first "flipper" to acquire one million dollars in cash and property, is declared the Ultimate Flipping Mogul.

Flippers begin with $250,000 in cash and a flip. The flipper that rolls the highest number on the dice begin play and then clock wise for the next flippers turn. Flippers roll dice and move the appropriate spaces on the colorful and bright game board, following the action on the spot in which they landed.

This game will provide hours of fun and education for groups of all ages.
mechanics: Command Cards, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Investment, Legacy Game, Loans, Negotiation, Ownership, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Les 4 Pandastiques
description:
A long time ago, 4 extraordinary creatures lived among us: the pandastics 4!
