But one day, to protect the 3 others, the 4th creature disappeared... Many adventurers went in search of it and it is said that to make it reappear, you must accomplish quests engraved in the ruins of an ancient temple...
During your adventure, it is up to you to be the most observant, attentive and clever to succeed in these legendary quests!
At the end of the road, you may discover this mythical creature that is just waiting to reappear: the Pand4stic!

Complete quests to solve the mystery of the Pandastic 4:
Turn your cards over wisely, using your memory to combine the characteristics of your cards!
But stop in time so you don't lose everything and score more points than your opponents!

Memory, risk-taking and daring will be essential for you to become the best adventurer and discover the Pand4stic!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Matching, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Silly Sounds
description:
Silly Sounds is the new family-fun party game where everyone gets to make and guess the silly sound stuck on their headband!

The sound could be ‘An elephant asleep on a train’ or ‘A baby playing the bagpipes’! The only thing you do know… it will be very silly.

Spin and pick a player to make the sound, but land on ‘All Play’ and everyone makes the silly sound and all at the same time… it’s total mayhem!

Just beat the timer, guess the sound and the card is yours. Collect 3 cards to win the game, but watch out for the mute rounds where you mustn’t make a sound and can only act it out!

Making silly sounds is only half the fun, guessing them is the other half! Silly Sounds, the game you play with your ears!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting
publishers: Fantastic Factory, Interplay (Board Game Related), PlayMonster

name: Deeproot Dwellers
description:
In Deeproot Dwellers, each player controls a village of unique critters in an attempt to beautify their town over ten seasons. Building an efficient deck, growing a well curated garden, and moving up the exploration track are all viable ways for players to collect points. With multiple paths to victory, and limited actions on the board, players need to be strategic about how they grow their village.

Each round (or season) has 3 phases: Action, Resolution, and Cleanup.

During the action phase, players will play dweller cards from their hands onto different action spaces on the board. This functions like a worker placement style game where your cards represent the workers. During the Resolution phase, the table will go down the board, section by section and resolve the effects of each section. The various areas allow players to collect resources, move up an exploration track, deal with effects for each Season, recruit new dwellers to join their village, thus adding them to their deck like a deck builder and finally the last area allows players to grab Flower tiles which provide points in a set-collection style of scoring. The Cleanup phase occurs where the board is cleared of each players dweller cards, each player draws a new hand of dweller cards for the next round, and a new Season card comes in to effect which offers a unique way to score in that round.

At the end of ten seasons (rounds), the player with the most points will be declared the winner.

It offers a unique blend or modern gamers' favorite mechanics wrapped up with great artwork and a whimsical, fun theme, that is easy to learn and teach.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Roll 'N' Wrestle: Territories
description:
Roll'N'Wrestle is a modern day twist on the 1950-1980 Wrestling era with you taking the role of a pro wrestling promoter.

The United States of America is divided into territories and you must conquer these by hosting wrestling events and attracting fans to your promotion.

Lead your wrestling franchise to success and beat the competition by recruiting, training, and developing a winning roster of wrestling superstars.

You will roll dice acting as your road agents to complete worker placement strategic maneuvers for your promotion, plus deal with superstar egos, backstage rivalries and locker room politics, negotiate deals with TV networks and sell merchandise to your hopefully increasing loyal fan base! Plus so much more...

Do you have what it takes to beat ruthless rival promotions
and conquer the world of Professional Wrestling?

Come and try in Roll'N'Wrestle: Territories the pro wrestling board game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Tech Chess
description:
Tech Chess is a two-player, chess variant game where chess pieces each have abilities. It replaces the pieces with a modernized deck of playing cards called the Tech Deck. The cards represent chess pieces on the board each with special abilities. Played on a 6x6 board, each player starts with two kings, a knight, queen, two rooks and 6 pawns that can be upgraded. Players draw 3 cards from the deck at the start of the game. If you like chess, you'll enjoy Tech Chess.

On their turn, a player may do one of the following things, Move a piece, Use card effects, Upgrade a piece, Build a pawn.
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Dose Cards
description:
Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Some 'R' Set Remastered
description:
The Levi Game Company has remastered this many times played classic - the 1903 original midwestern USA card game, Some 'R' Set. Levi first re-issued this game in 2019.

It plays very similar to Spades or Euchre. But the fact that each suit has a different number of cards, makes the strategy play each round.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Constrained Bidding, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Real-Time, Score-and-Reset Game, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Double Dose
description:
Double Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. It's a sequel to Dose that's playable alone or in conjunction with the original game. Compared to basic Dose, Double Dose includes cards that make players reveal truths, perform dares, and share their deepest, darkest history. It also integrates an online function that allows players to reload random rule, dare, truth, and never-have-I-ever suggestions via the website: dosecards.com.

Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Layering, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Tunnel of Love
description:
When it was announced that real estate developer Lucas Webb was buying the abandoned Fun Town amusement park, the reception was mixed. At the project launch party held at the park, Webb wandered off with his long-time girlfriend and never returned. His body was later discovered in the old Tunnel of Love ride, and his girlfriend was nowhere to be found. Who killed Lucas Webb and why? Hold on tight, this mystery is going to be a bumpy ride!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Deduction

name: El Gran Circo
description:
With a different proposal to everything comes El Gran Circo (The Great Circus). A tightrope that all the characters climb in each game to reach the final.

All the characters always participate in the game and each player can move any character on his turn. Each participant throws their cards to move all the characters strategically and get theirs to arrive first to win the game. An alternative proposed by El Gran Circo is the cooperative game, where players share a common goal: get all characters across the tightrope in 35 moves or less. For this, it will be necessary to work as a team and jointly analyze each move made by the participants on their turn.

In addition to entertaining the participants, El Gran Circo stimulates cognitive functions, helps regulate emotions and works on social skills.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Strike Deck Dinos
description:
Form your perfect team of dinosaurs, evolve their offense and defense abilities and lead them to victory against your family and friends!

Players select a team of three Dinosaur Characters and then nominate which Dino will be first to battle. They will then select a target from the other players at the table, ready to battle.

All players then race to draw a Strike Card, OR they can elect to swap out their lead Dino for another in their team. Once Strikes or Swaps have been finalised, cards are resolved, with non-Strikes resolved first.

Players can use EVOLVE cards to build up the stats of their Dinos, and use various STRIKES to deal damage to their opponents. If a Dino takes too many hits, that Dino 'retires for healing' and is out of the game!

Players continue to play through rounds, selecting targets, drawing Strikes and resolving evolution and strike cards until only one team is left standing, winning the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fighting, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Darwin Awards Party Card Game
description:
Welcome to Darwin Awards party card game! Do you enjoy reading or hearing about the crazy things that people do that sometimes end up with them being amongst the nonliving…in other words, someone doing something really stupid and dying. Do you like to make fun of your family, friends, perfect strangers, or maybe a celebrity? Then Darwin Awards party card game is for you!

Darwin Awards is comprised of 4 different decks of cards; there are Location, Action, Object, and Death cards. For advanced gameplay, you can add a 5th deck, Announcement cards.

Each player is dealt 2 of each type of card. One player starts off as the Judge. Starting with the player to the Judge’s left, the players will use the cards in their hand to make up a story. The story will be how someone dies by the Death card at the location stated in the Location card by doing an action from the Action card with an object from the Object card. Example: Location Card – Windsor Castle, Action Card – Doing the Chicken Dance, Object Card – Moon Shoes, Death Card – Choked on a bottle cap

Once each player has told their story, the Judge then chooses the story they liked best. The winning player will keep the Death card to track how many rounds won and all used cards are set off to the side. The player to the Judge’s left will be the next Judge and deals a fresh set of cards to each player and new stories are told. The first player to collect 3 (or as many as the group wants to play) Death cards is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Roll-Z: Coop Mode
description:
This is the cooperative mode expansion for Roll-Z and requires the base game to play.

This two-player mode is played pretty much the same way as the base game, but we recommend that you familiarize yourself with the base game before moving on to this mode.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Real-Time

name: Stacks
description:
Stacks is a fast-playing, abstract tactical game for two players.

The game is played on a 5 x 5 grid (25 spaces in total). Each player gets 10 playing pieces either in red or black. Your pieces start on stacks of 2 on your own home spaces, adjacent to the main playing grid.

In each turn, a player can move one or more of their pieces across the board. The aim of the game is to get four or more of your pieces into the opponent’s home spaces, or to eliminate six or more of the opponent’s pieces.

The game is easy to learn, and is highly re-playable, offering players interesting and difficult tactical and strategic choices.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Sangre y Acero: The Second Battle of Nanawa, July 1933
description:
The war between Bolivia and Paraguay for the Chaco region broke out over who would have control of the oil fields discovered a decade earlier. The small town of Nanawa was marked by a key crossroads as well as water springs that were highly prized in this arid region. The Paraguayans captured the town and fortified surrounding area soon after war broke out the year before. In July a massive offensive organized by General Hans Kundt by the Bolivians was launched to retake the area which they hoped would lead to the fall of Concepcion. Can you do as well or better?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Ghosts of Ur
description:
The Tabletop board game based on ancient Sumer 3800 - BCE. As one of six adventurers, each with their unique talents, you will fight your way through a vast and unrecognizable land filled with dangers and riches. Your goal is to journey through the landscape of Ancient Sumer and find the 4 City Ziggurats and collect all of the Map Cards (either through purchase, negotiation, or theft) that will lead you to the great City of Ur where you hope to defeat Nanna the God of Ur.

We have high quality pieces such as a Durable, Washable, Foldable Silicone Adventure Board, 6 Hand Casted 32MM Lead free Pewter (paintable) Adventurer's, Tetrahedron Dice, 20 Sided Die, D100 Dice, Cards, Tiles, Burlap Storage bags.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Civilization, Exploration, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Events, Grid Movement, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Admiral of the Fleet: Flag Officer's Handbook
description:
Flag Officer's Handbook: 50 pages of rules and diagrams plus printable signal card deck (67 cards) and Flag Officer Signal Book sheet.

The FOH explains in detail how the cards can be used to add a new dimension to your naval gaming experience by introducing this innovative method for aspiring flag officers to command their fleet on the game table. Due to the popularity of surface-only engagements and the difficulties inherent in an accurate portrayal of the additional dimensions required by the addition of aircraft and submarines to the game table, it focuses exclusively on surface warfare during the age of the battleship.

You can signal your divisions, squadrons and flotillas to execute a pre-determined battle order, turn in succession by division, alter course 3 points to starboard, distribute fire from the left, attack the enemy van and even perform a battle turn (Gefechtskehrtwendung)!

Required to play AOTF, but can also be used with other naval wargame rules.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Admiral of the Fleet: Scenarios Volume I
description:
Scenarios Volume I: 66 pages including background information, maps, orders of battle (OOB) and setup diagrams plus 169 pages of pre-formatted, ready-to-print ship logs. Ship Logs are required to play AOTF.

The 5 scenarios include:

The Battle of Tsushima (1905 - historical),
The Battle of Crete (1898 - fictional),
The Battle of Dogger Bank (1915 - historical),
The Battle of the Komandorski Islands (1943 - both historical and fictional), and
The Battle of Jutland-Run to the South (1916 - historical)

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: BattleTech: Interstellar Operations – BattleForce
description:
Marshal your forces and prepare to conquer the Inner Sphere! Interstellar Operations: BattleForce provides a sliding zoom that can scale from a quick game on your table up to the macro level, allowing players to assume the roles of House Lords and dominate the galaxy!

BattleForce is a complete, all-in-one-book game system of combat on a grand scale, but tailored to your interest at the gaming table.

Play lightning-fast, large-scale games like battalion vs battalion or conquer a planet with multiple regiments.
Not large enough? Invade an entire sector of a House as armies clash across a dozen systems.
Still not large enough? Become a Clan Khan or House Leader and amass all the industrial might of your empire to protect your worlds and defeat your enemies!
Note: The original publication of Interstellar Operations had rules for playing in alternate eras which can now be found in the Interstellar Operations: Alternate Eras.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Interplanetary: Space Race – Expansion 3
description:
The third expansion for Interplanetary, titled Space Race, enables competitive gameplay, transforming the experience into a two-player euro-game.
For the solo player, a new free-form sandbox mode is included as well.

This is not a standalone expansion as both expansion 1 and 2 are required to play.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Gears of Industry
description:
Gears of Industry is a Personalized Card Game (PCG) for 2-4 players. All players build their personalized decks from the same fixed card pool of two Tech Decks (52-cards). Each player customizes their own 26-card play deck to create a unique play experience to reflect their personality and play-style. Players also bring a customized 15-card Market deck contribution. Players combine their personalized Market deck contributions into a single communal Market deck. The theme of the game is an economic factory engine building game during the modern post-industrial era

Players play card(s) into markets. When the active player has three cards in a market that player can trigger a market clash (poker hand competition). They compete against other players by making poker hands to score points. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. The first to get to 7 victory points wins the game. Ties are broken with the value of a player’s factory and market cards.

GAME PLAY – Each player's personalized play deck will contain Technology cards (Gear cards) which represent factories. Factory cards allow other cards to be played into the two Markets. Horizontal (left or right-facing) Factory cards pay for playing Market cards. Upright and upside-down Factory cards can boost a market. Each market contains two neutral market cards. On their turn, the active player can use game effects on their Market cards or one of the neutral Market cards. The active player can trigger a Market Clash. During a Market Clash all the players compete in a Market by making the best poker hand they can using the player’s market cards, the two neutral market cards, and one factory card in the market boost orientation. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. Winning players score 1 victory point for a poker hand up to a three of a kind, or 2 points for higher ranked hands. Factory cards are rotated when Market cards are played and during the Market Clash step.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Ownership, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle Royale: Flick to the Death
description:
Battle Royale: Flick to the Death is a combat game where players flick cards around on the board to maneuver and then use a variety of “weapons” to attack such as rolling discs or other objects. It is intended to be a lightweight game, lasting 10 to 20 minutes per game.

—description from opinionatedgamers
mechanics: Flicking

name: Omen: A Reign of War – Champion of Uruk Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new hero 0/4/4

Text says: Treasured
During your Surge Step, you may discard this card from hand. If you do, shuffle together all unused Unit cards and draw 3. Play 1 for no cost, add 1 to your hand, and give 1 to the other player.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Malediction: The Magical Drinking Card Game
description:
Malediction is a party game for 3 or more players. You will learn magic, find gear, cast curses, create wards and surprise your friends with reaction magic, all the while you make the people around you drink.

When you deal damage in game to other players, that is translated into drinks!

Highly modular to let you customise how intense you want your drinking game to be with expansions and extra content.

Designed by Josh Allsop

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Take That

name: Monsterdicer
description:
Monsterdicer is a fast-paced dice game with a surprisingly strategic approach. Choose the dice and catch your own monsters or prevent the opponent from reaching the goal.

The aim of the game is to catch all your own monsters numbered 1 to 9. To do this, the appropriate dice must be selected in turn. Once a die has been selected it can no longer be used by the other players, so you always decide between personal victory and blocking the other players from winning.

There is an accompanying app for the game for android or via web browser.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Ases del Estadio
description:
Thematic game of Olympic Athletics.

Compete in 13 different disciplines of Olympic Athletics.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Babel Bricks
description:
A set of wooden blocks with engraved letters that can be played in a multitude of ways.

There are 100 wooden blocks with a letter engraved on each side. The letters are distributed throughout the game in line with common usage of the English language, plus two blank blocks.

A standard set of rules have been printed on the box to serve as a suggestion, but the game lends itself to players originating and adapting the rules as they wish to determine.

The standard rules suggest building the tower 5 blocks to a level, with 20 levels and players using dexterity, strategy and spelling skills to slide out blocks to find words to collect points to win.
mechanics: Physical Removal, Spelling, Stacking and Balancing

name: Uh Oh! at home
description:
Uh Oh! What's going to happen?
Turn over the cards to discover cheeky surprises in this educational card game created for babies (yes, babies!), toddlers and up!

With 8 different ways to play, little ones can explore the concept of consequences, build puzzles, find objects, play memory games and more! Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar rooms (kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and garden) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Uh Oh! at home is the second game in a range of card games designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

8 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0 to 4+. (6 are co-operative, 2 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free and Carbon Balanced with the World Land Trust.)

—description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Memory, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching

name: Stratira Königshalma Turm
description:
A compilation of 3 games in a wooden box, cover and bottom showing 2 of 3 boards. In addition, there is a board for Nine Men's Morris.
Components: 2 x 48 wooden blocks

Stratira: Very close to Score Four. Scoring is different as you may continue after having 4 in a row to get a better score. Details of the rules in BGG Weblink.

Königshalma: Very close to Halma. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Necessary components: King, 2 rooks and 7 pawns in 2 colors of a chess game (not provided). 2 x 6 standard pawns (of draughts e.g.) for the 4 player game needed. The blocks of the game could do well. (Not applicable for 3 players.)
The rules for 2 players are a mix of Halma and Salta as the pawns are to be moved to their mirror space at the other end of the board. The rules say you cannot change the color of the space because otherwise it would be impossible to enter the finish spaces (which is hard to believe).

Turm: Very close to Checkers. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Start: First row is empty, the next 2 rows have all spaces occupied. Moving is forwards and sidewards only. At the finish line, the pawn will be upgraded to a "Turm", like a "King" in Checkers.

Estimated year: 1990

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Race, Square Grid, Static Capture, Tile Placement

name: Pam pam pam
description:
Playful maths

We have created a board game that bridges the gap between school and home activities, and between learning and playing. It provides transition between age groups and people with different abilities.

It takes you from childhood to old age. It helps to move from playing alone, through playing doubles, to playing in teams. It can help children with autism to start talking. And it’s as diverse as autism.

The clarity and comprehensibility of shapes, colours and numbers can calm you down when competing.

Pam Pam Pam board game is built on values.
Pam Pam Pam rules of the game:

Pam Pam Pam is a board game in which players must find two identical symbols on the cards of a selected deck, place the colour, shape and value discs on the solution strip, and then place the solution strip next to the draw deck and name the discs.

In each deck, on each of two cards, there is only one symbol of the same colour, shape and value. A symbol is designated by colour, shape and value. The value is expressed by a number. The size of the symbols does not matter.
How the game works:

1. Players are given the basic tools.

2. Each player is dealt a card.

3. The remaining cards are placed face up in the middle. This will be the draw deck.

4. Players try to find two identical symbols on the newest card of their deck and the top card of the draw deck.

5. The first player who

a) places the discs of the correct colour, shape and value on the solution strip,

b) places it next to the draw deck,

c) names all three discs,

d) which are checked by another player, and if he/she judges them to be correct,

e) then the first player puts the discs from his/her solution strip back on the disc tray,

f) finally, he/she can pick up the card,

g) which he/she adds to his/her own cards.

If the solution is incorrect, the player takes back his /her solution strip and the round continues.

6. The game continues until all cards from the draw deck are used up.
Winner of the game:

Winner of the game is the player who has collected most of the cards.
A symbol consists of:

A colour: brown, blue, purple, red, pink, yellow, grey, green,

A shape: square, triangle, circle,

A value, e.g.: Arabic numeral, dot, finger, Roman numeral, number of two parts, a part of a number, mirrored number, vehicle, shape, letters, binary system, value of chess pieces, number of protons, number of legs of animals, combinations of these.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Memory, Number
mechanics: Matching

name: Xeonia
description:
Xeonia is an exciting fun anime-themed tabletop card game for 2-4 players that makes use of fast paced actions, skills, abilities, and powerful Assists to aid in becoming the champion of Xeonia!

​Play as a standalone game in a PVP (Player vs Player) game mode, or in a co-operative story campaign.

​My goal for Xeonia was to create a game that would engage the player into various combos, attacks, and skills. As I have played various card games myself, I took the ideas that stood out to me and have made them my own. With so many different combinations, the possibilities are endless.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Player Elimination

name: Rescue at Mt Etna
description:
A daring rescue mission! During a regular hiking trip, Mt. Etna suddenly becomes active. The access road is blocked and hikers are trapped. Your mission: fly your helicopters into the volcano to rescue the hikers before the advancing lava reaches them.

This game stresses crisis planning, risk-taking, and cooperation. Three separate lava advances are controlled by dice, and hikers run from the advancing lava. Some locations in the volcano are easier to land in than others. Eventually the lava will fill the crater, and any hikers trapped will perish. Pilots who crash into the volcano must also be rescued. It is a race against the lava!

Players use dice to simulate the difficulty of flying in tricky conditions. Helicopters can be upgraded with power-ups and individual pilot cards grant special abilities. The overall victory is cooperative, but points are also awarded individually for a best pilot award.

This is a great game for introducing the importance of cooperation, teamwork, and risk taking in life-and-death situations. The situation is simulated but tension is real.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: Attack of the Baby Koalas
description: A 6 card expansion for The Dark and The Deep (12 cards total) that expands the game for 4-6 players. It consists of 4 0 point cards, 1 13 point card, and a new thing.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Glamour
description:
Goal!
Here’s the deal. You’re in charge of a small group of Fairies trying to gain the favor of powerful people in the Fae Courts. Your goal is to use your Fairy Cards (your player hand) to manipulate Dram (the little chips, basically bidding coins) to buy Court Cards (point cards). You’ll have to use all your cunning, guile, and smooth-talkery to get the cards you need! The first player to get a Fae from all 4 Seasonal Courts wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Constrained Bidding, Deduction, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monopoly: U.S. Stamps Edition
description:
Celebrate a historical hobby enjoyed by philatelists around the world with a custom collection you can take out and play!

Created in collaboration with USPS, MONOPOLY: U.S. Stamps Edition lets players buy, sell, and trade the most memorable stamps from U.S. history!

Six USPS-inspired tokens will keep players connected to their trusty means of communication, such as a Mail Truck, Mail Box, Package, Postcard, Coil of Stamps, and USPS Eagle. Instead of Houses and Hotels, set up Post Offices and Distribution Centers to move revenue, as Chance and Community Chest cards called Special Delivery and Rain Heat & Snow create detours.

Keep your assets in superb condition to stick it to the competition and win!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Diamond Keepers
description:
Diamond Keepers is a four to six player tabletop turn based card game, where each player takes the role of the protector of a kingdom and their most valuable resource Diamonds.

The legend says that the one who possesses one diamond from each kingdom will rule the world.

This game is turned based, and in each turn the players can use different types of cards to either steal other player diamonds, protect themselves or their allies, or even alter the flow of the match.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Build & Blast
description:
The obstacle of housing shortage has been plaguing the government for a long time. Finally, the government has made an important decision: handing over several plots of land to large investors and contractors to build high towers! After many challenges, 3 large plots of land have finally been selected in 3 different neighborhoods of the city to build 5 towers on each by the biggest investors of the city.

In Build & Blast, players are given the role of the investors, to build 5 towers in a neighborhood each round, and while doing so, secretly invest in some towers. To earn more points, players should try to raise the tower on which they have invested more and sabotage other towers. The game ends at the end of the third round with the construction of 5 towers in the third neighborhood, and the investor with the most points will win.

In Build & Blast, there are several tiles, each representing a floor of a tower. In each neighborhood, 5 towers with 5 different designs and colors will be built. Some tiles belong to one or two specific towers, and some tiles can be placed in the body of all towers. A few special tiles, without being inserted into the body of the towers, will make changes to the building plans.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Mystery Empire
description:
A party game for people who want to conquer each other. Pick a secret identity and correctly guess the identities of other players to build your empire while using deception to remain unconquered yourself.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deduction, End Game Bonuses, King of the Hill, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Entities
description:
Entities is a 2-in-1 board game including the best of cooperative, competitive, and single player modes in a world where the chances of survival are slim to none. Adversaries from different parts of this plane will have the mission to save their own lives only by facing the Entities: beings created by the Demiurge with the sole purpose of destroying the human race and giving rise to a new world.

Four contenders heeded the call of the mysterious Demiurge, who summoned them to the Magnetic Mount to be the only survivors of their era, but there will be only one conquering the Mount.

In order to reach the exit, you must complete your Quest Board and get three Treasures from the Entities you defeat. But not so fast! You must cross the Portal with enough energy to defeat Greiden, Guardian of the Path, so you will have to get the necessary equipment and experience from the Blue and Red decks.

Along the way, you have to watch out for the Demiurge, who will be constantly attacking the area and you will have to be cunning to avoid him between the enemy attacks and Entities hunting.

If your strength falters you can head to the Vimana, the Ship of the Gods, which will give you a chance to face the Demiurge in the Real Side, where you can win a bonus if you manage to beat him.

Earn the favor of the Demiurge by mercilessly destroying your opponents in Competitive mode, or try your luck tricking a deity in Co-op. For those days when you feel omnipotent, you can take the lonely road to face the demiurge in Single Player.

Many paths, only one option. Escape from the planet.

Meet the other side and find the truth.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points

name: Rotation Rumble
description:
In Rotation Rumble you take over the role of a guild coach, that hires and commands mercenaries in the weekly rumble fights for money, cheesecake and glory. Chose wisely which fighters, challenges and inventory you combine to form the best possible pack of reckless rumblers.

Rotation Rumble is played with a pre-constructed deck of squared cards, which have 4 different actions on each side (in rare cases there are just 2) which can be activated by rotating them.
This allows for endless combinations, possibilities and threats. Easy, isn’t it?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Kick Off: Coach
description:
Become the coach and manager of your club. Line up the right players in the right positions, build the right tactic deck, manage your team's environment and much more to lead your club to the championship!

Kick Off - Coach can be played over several seasons or for one championship. Each season is divided into match days, during which you can allocate your resources to your various staff and action options: from training, stadium and club infrastructure development to the transfer market and much more. You compete against each other on match days. Kick Off - Coach uses a unique momentum mechanic in combination with a tactical card deck, which challenges you to perfectly coordinate your line-up, tactics, playing style and the stamina of your players.

The game can be played with 1 to 8 players, with easy-to-use bots taking over clubs. Due to the parallel processing of the game days, there is little downtime and the game time is not extended. If you play over several seasons, an additional legacy effect comes into play through the development of the players and the club.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Spells
description:
Quest across the wild lands to the Magic Tree! Cast Spells along the way, conjuring helpful tools while encountering curious and enchanted characters .

Spells is a hex-grid, pick-up and deliver, open draft, race-ish adventure word game. Players take turns traversing the magical wild lands, spelling words and making tricky decisions about whether to race to the end or go on side quests.

You will cultivate Magic as you Spell words out. This Magic will be counted at the end to determine a winner. But it can also be used to conjure a Broomstick to move further, a Wand to transform consonants into vowels, as well as a Charm, Crystal Ball, Familiar, and Friendly Spirit.

Magic can also be earned by meeting the requirements of the various Helpers you'll meet along the way. The Coven of witches need a Spell with a 'Q' in it for their recipe. You can sneak past the Sleeping Giant if your Spell contains the letters 'SH'.

Everyone will have a different adventure traveling the lands of Spells.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Spelling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Veney
description:
Veney is a chesslike game for two players designed to invoke the mechanics and spirit of a sword fight. The goal is to use your blade piece to checkmate your opponent either by touch (taking the Self piece) or by disarm (taking their only blade piece) while defending against checkmate in return. On your turn, you can move one of your pieces to an open square, move to take an opponent's piece or "fend" it (sending it to their reserve), place one of your reserved pieces on an open square, withdraw a piece, pass, or use various special moves and aspects of the pieces in play.

Many of the core elements of chess are inverted, removed, or altered to more closely resemble corresponding aspects of fencing. For example, there is no check, and two-way checkmates are possible. There are multiple methods by which a player can make two moves at once, and a wide array of special moves allows for unpredictable ripostes. The 4x16 board is subdivided lengthwise into four "measures" which allow for unique piece movements and flexible range constraints. Positions can get exceedingly complex, and breaking the rules (knowingly or not) is incorporated into the game as a potential grounds for disarmament or sudden-death.

A veney set is made up of collected rocks and trinkets which players cultivate and trade over time. "Token" pieces are won and lost as prizes at the conclusion of a formal game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Elevator Pitch
description:
Players create and deliver Elevator pitches by associating concepts from pairs of Tech Deck cards. Players present a 1 to 3-minute pitch for a new product, service or project in a causal party game setting. Then, other players get to ask two questions about the pitch just delivered. Play in idea or competitive mode. An Elevator Pitch is a brief speech outlining an idea for a product, service or project. The name comes from the notion that the speech would be delivered in the short time period of an elevator ride. In the financial world, it is an entrepreneur's presentation to a venture capitalist to persuade them that a business idea is worth investing in.

OBJECTIVE – The objective is to create and deliver Elevator Pitches by associating concepts on pairs of Tech Deck cards.
THEME – The theme of the game is an entrepreneur creating the concept for a new product, service or company in modern era setting.
GAME PLAY – The players form teams if playing with more than 4 players. Pairs of concept cards from the Tech Deck are dealt to the table and players/teams get to select a pair of cards from which to create a concept for. Elevator pitches are delivered. Then, the other players get to ask the presenter two questions. In idea mode, the game ends after 10 pitches have been given. In competitive mode, other players vote on whether to fund the idea.
WINNING – In idea mode, there are no winners/losers. In competitive mode, the team/player with the most funded ideas wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Planetary Profiteers
description:
Ad astra ad lucrum! You each represent a different culture from a solar system where competition for dominance among your peoples has been the norm for centuries. Now rivals have come together (barely) to send your team on a voyage to negotiate with worlds new to you to build an interplanetary confederation and earn commissions.

You are each in this for yourselves, yet you will somehow have to work together to complete missions. The player with the highest commission point total at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Hallux Rigidus (2nd edition)
description:
This is another release of the original with some alterations to improve various aspects of game play. Mainly we promised one of the characters could be the villain but with so many to choose from the statistics made it unlikely to happen so we reduced the number of characters to 6, the maximum number of players. Some possessions have been adjusted to conform better and certain wording improved for better in-play understanding without having to refer to the rule book.

Each person plays the role of a character that returns to Hallux Rigidus to gather evidence to discover the cause of the horrors that plague this small community. Once the cause is discovered, the players travel to the location in an attempt to end the horrors and save the town. The first player to successfully accomplish this, and retain his or her sanity, is the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Hidden Roles, Relative Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Sleeper Cells
description:
In Sleeper Cells players take turns drawing and playing cards to lead attacks against their opponent. The game ends when a player runs out of life. Outwit your opponent in a tactical duel where playing the strongest cards at the wrong time can be just as deadly for you as for your opponent.

Each turn consists of 3 actions. You may draw cards play, flip cards or attack with cards all with the intent of overwhelming your opponent and destroying them.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Boratimê
description:
Boratimê is a Brazilian tongue-in-cheek strategy card game about two soccer crowds competing to push their team to victory by using ridiculous and epic tactics.

Each player takes control of one crowd with unique abilities and must react to key moments of the match. The crowd who reacts best pushes their team forward. At the end of the match, the crowd that inspired the most goals is victorious.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Take That, Tug of War, Variable Player Powers

name: Flavius Rule
description:
Plucked from daily life by our sponsor Flavius and forced into vicious arena events, players are tasked
with surviving in a deadly gladiator arena at the twisted delight of Flavius and for the much needed favor
of the crowds. With your body, freedom, and friendships at stake, will tensions push you to defy the sponsor
and serve for personal glory, or will you accept and satisfy Flavius' rule?

Flavius Rule is a turn-based gladiatorial strategy game for 4x players
(with extra events supporting 1-8x players)

Starting with a humble class loadout, each player tries to advance their gladiator in several ways;
battling savage arena animals and spawned opponents, acquiring shiny new armor and weapons,
precious coin, strategic tokens, gracious crowd favor, or drawing helpful, albeit risky arena cards.
The Summa Rudis, NPCs, pesky spectators and more will hinder your chance for success, however
the most difficult challenge will be eliminating one another to be the last remaining player.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Animals, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Map Deformation, Map Reduction, Market, Movement Points, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Take That, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Monasteries in Spain (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
A 12-tile fan expansion for Carcassonne centered around the rich cultural heritage of Spain. As the nation with the 3rd most UNESCO World Heritage sites (48, as of July 2019, behind Italy and China), Spain is rich in monasteries. This expansion gathers the most important ones, together with a new way of playing.

Similarly to other expansions consisting in monasteries, the player will be given the option to play them as a regular monastery by placing a monk or as a Spanish monastery by placing an abbot, simbolized by a meeple balanced on its side.

Special rules apply to the Spanish Monasteries, which score points for having features in the 8 surrounding tiles. The more features around it, the greater the score. But beware, the abbot and the scoring of the Spanish Monastery will only happen once those features are fully complete. Should things not go as you hoped, don't worry, you will still get some points on end-game scoring.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Quivit!: The Color Matching Card Game
description:
Quivit is a simple and fun grid-based card game playable on any surface. Cards are arranged in a 5 x 5 grid with players rotating cards with random color squares to match adjoining cards with like colors to score points. Numerous optional rules are included to make Quivit competitive for all age levels.

Quivit the color matching card game is quick and easy to learn. 2-5 players take turns rotating cards to link colors, scoring the most points possible.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Coverage

name: Naughty R18 Cards
description:
These naughty cards are designed just for the dirtiest little F*****s out there and they are definitely not suitable for all the Karens out there. The questions in these cards will shock even the kinkiest players.

GAME PREPARATIONS:
Mix the deck and deal paper and pens to all players. The youngest player starts and the game continues clockwise. The active player draws the top card of the deck and proceeds according to the category rules. Used cards are placed under the deck.

Winner is the one who reaches 15 points first. If two or more players reaches 15 points in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

Cards are well suited for bachelor parties, Christmas parties and wild get-togethers with friends. Naughty R18 cards can also be used separately without the main game

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Iaijutsu
description:
Theme
2 Players are catapulted in a Japanese samurai movie right at the very beginning of a duel, they must follow the cinematic canon:
-the talk: a bluff game
-the stare: a resource management game
-the fight: outsmart your opponent
No part is more important than the others and the outcome is never given for granted where honour is as important as blood.

Mechanics and Components
This game it's all comprised in 15 tarot size cards and 30 tokens, but don't let the size fool you, it's a mid to heavy game of bluff, resource management and out-thinking the opponents intentions.

To whom the game is intended
The game is for heavy card gamer as CCG and LCG players (especially Netrunner players) and all players that enjoy to think deeply on the consequences of they moves.

To whom this game is not intended
Casual players, one-of players, multi-players solitaire lovers

Why PNP
I think this game is so minimal in its components that betrays its expectations by providing an deep and unforgiving (and I hope unforgettable) play experience. Given this characteristics it becomes hard to sell as a physical product therefore decided to release it as a PNP.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Sudden Death Ending

name: Politik
description:
Politik is a strategy game of political, economic, and territory control for 2–6 players. Players represent 1 of 12 Nations who develop distinct identities during a struggle for global power. They introduce doctrines and choreograph propaganda campaigns. They hire talented leaders to conquer new states and swing elections. And they expand and improve companies to conquer markets and fill their coffers. A deck of 450+ unique cards provide the doctrines, propaganda, companies, assets, leaders, and events that each nation uses to forge its path.


Set just after the Great Collapse, the world is disoriented from decades of misinformation by an ailing regime. Entangled pirate signals now fill the airwaves. Abandoned Imperial broadcast stations are commandeered to pipe out ideologies at high volume. Right and wrong blur together. There is no authority on truth. One nation will shape the world to come.


Politik plays out simultaneously across 3 different arenas. Seizing control of 1 arena wins the game. Conquer states to control regions of the Map for Military Victory. Rally bases of support to control the Council for Political Victory. Lead competing companies to control industries for Corporate Victory.


Along the road to victory, each arena offers distinct opportunities. Controlling states on the map increases resource production and card draw. Holding seats on the council adds game-changing benefits and abilities. Running effective companies boosts income. Opportunities, however, sometimes come with risks. Nations may embrace corruption to supercharge their strategies. But greed unchecked can lead to eventual demise.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Hand Management, Market, Variable Player Powers

name: War: Game of Thrones
description:
War: Game of Thrones is a reimplementation of War(the Brazilian version of Risk), with the theme of Game of Thrones.
The game can be played in two different ways. The first is basically the same as Risk/War, but in the map of Westeros.
The second way keep the basic mechanic of Risk/War, but in order to win, you no longer need to fulfil objective cards. What you need in to place flags of your nation on the map. In order to do so, you need to conquer a territory and spend one army.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Outbreak on Hypatia
description:
Science officers brought back a strange alien fungus from a survey mission to an asteroid. Following the usual protocols, the fungus was placed in quarantine, but its explosive growth when exposed to the warmth of the ship caused it to break out of its containment area, shattering the glass and releasing spores into the ventilation shafts.

Now, the alien fungus, dubbed the "Phage" by the ship's scientists, is infecting the crew, turning them into lurching, zombie-like horrors that are taking over the ship! The central power grid has failed, and half the crew are either infected or still in cryosleep.

As captain, it's your job to make the life-and-death decisions. You need to get as many crew members off the ship as possible, but you cannot allow the Phage to escape. You'll have to wake the remaining crew members from cryosleep, power up the lifeboat hangar, keep the oxygen flowing, and initiate the self-destruct sequence. Consult your science officers to gain insights into how the Phage works. Send your engineers to jury-rig mechanisms to keep the Phage at bay. Task your operations personnel with keeping the oxygen flowing and the power online. Order your security officers to cover the retreat of your crew. How many can you save from humanity's first encounter with the Phage?

In this strategic solitaire game, you play cards that represent your crew members to different areas of the ship. The game also plays "Phage" cards representing the ever-advancing influence of the alien fungus to the same areas. Using a simple trick-taking mechanic, you quickly determine whether the humans successfully achieve their goals (such as powering up the Bio Lab or restoring the oxygen supply by repairing the oxygen scrubbers), or whether the Phage have killed off the humans attempting to do so.

Each "station" on the ship provides different winning and losing effects, and managing these effects in the face of the onslaught of the Phage is the key to rescuing crew members from the ship. You win by activating the self-destruct sequence and destroying all of the Phage. You lose if the Phage escapes the ship. Your score at the end of the game is how many of your crew members escape.
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking

name: Illeria
description:
Illeria is a fantasy wargame, in which players control small parties of former prisoners, who fight for survival on the defunct prison island of Illeria. Illeria plays like a cross between a skirmish-style wargame and 3D-chess. Battles are fought on two parallel boards: the harsh Illerian desert of the physical world, and the mystical and surreal badlands of the spirit world. Characters exist in both worlds, and actions in one world often affect the other. For example, characters can spend actions in one world to boost their counterpart, and killing a character in one world greatly harms them in the other.

Illeria is a miniatures-agnostic game, in which you can play with any models you have. It can be played as either a one-off game, or as part of an ongoing campaign.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Escaping Mars
description: In Escaping Mars, you role play as one of the last remaining citizens of Colony 7, a settlement on a post-terraformed Red Planet (which has been overrun by a ruthless gang known as The Brotherhood of Broken Skulls), in the year 3254. During play, your goal is to get past the baddies, find the "battery unit," power up the last working drone transport, fend off other citizens who have the same idea, and get out while you still can.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: TOKKA Race
description:
TOKKA Race is a dexterity game where wooden pieces are used to construct the boundaries of a race track. The players use finger-flicks to send small pucks around the track, a la Carrom.
During the race players can unlock one-use special abilities, e.g. when another puck is moved outside the game boundaries, which give them an extra move or allows them to try to flick another player outside of the game boundaries.
The race lasts five rounds and whoever crosses the finish line first is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Flicking, Modular Board, Race

name: ExoTerra
description:
Welcome to the universe of ExoTerra, a sandbox strategy game with tactical planning, deep customization, and enemies who are complex and highly challenging.

ExoTerra is played cooperatively by 1 to 4 players over the course of many sorties in a campaign. Each Player takes on the role of a Pilot in charge of requisitioning equipment, personnel, supplies, and, most importantly, Jackets – massive humanoid weapon systems, to be customized and fielded in battle.

Leveraging a new system of enemy generation, battles should always feel different, even if facing the same enemies. This is accomplished through several factors of enemy customization that force players to assess each situation individually. You can rely on your experience from past battles, but must be able to change your strategy on the fly based on the variables of the mission.

You can learn more about ExoTerra on our website - Wyldegames.com

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – Go Brandon Variant Pack
description:
An expansion pack to Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – because racism didn't end in 2020!

All-new game cards based on the events of 2021 & 2022 – the pandemic, the Biden administration, etc. – with new jokes, artwork, and the harsh realities of a “post-racial” society.

9 "Proof of Vaccination" cards, 4 new property/Deed cards, and 23 new game cards for "vaccinated-only" players.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: GOOCON Dice 1v1 Basketball
description:
The dice determine distance traveled and field goal percentage.
The player controls the walking direction.
Attacker can choose to move or shoot.

First to 15 points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers
publishers: Goocon CO., LTD (雁隼有限公司)

name: BALL American Football Board Game
description:
BALL is a turn-based board game for two players. Both the aesthetics of the game and the rules are inspired by American football. The main objective of the game is to score a touchdown. Luck, elements of randomness or chance do not intervene in the game. Strategy is everything. Concentration, foresight and the development of game tactics are the key.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Craft & Conquer: Medieval
description:
Craft and Conquer: Medieval is a fun and competitive game of conquest where you collect, craft, deploy and conquer other players in classic turn-based strategy gameplay.

Resources are gathered and used to build your armies which are deployed to achieve objectives while defending against or attacking your opponents’ units and settlements. The game is played in approximately 60 to 120 minutes depending on the number players and objectives in play.

To play the game, all players are given a number of objective cards to complete. The first player to complete that number of objectives ends the game. But be weary, he or she may
not be the actual winner. The player with the most points scored by the total value of their objective cards will become the “king of the land”.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Le jeu des Armées
description:
One of the few pre-WWII wargames from Belgium. Featuring a board on heavy card stock with various terrain features and a superimposed grid for movement of units. Playing pieces (of wood) representing artillery, infantry and other units. Each unit has a value on the bottom to represent the impact of capture.

—user summary
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rapture: Climate
description:
You can control many things in the battle, but the forces of nature remain unpredictable.

Expose your battlegroups to the elements with the Climate Add-On and put their will to survive to the test under the most inhospitable conditions. Choose a season, location, and time of day for your game, and customize each game using a multitude of combinations of weather conditions and dangerous environmental impacts. Nightly skirmishes on a storm-battered seashore or icy cold snow storms in the middle of a city? Uncertain times are brewing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: O'Tali's Bizaare
description:
O'Tali's Bizaare is a culmination of shops, inn's, gambling dens, hired guns, and more! The vendors in O'Tali's Bizzare either thrive in the chaotic ebb and flow of the bizarre or owe the Merchant's Guild a debt. These same vendors often travel outside the safety of the bizarre to find rare resources, priceless artifacts, or slay great beasts to make unique items sell in their shops. The market is competitive, and vendors must do whatever it takes to stay in demand.

Gameplay:

O'Tali's Bizaare is a engine building RPG were players try to gain the most from their sales, over a limited set of rounds. The day/night cycle gives players a wide array of actions to take and ways to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Crimewave: California
description:
Sun, surf, sand… and serial killers. It’s 1970-something in California, hippy culture is rife, things are getting groovy, and serial murders are at their peak. Public panic is high but arrests are still low, so you and your fellow investigators (or just a bunch of friends) have been tasked with solving these heinous crimes.

Crimewave: California is a hidden movement co-op game. Players choose to play as one of the investigator roles or take on the task of controlling the three criminals.

One player operates as all three killers, who reside in secret locations across the board. On each turn, that player places down crime scenes to try and increase public panic and outsmart the investigators.

On their turn, investigators will move around the board in an effort to locate the killers' residences. Their goal is to work together to find out where the killers are residing by piecing together crime scenes. Investigators also roll dice to try and verify evidence at different crime scenes, which they'll use during the trial phase.

When the investigators successfully take the killers to trial, they go into a courtroom face-off and play defense and prosecution cards to try and increase and decrease their own score.

The winner is the player with the highest card score at the end of the trial. For the investigators, the way to win the game is to jail all three killers. Alternatively, if the public panic marker reaches 10 before the killers are jailed, the player controlling all three killers wins the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Memory, Neighbor Scope, Pattern Building

name: The Game of BUFFALO
description:
Any number of persons can play the Game, from two up. The mode of playing the Game with but two Players is different than when played by three or more.

It will be seen that the Deck is composed of Books consisting of four Cards each, and the name of the Book is indicated by the center line in large type on all four Cards constituting any one book. The top line of each Card indicates which particular Card that Card is of a certain book. The three bottom names on each Card indicate, for the convenience of the Player, what the names or top lines of the other Cards composing that particular Book are.

The object in a game is for a Player to acquire all the Cards composing any one Book. When he has accomplished this he places the four Cards on the table before him to be counted as one trick at the end of the Game, unless he shall lose said Book in the manner described in the following rules.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: The Path Seekers
description:
The Path Seekers is a sandbox tabletop experience that brings players back to an ancient China fantasy world. You are playing as one of the young protagonists who starts off with a modest background. With tremendous hard work and determination, you set off living your dream to make a difference in this treacherous time.

On players' turn, they will perform up to 3 main actions using multi-use Actions cards to move around and interact with locations on the board to improve their protagonist's attributes, and to befriend all kinds of interesting characters to help you with their special powers.

You may travel to visit different clans, learn from more than 20 new skills in the form of Action cards to execute more challenging missions, explore the uncharted cave for what lies within or hunt dangerous animals to gain precious resources and go on many more adventures. Prestige will be earned in many ways from successful missions, event interactions, gold and virtue etc.

At the end of twelve months, the player with the most Prestige will be titled the winner.

Will you succeed on your quests to gain a prestigious reputation or succumb to the growing pressure and regress into obscurity? Your journey starts now as The Path Seekers.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, End Game Bonuses, Events, Multi-Use Cards, Stat Check Resolution

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Badar Promo Cards
description:
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card that were included with the Badar First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

2 Glossary Cards for new living glossary: Cleave and Sealed.
New Gear: Toxicimitar with Sealed bonus and gain the Crescent Step Secret Fighting Art.
New Secret Fighting Art: Crescent Step with the new Cleave action.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Badar
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Badar drank from the chalice of black sand and embarked on his quest to slay the moon. Hatred boils within his guts, the catalyst needed to vomit black glass steps and ascend the stairless tower where his foe awaits.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Last Haiku
description:
Then the dreams overtook me. I conversed with the thousand poets long dead, they who trod the roads weaving toward eternity and never returned. In the morning’s warm embrace, my limbs felt their old vigor and the undeniable desire to travel. To seize the horizon. To behold hidden wonders. To exhume the words that will give life to my LAST HAIKU.

Last Haiku is a one-player adventure card game with a dose of creative writing. You are the latest in a long line of poets feeling your age, and you know you are not long for this world. Yet you also feel the call of distant, uncanny, and wondrous places where you might seek the inspiration to write one last haiku to leave to the ages to inspire future generations of poets, who may themselves discover stranger, more distant places to spark the words of their own haiku.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few index cards and a pen. Each game will add new cards, either maps of locations or haiku your poet composed. The rules provide all the guidance you need for creating new cards and selecting the game’s thematic elements, which makes every copy of Last Haiku an evolving, unique world. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. There is no limit to the places you can visit and the poetry you can compose.

Each turn of the game involves playing cards of the appropriate distance. If the card was created in a previous game, your poet travels deeper into the frontier. If you cannot play an existing card, you create a new site on a card and your poet is inspired to write a line of haiku, these lines recorded on a separate card. The game ends when you have written each of three lines forming your poet’s last haiku, and your score equals the total of the distances of the new sites visited. Each new site and your haiku then enter the deck permanently.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Ultimate Board Game
description:
The Ultimate Board Game is an exciting, competitive, fun game for 2 to 8 adults. The game is inspired by Ultimate and reproduces the dynamics of a tournament between two teams, consisting of a Match, a Party and a Final Match. To become The Ultimate Champion Team, collect the most victory points from the three stages of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Revengineers!: The Reverse Engineering Party Dice Game
description:
Revengineers! is a 3 to 10-player party game.

You and your fellow Revengineers are in a race to reverse engineer computer “viruses”, so that the Cybercrime Division can trace them to their source and catch the hackers in their hideouts.

Each player takes it in turn to become a “virus”, and draws 1 to 3 Program Cards. The other players use dice rolls as inputs for that virus program. The Virus Player looks at the dice rolled, and speaks the output, as described by their Program Cards. This continues until one of the Revengineers successfully determines what the Program Cards say.

With increasing levels of difficulty, this game is exciting for adults and kids alike. If you can read, and do basic arithmetic, you can play this game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition

name: Tokyo Sidekick: Special Event Scenario – Akihabara Web
description:
Delve into a new story unfolding in Tokyo!

Experience a frightening new story for Tokyo Sidekick! People are disappearing from Akihabara's idol music scene, and Hi-Q and Haruki want to know why. Join your favorite characters - and a few new ones - as they face a challenge that will really test your teamwork! Can you stop this new Menace in time?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game
publishers: Japanime Games, Little Future (リトルフューチャー)

name: What's The Deal?
description:
A deck-builder that has players competing to build influence by collecting Prospects base upon famous personalities from around the world.

2-5 players draw resources of Energy, Skills and Confidence that they use to pay for Prospects ranging from politicians to tech innovators to washed up celebrities. These Prospects have bonus abilities that can turn the tide of the game. Collecting Prospects gains Influence Points. When the Draw Deck is depleted, the player with the most influence wins.

But watch out for the Meetings! When a meeting card is drawn, the game play pauses and the players vote using their resources to turn the game on its head.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting

name: Duel Arena
description:
Duel Arena is a strategic resource management game in a medieval fantasy setting. Each player takes control of a Hero with unique abilities and must travel around the Arena collecting weapons and armour to become stronger. You must carefully manage the use of your items, as well as your Gold and Health. Only by correctly leveraging these resources will you be able to outmaneuver your opponents and claim victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sentenced to Death
description:
A card game where you form inappropriate sentences about your fellow players.
Each player starts with several words chosen at random on cards. Player 1 says their name (or name of someone all players know) and then Player 2 plays a card to get the sentence going followed by Player 3 etc (eg Simon likes to play...).
The object of the game is to keep the sentence going whilst still making sense.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Storytelling

name: ¡Extinción!: Dinobotsaurus Promo card
description: One Extra Card Add-on for subscribers of the RabbitZs and Robots verkami Campaign. The card has an image, but no text.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Heros Fusion: Starter Pack #1
description:
With this first starter pack, 2 players can play right out of the box with preconstructed decks !

Heros Fusion is a collectible card game that uses characters from the Heros Fusion novels.

Before the game, players need to build their own deck of 20 cards, cards that come in four different classes : super heroes, villains, allies and animated objects.

Players will fight to build the best team of super heroes on the table !

On his turn, a player has 2 actions. There are 3 possible actions : draw a card, play a card (and eventually its effect), or use the power of a card that is already on the table. It's that simple ! Of course, cards will interact with each other, and players will have to correctly manage them to be efficient.

The first player that reaches a Power Level of 25 with his active cards triggers the endgame ; all other players get a last turn. Then, the player with the most powerful team wins the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Force Commitment, Hand Management

name: Roar: The Card Game
description:
Roar The Card Game puts you in charge of your very own dinosaur park. In this 2-4 player game you will compete against other players to build the best dinosaur park over the Cretaceous, Jurassic, and Triassic periods. But watch out an extinction event can disrupt your plans at any moment, and dinosaurs running around outside of your park are bad business.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Pyramids!: Curse of the Pharaoh
description:
Osiris was Pharaoh, the first God King of Egypt and future farther of Horus, he was a great Pharaoh, but was murdered by Seth his brother the God of Chaos, who hid his body within the great Cursed Pyramid, guarded by fourteen Shabtis, Guardians of the Undead. Isis, Osiris’s faithful wife, pleads with you the wisest Warrior in all of Egypt to help her rescue the Pharaoh Osiris from the Pyramid so he can travel to the afterlife, but to rescue the Pharaoh’s spirit, you must defeat the evil Pyramid guards. The future of the whole of “Egypt”, is in your hands.

Light, Solitaire-style game for 1-2 Players.
Ages 12+ takes about 20-30 minutes and is an Egyptian Theme, filler game.

Solo play is fun as you battle to rescue the Pharaoh, the Solo game is quite a challenge so prepare to lose a few games.

Overall - Light filler, good for family game night and waiting for friends to arrive or to fill in some time with a bit of fun or for some quick Solo challenging play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Elements
description:
Elements consists of cards with two properties: the element (earth, water, air, fire) and the shape (circle, triangle, square, pentagon). There are also Single Cards with only one property and the rare Element Cards that can transform into any card.

Each player starts with eight random cards. The first card from the drawing pile gets turned over and the players continue the series. The first player who has laid out all of their cards wins the game.

In their turn, a player can lay out as many cards as they want as long as the element or the shape from the top card is continued. Once made, the decision between element or shape cannot be changed while laying out cards (For example: A water circle is the top card. The player lays out a water circle and then a fire circle. With the fire circle they chose "shape" and are able to lay out earth or air circles but no other shapes).

If a player is unable to lay out any card, they draw three cards and the direction of the game changes. This enables the players to make strategic decisions on which cards to lay out and in what order.

-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Power For The People
description:
Power for the People is a political satire game that recreates the current divisive political environment. Players take on the role of an already powerful party leader. Each party leader is revered and respected by supporters and opponents alike, but are plagued with an insatiable desire for more power. Power is gained by gathering support from the party and by winning the influenceable party members of opponents’.

One party leader is the chairman for the round and takes on certain roles and responsibilities. He or she starts the round by saying, “for the people” at which point everyone picks up the hand they have been dealt and begins to play in an orderly fashion, always abiding by the rules and laws.
