Proper respect and decorum must be maintained during play including only speaking at appropriate times and only when required by rules and laws. Players keep each other in check by giving a penalty card from the top of the deck for observed deviation from the rules and laws. One player wins the round by playing his or her last card and proclaiming “Power for the People!”. The winning player collects power, creates a secret law, and becomes the chairman for the next round.

Play continues with the next round. All of the existing rules and laws are in force, but now a secret law is in play. Opponents of the new chairman must deduce the action or lack of action that the secret law requires. Doing so will avoid penalties and enable a potential future win allowing him or her to gain power and write a secret law of their own, for which he or she can penalize other players.

By the final round there may be up to 10 secret laws in effect. At this point it becomes challenging to remember all the laws and rules in order to avoid getting additional cards through penalties. At the end of the final round, the player with the most power becomes the Supreme Leader!

To review, in Power For The People, players establish the party platform, gain power, create and follow secret laws, penalize offenders, and become Supreme Leader!
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Set Collection, Take That

name: Discover The Way
description:
Discover The Way is a strategic game that requires adaptation, planning, risk vs reward choices, and luck. Each player builds the world as the game is played and the decisions start off right away. Players need to decided if they are going to defend, attack, upgrade, or a combination.

Each player has a relic to grab from another player’s board which means that they will have two relics from other players on their board. Each player also has customizable dice that can be upgraded during game play. The boards start empty and as the players move and do discoveries the world begins to fill out. The first player to retrieve both of their relics and bring them back to their base wins.

On your turn you will roll three dice (more can be purchased later). Each die has one gold, one wood, one stone, and three movement. You can only bank the gold and the others need to be used that turn. Anything rolled could be used for movement instead of the resources rolled. You use movement to create pathways to your relics. You can use gold to discover more gold, wood, and stone Tetris like pieces which can also be used to block other players. After you make a discovery you can take that resource and modify your dice to improve your future rolls. Other combinations of resources are used to build walls, bridges, and more soldiers. When you have your relic you can only move at half speed to bring it back to base. After someone drops both relics off at base the game immediately ends with that person as victor.

-description from designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Re-rolling and Locking, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Catacombs Playmat Upgrade and expansion
description:
This entry is both an upgrade to Catacombs (Third Edition) and adds new content from the 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

This exclusive Upgrade version of Catacombs 3E (not available at retail) includes:

Six double-sided neoprene playmats instead of the game boards in the retail version of Catacombs 3E
The new “Kallax shelf” friendly extra large box and two organizing trays instead of the single organizing tray in the retail version
The new wall system including custom plastic stands
The fully revised and updated 36 page Reference manual
The new 40 page Tutorial manual
The new large obstacle pieces


The six, double-sided playmats included with this set:


Campfire | Stone Altar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Lava Tube | Root Cellar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Mausoleum | Throne Room (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Scavewyrm Pit | Forthstron River (the playmat that accompanies the Wyldlands expansion)
Wild Woodlands | Poisonwood Bridge (from the Wyverns of Wylemuir expansion)
Ice Cavern / Quartz Grotto (the playmat that accompanies Resurrection Packs 1 & 2. Note: the game board version is called Resurrection Pack 3)


Includes the components and rulebooks (where applicable) for the following Catacombs expansions, packed inside the upgrade box:

Ice Box (Elzra exclusive)
Wyldlands (Elzra exclusive)
mechanics: Flicking, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Nitroplus Card Masters: EX
description:
This game is the 4th expansion to Dominion Nitroplus Card Masters.

It features 305 cards with characters from "Hello, World.", Axanael, Phantom of Inferno, Kikokugai - The Cyber Slayer, Song of Saya, Deus Machina Demonbane, Sumaga Special, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa, Outlaw Django ~ Zoku: Satsuriku no Django, Sonicomi, Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia, Tokyo Necro, Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet, Expelled from Paradise, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa Makai Hen, D.Y.N. Freaks, Chaika - The Coffin Princess, and PSYCHO-PASS.

This expansion also adds New Victory and Coin Cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Nitroplus Card Masters: Edge
description:
This game is the 3rd expansion to Dominion Nitroplus Card Masters.

It features 190 cards with characters from "Hello, World.", Axanael, Phantom of Inferno, Kishin Hishou Demonbane, Guilty Crown: Lost Christmas, Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer, Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia, Gekkou no Carnevale, Deus Machina Demonbane, Hanachirasu, Jingai Makyou, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa, Kimi to Kanojo to Kanojo no Koi, Phenomeno, PSYCHO-PASS, and Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Elven Throne
description:
Elven Throne emulates the art of political maneuvering and strategic thinking within a fantasy realm. It combines novel social-networking like mechanics with alliances and counter action chains. Houses can influence and use the help of civilians and beasts, get to control organizations and much more. Up to seven Houses, each with unique characters and abilities, forge alliances and fight to gain influence over the realm.

Organizations, tile maps with hexagonal spaces, link together to form a large play surface. Players move their characters into organizations, activate tiles, and counterattack their rivals in their quest for the Elven Throne. With over 50 characters, variable setup options, and multiple win conditions, each playthrough is a unique experience.

With over 50 characters, variable setup options, and multiple win conditions, each playthrough promises a unique experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Koomi
description:
Koomi is a fun learning game to teach children basic math skills by trying to reach the number -10 or 10 using addition, subtraction or special cards.

On a players turn, they must play cards on top of the last played card and reach +10 or -10, or draw one card from the top of the stack. The player may play at most one of the special cards. Special cards can change the start number, change the sign of the card from + to - or reverse, let a player get rid of a card, or make all players move one space in a clockwise direction.

First player to get rid of all cards wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Team Halloween
description:
A round based, dedicated deck card game based on Halloween night, where 3 random Halloween Monsters have appeared at the mansion at the end of your cul-de-sac and it is up to you to defeat them!

To do so you will recruit Trick-or-Treaters as they come down your street! Once on your Team you will assign them to an infantry dedicated to a specific monster.

In order to pick first you must win the Pumpkin Picking Contest by picking the lowest numbered pumpkin! However, pick the rotten one and you can't pick a Trick-or-treater!

On your turn you can assign weapons and friends to your Teams, pick on your opponents or save your turn and defend yourself against your opponents!

First to prepare the 3 Teams with enough Hits to beat each Monster wins! Play against your opponents or Team up in pairs and save Halloween night!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Auction

name: Relay Rivals
description: Relay Rivals is a competitive team-based racing game where teams are trying to be the first to the finish line of an Epic Relay Race. As you navigate the course there will be hazards and power ups that will make the course harder or easier. However, going after the power ups causes you to detour off course which could be the difference between winning and losing the race. So your teams will have to discuss which pathway you want to go. Throughout the course you will stop at 3 Arenas! These arenas are the proving grounds where your team will relay race against the clock! Each team member will perform a different task while their teammates guess correct answers. You will need to get all of the tasks done in a row before the three-minute timer goes off in order to keep advancing down the board. Once you have made it to and completed the 3rd Arena you have reached the finish line and are the winners of Relay Rivals!
categories: Party Game, Racing, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Catch the Leader

name: Animo: Cross Trainers – Stagnetic Strategy Deck
description:
Stand Firm! The Stagnetic Strategy Deck features everything you need to start playing Animo! Use this deck to play the game mode "Hide it in Your Heart" with up to 5 players- OR- use this deck as a stand alone to challenge up to 3 other players (each with their own decks) in the more strategic game, "Sharpen Your Sword". This deck contains 54 collectible game cards from the latest Cross Trainers expansion. Also included is a deck box, score tracker, power tokens, a Stagnetic themed poster playmat, full game instructions, and a shiny holographic Stagnetic Ultra card!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Memory
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Yay, May-or, Nay
description:
The goal of Yay, May-or, Nay is to work with your team to make it to the Mayor's office. You do this by answering questions anywhere from logic puzzles to open-ended opinion questions to move across the board. These questions are scenarios you may encounter as mayor or problems that could happen in a city. One player takes on the role of "Council Master" and judge the answers of the two teams deciding whether they can move on or repeat the question. The Council Master will have two biases from the bias deck that inform their opinion about proposed answers.

This game encourages players to think through logical arguments and their reasoning behind their answers. No matter how good the end solution is, if a player does not support it with a logical argument, they will fail that question. This games also encourages teamwork as the players except for the Council Master are split into two separate teams who must work together.

The end goal of this game is to be able to use it in the classroom to teach logic, argument skills, teamwork, and engage students. It was created with a math classroom (specifically geometry) but it can be used in any classroom, especially government classes.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Party Game, Political, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Bias, Dice Rolling, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: Distress Call: A Game of Cubes and Corporate Reacquisition
description:
Congratulations on successfully completing the hiring process for the Corporate Reacquisitions Department. As a newly inducted permanent employee of CORECorp, you will soon have the privilege of answering Distress Calls, urgent summons for aid from fellow employees, where you will proceed to secure all of their issued company property and return it safely to the nearest Processing Facility. Distressed employees are not eligible for rescue or relief at this time.

In Distress Call, players will assume the roles of crew members aboard a Corporate Reacquisitions ship, specialists who have been tasked with securing specific types of cargo. Taking turns, following the lead of the Employee of the Moment, players will divide up company assets, choosing pallets of randomly sorted cargo.

Once all the cargo has been seized, each crew member will deposit their pallet's cargo into a locked storage container. The three shared storage containers are only opened at the end of the game, so each crew member will have to remember where they stored cargo as well as what type of cargo other crew members stored.

After answering three Distress Calls, sorting and securing cargo each time, the ship will set its autopilot for the nearest Processing Facility where the containers with the least Space Trash are deposited and their contents scored. Make more points than the other crew members by ensuring the return of your specialized cargo to win the game!

-description from designer
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Animo: Cross Trainers – Draylight Strategy Deck
description: Dive Deeper! The Draylight Strategy Deck features everything you need to start playing Animo! Use this deck to play the game mode "Hide it in Your Heart" with up to 5 players- OR- use this deck to challenge up to 3 other players (each with their own decks) in the strategic game mode, "Sharpen Your Sword". This deck contains 54 collectible game cards from the latest Cross Trainers expansion. Also included is a deck box, score tracker, power tokens, a Draylight themed poster playmat, full game instructions, and a shiny, holographic Draylight Ultra card!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Animo: Red Letter Day – Percy Strategy Deck
description: The Percy 54 Card Strategy Deck is packed with everything you need to start playing! This Hope/Faith themed deck is built around beloved character, "Percy" and features Percy themed deck box, punch tokens, scoring trackers and poster playmat accordingly. This deck also includes an exclusive Percy Lv. 2 foil card and a Percy miniature figure for tracking your defeated Sinnies! This deck is pre-structured for 1 player to play Sharpen Your Sword (each player needs their own deck)- it plays great on it's own, but can also be customized by swapping and trading cards from other decks or packs. Red Letter Day cards are cross compatible with other Animo expansions!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Black Seas: Hold Fast! Supplement
description:
Black Seas focuses on the golden age of sail, which encompasses the period between 1770 and 1830. During this period the navies of Europe and beyond fight for dominance of the high seas. Hold Fast! is a supplement for the Black Seas age of sail game. Inside, find new ways to play, such as charting your course as an independent smuggler or following a navy career from lieutenant to admiral.

Fight in 16 new scenarios that range between cat-and-mouse chases, shallow river battles, passenger escorts, and mutinies. All culminating the explosive Battle of the Nile which saw the spectacular demise of the French Flagship L'Orient.

Launch new famous ships, such as HMS Agamemnon, Santa Ana, or USS Niagara. Commission new captains of renown for the British, French, Spanish, and US navies, such as Louis-Antoine-Cyprien Infernet or John Paul Jones. Or set sail with entirely new fleets from the Russian, Swedish, Dutch, Portuguese, or Ottoman Empire navies. Alternatively become the scourge of the Mediterranean at the head of a Barbary Cost pirate fleet.

Finally, alongside all the new additional advanced rules and ship statistics, enjoy three solo scenarios or introduce the nightmare terrors of the deep that are born from sailors' superstitions.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: Chess Set
description:
In celebration of Jim Henson’s imagination we are releasing this highly collectible chess set. It features finely detailed figurines sculpted by Johny Fraser-Allen.

A traditional chess set, played in the traditional way. Also has an alternate side with the board to play 'Shurro'. Shurro is a game derived from chess, by the mind of Alessio Cavatore.

It allows you to choose your own ‘chess army’ before every game, so that each player will have a different set of pieces. The obstacles on the board also change position every time you play, ensuring that each game will present new challenges. It’s chess, but not as you know it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Relative Movement

name: Rolling Dungeons
description:
You and your friends become brave warriors and take the first step in the dungeon.

You roll two dice and follow the dice, catch the monsters, open the treasure box, rest, and finally catch the boss monster.

Who can take over the dungeon the fastest?

-description from the designer drawanything
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Roll / Spin and Move

name: CobbleCritters
description:
In CobbleCritters, you’ll duel another Tamer for control of the Cavern, a mystical space filled with powerful Crystals.

In the game, you build two decks — a Critter deck and a Special deck — and you can always choose which to draw from. Critters are your monsters while Specials are a grab-bag of tricky hijinks, trinkets, and rule-warping events. You refill your entire 6-card hand every turn, giving the game's cardplay a fast pace.
A player's board is a grid split into two areas, the Hideout and the Cavern. Players prepare their Critters in the Hideout and then send them to the Cavern to battle for Crystals, a precious resource that functions as score.

Critters have stats used for battle and a “Star Rank." Critters can be upgraded from 1 to 2 and then 3 Stars to power them up. They also have card text that grants them a wide variety of combo-able powers.

Strategic positioning, clever deckbuilding, and a pinch of luck are key to victory in the Caverns!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Drawing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle for the Empire
description:
'Battle for the Empire' is a competitive strategy game, set in the Roman Empire. A game for 3-5 players, players must amass legions, horde gold, and gain senate support to control the board.

With 15 different Emperors to choose from, each player has unique abilities and traits to take advantage of during the game.
Every player resolves a number of phases per turn:
They will first collect tax from the Provinces they own and also gather Senate Support points according to the number of their Provinces. They then decide how many Legions to pay for and recruit, and place them anywhere they have a Garrison stationed.

From there, the player moves any number of Legions they wish, into whatever provinces they share borders with; this could mean conquering a new location, regrouping with their Garrisons or Invading another player!

If an Invasion occurs, the players concerned must resolve the conflict - first based on numbers, then Emperor's traits, and then the use of ability cards!

Once a conflict is resolved, the player will draw a Catastrophe card!
Catastrophes will threaten to destroy you throughout the game by costing you Gold, Legions or Senate Support. Many Emperors will have traits that can help them against certain Catastrophes. Otherwise, the player must rely on sound strategy and luck to survive and conquer! Each Catastrophe can effect either the current player, or other players depending on circumstance!

The game is an elimination process; if an Emperor loses any one of the main three currencies (Gold, Senate Support & Legions), then they die and are eliminated.

Once there are only two remaining players, the rush begins - the first Emperor to 20 Provinces wins the game!
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Dice, Territory Building
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Cutthroat Ninja: Defensive Booster Pack
description:
Tired of having your Attacks, stolen, swapped and discarded? Or having your Poison Dart and Dragon Rages getting moved around in your Attack List?

Well no more! With this Booster Pack you simply shuffle these cards into your original Cutthroat Ninja deck and play!

No you can have the ability to:


Block
Reverse
Hide in the Shadows
Play a Secret Move
Assign an armored guard to the Target
Provide the Target with an Armor.


Make Cutthroat Ninja that more wild with this Defensive Booster Pack!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Koala Kraze
description:
Use the powers of your koalas to get rid of your cards first to win! Invented by Sofia and Luca, two siblings under 10 who mostly get along.

Get everyone to the table! Koala Kraze is for 2-8 players ages 6 and up, and you'll learn to play in 2 minutes. The game's 100 cards fit in a small box, so you can take it with you anywhere you go!

We commissioned some amazing hand-painted koalas just for this game, and their personalities burst through the cards!

Ready for Extreme mode? Start with the Junior mode to keep it simpler for younger kids, or try Extreme mode for older kids and adults!

Koala Kraze is a family-friendly game where the goal is to use your Koala Friends to discard all your cards first. If you've played Uno, Crazy Eights, or any other card-shedding game, you already know how to play!

Shuffle the deck, deal some cards out, and you're ready to play! Each turn, you'll play a Number card or a Koala card. Number cards can be played if they're one above or one below the Number card on the discard pile. If a Koala card's on top, play any number card you like! Each Koala card has a special power to help you play or discard more cards. Use the Burglar to switch hands with another player, or play the Big Boss to make a player discard a Koala card.

You can play two modes with the same cards. The simpler 'Junior' version is all about getting rid of your cards first, which is great for younger kids. A game like this is great for teaching colors and numbers, or for recognizing colors and numbers as the game gets fast!

If playing with older kids or adults, the 'Extreme' version adds a bit more challenge while keeping the core gameplay the same. As you play, pay attention to the scoring icons which say 'plus' or 'minus'. Sometimes the card you want to play will cost you points, so be careful! Some Koalas (like the Disk Jockey) will help discard those cards so they won't hurt your score, and a waypoint system ensures you can't go below certain milestones once you've achieved them.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monopoly: Fall Guys Ultimate Knockout
description:
In this exciting edition of the Monopoly game, players buy up as many Rounds as they can. The more Rounds they own, the more Kudos they can collect. Players move around the board as a Fall Guys character token, performing wild actions such as jumping, grabbing, and falling to victory! Besides dodging the 3D obstacles, players collect valuable Crowns when passing Go, and roll the Knockout die to change gameplay.

Go past GO to collect a Crown, the game ends when all Crowns have been claimed.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Animo: Red Letter Day – Treashell Strategy Deck
description: The Treashell 54 Card Strategy Deck is packed with everything you need to start playing! This Love/Spirit themed deck is built around the brand-new character, "Treashell" and features Treashell themed deck box, punch tokens, scoring trackers and poster playmat accordingly.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: RockBottom
description:
RockBottom is all about having fun while drinking and chatting with friends.

Two young college students came up with the first matching-card game that never repeats, and can get you drunk as fast or slow as you want to. The rules are simple, yet super entertaining.

Perfect game for groups of 5+, but three players will also do. Up to 10. Just grab a drink with friends and spend a funny evening chatting and drinking.

Have a great time playing with friends and share your playing-drinking experience with us!

Will you hit RockBottom?

In this game, the first player to collect four identical cards (e.g., 4 Rich Pig cards) wins the round and scores points. Watch out—there are a few more good conditions ?

Players drink a sip every round, except the winner. Each card type has its own score number printed in a corner, which determines how many sips your opponents must drink in a round and adds up to your game score. Whoever holds the Joker card must drink double in that round. The Joker card is always visible to others and, once received, it cannot be passed until the next round. The first player to score 25 or more points (if there are no threes and fours in the game, recommended for groups of 3-5 players) or 50 or more points (if there are threes and fours in the game, recommended for 5 or more players) wins the whole game and forces others to drink double. Whoever holds the Joker at the end of the game drinks quadruple. The Joker also reduces your score by -6 points (if there are no threes and fours in the game) or -8 points (if there are threes and fours in the game).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Deepest Valley
description:
You rule a fantasy realm during the final battle of the ancient wars. The Battle of the Deepest Valley. Your armies have been driven from the field, and your treasury drained, but you have one advantage, and one last chance at victory.

Deepest Valley is a fantasy strategy gamezine for 2 to 5 players. A complete hand-drawn hex and dice wargame in zine format. Plays in 1 hour (2 players), to 3 hours (5 players). Comes with a large fold-out map, carry case, and *lots* of dice.

"They say the valley has always been at war. That it always will be... They call it the Deepest Valley. Say it will never fill up. No matter how many bodies we throw in, or how much gold we bury them under. To the other realms it's a strategic key, a prize to win at any cost. We remember a time when there was peace in the valley. We are the children of the mountains, and the valley is our cradle. We know there can be peace in the valley again. There will be peace. Once our realm takes it back!"

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bribery, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Empires of Influence
description:
Knowledge is power, and applied knowledge is freedom. Countries have risen from the ashes because of it, others have succumbed for lack of it. Now, it's your turn. Your era. Will you rise to the occasion and grow your empire? Or be devoured by the other leaders at the table?

Empires of Influence is a board game that embodies the true struggle for power. It merges strategy and economics with trivia. Put your general knowledge to the test by answering questions about geography, culture, and economics, and compete for industries, big business deals, and state contracts. There are over 360 playable cards to enjoy, country cards, industry cards, news cards, and trivia cards.

The secret to conquering EOI lies in tapping into your instincts, flexing your decision-making prowess, and bringing your knowledge up to par. EOI exposes your mind to other cultures and expands your understanding of the world with quizzes and a general knowledge learning formula

Take a seat at the round table of world leaders with your friends and family, get comfy, and put your general knowledge to the test. You win by possessing all 8 countries and achieve world domination before the time runs out, or by amassing the most wealth, least debt, and possessing the most countries.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Loans, Negotiation, Ownership, Questions and Answers, Real-Time, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Trading

name: Yeah Nah!
description:
Yeah Nah! is a create your own luck card game for 2-4 players. The game play will have you making decisions on every turn that could change the outcome of the game. It will leave you wondering if you made the right decision, Yeah Nah!

Many decisions are centred around helping yourself or slowing down your opponent on the path to victory. The strategy and layers to the game means every game can have a different path to victory. With themes and feels from all classic family card games this game is sure to be a hit for those wanting to spice up the family card game genre with a bit more depth. Easy to learn, with layers to mastery.

Players draw and discard cards in an attempt to Lock a set. Each step has you deciding between advancing yourself or hindering your opponent/s.

Win by being the first to complete & “Lock” In all 3 Sets.


Standard 6 sided dice not included, but Dice Cards are for optional advanced game play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Doll Promo Cards
description:
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 2 x Gear Cards that were included with the Doll First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

1 Glossary Cards and
New Gear: Needle Sword and Mechanical Heart.
Gear card sneak peek: Mechanical Heart (item, metal, heavy, cursed, center)- Add 9 to all hit locations. Reduce damage you suffer to 1. You can no longer remove your armor gear or gain armor points.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Doll
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2x Gear Card, 1x Glossary Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Islamstory: The Messenger
description:
Islamstory The Messenger, is the best game based on the Messenger's life (Muhammad). Place your cards in chronological order, so as to reconstruct the story of the Messenger’s life (peace and blessings upon him).

Carefully shuffle the pack of cards and hand out 3 to 5 cards to each player according to the difficulty level you have chosen. 3 cards: easy; 4 cards: medium; 5 cards: difficult. Place the pile of remaining cards on the playing surface and turn over the first two cards from the deck; they shall be your starting point. Place the cards facing upwards in front of you. Choose a card, announce the title of the event and put it in the right place so as to reconstruct the story of the Messenger (peace and blessings upon him). You can also read the summary of the event if you need additional clues.

Once the card is placed, flip it over and check if it respects the chronology. If the card is correctly placed, keep it on the playing surface. If it is not the case, put the card in the discarded pile and draw a new card.

The first player to correctly place all their cards in order on the timeline, wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mistborn: House War – Hoid Promo Card
description:
Available at Gen Con 2022. The card states:

"Play at any time.

Until the end of the turn, the cost to solve 1 Problem is raised or lowered by any 1 resource."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Answer This: Friends
description:
WHO KNOWS WHO BETTER? - Answer questions about your friends or family. The first to answer 10 questions correctly wins the game. Get ready to unveil new info about your friends.
FUN GAME NIGHT - Hilarious game to get to know your friends even better. Real-life questions leading to interesting stories and amazing facts. Which friend knows you the best?
FAMILY FRIENDLY - The game is also suitable for families. Deepen your connection while having fun. You better not forget your aunt's birthday or your father's first car!
PERFECT GIFT - Bring the game to a pool party, birthday, road trip or camping. Perfect gift for everyone that values their friendships and family bonds.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Storytelling

name: Aura Hunters
description:
Aura Hunters
Young orphans become friends and bear the mark of the Aura Hunters.
A mystical-fantasy coop and competitive game for 1-4 players and a battle system with 8 different elements in the world of Lunaria.

Mechanics

+ a mystical and fairytale world

+ cooperative

+ competitive mode

+ 1-4 players

+ combat system with 8 different elements

+ Mighty and individual Aura Attacks

+ learn the old Aura language and discover the secrets

+ Monsterfarm building

+ a lot of Monsters and Bosses 50+

What happens in Aura Hunters?
The player is free to hunt the enemy, trade at different dealers or upgrade his Hunter. The unknown powers also moves towards the capital cities of the world. These must be intercepted and the corresponding tasks fulfilled. In addition, enemies drop special items and Aura with which the Hunter can individually improve his equipment and skills to make his own Hunter. And every kill of a monster fills the Monsterfarm with nice benefits.
All Hunters have 3 different ability trees and their own mighty Aura Attacks.

If all "Gates" are closed and the Big Bosses are defeated, then you have reached the end of the game....MAYBE....
Also learn the old Aura language and discover the secrets.

Playtime & Save
You can easily end your session if one gate is closed. Next time you will go on with the next one. Just save your experience and stuff on the save-block. For each gate you will need around 120min. and a max. to close all the gates of around 35h.

Competitive mode
If you have closed the first two gates in the coop mode, then you will know everything to play also the competitive mode. There are different scenarios where you can "lose your friends" ;)
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: Classic
description:
Classic miniatures from Lobotomy 1 are now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included new Daily Nightmare cards and the new monster cards compatible with Lobotomy 2! With this pack, you will be able to play five additional scenarios.

4 Patient (monsters)
4 Nurse
4 Scavenger
1 Clown
1 Construct
1 Antichrist
1 Nemesis
1 Warden.

Miniatures in this set are the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own these miniatures, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: Horror
description:
These horror miniatures from Lobotomy 1 are now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included Daily Nightmare cards and the new monster cards compatible with Lobotomy 2! With this pack, you will be able to play five additional scenarios.

1 Parasite
4 Body Snatchers
4 Damned Girls
1 Big Momma
1 Slasher
1 Twins
1 Witch (ver1)
1 Witch (ver2)
1 Vampire Cheerleader
1 Vampire Queen

Miniatures in this set are the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own these miniatures, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dicing with Dinner
description:
This is a cut-out-and-play game with a food/cooking theme.

The setting is a kitchen contest. Players take turns to roll dice to build up ingredient tokens, then get a chance to make recipes from a random selection of cards.

Recipes score points; first to the target score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Random Production

name: Master of War: Trading Card Game
description:
Master of War is a trading card game where your goal is to defend your Master of War and defeat the opponent one's by reducing their War point to 0 using your Soldier and War Weapon cards.

| WHAT'S INCLUDED IN THE GAME |
• 100 cards, enough to build two different decks and play with a friend
• The complete rule book

| HOW TO PLAY |
You need two players to play this game. Each player also needs a Master of War card, a Divine card, and a deck of 40 to 50 cards (compose of Soldier and War Weapon cards). You can have the same Soldier or War Weapon cards three times in a deck.
Players need to choose who goes first before starting the game
(ex; roll a dice) and then shuffle their deck.
When this is done, each player must place their Master of War (face up) and Divine card (face down) on the terrain.

| PHASES EXPLANATION |
- PHASE 1: Each player draws five cards at the start of a game. At your next turn, you draw one card unless you already got
five in your hand.
- PHASE 2: You then place your Soldier and War Weapon cards on the terrain.
- PHASE 3: In this phase, you can attack with Soldier, use War Weapon or use your Master of War or Divine card effect.
You cannot do any of this in the very first turn of the game.
- PHASE 4: End your turn. It’s now the opponent’s turn and after that, you restart at phase 1.

| CARD EXPLANATION |

MASTER OF WAR

This card represents the total amount of War Point you have for the game. Each Master of war is different with a unique stat and effect. This card is always placed face up before starting the game.
Functions in general
This card cannot attack other Soldier cards unless you have no more Soldier left. This card can attack an opponent Master of War directly if the following conditions are met: no Soldier in the enemy field and you have no Soldier card left. This card can use its unique effect during your phase three (or another phase depending of the effect description). A player loses the game when this card War Point reaches 0.


DIVINE

This card is used to turn the tide of a game with a one-time-only effect. This card is always placed face down before starting the game.
Functions in general
The Divine card cannot be attacked but can be affected by other card effect. This card can never be destroyed, but can only be used once. The Divine card has no stats, only a unique effect. When used, the card becomes face up.


SOLDIER

The Soldier card is the main way of protecting your Master of War and attacking enemy Soldier or Master of War. Soldier work in pair with War Weapon card most of the time. This card is always placed face up.
Functions in general
This card can attack enemy Soldier cards with their power and defend against them with their resistance stat. It’s the same thing against a Master of War. Soldier work with class effect. Each class has a unique effect, but it’s the same across the class (meaning two different Soldier with the Warrior class will have the same effect, but not the same stat). When a Soldier is destroyed, your Master of War loses the amount of War Point the card had originally. Also, when a Soldier card is destroyed, it goes to the graveyard.


WAR WEAPON

War Weapon have different kind of effects. This card is always placed face down until activation
Functions in general
This card can be used during your phase 3 (or another phase if stated otherwise). You can place up to five of them on the same turn. War Weapon end in the graveyard when used/no longer usable or if equipped on a Soldier that ends in the graveyard. This card come in three different types (equipment / turn-based/ instant effect).
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Beetleground
description:
Beetleground is a dexterity “dewling” game.

Players take turns aiming dew that’s dripping off overhanging leaves at beetles on a stump below. Beetles they knock off the stump are added to their collection.

The player that has a better beetle collection and more dew droplets closer to the stump’s center without knocking the ladybug off the stump wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Set Collection, Slide/Push

name: Retro Tetro
description:
Finalist in the 2023 Boulogne Billancourt International Contest.
Nominee for Most Innovative Game at BostonFIG 2022.
Finalist in the Lunchtime Game Challenge on The Game Crafter.



Retro Tetro has malfunctioned and is threatening the homes of all of the Meeple People! Save the video board game world from rogue polyomino buildings by diverting them carefully around the Meeple People and onto their proper places. As the hero of the digital world, use the foresight granted to you by the polyomino cards and use precision to maximize points in the retro style puzzle game.

The game is played over 24 short rounds of one card each. When each card is played, all players will choose which of the pieces to slide onto their own personal Arcade Board following two main rules:


Like pieces cannot touch sides.


AND


A piece cannot be played below one already placed.


Over the course of the game, you will gain bonus points in the form of coins by covering spaces with matching pieces on the board or from completing highlighted half rows. If you are unable to play a piece for any reason, you will lose two of your hard earned coins for each! You must plan efficiently to avoid this, keeping in mind that, out of the 8 possible shapes, you only get 4 of each. Score at the end of the game for collected coins, building tall columns, covering gold squares at the top of the board and saving Meeple People. Add in "?" cards that let you pick any piece you want and abilities that give you a chance at extra points or take on the evil Tetro Corporation in 12 challenging solo levels and Retro Tetro will entertain you for hours!

—description from the description
categories: Abstract Strategy, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Tile Placement

name: Act Fast Speed Charades
description:
Ready...Set... Act Fast! In this fast-paced charades game, one "Guesser" is tasked with guessing the different charades that multiple "Actors" are acting. The catch? All players are acting at the same time! Each "Actor" is armed with three sand-timers, and must ACT FAST before time runs out... If a charade is guessed correctly, that player simply flips over a new sand-timer and starts all over again. When the round is done, both the "Guesser" and "Actors" are awarded points for each correctly guessed charade.

Flip it. Act it. Guess it. Repeat! Will you act fast enough to beat your competitors?
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Communication Limits, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Alaria: Valor and Company
description:
Alaria; Valor and Company is an indie Table Top RPG, that offers a fresh take on the traditional TTRPG experience. It features Alaria, an original adventure setting introduced through a brand new RPG system named Valor and Company.

Alaria; Valor and Company is a high strategy TTRPG that encourages teamwork, planning, discovery, and adaptation. Heavily inspired by traditional table top rpgs, and squad based tactics games. Adventure through a variety of different scenarios in the isolated colony of Alaria using a refined RPG system designed to facilitate everything from exploration to wargames. Just like classic role-playing games such as Dungeons & Dragons, every adventure has a different length and success conditions.

The game comes with full roleplaying support in the form of a skills system to perform any sort of task, custom character creation rules, and a completely original combat system.

It also comes with a competitive Player vs Player mode with a collection of maps and characters for this competitive mode
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Winged Boot
description:
The Winged Boot was the unofficial award given to British and later adopted by American airmen who “flew out” and “walked back” so they could continue their duty. Although not official, airmen would have their badges custom made in London and worn concealed under the lapels of their uniforms. This was an exclusive club that nobody signed up for. You could say, you just fell into it.

In Winged Boot, you assume the role of a downed bomber crew member. You could be anyone from the pilot to the tail gunner. The game picks up from the point of exiting the aircraft and continues until you are either killed, captured, or rescued. Once that end has been met, you can then step back in time to assume the role of one of the other surviving crewmen, from the beginning. That is, of course, if there were any.

You may find that some, or all, of your fellow crewmembers went down with the aircraft and you may or may not link up with the survivors on the ground. Either way, it is now your mission to evade capture and make your way through enemy territory and find your way back to your squadron in England.

Winged Boot is a stand-alone choose your own adventure style game, but it is designed as an add on for Bomb Run, a solitaire, B-17 bomber experience. It could easily be applied to games like B-17, Queen of the Skies and Target for Today.

Winged Boot is played from a large coil bound book of 72 pages using 21 different 2-page maps and pages of narrative driven paragraphs to help tell your story.

Winged Boot comes with an entire fresh crew that you can mix in and play with your copy of Bomb Run.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Legacy Game, Multiple Maps, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Interstate Vigilante
description:
Interstate Vigilante pays homage to the car combat games of the 90's. It brings COOL CARS, CHAOS and all the CAR COMBAT CLICHES you would expect to the world of board games.

You can choose a vehicle and driver that suit your play style! Slow and heavily armed or nimble and light on armaments. Players race their 3d printed muscle car tokens looking for other vigilantes to destroy. Players construct a unique road map as they drive from tiled map cards. Combat is carried out by collecting load out cards on the map which can be used to start dice battles in the combat arena of the Battle Box.

The objective of Interstate Vigilante is to capture gas cans and return them to Mechanic Mel to obtain victory points. The player or team with the most points after an agreed number of objectives captured is the victor.

Open a box of missiles, muscle cars and madness for 2 to 6 players!
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck Construction, Drawing, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: ALL-FATHERS: Ra's Last Journey
description:
In an ancient world where Gods reigned over other Gods, an epic battle broke out to dethrone the so-called ALL-FATHERS.

Join Osiris, Horus, Isis, and others in this skirmish game for the throne of the Solar God Ra.

In ALL-FATHERS Ra's Last Journey, players will take on the role of one or more Gods from the Egyptian Pantheon who through their powers and abilities will battle against each other and against Ra to ascend the divine hierarchy.

Choose your God, use your action points to move their standee on the Giza battle map, and engage in melee or ranged combat using cards from your God's preconstructed deck.

Add new cards to your God's deck as the game progresses. Work with your enemies to defeat Ra, but be careful, those alliances will soon end when they try to defeat you for the throne.

When the first god is overthrown, the game will end immediately, so there will be no player elimination.
At the end of the game, the God with the highest score will win the game, it could be you, your opponents, or the game itself if Ra stays on top.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points

name: 5 Second Rule: 10th Anniversary edition
description:
It should be easy to name 3 breeds of dogs - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time's not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It's all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to "Just Spit It Out!"

The 10th Anniversary edition adds 50 new questions about the last decade on 25 new double-sided cards that have a different color scheme from the rest of the deck (blue/gray). The plastic 5-second “Twisted Timer” is dark blue with silver-gray feet.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Real-Time

name: Lands of Loot
description:
Lands of Loot is a fantasy board game for 2- 6 players. The players assume the role of an aspiring adventurer who sets out on a journey to build their reputation. At the end of the game each player will have made a tale of heroic deeds, awful blunders, epic battles, and of course loot!

Players start with creating a hero by drawing a combination of Folk and Class cards, then take turns rolling a 12 sided die and moving their meeple through a branching track. The game board itself is a map of the "Lands of Loot" and the track contains spaces that relate to their position on map.

The spaces can be events that cause the player to either gain or lose reputation points (RP)- sometimes paying the points to other players in the game. RP is represented by silver/gold coins and glass gems.

Some of the other spaces include monsters, which earn players RP based on their class, and loot chests which allow the player to draw from a limited deck of loot cards. When the loot deck runs out, loot can be taken from other players.

Once every player reaches the end of the track, the reputation for each player totaled and each player is given a title based on their finishing RP. The player with the highest RP is declared the winner.

—description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Grinivil
description:
Build Grinivil together, but win!

Unique town development game by Rudy Priecinsky.

A rare combination of cooperation and competition gives you the best of both of these natural human needs. And engines of progress, as a matter of fact.

TAR (Time Action Ring) allows you to set your own pace in the game. At the same time, TAR eliminates the first player advantage.

There is an eminent sandbox...or freedom of choice...feel present. Decisions and actions of your opponents and their skills, along with different starting conditions each time form a new challenge for you. Like in a real life.

In the end, all new Grinivil welcomes its new residents.

Not only a good strategy but fine tactics skills are needed to decide about the winner. Still, the game remains easily accessible to casual gamers.

Basic rules

Players cooperate and compete, to build the modern town according to the desires of its residents. Players take turns on the TAR ring. Each turn player performs takes a different time. All competing developers feel the impact of your actions and vice versa.

Players buy land, plant trees, build roads and develop the town. Effectively gain resources and construct houses, schools, shops, and other facilities wanted by Grinivil residents.

Some future inhabitants are open about their wishes for their living space. The desires of others remain hidden. To be successful, you must timely choose the proper actions, work with other developers and cunningly guide them to do what you want. Or better to say, what you think suits the modern and eco-oriented Grinivil the best.

You earn money and success victory points depending on how skillfully you develop a Grinivil. Guess who is the winner?

Ok, money is needed for development and success points for overall victory. Maintaining the right balance may prove decisive.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Environmental, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Timer, Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Sealed Bid, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Market, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: EleMon Party
description:
A turn-based party card game.

In this game, you’ll see how fantasy Snacks help you finish Trials, and make Puppy EleMons grow up into powerful EleMons.
The First Player who finishes enough Trials to have 9+ Trial Points is the Winner!

How to play:
1.All the players take Turns one by one, in clockwise.

2.In your Turn, you take 2 Actions, which could be same and must be one of the three below:

A) : Draw 1 card from the deck.

Your Hand Limit is 6. You Cannot take when you already have 6+ cards in Hand.


B) : Play 1 card in front of you, from your own Hand.AND use its Effect!

The cards you Played must be kept in front of you, until you Discard them in .
Some Snack has Response.Such Snack can be played in response to other player’s Snack with Effect.AND only in such situation, its Response can be resolved.


C) : Finish Trial cards as many as you can! AND get all the Trial Points!

Each Element icon on Snack cards can only be used once, providing you 1 Element. AND at the end of the Action you must Discard the Snack cards if you have used 1+ icons from them.
Each Element icon on flipped EleMon cards can be used once per , providing you 1 Element. AND you NEVER Discard your EleMon cards!


3.The First Player who has 9+ Trial Points becomes the Winner!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Race

name: Shadow War
description:
Shadow War will tantalize your senses. Shadow War is a game based on hidden movement with miniature war game battle rules and custom campaign growth. This is a small team miniature war game with 4 v.s. 4 models facing off. You need to score more points than the enemy to win the game. Earn points by killing the enemy, scoring points on the objective, or destroying their home tower base. Choose your character then upgrade them to learn new skills.

On your turn, you can search with the 5 senses to find and destroy the enemy.

Some actions are attacking, defending, casting spells, and bluffing.

When all the models die on one side or whoever scores the highest points after 5 rounds.

This is a pvpve game. If you can destroy all their models or towers the game automatically ends. Whomever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Role Playing

name: Saurvival
description:
Embark on an adventure and fight for survival in an area full of wild saurians. You are sent on your way with a few simple items. Everything else you have to scavenge for, fight for or craft yourself. Use the strength and skills of the saurians by adding them to your squad with a catching utensil. Collect everything you need on the plain, in the cave and on the lake to face the ultimate challenge in the jungle: the T-Rex!

You start with a deck consisting of 9 base cards and move along the hexagonal game board. During the game you will visit different locations and expand your deck with cards from a selection of 165 uniquely designed objects and saurians. With your cards you can move, attack, defend yourself, craft, trade and use card effects. As the game goes on you prepare yourself to defeat the T-Rex before the other player/team does. This wins you the game. The T-Rex is regularly moving withing the jungle, so you have to plan how to get to it safely with enough attack power in hand to best it. There are five different T-Rex variants which determine the game's difficulty/duration.

Saurvival is a mix of board and card game. Prepare for a strategic adventure full of action, fun and dinosaurs.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Market, Take That

name: Animericals
description:
Animericals is a devious dice & card matching game. Players take turns drawing cards to match randomly rolled dice.

But these dice are like no other. Instead of the abstract shapes we all know as numbers, colorful animals represent 0-9. Instead of the number one, a unicorn horn reminds us that all mythical creatures in the game match '1'.

Use mechanics like, color stacking to build strategies and replace all the dice using super combos.

Whoever can recite the the full hidden sequence (without interruption) wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Memory, Number
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Company of Heroes: Lost Brigades
description:
The Lost Brigades Expansion is special because it allows players to incorporate these new units into their faction's core units, without requiring a Commander Card call-in. Alternatively the 60 building board extender tiles offer a play-mode that allows players to add units from across their entire collection into their faction's building boards.

Lost Brigades vehicles also emphasize the new Assault rules found in the second edition. This can dramatically flush out a faction's options and strategic decisions from early on in the game. Each Lost Brigades vehicle also comes with two commanders that allow players to further specialize and upgrade that vehicle, or alternatively they can field the core Lost Brigades vehicle and choose an entirely different commander to gain access to an even wider range of units.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Xorakus
description:
Your spaceship, the Daedalus, has crashed on the planet Xorakus! You must work together to explore this alien world, find resources, repair your ship, and escape with your lives.

The crew has many characters to choose from, each with their own special abilities and a unique set of base skills. You can customize your character by gaining cards from their advancement deck.

Explore or scout new territory by placing hexagon tiles from a variety of terrain categories. Then reveal the corresponding Encounter cards (Items, Enemies, Events, etc.) that could either help or hinder your efforts.
Once each round, activate native Xorakians and other enemies with a card from the Movement deck. Track the Xorakian Body Count with the Status Display Dial, but be careful; as the kills begin to mount your ability to communicate with them will slip away.

You’ll have to stay on mission and gather resources like fuel, electronics, and machine parts, which are necessary to fix the damaged systems of your spaceship.

Once everything has been repaired the players must make it back onboard and blast off to win the game of Xorakus!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Map Addition

name: Company of Heroes: Soviet Faction Player Set
description:
SOVIET: Extremely mobile core infantry allows for immense early pressure and options for aggression. While your units are versatile, plan ahead with what commanders and units you want to transition to, with many of your options being the strongest in the game for their cost. While your commanders are flexible, look to combine your core unit choices with a surprising commander combination to throw your opponent off guard.

The new Faction Player Sets now include all of the components to add an additional player, like command cubes, dice, infantry trays and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Company of Heroes: British Faction Player Set
description:
BRITISH: Look to make up your lack of firepower by taking full advantage of your durability. Focus on maintaining critical areas and slowly build up your forces to force your opponent into futile aggression. Carefully select your commander and your heavy tanks as they offer a different style to meet your needs to defeat anything your opponent may field.

The new Faction Player Sets now include all of the components to add an additional player, like command cubes, dice, infantry trays and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Company of Heroes: OKW Faction Player Set
description:
OKW: Plan the best locations for your forward spawning buildings, weighing the risk versus reward. Your early infantry can deal with any situation even though you lack weapon teams. Your expensive tier 3 units all have a huge impact when they hit the board, so just adapt your unit and commander choices to apply early pressure to buy you time to make a big play to seal the victory.

The new Faction Player Sets now include all of the components to add an additional player, like command cubes, dice, infantry trays and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Company of Heroes: USA Faction Player Set
description:
USA: Lean on your firepower and mobile weapon teams to focus early on critical points on the map. crushing your enemy where they are weakest. Transition to arguably the most mobile, versatile and inexpensive core tanks to secure those points into the late game. Look to rely on your commanders to focus on your strengths to exploit your enemies weaknesses.

Note the USA player set is included in the Core Set but are available as an add-on.

—description from Kickstarter
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Company of Heroes: Wehrmacht Faction Player Set
description:
WEHRMACHT: Overwhelm your opponents with your strength and powerful infantry, able to lockdown the map early. Use your mobile light vehicles to adjust to your opponent and bring support to where you need it. Your elite core tanks along with your commander call ins can destroy any pesky problems you may run into.

Note the Wehrmacht player set is included in the Core Set but are available as an add-on.

—description from Kickstarter
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Core Connection: Jade Judgement
description:
Core Connection is a deck-building card game for 2-4 players in which you take on the role of a pilot of a Resonant, a giant mecha, fighting to free society from the tyrannical reign of its oppressors!

UNRAVEL THE TRUTH HIDDEN IN JADE
Delve into 3 different replayable scenarios depicting the story of Core Connection Nabla Conspiracy!

All 3 scenarios feature new cards and rules which turn everything you thought you knew about the game upside down. Are you ready to unravel the truth hidden in the shards of jade?


This game is an expansion. Core Connection Nabla Conspiracy is necessary to play this game.


-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Stars Arcana
description:
As our knowledge of the Universe expands so does our ability to roam the stars and widen the horizon of our lives. You take the role of explorers who will gather knowledge, analyze it and with that knowledge expand our vision.

In Stars Arcana, players try to set up the most efficient engine builder by collecting cards, building up their tableau and storing cards in their vault. The game's goal is to score as many points as possible by having cataloged (collected) the most valuable stars and constellations before the deck is depleted and all of the stars are cataloged.

All of the stars, constellations, and night-sky wonders you see on the cards are hand-picked by our astronomer friend Nataša Stanić and appear in the sky as depicted and described on the cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Exploration, Space Exploration
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Bert's Half-Ass Ale
description:
This card is the premium promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 7 (2022).

The card is a Drinks Card with +2 Alcohol Content to be used added to the drinks deck. In addition to being a regular drink, it has the following extra use:

"Put this card in front of you. While it's there you may play it as a Cheating Card with the effect "Take control of a Round of Gambling.""

The Organized Play Kits each contained 6 copies of this card (3 for each tournament) and 40 of the Quick-Draw Barstool prize card (20 for each tournament).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Super Castle Fighter
description:
The King has chosen you to be the warrior who finally ends the bloody war that has been going on for years between the two strongest races that inhabit the lands of Lundor, the Elves and the Barbarians. After thousands of casualties on both sides, there is only one option left to end the war once and for all. THE FINAL DUEL. This fight to the death between the two best warriors of the two factions will determine who will be the victor and who will claim for himself the lands of Lundor. Since ancient times, the final duel has been used as a last resort and takes place in Rindel's castle. Which warrior will be the victor? The Barbarian or the Elf?

Super Castle Fighter is a card-based combat game for 1-2 players ages 12+ that plays in 15-30 minutes created by Victor Robles, designed by Lizuren Games and published by The Game Crafter. Each player chooses a character and must fight to the death using cards as special techniques. The player who wins 2 rounds by reducing the opponent's life to 0 is the winner. To use an attack card or special move, you must pay the cost with your controller cards. The opponent can counter those attacks by blocking or using instant cards on the opponent's turn. Some attacks require power points. Accumulate power and spend it at the right time to deal the final blow and claim victory.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Simulation, Speed Matching

name: Left Unsupervised: Family Edition
description:
It's a card game intended to bring everyone to the table and invoke laughter centered around YOU, the game players. What crazy things might you be up to when you and your friends are Left Unsupervised?

Here's how gameplay works:
- Each player gets 5 yellow cards and 5 red cards.
- Choose a player to be the judge for the first round.
- The judge rolls the special die and determines which player the arrow on the die is pointing to.
- That player is the unsupervised player for this turn.
- The judge chooses any card from their hand to play about the unsupervised player.
- This creates part of a story: "Brad [blank] and that's how legends are made."
- All other players play a card to complete the story and the judge picks their favorite.
- Cards are replenished and the judging role moves to the next player.

Think of Left Unsupervised as kind of like *that other* similar party card game, but staring the players at the table.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Justice: Jack the Ripper
description:
Justice is a new game system in which the players will participate in a trial, one of you will be the defense attorney, the prosecutor will be in charge of bringing the accusation and the rest will form the court.

Each case proposes a unique enigma, but with multiple resolutions that each game will lead to a completely different trial.

Mary Ann Nichols, Annie Chapman, Elizabeth Stride, Catherine Eddowes, Mary Jane Kelly and who knows how many more victims passed through the knives of the notorious killer known as Jack the Ripper. Many were the suspects but none of them could ever be tried. Can you do justice?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Justice es un nuevo sistema de juego en el que los jugadores participaréis en un juicio, uno de vosotros será el abogado defensor, el fiscal se encargará de llevar la acusación y el resto formará el tribunal.

Cada caso propone un único enigma, pero con múltiples resoluciones que cada partida llevarán a un juicio completamente distinto.

Mary Ann Nichols, Annie Chapman, Elizabeth Stride, Catherine Eddowes, Mary Jane Kelly y quién sabe cuántas víctimas más pasaron por los cuchillos del famoso asesino conocido como Jack el destripador. Muchos fueron los sospechosos pero nunca se pudo juzgar a ninguno de ellos. ¿Podréis hacer justicia?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: Milliarium
description:
milliarium is an abstract-strategy board game for 2 players, competing to be the first to build a stack of 4 blocks of their color.

Contents
24 pieces, 1 board game, 1 Rule book.

Setup
Each player receive 12 components of the same color. Place the board in the center of the table.

Players turn
At every turn you can do one of the following steps:

Place one component on the board.
Move your component/stack that contains only your components, that already on the board, 1 tile in any direction in a straight line or diagonally.
Step-up on 1 level on any component on the board.
Step-down 1 level.
Move your component on another component at the same level.


Wining conditions
To be the first to build a stack of 4 blocks of your color, or when one of the players don't have any moves to do.

Notes

You can't move from one border to another.
You can only move one level up or down. Example: component in level 2, can step-up to level 3 but not to level 4.
If you need, It is allowed to stack more than 4 level.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Dozen War
description:
Dozen War (Thập Nhị chiến) is a strategy board game, designed by Vietnameses. It takes a fantasy setting called Mativen, where there is a raging war between 12 heroes.

The game have 2 seperated game modes:
- "Đối đầu" (Engage): 2 players only, with game time between 5 to 15 minutes.
- "Chiến thần" (War gods): 3 to 4 players, either Free for all or Co-op, with game time between 90 to 150 minutes.

Dozen war is inspired by many classic games like Chess, Xiangqi, and MOBA video games like DotA.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Take That

name: ERIS Seed of Discord
description:
ERIS Seed of Discord is an auction game in which players take on the role of a Greek god in search of the prized apples of discord.

The auction deck will be made up of two types of cards: apples and calamities.

Apple cards contain the victory points that players will seek to acquire in order to win the game.

Apples vary in value from 3 to 7. These can be purchased through a Turn Order Until Pass auction. Players will have their God's power and their bribes to be able to bid on these apples.

Secondly, Calamity Cards. These will enter the auction not to be acquired, but to cause chaos, jealousy, and discord among the players.

The effects of calamity cards will be permanent until the players decide to pay the necessary bribes to remove them from the game.

Plan your strategy and bid to get the golden apples that will recognize you as The Fairest!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Events, Turn Order: Auction

name: Ghast
description:
A 2-player game of skill played on a hexagonal board. A, distant descendant of the game of Go. But, in its feel, its volatility and its length it is closer to Chess.

The aim of the game is to have more tiles of your colour on the board than your opponent. You achieve this mostly by killing opposing tiles by depriving them of oxygen, and by making your own tiles hard to kill. All tiles have connections printed on them; as long as your tiles connect to an empty space, they have oxygen.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Roles, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Ravens
description:
RAVENS is a modern twist on a classic German card game, Tod und Leben, for 2 to 6 players.

You'll have to move fast, very fast. The goal is simple, gather all the cards into your hand but getting there...that's quite the challenge. Forget what you know about fighting fair and time your attacks by counting other Raider's cards.

In clockwise order, players lay the top card of their face-down hand in the center of the field. All players must watch carefully for certain rune combinations/color series and slap the pile first to lay claim to it. Each weapon card challenges the gathering cards in the playing field, the strength of each indicated by hash marks along the edge of the card. The player following a weapon card may choose to meet the challenge or forfeit the plunder.

Watch carefully for the Ravens, they hold the fate of the game. The Blue Raven is an instant slap condition whereas an ill-timed claim of the Red Raven may leave you amongst the ranks of the dead.

A player who has emptied their hand has become a Valkyrie and they may no longer challenge or add to the field. Valkyrie may at any time slap combinations. These cards enter Valhalla and are no longer in play thereby thinning the deck and raising the stakes. If the Valkyrie is able to gather both Ravens into their hand, they have won the game.

Will you dominate your foes by implementing Weapons of War or join the ranks of the Valkyrie as harbingers of Ragnarök? Be cautious of strangers, a new Raider may join the fray at any given opportunity.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Pattern Recognition

name: Null Kort; Núll Spil
description:
In this bilingual card game, you learn numbers, colors, and phrases in Norwegian or Icelandic - or both. The game is primarily for beginner learners, but phrases are beginner to intermediate.

Cards are played on matching numbers or colors, and the Norwegian/Icelandic words must be read aloud as they are played. Ville and Rosa cards spice things up with player interaction, double-digit numbers, and super simple arithmetic! The goal is to get rid of all of your cards first and declare "Null Kort" or "Núll Spil" ("zero cards").
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: The Little Prince Boardgame
description:
The Little Prince board game inspired by classic novel book + coaching concept + positive parenting concept. This game allow you to create safety environment to play and learn parent philosophy quality time with a group of 2-4 players that you can choose yourself. To share, discussion become "The Old New World" of your own.

For the game mechanic is very simple for understand and play. Which life the space for sharing and learn each other via playing game.

For the developer (Thailand Coaching Institute and Learning From Boardgames) believe this game will help you to create "The Quality Time" and visualize how become parents the way you choose to be

You may choose you boss and design your career path. But for you children, they can't choose their parents or quit being your child.

The player try to collect the card set to convert to the Quote Card to gain more points. and the most point is the winner.

The Color in the game;
1) Red (Rose) 1 point
2) Yellow (Fox) 2 points
3) Blue (The Little Prince) 3 points

The set of Red Yellow and blue able to covert 1 Quote Card (that contain 10 points). Alternatively, 5 reds or 4 yellow or 3 blue able to ruin the black (Snake) that contain -5 points from their score.

4) White (Sheep) 4 points:the set of 2 white able to convert 1 quote card (that contain 10 points)

5) Black (Snake) - 5 points: The set of 3 black are guarantee you win the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Storytelling

name: Six Links
description:
SIX LINKS is a word guessing game. Be the first team to score 30 points by correctly guessing mystery words based on 6 clues! But… more clues mean less points!

Players form two even teams and play the game in rounds. In a given round, one player on each team will be the hinter, and the remaining players will be guessers. Each round, a new clue card (that contains 6 clues and a mystery word) is drawn by the designated hinter. The hinter has the power to choose if their team will play first or pass the clue card to the other team.

The hinter of the starting team randomly pulls tokens from the bag, dictating which clues can be given. Their team has ONE guess at the mystery word — if they guess wrong, the clue card is passed to the other team who can then pull more tokens from the bag and try to guess the word. The card is passed back and forth between teams until the mystery word is found!

Be strategic, and ready to show your acting, drawing, and singing skills!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Bucket Race
description:
Bucket Race is a brand-new strategy and tabletop game where players race to see who can complete their bucket lists first! The first edition is a map of the United States.

We welcome fellow explorers, dreamers, trailblazers, curiosity-seekers and casual bucket-listers of every kind to the Bucket Race!

The game consists of the following phases:

1. Setting up the game:
- Game setup
- Player setup
- Choose a Home Destination

2. Game flow:
- First Turn, Every Turn
- Additional Actions
- Ending the Game

The board has the following components:
- Game board (map of US with 5 distinct region with 1 reward lounge each, 45 destinations with a # between 2-12, spaces for 2 supplies that are randomized at the game's onset)
- Game pieces: 2 dice, 5 player pieces, 52 deck of Surprise! Cards, 52 deck of Upgrade Cards, 5 wet erase markers, 90 supplies, 5 reward lounge tokens, Money
- Rules booklet
- 18 Persona Cards/Bucket Lists - the heart of the game is selecting a Persona Card/Bucket List which is the character you will take on and have to complete their bucket list the fastest in order to win.

Game flow:
