Each turn players first collect $100, then roll the dice to see if they can collect additional money (many ways through dice rolls, Surprise! Cards, also if roll doubles get an additional $100!). Then they use money to pay to move their game piece, collect and manage supplies, check-off bucket list items, visit rewards lounges for additional upgrade cards, redeem upgrade cards if in possession, or trade and sell supplies to other players.

The first player to check-off all Bucket List items on their Persona Card and travel back to their “Home” destination, wins the Bucket Race!

This is a game where it is best to collaborate early on (trade supplies, help each other out), but then the last stretch it is truly a race to see who can win first!

Additionally, the bucket list items are based on real-life bucket lists, so we like to think this is a learning and travel game as well! It is perfect for those that love competitive, strategy board games with travel and culture.

3-5 players or can play in teams. There are 3 versions (Easy Tenderfoot, Medium Trailblazer, Advanced Globetrotter). We recommend starting with Easy first to get the hang of the game. Usually takes between 50-75 minutes to play, although for experienced gamers you could complete in 30-45 minutes if do a speed round.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nukular: Wer überlebt den Atomkrieg – Bonus-Set
description: Adds one Despot and 7 target cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Runebound: Mistrz Runów
description: Mistrz Runów contains three additional character sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Mistrz Runów, Mag Bojowy and Pobratymiec Duchów.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Aussie Rona Rules
description:
The Aussie Rona Rules Game is an Australian tabletop game. During the game you will read out loud some of the funny and strange news and events that happened in the last two years while you are traveling around Australia. It is a great family game but also recommended for friends gatherings as it will give you lots of laughs.

The aim of the game is to travel around Australia and arrive home healthy.
Players choose which state they would like to play with and start off on the journey with a couple of healthy people tokens. During the journey they will receive more tokens, which will be affected by the places and events they travel through and by the often surprising News cards too!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warcrow Adventures: Deathclaws of the Dream
description:
After the events of the main campaign of Warcrow Adventures, an island near Hawthorn Point is freed from the fog. The inhabitants of the coastal town decide to approach it to gather possible resources but, what is their surprise upon arrival when they encounter creatures that no one had ever seen before. The explorers of Hawthorn Point named these creatures "Red Caps" in allusion to the red color of the top of their heads. Since the presence of these monsters makes resource gathering difficult, our beloved adventurers are called upon to help clear the island of these pesky creatures.

The surprise comes when, while exploring the island, they discover some ancient constructions in the interior of the slopes of the volcano that governs this piece of land. These constructions hide many mysteries that you will have to discover.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Get in!
description:
Abduct specimens for your galactic zoo. Join the Earth Abduction Project and fly your saucer to Earth to gather as many specimens as possible and thus gain the key to success and Earth Domination!

In this exciting card and dice game, you will play as 1 of 6 randomly chosen Aliens.

By throwing dice up to 3 times per turn, you have to charge up your saucer’s beam power and abduct specimens, whether they are humans, animals or objects. Use your harvested DNA tokens for rerolls and play action cards to boost your abilities, or thwart your opponent’s plans.

This fast paced dice action will keep you and your companions guessing who the winner will be until the very end!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ophidian Redux: Legacy of the Arenas
description:
Ophidian Redux: Legacy of the Arenas is the first release for the Ophidian Redux line. So what you can expect from this new Ophidian Redux? We're going back to the basics, as we are proud to repurpose, review, and republish the original 5 digital full-text card sets and print them with some graphics added and with a fully updated text to fit into the new audiences and new potential Gladiators, on TheGameCrafter in print format, adding new additional content, all compatible with the original Ophidian 2350 CCG as well as the more recent spin-off Ophidian 2360.

The Ophidian Redux: Legacy of the Arenas storage box holds 625 unsleeved Ophidian (2350 CCG, Wars, 2360 or Redux) cards or 460 sleeved Ophidian cards. But more, Legacy of the Arenas will come with the following contents:

> 2 - Ophidian Redux: Preview Decks fully playable out of the box. Each deck contains 30 cards previewing all the upcoming Ophidian Redux releases, 1 never seen before Gladiator card exclusive to each deck, plus 3 add-on cards each.
>> 1 double-faced Ophidian Redux Credit Points Tracker / Steps Of The Breather card.
>> 1 double-faced Ophidian Redux Cheer Points Tracker / Ophidian Redux Preview Deck Cardlist card.
>> 1 Ophidian Credit Points Rewards card, with ½ CP.

> 1 - Ophidian Redux: Legendary Xmas full collection expansion set. A set contains 34 cards, plus 6 add-on cards.
>> 1 double-faced Symbols For Cards card.
>> 1 double-faced New Card Types card.
>> 2 double-faced New Mechanisms cards.
>> 1 double-faced Redux Checklist / Special Thanks card.
>> 1 Ophidian Credit Points Rewards card, with 2 CP.

This release also comes with a digital download Ophidian Redux: Quick-Rules Booklet .pdf file, which features a brand new Ophidian Universe Fiction, plus the quick rules and can be downloaded on TheGameCrafter game page or by scanning the QR-Code on the box linking to the Ophidian Universe website where you will also find it, alongside the complete rules for all our Ophidian Games.

And the Ophidian Redux: Legacy of the Arenas storage box plus the 108 cards will have an MSRP of 27.99 USD.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Fat Cats Inc.
description:
Welcome to Fat Cats Inc, the exciting new board game from Board and Sorcery! In this game, players will compete to earn as much money as possible before the world inevitably comes to an end.

As the CEO of your own company, you’ll have to make tough decisions and strategic moves to outwit your opponents and come out on top. You’ll have a variety of cards at your disposal, including Production, Action, and Funding, which you can use to benefit your company, hinder your rivals, or earn revenue.

But beware – every move you make will have consequences, and your choices may contribute to the ultimate demise of the world. Do you risk everything to come out on top, or do you try to save the world at the cost of your own profits? It’s up to you to decide in Fat Cats Inc.

So screw your friends over and earn the most to win – but be warned, in Fat Cats Inc, there can be only one true fat cat!
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Graveyard Chess
description:
Graveyard Chess is an undead-themed chess variant in which the Kings are replaced with Necromancers, and the other pieces are replaced with various undead creatures.

Functionally, Graveyard Chess plays similarly to regular chess, but with a smaller board, and a simplified lineup of pieces. The main key difference is that after you capture an opponent's piece, you can skip your turn to resurrect it onto the board as your own.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: 3KSES
description:
The name 3KSES is a combination of words "Three games" and "Tricks" into one word TRIKSES.
Three easy-to-learn games in one box.
66 triangular play chips(tokens) in this game are made from wood and both side printed, from one side is a thematic colourful painting of one of famous world architectural jewels. From other side is printed an ornament. Each chip has on the sides 3 different symbols, made as shaped cutouts, it is a triangle, a square and a circle. 6 play chips from 66 are rare POWERCHIPS, they are described with cut-through marks. Game rules are based on using the pictures or using the cutouts. No gameboard is needed, only small piece of flat place is enough to play 3KSES.
Two players compete against each other, 4 and 6 players then builds a team which is cooperating and competing other team.

Game 1 | FIND A MATCH - 66 play chips are placed on table in 11 groups, 6 pieces of chips i each group. Players are trying to find 2 pictures of the same building to get a MATCH, in the end of the game the winner with more pairs wins the game. IT is good memory fitness training.

Game 2 | JOINTS - 66 play chips are distributed to players, each player gets same amount of chips and put in a stack in front of them in a column. The shaped cutout symbols on the chips are used here. First player put first play chip from his stack on a desk and other player can lay one of his chips to connect it only with the same symbol to one of the chips laying on the table, it makes a JOINT between two connected chip. For each JOINT made player plays one new chip, so if it makes 2 JOINTs - is playing 2 times in his turn, gives quicklier chips from his stack to the table. The trick is to get a combination of more chips near each other to build 2 or 3 JOINTs in one time.
POWERCHIPS is special, of course, doesn't need to be played out when in top of stack, but can be put near for later use and play normal chip instead. POWERCHIP has the ability to turn chips to get a compatible shape for connection.
Player or team who first gets rid of all chips of their stack is a Winner. It is great logic fitness training.

Game 3 | TAMITADY - 66 play chips are mixed and each player gets 1 POWERCHIP and any 6 pieces of normal chips. One player to players, each player gets same amount of chips and put in a stack in front of them. The shaped cutout symbols on the chips are used here. First player put first play chip from his stack on a desk and other player can lay one of his chips to connect it only with the same symbol to one of the chips laying on the table. For each connection made is played one new chip,so player which connect one chip to 2 other chips, is playing 2 times in his turn, gives quicklier chips from his stack to the table. The trick is to get a combination of more chips near each other to connect 2 or 3 in one time.
Player or team who first gets rid of all chips of their stack is a Winner. It is a great logic fitness training.

-description from designer
mechanics: Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Slamapalooza
description:
Slamapalooza is a fast-playing card game simulating a one-on-one pro wrestling match.

Players use Basic Move Cards to create chains of attacks. Each move alters the stats: Stun, Control, or Potential to set up the next move. If played strategically, you can avoid a major reversal from your enemy.

Use deception, luck, or physical challenges to raise the stakes at any time with Psychology Cards!

Unlock your Signature Move by completing its unique Signature Sequence of Basic Move Types. Every time you pull off a Signature Move you go for the pin and might just win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Interrupts, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: The Sack Man
description:
Welcome those who enter the territory of the Sack Men. Krampus, the supreme lord, and tyrant, leads a legion of sack monsters that snatch unwary souls roaming around in the dark of night.

Your goal is to help a crew equipping themselves with the best sacks available and seize the highest numbers of souls, so you can gain the favor of your supreme lord.

The wining mechanic is based on collecting Victory Points from multiple game strategies. The player with the highest number of VPs will win the game.

The Sack Man is an auction based game that combines deck building and competitive gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck Construction, Trading, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Majority
description:
An abstract strategy game, nominally themed around a battle for political supremacy in which every decision trades one issue or dimension against another.


Payers take turns to place black and white stones on a diagonal grid board.
The aim is to end the game with more points than your opponent
You get points by winning “tricks”, which you do by being the first to complete all your squares in a row or column.


Majority can be played with or without hidden information. The hidden information adds a level of difficulty and an element of deception. Beginners can start off by playing without the hidden information. This is called deterministic mode and I will describe it first.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: OMNIA Beginnings: Season 1
description:
OMNIA Beginnings: Season 1 brings new heroes, new spells, and new ways to use your opponents cards against them!

The first expansion set for OMNIA Collectible Deckbuilding Game expands on the world of D’vandia and its inhabitants.
The Homeplain elf tribes and the powerful Fyretek priests that guide them spiritually are explored in more detail, allowing might users some spicy new toys while the denizens of Argent and its bustling marketplace start to make an appearance, giving divinity users ways to manipulate the shop zone to suit their own desires.

The Academy at Argent trains mages in much more than just fire, and in Season 1 we are giving arcana users more options with the spells and strategies they can use both offensively and defensively. Deep in the shadows of Argent are more unscrupulous magics being worked however, as necromancers raise undead servants for various purposes. All self-serving, and none of which are “Wholesome”, shadow users will find more undead, and more things that make undead better.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hexian
description:
HEXIAN is a 2-players shoot 'em up boardgame, inspired by the glorious retro arcade space shooters.
Will you beat your opponent and reach a new High Score?

You create a 6x4 grid with 24 alien invader ships and Flying Saucer above that moves to the right turn by turn. Below the attackers you place your defender ships for both players. You draw 4 cards each turn from the action card deck that you use to steer your ship left and right below the invaders, gain shields, fire lasers, place decoys, also to negatively influence your opponent, like pushing his ship away.
When the last of the 24 alien ships is destroyed, the game is over and you score the alien ships that you shot down (different ships are worth different points).
The player with the higher score wins. Keep track of the high score and try to beat it in the next game.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: To Honor Grandfather
description:
Set in the legendary science fiction universe of the Traveller roleplaying game, To Honor Grandfather lets players take on the role of young aliens (Droyne) competing to gain the favor of their leader (Grandfather).

Using the custom dice, players will travel between a variety of unique planetary systems and engage with a huge selection of events, each with the potential to draw Grandfather's approving eye. Those with the most "honor" after all planets have been explored will be dubbed the victor!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: To Honor Grandfather: Vilis Subsector
description:
Go beyond the Regina subsector in this expansion for the dice-rolling game, To Honor Grandfather. Set in the science fiction universe of the legendary Traveller roleplaying game, this expansion will allow you to explore and interact with the Vilis subsector in a whole new way!

Included in the Vilis expansion:

Player boards for a 5th and 6th player.
Secret Objectives to help shape your strategies.
Droyne Caste Abilities, giving each player a unique power.
New System cards charting the Vilis subsector.
New Encounter cards, with strange new Abilities and Effects.


The Vilis expansion can be freely integrated with the base game, allowing easy and seamless play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Nyarlathotep
description:
You have joined the team at Kauket Analytics Operating Systems and you are tasked with investigating the strange events that surround your predecessor's work. In this Lovecraft-inspired narrative adventure game you will scour for clues, solve riddles and puzzles, and put together pieces of the story in attempt to find the hidden temple and unveil the secrets within.

There is no turn order or specific roles, players work collaboratively to piece together clues hidden throughout specially crafted artefacts, documents, and digital content. The game ends when you uncover the full truth of the narrative mystery.

Will you discover the purpose of the temple? Was it created to praise a new god, a memorial to those who died there, or was it a cage, keeping something dangerous inside?

It's up to you, the players, to find out.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Hastur
description:
This fearsome immersive adventure invites players to work collaboratively as they scour for clues, solve riddles and puzzles, and unravel the mystery surrounding a story of demonology, horror, and the occult.

In this Lovecraft-inspired narrative horror adventure you must use all your strength to withstand the ochre of madness, in order to sort through the many mysteries and puzzles within. Will you save the rest of the world or will you serve them up to the evil that dwells in the space between the stars?

There is no turn order or traditional board, players receive an uncooperative wooden crate filled to the brim with relics, rune scrolls, star-charts, and mysterious notes that must be pieced together to decipher the mystery of the King in Yellow.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: To Honor Grandfather: Promo Pack
description:
This small pack contains all nine promotional cards from the "Wave One" release of the game To Honor Grandfather.

System Cards:

Mortrog
Polybius
Yuggoth


Encounter Cards:

Lost City of Squindor
The Sum of All Evils
Droyne Coyns
Space Station VII
Dark Dreamscapes
Vampire Ship


Note: All included cards were previously released as individual promos, either through crowdfunding or at conventions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Scriptless
description:
The improv party game! Players assume the role of Actors performing in improvised scenes that are (almost) completely unscripted.
Create hundreds of scenes on the fly on what's been described as "the improving actor's toolkit!"
Generate scenes by drawing a Relationship and Location card, and grab a secret Script card for each player. Actors that can use their script before their scene ends gain a victory point! The first to 5 victory points wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Drawing, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Bloody Big Battles in INDIA!
description:
Scenario book for the "Bloody Big BATTLES!" wargames rules. The major states of India, especially the Maratha Confederacy and the Sikh state in the Punjab, were among the most redoubtable opponents of the extension of British power in the sub-continent. The size and technological sophistication of their forces posed major problems for East India Company commanders in the field and frequently threatened them with defeat. BBBI lets you refight sixteen of the most important battles of the period from the Second Maratha War (1803-1806) to the Sepoy Uprising (‘Indian Mutiny’) of 1857-1858.
This collection gives you:

The battles where Wellington made his name!
A wide range of terrain and tactical situations!
Balanced scenarios with asymmetrical armies!
Unusual troops – Gurkhas, camel rockets, ghazis!
An engaging game of constant decision-making!
Battles you can fight to the finish in an evening!


Many also offer scenario options to explore ‘what-ifs’ and increase replay value. Campaign options allow players to link battles so that each has consequences for the next.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ghostlink Pumpkin Promo
description:
Beta Rules - 3 x new Pattern cards and 3 x new Pattern gear cards that were included with the Erza of Dedheim First Run Collector's Edition miniature, that is not part of the game.

Gear card sneak peek: Ghostlink Pumpkin (item, consumable)- Consume: Suffer frenzy and become doomed until end of round. Convert all your attribute tokens to +1 strength tokens. Limit, once per showdown.

Erza of Dedheim is packaged in an illustrated box that includes:

1 x Hard Plastic Painters scale Erza of Dedheim miniature
1 x Hard Plastic Players scale Erza of Dedheim miniature
3 x Pattern cards
3 x Pattern gear cards
1 x Large Matte art print of the Erza of Dedheim.
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round base and insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 50mm round base and insert

Led by Grozharous, the Pale Turnip King. Dedheim was established in the ruins of a forgotten town. The monstrous lord claims that within Dedheim’s crystaline gates the dead are collected.
Erza of Dedheim guards the settlement's black tourmaline gates. She bars the denizens of Dedheim from leaving and spilling into the world of the living.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Flower Costume Promo
description:
The Flower Costume Promo was included with the Halloween Survivor - Flower Knight Costume miniature (not part of the Kingdom Death: Monster Game).

Gear card sneak peek: Flower Costume (item)- Add 1 to all hit locations. On Arrival, trick or treat! Roll 1d10: 1-5, survivors gain a -1 luck token. 6+ survivors gain a +1 luck token.

The Halloween Survivor - Flower Knight Costume is packaged in a festive box that includes:

1 x Hard plastic Halloween Survivor - Flower Knight Costume figure
1 x Hard plastic scenic base insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base
1 x Large matte art print
1 x Pattern gear card
1 x Pattern card

Exclusive to Halloween, this Halloween Survivor wears a Flower Knight costume while trick or treating, and will not 'leaf' without some sweet treats. The Halloween Survivor - Flower Knight Costume includes a unique decorative base insert, Pattern gear card, and Pattern card for use with Kingdom Death: Monster.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Creature Collectors
description: In this game, you are a leader of a group of fantastic creatures in a world where civilization is surrounded by creature-infested wilderness. Your goal is to get the biggest number of creatures in your group. At the start of the game the players decide on a number of creature that they need to get to win and the first player to get those creature and return to start wins. In the setup cards are distributed into numerous piles. Each turn, players can travel to adjacent piles and decide whether to encounter a creature there. By putting forward the best creatures for each encounter, you can befriend and recruit new creatures or battle and subdue them. Your success depends on whether they like each other, what the creatures are good and bad at fighting, and what type of creatures they are. Remembering the characteristics of the other creatures that have been encountered can help you to strategically match creatures in an encounter so as to grow your group. Players may also encounter each other and trade or battle.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Set Collection

name: Bellum Cretaceum
description:
Using the latest genetic technologies, you will fulfill your dream of creating a cretaceous park! To do so, you will place dinosaurs in your park to attract tourists. But be aware of rival parks, attacks will be constant! Who will get more tourists?

Each player starts with a hand of three dinosaur cards. There are two common stacks: one for dinosaurs and another one for tourists.

Players will make turns and in their turn they will follow these two steps:
1.Draw one card: a dinosaur or a tourist.
2.Do one action choosing between these two options:
2a.Expand your park by placing one dinosaur in it.
2b.Attack and steal one dinosaur from another park using one stronger dinosaur from your hand, which will be discarded afterwards.

When you get two dinosaurs of the same type in your park, a tourist will come to see them and give you profits so you can take another dinosaur card from the common stack.
When you get three dinosaurs of the same type in your park, you can place a Ranger that will protect dinosaurs and tourists in that group.
When you get four dinosaurs of the same type in your park, you can steal a tourist from another park.
After an attack, if a carnivorous dinosaur is left without a partner it will eat its tourist which goes to his owners' hand. The tourist also goes to his owners hand when the last herbivorous dinosaur from a group is lost.

When both common dinosaur and tourist stacks are depleted, a last round is played and then the game ends. The park with more tourists is the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Vendel to Viking: Promo Pack 1
description: The Vendel to Viking promo pack 1 will introduce rules tiles to Vendel to Viking, as found in the Pax Viking Promo pack 1. It will feature a mix of Venture tiles, Rules tiles and new mission cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blabbi
description:
Blabbi is a game of made-up words.

Overview:

Blabbi is a game of made-up words! Rack up points by coming up with imaginary words using topic cards, then let your buddies decide if your definitions are gold or goof!

––––

How to Play:

Blabbi is a party crosswords game where every word is entirely made-up!

On your turn, use any number of your 8 letters and 3 topic cards to invent a fake word and pitch a definition on the spot.
But get ready to explain yourself because other players can ask questions about your word until they've voted: Yes (they believe it) or No (they don't buy it).

If the majority votes Yes, you keep the topic card and earn points.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!

• Easy to learn to start playing in 2 minutes or less!
• Great news for bad spellers: Blabbi is a twist on word games that leans more on humor and creativity!
• Designed for people who hate rules, so play how you want and in any language you want!
• Never gets old. Blabbi is all about language creativity, so you’ll never play the same way twice!
• Big on content? Our box includes a built-in phone stand to record your favorite definitions.

Game Details:
Players: 3+
Age: 12+
Set Up Time: 2 mins
Game Length: 30-60 mins
Type: Word Game / Improv Game / Party Game
Difficulty Level: Easy
Ideal for: Creatives, storytellers, actors, and everyone in between.

What’s in the Box:

100 Squishy Nonslip/Waterproof Letter Tiles
80 Oddly Specific Topic Cards
8 Voting Cards
1 Built-in Phone Stand

Dimensions:
9.9" x 7" x 2.4"

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Questions and Answers, Storytelling, Voting

name: Ritos Ancestrais
description:
A Lovecraftian Card Game by Hugo Bustilho from QG BUSTILHO where players summon monsters and investigators to have the greatest cult in Elder Rites.

Object
Build your Cult and perform Summon Rituals! To win you must have more Invocation Points at the end of the game. The first player to reach 21 Invocation triggers the end of the game.

Gameplay
The game is played in turns. The first player begins his turn, with one move passing to the next player on the left.
In one turn, follow this order (some card effects you previously played may modify these steps).
1. Buy two cards from the principal line.
2. Make a Invocation or Play a card into your Cult or Pass.
3. Stay with 7 cards in your hand.

Um Jogo de Cartas Lovecraftiano de Hugo Bustilho do QG BUSTILHO onde jogadores incocam monstros e investigadores para ter o maior Culto em Ritos Ancestrais.

Objetivo
Construa seu Culto e realize Rituais de Invocação! Para vencer você deve ter mais Pontos de Invocação no final do jogo. O primeiro jogador a chegar a 21 de Invocação dispara o fim do jogo.

Gameplay
O jogo é jogado em turnos. O primeiro jogador começa seu turno, com uma jogada passando para o próximo jogador à esquerda.
Em um turno, siga esta ordem (alguns efeitos de cartas que você jogou anteriormente podem modificar essas etapas).

1. Compre duas cartas da linha principal de compras.
2. Faça uma Invocação ou jogue uma carta da sua mão no seu Culto ou Passe a vez.
3. Fique com no máximo 7 cartas na sua mão.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management

name: Tales of the Unsolved: The Blackthorn Manor
description:
The Blackthorn Manor is an Adventure Puzzle Book by Tales of the Unsolved. Solve a puzzle in the book, the answer of which is called a "Key". Those Keys act as clues and will be needed moving forward to solve later puzzles. Work your way through the book, solve the puzzles, and unfold the mystery that surrounds this seemingly abandoned house.

The Blackthorn Manor is a 154 page physical book with 63 puzzles to solve. Will you dare to enter and manage to solve them all?

Each puzzle is unique, and will test your ability to think outside the box. Numbers, ciphers, pattern recognition and manipulation of the book - fold, search, tear, draw and more, can all prove critical to your progress.

For some puzzles, you will be requested to visit a URL where the puzzle leaves the book and comes to life in a 3d environment thematic to the room in which you are in the story. Not only will you need to think outside the box to solve the puzzle, you will need to explore the rooms you are in to find the clues to do so.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flashback
description:
The Flashback cruise was intended to be a way to revisit the '90s in fun ways that kids from back in the day would describe as "all that and a bag of chips." Some of the most popular child celebrities from the '90s, all managed by Jake Murray, were scheduled to be aboard for a week of sunny nostalgia, discussions about which flip phone was better, and whether or not you prepped for Y2K. When Jake Murray is found dead aboard the ship, all indications point to one of his celebrity clients as the killer. Unfortunately, you are one of those celebrities, and are implicated in the crime by the fact that something belonging to you was used as the murder weapon. Because jurisdiction out on the open water is tricky, you have a few hours before the Ladybird is due back at port to find out who the real killer is and expose them for the criminal they are. Can you Flashback to an era of slap bracelets, Furbies, and floppy disks and find out which of your '90s celebrity friends is really a cold-blooded murderer?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Murder at Cape Anna
description:
Vacations are rare for the Will Street Detective Agency staff, but only a fool would pass up the opportunity to spend a week in Cape Anna, a sleepy, seaside town on the northeast coast. The trip is a fringe benefit of a speaking engagement you had earlier in the day at a symposium on modern day crime-solving techniques. Now that you've given your presentation, you are free for the rest of the week to do nothing but sample all the fresh seafood, bask in the warm sunshine, and revel in the complete lack of responsibility. The activity at the top of your “to-do” list is to stop by the town’s Founder’s Festival. You've read a lot of interesting stories about the festival and the town itself and think it would be a shame to miss this opportunity. You reconsider your position on the matter when you arrive at the festival and see an all too familiar site at the end of a row of tents - police tape. The stark yellow tape seems out of place in such an idyllic locale. As you move closer, you see two men wearing Murphree County Coroner shirts carrying a black body bag. The sheriff’s deputies who are attempting to investigate the scene seem to be in over their heads. The head detective on the case, Ryan Clark, recognizes you from the symposium and informs you that they've never seen a case quite like this before. Given your expertise, Clark asks if you’d like to help them on this investigation. He promises all the lobster rolls and blueberry pie you can eat! How can you say no to that? Pull back the curtain and examine the dark heart that beats beneath this sleepy, seaside town. Can you solve the Murder at Cape Anna?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Follow the Leader
description:
The silence of a quiet night at Valley Falls Dispatch is shattered when a frantic call comes in. The man on the line says he is being chased and rambles about something that happened in the past with him and a group of friends. Then, the call is abruptly disconnected. When the police pinpoint the location of the call and arrive on the scene, they discover the caller's dead body. Written in blood on the wall behind the body is a message that reads, "Follow the Leader 2017." Something terrible happened 5 years ago, and someone is out for revenge. Old scores will be settled. Old secrets will be uncovered. Will you Follow the Leader and live to tell about it?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Heirs of Prometheus
description:
Players control city-states in Ancient Greece, and vie for control of other cities in the Greek mainland.

Players acquire power through the form of four influence types: Military, Diplomatic, Cultural, and Economic. Each type has unique ways of counteracting the others, and players must be adaptable to succeed. Multiple winners are possible, so forging alliances and well-timed betrayals can help players end the game among the victors.

The main goal of the game is to gain the most Glory, and the game ends when the pool of Glory Tokens is depleted. Players may erect monuments, which provide alternate paths to victory once the game has ended.

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Players start by selecting a city state, each which has two advantages and a disadvantage, and two focus influence types; there's also a jack-of-all-trades city which doesn't have a focus, but its advantages let it switch among the influence types more easily. Each city is not a specialization, but more of a slight nudge off center. If a city needs to switch tactics based on the situation, they are each able to gain cards and influence of other types to meet the challenge. Each player city contains three districts, which can be developed using building and tradesmen cards; other cities only have 1 district each.

Influence is gained in mainly two ways. Players may select what influence to gain each turn (with extra cards if for each focus type chosen), but this happens at the end of each turn, so players must plan ahead for what they will do. The second way is at the start of each turn, but is more randomized. The buildings and tradesmen used to develop a district each have a production number, and gain an influence if that number is rolled. Players may also trade influence and cards on their turn; trading has the extra benefit of making a one-round truce between the trading players, which gives some measure of safety and ensures the traded items won't be immediately used against them.

For those influence-gaining rolls, the current player rolls two 8-sided dice: one applies to all players, and the other only to the rolling player. If a rolled number matches a production number the district the card is on gains an influence; however, there is a limit to the influence each district can store, so the same number getting rolled repeatedly doesn't grant extra influence. Also, the game setup makes it so at the start of the game each player has access to cards with the same numbers on them, so players gain influence at the same rate; later cards are needed to diversify their numbers. The starting cards have a 1, 2, or 5 on them (the 8 is only for rare cards, so will mostly be unavailable for players), so 50% of the values are already matching at the beginning. Furthermore, the values 1-4 are only on buildings, and 5-7 are only on tradesmen; since tradesmen must be added onto buildings, the higher numbers are less accessible.

Each district can perform one action every turn, so the more cities you control the more you can do. Since most actions cost influence, it's often best to not use all your actions to save your influence for later. Actions allow players to use abilities, which mainly come from two sources: a set of basic abilities available at all times, and event cards a player draws to their hand. The event cards correspond to the four influence types, and usually require influence of that type to use.

Victory points, called "Glory" in the game, are gained by placing your pawns (called "Officials") on the board, as well as by winning special events called Contention Rolls. Contention rolls represent things like battles and votes, and utilize a push-your-luck mechanic to determine the outcome.

Each influence type has a contention roll, and are the main way officials are added (there is a basic ability to add an official to a neutral tile; the contention rolls are used mainly against other players). First, the player who initiated the roll allocates all their resources, plays abilities, gets allies, and rolls; then once their value is determined, the targeted player does the same. This allows for a player to defend with few or no resources if the odds are too stacked against them; they can always use the influence they saved for their own contention roll later). The player who initiated the roll has the added benefit of rerolling their die before the targeted player allocates any resources; however, doing so costs some of the influence allocated to the contention roll, so their total potential value will weaken with each reroll.

Turns start with drawing an Adversity Card, which is the "bad stuff happens" card. Based on the officials and buildings a player controls, it's more or less likely that one of their cities will revolt. A city under revolt more or less returns it to a neutral state, and makes it more vulnerable to contention rolls. There is also the Olympics card, which makes a universal truce for a round, which is great if you need a breather in the game to consolidate your gains, but can be disruptive if you've been preparing a big move which now has to wait another round. The setup also makes sure the Olympics is on the first round, so it has somewhat of a built-in tutorial to allow players to get the gist of a turn before targeting one another.

The four influence types counteract one another, but not in a rock-paper-scissors way: instead they have unique ways of interacting with the board and other players. Diplomatic influence deals mostly with how cities are connected to one another, and a disconnected city cannot use the influence or actions available to it; this influence can strike anywhere and limit the options available to other players. Economic influence doesn't gain more influence, but does allow it to be moved to where it's most effective, making it more efficient; furthermore they allow players to take the influence of others as well as being a requirement for each building card. Cultural influence is more defensive in nature, and helps defend against both contention rolls and adversity cards; on the flip side, players can use it against opponents to get more revolt tokens, and is the only type which can modify rolls due to adversity cards, acting as an alternative to contention rolls. Finally, military influence is able to remove effects from all influence types from a city, but its gains are the most vulnerable from all influence types as well, making it have a more easy-come-easy-go effect.

Players will need to select which influence types to focus on as the game goes on, and might need to change based on the available resources and actions of other players. Trying to focus on all four types will generally just mean you're weak in all four, whereas focusing exclusively on one leaves you very vulnerable to the other three types. Most of the time focusing on two and dabbling in a third is the way to go; stockpiling the influence type not being used can help defending against contention rolls of that type. Since up to half of the players can win a game, cooperating with other players and trading for the influence you need is the best way to make sure you're prepared for what comes up next.

The instruction manual is set up in a learn-as-you-go format, so you perform steps as you read them rather than having to read the whole thing before starting the game. Relevant rules are referenced as you go through a section, so you know what to read when. A quick-reference sheet is on the back of the manual, the setups for the various maps are in the first opened page, and the rules for how Contention Rolls affect the game board are in a distinctly styled page where the staples are, so the frequently referenced rules have quick access. There is also an appendix which gives an example of each game component, some historical context, as well as suggestions on how the game components interact with one another.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Flitterkiste
description:
Whether you’re newly in love or already married: turn your everyday life into an experience and have a fabulous time full of fun and closeness. Because this game is all about you!

Flitterkiste is a legacy game for two people who love each other. It offers a completely new gaming experience – because the challenges are played for and with each other in everyday life. As a gift, it suits any occasion and can be combined with other presents.

How to play and win:
On your turn each of you draws a secret card with a task from the shared deck. You can solve it within a few days. After this period, you draw the next card. Completed tasks reward you with hearts – the currency of the game. You collect them and can use them to unlock added content and gifts. It is your choice. There are ten locked chapters within the chronicle. When you open and complete the last chapter both of you win the game.
In between you will receive shared cards. They are not secret, and you can solve the challenges together at any time. They will help you to change the rules of the game and give you bonus hearts.

The perpetual calendar always gives you an overview of what is next in the game. He functions as a game board, because this is where you can see your progress and record your goals.

During play you will write, paste over or use up cards and other components. This is how the Flitterkiste develops further and adapts to the interests of the couple.

Components:
133 Unique cards
76 Pages game book
1 Perpetual calendar
31 Sticker
2 Game markers
& lots of love
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Physical Removal, Team-Based Game
publishers: Raphael Meyersieck und Jan Schmitz GbR

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Ironjawz – Brutes
description:
Lumbering, heavy-set creatures with furrowed brows and heavy armour, orruk Brutes are unconcerned with the complex things in life. Their minds are filled with one thing only - violence. Bigger and harder than most warriors of the mortal realms, Brutes fill out the warclans in a seemingly endless tide of green skin, angry shouting and tiny-minded aggression. After all, as they say – if smashing it ain’t working, get more boys to smash it with! Brutes seek out the largest enemies – or trees, or walls – that they can find, and set about them with determination, often being joined by dozens more, all clamouring to bring down whatever enemy (or object) has the temerity to be bigger than them.

This multi-part plastic kit contains the components you’ll need in order to assemble five orruk Brutes! Festooned with trophies of war, featuring massive metal or bone jaws, they can be armed with two choppas, or a double-handed jagged gore-hacka. One in five can be armed with a massive gore-choppa, and one model can be assembled as a Brute Boss, armed with either a boss choppa or a boss klaw and brute smasha. 102 Components in total, with 5 Citadel 40mm Round bases.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Start Collecting – Ironjawz
description:
Huge, hulking brutes, much taller and broader than a man, the Ironjawz rumble across the mortal realms in search of a good scrap. To them, nothing is so pleasing as the sound of battle – blades on metal, screams of the dying, the clamour and rattle of absolute violence is music to their ears. The most fightsome of all orruks, the Ironjawz are rightly feared all across the realms as their numbers swell and their Waaagh! grows ever larger.

This is a great-value box set that gives you an immediate collection of fantastic Ironjawz miniatures, which you can assemble and use right away in games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar! You’ll receive an Orruk Warchanter, three Orruk Gore-gruntas, ten Orruk ‘Ardboyz and an exclusive Ironjawz Warscroll Battalion rules sheet, allowing you to collect, assemble and play with your new miniatures right away!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Firma Kids
description:
This fun family board game will teach the entire family entrepreneurial skills! Children will comprehend how companies operate. They will understand how companies make money and why some companies are more, and others less successful.

Firma Kids is the ideal tool for quality and pleasant socializing. While your child runs his or her first imaginary company, you will proudly watch him or her acquire knowledge that he or she will possess for the rest of his or her life. Firma Kids is a great choice which will give your child abundance of knowledge that he or she can use throughout his or her life.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income

name: Marching Order: Master of the Onyx Tower
description:
“Drink up, my friends, for we cannae foretell who will survive the night.”

Grunheld slams a frothing pitcher of ale onto the table. The northerner is either a happy drunk or a mean drunk, and there is never any telling which you might get. It looks like you are lucking out tonight, which is good. You don’t have much coin left to spend, and your mug is almost empty.

“That’s right, you southern softbellies. Ever since the Onyx Tower appeared outside of the city walls a fortnight ago, people have been disappearing every eve. The guard won’t talk about it, but each morning, another person fails to return home. Some claim to have seen weird shadowy beasts howling through the streets in the wee hours of the night. Gossip it may be, but I’ve seen stranger things and have no wish to test my luck.”

Take your Rogues to a strange wizard’s tower and pillage everything in sight! Ponder orbs! Deal with fecal covered imp dens! Live your best Rogue life!

“The Master of the Onyx Tower” introduces two new characters- The Northman Berserker and the Wizard’s Apprentice. In addition, it brings you Dusty Balls tavern, for when you get kicked out of your regular watering holes. The greatest thing about Dusty Balls is it has booze to go, so your Rogues never have to adventure sober again!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Time Travel Entertainment, Inc.: Robot Pack – Arts & Games
description:
The multimedia conglomerate Time Travel Entertainment. Inc. has developed new technologies for their advanced robots. These new robots have the ability to create art and play games, adding more skills for the audience to enjoy.

Two new robots for Time Travel Entertainment, Inc..
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: I Guess This Is It: Denial
description:
The conversation stops. You sense that this break is deeper than it appears. The conversation picks back up, but it's different now.

Four new Story cards with the Denial symbol, for I Guess This Is It.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Towns
description:
Starting from a small town, will you be able to develop your civilization with constructions and discoveries until you get to build the Statue of Liberty ?

During the game you will have to manage your resources to build and upgrade your villages, you will have to advance your civilization, sometimes you will have to fight to attack the enemy or defend yourself.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: A Sea of Fog and Fire: The Battle of Heligoland Bight, August 28, 1914
description:
“There straight ahead of us in lovely procession, like elephants walking through a pack of dogs came Lion, Queen Mary, Princess Royal, Invincible and New Zealand. How solid they looked, how utterly earth quaking. We pointed out our latest aggressor to them and we went west while they went east and just a little later we heard the thunder of their guns.”—Rear Admiral W.S. Chalmers.

A Sea of Fog and Fire is an introductory level wargame simulation on the first surface naval action between the Royal Navy and that of Imperial Germany in WWI. The game design is meant to be simple and highly playable, yet one that portrays the historical challenges facing the combatants.

Players alternate moving their ships and resolving combat after determining initiative and random events for the turn. Combat includes fire, torpedo and mines. Each unit represents 1 vessel, a turn is approximately 45 minutes of time and hex is a half mile across. Play is very interactive, fast playing and true to the history.

Each copy of A Sea of Fog and Fire is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch maps
202 single-sided, un-mounted units
One Players' Aid Sheet
Eight pages of rules

A six-sided and a ten-sided set of dice is also needed to play the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: ADMAN
description:
It’s the 1960s. Each Player is at the helm of a zoomy Advertising Agency on New York’s Madison Avenue. They compete to acquire the Advertising Accounts of major brands spending millions of dollars each year on advertising. There are 32 Accounts with annual Ad Budgets ranging from $1 million to $10 million.
Your Personnel are the key to success in the ad game. To aquire accounts you must employ both ‘Creatives’ and Account handlers (business types known as ‘Suits’). This will require strategic risk-taking in the deployment of the Agency’s two resources: Personnel and Working Capital.

Players may choose any of four different Strategies for playing the game: Ethical, Co-Operative, Payola and Peacenik. Each strategy involves both an upside and downside and may be abandoned or switched during the game.
The winner of the game is the first Player to acquire Accounts whose Advertising Budgets total $50 million or more. Or you can impose a time limit, the winner being the one commanding the most Advertising Budgets at the end of play. The maximum possible target is $80 million, which could take a long time.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Torch & Shield
description:
DESCEND INTO A WORLD FORSAKEN TO THE DARKNESS

In Torch & Shield, Dwarven steel clashes during fierce confrontations between rival clans in the ruined halls of the fallen Dwarf empire. Within the sealed vaults lies treasure unimaginable, and each clan believes it is theirs to take. Oaths have been sworn, and feuds will be born in blood that will last a century. But the Dwarves have more to worry about than each other. Ancient enemies have awoken in the lower levels and foul beasts still hunt in the dark halls eager to feast on Dwarven flesh.

In the Torch & Shield miniatures game, you will assemble and control a hardy delving crew from one of the twelve great Dwarf clans and head into your ancestral underworld to claim the gold within. You must choose your equipment well and carefully weigh your tactics if you are to defeat your rival kinsmen and get to the riches before they do. Most of all you must keep your torches burning, for when all the lights go out the monsters will come from the deep.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Telepathy TongTong
description: Telepathy TongTong is a warm empathy board game that allows families, friends, and lovers to learn what they think through sound and form a consensus. Can we hear the same sound and think the same thing? If you hear the same sound and select the same token, you succeed, and if you select at least one other token, you fail. Send telepathy to the person next to you now. Telepathy, TongTong!
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Voting

name: Skin Scuba
description: Skin Scuba refers to scuba diving. It is a simple set collection game where you can become a diver and meet various animal friends in the cool sea. Players become divers, move through oxygen, dive, and meet fish. Fish have a special method of calculating scores by color. Whenever you collect fish by type, you can meet special animal friends. There are fish that have a big advantage, and there are fish that have a small advantage, but can keep the other person in check. But it's not easy. You have to avoid scary sharks, too! Who will be the best diver?
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection

name: Trick or Treat
description:
Open your box, examine the contents, and begin solving the puzzles behind this Halloween mystery!

Some components include QR codes that will need to be scanned with a phone or tablet. This will lead you to more clues or evidence about each case via the internet. You might also be asked to visit websites, send e-mails, etc as part of your investigation.

Summary: Hyde Manor is one of those places in Valley Falls that is notorious for its reputation as a haunted house. The house is abandoned, in a serious state of disrepair, and should have been condemned long ago. But, tonight, on an evening when the air is crisp and filled with the acrid smell of burning leaves, there is a light on in one of the downstairs windows. Tonight...on Halloween night!

As president of the Neighborhood Watch, do you investigate and try to figure out what is going on at Hyde Manor? What will you find at the bottom of this Halloween mystery?

This is a special seasonal One-Time Box for Halloween and is not part of the subscription service.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Wrench's Great Big Helper Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2023!

Text on the card:
Wrench's Great Big Helper
Prize

When you win this Prize, add it to the Prize Bin, then discard your hand and draw that many cards from your Character Deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Gemwielders: Tome
description:
A brand new Gembearer (starting deck) for Gemwielders Deckbuilding Game. It comes with two handy cards to track life and power.

Tome is a Gembearer for those who like to construct a sizable deck, packed with powerful abilities. Not only does it offer direct access to the gem card deck, it enables you to shuffle your discard pile at will, and thereby use your shiniest powers as often as possible.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Circle of Power
description:
Circle of Power is a free mecha-themed print & play game that you can play using ANY deck of cards. Yes, ANY! Print out a Fighter sheet for both players, grab some dice and cards, and you’re good to go!

Each Fighter has various Parts that they can activate. Attach cards to Parts to Charge them up. Once they're ready to go, Discharge them to unleash their effects, allowing you to do things like attack your opponent or disrupt their card economy. Discharging also generates Gauge, which you can later spend to activate more powerful effects. Reduce your opponent's life to 0 to win the game!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Variable Player Powers

name: Flieg, Dino
description:
Flieg, Dino is a cooperative game about the world of feelings. Together with the flying dinosaur Tika, kids learn to explore and identify different emotions and learn how to deal with them.
‘Scene cards’ picture various scenarios showcasing different emotions (joy, sorrow, anger, fear, pride and shame). By rolling dice, players are trying to match the shown emotions to acquire feathers. The objective of this game is to gather enough of these feathers to enable Tika to finally fly and escape a rumbling volcano.
Furthermore, some of the ‘Scene cards’ also address the topic of addiction, and emotions which may come up for kids confronted with those topics.
This game was developed in cooperation with NACOA, and its usage is intended for Kindergartens. Kindergarten teachers can utilize Flieg, Dino to introduce children to the topic of addiction in a safe, pedagogical and easy to grasp way. Simultaneously kids are encouraged to talk about their feelings in a playful environment.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Torfitz
description:
Torfitz is a management game about structural change developed for students of ninth grade or higher, university students, and apprentices.

Players take on different roles (such as citizen, mayor, entrepreneur, etc.) and are confronted with different tasks. Together, from their character’s perspective, they have to communicate and develop ideas for projects. Afterwards, they have to present their ideas to a committee, which chooses the best ideas on the basis of different criteria. During that selection, a shift of perspective happens, because players have to slip in different roles as part of the committee.
The exchange of arguments in constructive discussions and finding compromises creates a competency development in democratic, social and environmentally sustainable reasoning.

Torfitz can be played with 6 to 30 players. There are 3 different variations of the game with varying complexity and game durations of 45 min, 60 min and 90 min. Game and rules are set to allow a smooth start into the game requiring no previous knowledge and minimal effort.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Sense of Time
description:
Honorable gentlemen and brave ladies skillfully wrestle with robots for energy!

Everyone competes at the same time to get as much energy as possible. They react to their opponents in real time and make tactical decisions in seconds that decide victory or defeat.

Sense of Time is a real-time strategy game in which two to four players play against each other.

Everyone plays at the same time, you don't have to wait for your turn.

Each player has five robots, the robots are hourglasses and can be moved across the field whenever an hourglass has expired.

With the robots you try to conquer batteries and bring them into your own area on the game board to get an energy. But you can also steal energy from your opponent.

When the robots meet on the board, dice decide the outcome of this encounter.

A game runs over 4 phases of 10 minutes each. Depending on the phase, you can have different numbers of robots on the field.
Whoever has the most energy at the end of the last phase wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Real-Time

name: Achô!
description:
Achô! is a 9-in-1 card game that offers multiple ways to play and grows with your child. In this little box, you will find fun and the development of specific skills for various age groups.

Each game mode is designed for a specific age, offering just the right amount of fun and challenge!

Some games included:

Achô!
Flip cards and show them to your little ones. They must get the name of the figure right, which can have additional details such as color and size.

WHERE DID IT GO?
Show some cards and then turn them face down. Your little ones should try to remember where the requested card ended up.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Game of HAM: Into the Heart of Emotion – Volume 1
description:
This is a serious set that aims to capture strong emotions within each of its cards. Some of the cards can be slightly poetic, and all try to capture the essence of a type of emotion. Bring powerful cards to your game night for the right mix of emotions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – X Ways to Say "I Love You": Volume 1
description:
As the name suggests, the theme for this set is the ways to say “I love you”; this can be sweet, like breakfast in bed, or sour, like a black eye. Who and what we love changes, and we all have unique ways of showing it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – X Ways to Say "I Love You": Volume 2
description:
As the name suggests, the theme for this set is the ways to say “I love you”; this can be sweet, like breakfast in bed, or sour, like a black eye. Who and what we love changes, and we all have unique ways of showing it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – Rose-Colored Glasses: Volume 1
description:
Imagine everything happy and sweet thrown into one box, and you know what this set contains. This could mean a lot of wholesome cards in a round of play, or it can easily turn into throwing puppies to a shark. You can decide.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Game of HAM: Pocket HAM – Volume 1
description:
As a standalone expansion, it’s not a full game, but you can play it on its own. Like the Adult Set, it's for people who like their coffee the way Scrooge does, dark and bitter. However, this content has some cream and sugar, so it doesn't get quite as dark.

—Bill S. Naim
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: The Great Rat Wars
description:
The Great Rat Wars is an all-vs-one tactical skirmish game in which one player controls an army of mutated Rats trying to take over New York City. The rest of the players must work together as small squads of Human characters to defend the city and push their Rat overlords back to where they came from.

The Rat player will have to make difficult decisions on where to send their soldiers and which Humans to target. They will have a lot of power at their finger tips, but how they use it will be the difference between victory and defeat.

The Human players will be taking simultaneous turns, interweaving their skills and their maneuvers to create strong combos and deal out massive damage. Their path to victory is paved with cooperation - the Humans are strongest while working together.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Timer, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Template, Moving Multiple Units, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Antwerpen (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: A mini expansion for Carcassonne inspired by the city of Antwerp, Belgium. no additional rules are made for this expansion. It contains 9 tiles with drawings of famous Antwerp landmarks like City Hall, Brabo statue, cathedral of Antwerp and more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Venn Card Game
description:
Venn is a bluffing card game.

With only three different types of cards, this colour based card deck has two completely different card games that are quick to learn.

'Venn Classic' is game one and 'Venn Party' is game two.

In both games, there is no such thing as a bad hand or a weak card, winning and losing are down to how you play. You’ll need to bluff in order to prevent your opponents from winning easily, but bluff too much and you’ll be easily found out.

The object of Venn Classic (game one) is to find cards of a certain colour while stopping your opponents from doing the same. The game is played in rounds and at the end of each round, cards are lost. The last player to have cards in their hand is the winner.

The object of Venn Party (game two) is to push a card to a player while stating a colour and get the receiving player to incorrectly guess if they are telling the truth or not. The game is played in rounds and at the end of each round, one card is discarded. The game ends when all cards have been used and the winner is the player with the fewest cards in front of them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Sundered Fate
description:
Deep in the deadly Gnarlwood forest lies the Ravening Ruin – the shattered remains of a mighty Seraphon temple ship. Within the ship's broken hull lie artefacts of immense power and treasures of incalculable wealth. The Chameleon Skinks of the Hunters of Huanchi are determined to defend these secret wonders from those who would claim them, skulking from the shadows to ambush any invaders – but the followers of the Jade Obelisk do not seek to claim the Seraphon's secrets. Instead, these accursed iconoclasts wish to destroy the ancient relics, smashing them to rubble at the behest of their god, the Speaker in the Stone.

The first expansion for the new edition of Warcry has arrived, bringing with it two new warbands – the sinister Jade Obelisk and the stealthy Hunters of Huanchi – along with a host of carnivorous Gnarlwood terrain. In addition to these models, you'll find a double-sided game board with matching artwork, a book with background information and the rules for both warbands and the included terrain pieces, and a set of battleplan and warband cards to keep your games running smoothly.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: メイドマフィアK (	Maid x Mafia x Kai)
description:
A long time ago, the British Empire colonized the world and propagated the consumption of tea. The british forces were eventually repelled by a small country in the Far East. And so, tea was banned as it had grown to become a symbol of the british imperialism in many countries. However, people who couldn't resist the allure of tea secretly had tea brought to their homes by mafia organizations and held tea parties. The mafia members in charge of delivering tea were dressed in maid uniforms. They became known as "Maid Mafia."

Maid x Mafia x Kai is the second game in the serie after the first Maid x Gun x Tea which was a smaller scale prototype.

Battle on the map of Kobe with your fellow players. First player to reach 25 points on the score track win the game. Gain points by smuggling tea in a pick-up and delivery gameplay and bringing them from the ports/warehouses to the shop that will serve it. Hire additional maids that will share their movement points to deliver more tea and battle henchmen or other player's maid with the use of the confrontation card system.
But be careful, you are all part of the same organization so attacking another player will brand you as an enemy. Yet, among the many actions at your disposal, it may sometimes be the best option. Happy smuggling!
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Scribble Pirates
description:
The legendary pirate 'Golden Hook' has disappeared! Countless treasures he left behind are buried in this island and that island!
4 pirate captains fighting for treasure island! Whose pirate crew will become a legend?

In Scribble Pirates, each player becomes a pirate boss, protects your own pirate ship, destroys the opponent's pirate ship, captures the treasure island, and develops your base to earn points. The game ends and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Agemonia: Gaming Den Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

A new City event card. Shuffle into the corresponding deck and proceed as normal.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shipping Showdown
description:
Shipping Showdown is a two player card game where players are competing to pack up and ship off valuable items. The goal of the game is to pack and ship each item based on the criteria needed for that specific item using materials. Players strategically will build up their packages but must be cautious of attacks other players place on them.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Novice Dagger Promo
description:
The Novice Dagger is a promo gear that was included with the First Run Collector's Edition of the Novice (Resculpt) miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

Novice Dagger (weapon, melee, dagger, bone, deadly) - If you are a Novice when you critically wound with this, inflict 1 additional wound and gain a deflect token. Limit, once per attack.

A Novice is a survivor with 1 or less hunt XP; a living glossary card is added to provide this definition.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Pónilegelő
description:
The Pony Meadow is a fun, developmental board game.
During the game, participants fill a pasture of 5x5 fields with ponies and hay bales.
The game involves playing out sets of cards from the cards in hand, with the construction of a fence being mandatory. If the fence comes around before the players fill it with ponies, the players lose, if they manage to fill 5x5 fields before the fence comes around, the players win.

A Pónilegelő egy különleges, vidám, szórakoztató és fejlesztő társasjáték, amely az együttműködésre tanít, a játékosoknak közösen kell megtölteniük a legelőt pónikkal és szénabálákkal, mielőtt a kerítés bezárulna a rét körül. A játékosok csak együtt nyerhetnek, ezért a lehető legügyesebb módon kell segíteniük egymásnak, hogy kedvenc lovacskáik szabadon barangolhassanak a mezőn. A játék során a résztvevők egy 5x5 mezőből álló legelőt töltenek meg pónikkal és szénabálákkal, miközben versenyt kell futniuk az idővel, mert a rét körül folyamatosan épül egy kerítés. Minden egyes parti más, mert a pónik, a szénabálák és a kerítés elemei véletlenszerűen követik egymást, ráadásul a pónik letételéhez a résztvevőknek össze kell dolgozniuk. Nagyon fontos, hogy ebben a játékban a gyerekek csak közösen tudnak nyerni, így nem kell egymást legyőzniük! A játékot könnyen magunkkal vihetjük bárhová, így a család és a barátok bármikor összeülhetnek egy kis legeltetésre. A Pónilegelő csapatjáték, ahol a játékosok közösen küzdenek az idő és a balszerencse ellen. Az együttműködés fontosságára tanít, és arra, hogy csak a közösen hozott döntések lehetnek eredményesek. Fejleszti a problémamegoldó készséget, a kommunikációs képességeket és a logikát is.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Oath To Embers
description:
Introducing Oath to Embers, a groundbreaking strategy campaign game designed for 1-4 players, where every move counts and narrative choices shape your destiny. Experience the thrill of unparalleled gameplay with our innovative card combo mechanic, ensuring each session is as exhilarating as the last.

Set in the captivating realm of Astyria, players are thrust into a world embroiled in chaos following the assassination of the revered King of Beornallye by his trusted General. As a band of Heroes answering the King's Call, embark on a journey of self-discovery and unravel the mysteries of your past in a captivating voice-acted narrative.

Navigate through a 4 Acts of Storybooks, where every decision leads to thrilling Encounters. Engage in multi-phase battles on ever-changing boards, where players delve into a rich legacy story, acquiring new skills, loot, and even memories that permanently alter your character, ensuring each playthrough is unique.

Discover the game's hallmark feature: the revolutionary combo card mechanic. With just six cards in your hand, and hundreds of cards to unlock for your character, there are endless possibilities to adapt your strategy to overcome any challenge. Engage in intense battles on the board, with Heroes facing off against Enemies amidst the fluctuating conditions of the "Battleflux" cards at the board's center.

Choose from six distinct Heroes, each with their own story arcs and unique abilities, ensuring diverse and exciting gameplay experiences. With multiple branching paths and outcomes, coupled with the dynamic mechanics of each Hero, no two adventures are ever alike.

Enhance your journey with our companion app, providing immersive storytelling, original music, and over two novels' worth of voice acting to guide you through this epic RPG experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing

name: D.E.I.: Divide et Impera – Christmas in Old London
description:
The great Jukas decided to revive an ancient Christmas tradition, in order to convey some hope in these trying times. He has disguised himself as Santa Claus and prepared a set of Gifts for the people of Old London’s Outposts, who do so much to help the city’s population. Unfortunately, he is unable to deliver these gifts himself, so he has enlisted the assistance of Factions of survivors to deliver his gifts to the Outposts in exchange for valuable Supplies!
Will you assist him in his great cause?
—description from the publisher

Jukas, from Runar, has decided to play the role of Santa Claus, delivering gifts to the less fortunate outposts of Old London. Your scrappers can deliver his gifts in exchange for precious supplies, which are the key to victory in D.E.I..
—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Three Dimensional Movement

name: ZynVaded! EVO
description:
ZynVaded! EVO is a 1/1 scale miniatures game unlike any you’ve likely seen before because you literally fight battles on a tabletop (or desktop, or countertop, or wherever) set in our own world! In it, you control a team of inches-high, insectile aliens or their enemies, waging war on our planet. The battles are fought on one cluttered surface at a time, and since there is no need to buy any outside terrain for this, or any other ZynVaded! EVO - based game, any items around your home can represent the obstacles the different Factionz face. Besides each other, of course.

If you've never played a miniatures game or are new to the hobby, ZynVaded! EVO is PERFECT! An easy to learn, fun game with models that look like they just came out of a Saturday morning cartoon make ZynVaded! EVO a hit for gamers of all ages! For those who come from other figure-based tabletop games, ZynVaded! EVO will seem familiar but totally more fun!

A D10 system using 2 dice rolls to determine combat results, simple model stat lines and easy to learn Rulez, games of ZynVaded can be played almost anywhere in 20 - 30 minutes with minimal setup. With ZynVaded! EVO there is a surprisingly rich story as well as a whole lot of fun to be had painting the models.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Random

name: Wombo Combo: Paper, Scissors, Rock
description:
Wombo Combo: Paper, Scissors, Rock is a quick trick-taking game that combines Rock, Paper, Scissors strategy with comboing, and team fight tactics.

Choose a starting suite, rebuttal with a massive WOMBO COMBO, and the player with the highest combined card value wins!
mechanics: Chaining, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Trick-taking
