Diabolical Dave's Rumble Throwdown is a board game that captures the excitement of the golden era of pro wrestling, pitting 3-6 players against each other to vie for the ultimate prize - the DWC World Championship Belt.

Players will start their wrestling careers at the bottom ranks of the DWC. Each round, or weekly ‘event,’ players will face off against a colorful cast of superstar challengers and get rewarded for winning matches with better moves and gear to rise through the ranks from the opener tier to becoming a main eventer. The first player to win and defend the DWC World Championship is the winner!

With over-the-top action, unique superstar opponents, and other players providing move-by-move commentary for every match, DDRT delivers action and humor at every turn.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Race, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Thunder Rolls: The Garage Expansion
description: Introducing the Garage Expansion - the ultimate expansion for THUNDER ROLLS by Richard Launius! Unleash the full potential of your racing experience with over 100 thrilling cards packed into this exciting addition. Upgrade your gameplay with an assortment of new sponsor stickers, a variety of dynamic driver decks, and a revolutionary NDP deck/system that takes the game to new heights of speed and accessibility. With the Garage Expansion, get ready to push the limits of racing fun as you embark on adrenaline-fueled adventures with your friends. Buckle up and prepare for the ultimate race of your life!
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Track Movement

name: Periphery
description:
As personalities enter the cultural scene, inevitably some are pushed to the very fringes of society. But there at the periphery, new bonds are formed as they find their common traits.

The goal of this set-collection game is to attain the lowest score possible by finding cards whose abstract background patterns match each other, and either ending the game while you're ahead, or pushing your luck to maximize the benefits of the sets you close.

With over 2,000,000 possible setups, every game feels different! Randomize or customize to your heart's content!
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Nuvens
description:
In Nuvens ("Clouds"), you and your friends are watching clouds in the park on a nice summer afternoon. Each round, one of the players assumes the role of Cloud Sculptor and must mold shapes with cotton balls to communicate a secret word draft by an app. The other players, one by one, are Observers who try to guess the secret word or pass the turn. However, if the Observer gets lost in his daydreams and takes too long to pass the turn, he will get wet in the rain and lose points. After two rounds, the player who accumulates the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Real-Time, Targeted Clues

name: Ivion: The Falcon & The Snake
description:
Ivion combines the intensity of a fighting game with the strategy of deck-building card games to create an experience unlike any other. In Ivion, your deck IS your character, and you build it from a variety of classes and specializations. Each character type has numerous cards from which to choose, along with wildly different playstyles. Mix and match them to create your own, unique character!

THE FLETCHER is a force to be reckoned with - her keen eye and steady hand make her a master archer, feared by foes and beloved by allies. From tourney to tourney, she travels the realm, winning over the hearts of the people with her exploits and undeniable charm. When the Baron commits his latest act of villainy, she knows that target practice is over. With bow in hand and arrowheads at the ready, she sets out to deliver a message the Baron won't soon forget.

---

THE BARON has earned every scrap of power he clutches. His tactics are as slimy as they are effective - lying, thieving, poisoning - everything must be on or under the table if he wants to sit at the head of it. He didn’t write the rules; he simply realized there are none. After his most recent power grab, one of the peasantry seems to be more agitated than usual… but that’s nothing he can’t smooth over with one of his special glasses of wine.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Whose Turn Is It?
description:
The first player to deplete their hand is the winner! A card can be discarded only if it matches the card already atop the discard pile (in color or face value), but every card also has an additional effect. Look for chances to exploit unique possibilities as they present themselves! You may even get to play some cards out of turn.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Speed Matching

name: Bungu Squad
description:
In Bungu Squad, two players play an abstract strategy game, alternating turns, and trying to get 5 of their mark in a row.

However, the game also uses a deck of cards, and if a player has certain combination in their hand, they can activate the use of erasers, tape, scissors, and glue (or a stapler or compass with rules on the publisher's website), to manipulate both the marks on the board and the board itself.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cookdown: A Food-Based Party Game
description:
In Cookdown, players are high level chefs, put through a gameshow-esque series of tests to be judged by their peers. Whoever wins the most food battles wins! The players are given a hand of different ingredient cards, and two people at a time compete to create a certain type of meal, based on a meal card played for that round.

After choosing three cards from their hand (and accounting for any special rules on the meal card), the competing players reveal their meals, and the discussion begins.

Anyone playing the game can argue for or against either meal, and this discussion session can last as long as people need before all non-competing players have decided who they think is best. All at once, the players vote, and whoever wins gets two points, and whoever loses gets none (in the event of a tie, they each get one).

The game continues as people refill their hands with cards from the deck and the winner of each match competes with the next person clockwise around the circle. Once all the ingredient cards have been used up, the game is over, and whoever has the most points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Bias, Player Judge, Voting

name: King of the Casinos
description:
You're in charge of a Vegas style casino. It's up to you to bring in as much money as you can. In order to do this you'll need to attract visitors to your casino. You'll be able to attract these visitors by building new and exciting amenities, but watch out, your rivals will be doing the same thing! As the casino boss, you'll be able to expand the four essential casino areas: Gambling, Drinking, Entertainment and Dining.

On your turn, you'll choose how to use your buying action. You can improve your casino, pave a parking lot, or select an available special. You'll only be able to select one per turn so you'll want to plan wisely. Then after all have gone, the visitor deck is dealt out and the casino with the most matching symbols brings in that visitor. Income and rewards are collected after the deck is dealt, and then you set up the marketplace for the next round. Sound simple right?

The game starts with the first era in Old Vegas when times were simple and casinos can get by with basic slots and a simple bar. You'll play each era 3 times before moving on to the next one. As the new era is revealed, new options will open for you and your rivals to build. New visitors are also added to the game as it continues. They'll be looking for more sophisticated casinos. You'll need to make sure to build the newest options available to continue to keep your doors open. The game also adds in specials to keep you on your toes and each game different than the last.

After the last turn is played on the final era all the money is counted up and the casino who raked in the most is proclaimed the winner!

Do you have what it takes to be King of the Casinos?

-description from designer
mechanics: Income, Market, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Napoléon Saga: Aide de Camp
description: This third expansion for Napoleon Saga gives you the chance to completely revamp your Strategy Decks. You can implement new tactics for the five armies already available and also surprise your opponents on new terrains to achieve new Objectives. This expansion is updated with erratas and modifications developed with the help of the Napoleon Saga player community.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Crónicas Nemedias
description:
A highly thematic card game in which you will step into the shoes of a hero to experience adventures in the Hyborian Age.

Each game is a mission that in turn is divided into 2 or 3 adventure phases. The hero travels through adventure cards, encountering dangers and various situations. Every decision you make will condition your progress through the game.

—description from the designer

Juego de cartas muy temático en las que te meterás en la piel de un héroe para vivir aventuras en la Era Hiboria.

Cada partida es una misión que a la vez se divide en 2 o 3 fases de aventura. El héroe va viajando por cartas de aventura, encontrándose con peligros y situaciones diversas. Cada decisión que tomes condicionará tu avance por el juego.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Smurfs: Hidden Village
description: In The Smurfs: Hidden Village, players are Smurfs who are tasked with rebuilding the mushroom village from scratch following the evil sorcerer Gargamel's latest scheme. To succeed, you need to work together as a team, collecting resources, building inventions, and locating missing Smurfs to help rebuild mushroom houses. Each Smurf has a unique set of skills that you must use strategically to outsmart Gargamel and his cat Azrael.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Corporate Onboarding
description:
Corporate Onboarding is a solo journaling game all about navigating corporate bureaucracy. Players use a standard deck of cards and two six-sided dice to create an evolving map of their new office as they try to find the six bosses they need to report to.

Along the way, they will encounter random events in rooms that are generated based on their cards and dice rolls. These will impact how they play the game and how quickly they can achieve success.

Players can also be reprimanded by HR and will need to deal with the reprimands as they arise - if they fail to do so adequately they will end up with a warning. If a player receives five warnings they are fired and lose the game.

Corporate Onboarding includes two A4 tri-fold pamphlets (that can be printed at home) and is based on the Firelights game system.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Whoops
description: With a strong, but if possible not too energetic snap, the players set their colored marbles on their way. The middle lane serves as a launch ramp, on which the balls accelerate to roll over as many waves as possible after a turn. The up to four players take turns with one of their marbles each. Three scenarios are possible after the start: The ball can 1. get stuck in one of the troughs on the left or right track as hoped (the further it gets, the better), 2. come to rest at the front of the ramp or 3. in the Groove getting stuck at the end of the ramp. The large metal ball serves as a joker - each player may use it once per game to move opponent's marbles out of the way or into the penalty groove or to bring their own marbles forward.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Balloons
description:
Oh, no! The greatest balloons party of all time was about to start when, all of a sudden, the balloons got mixed up. You and your friends are in charge of selecting the balloons that better fit the party.

Balloons! is a kids game where you'll have to be the quickest collecting balloon cards in order to win. Everyone plays simultaneously, so laughter and craziness are a given!

This game is adapted to people with visual impairments, as all the balloons have unique colours and shapes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching

name: Celtic Animal Knot Dice
description:
Work cooperatively with your fellow players to complete a beautiful Celtic knot design.

Each turn, you take a new rolled die and add it to your personal pool, then either add one of your dice to the shared design or throw out your die. But if the players throw away 3 dice total, they lose.

Once you complete the design, all remaining dice are thrown away - so you need to complete the design using almost all of the dice. You also need to complete the 3 goals (chosen to set the difficulty level of each game) in order to declare it a win and move on to the next level.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Variable Set-up

name: Dragoon: Bard-Barian
description:
The awesome folks at Lay Waste Games collaborated with Pat Rothfuss to create the almighty Bard-Barian to help raise awareness of Worldbuilders!

Swap out your base Barbarian with this Bard-Barian for enhanced storytelling and singing to defeat foes.

Solid metal! Comes with 3 unique rules that enhance your vocal chords and storytelling.

RULES:

Combat Bard: When rolling for combat, sing a triumphant diddy.
Sea Bard: When riding the ship, hum a sea-worthy diddy.
Level Bard: When achieving level 5, speak an inspirational phrase.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Video Game
description:
A game about how to make a video game
In this game, players play the role of game coders to create and produce games.
There are 4 different consoles in the game, and each player must make 1 game for each of these game consoles.
Coding is done by code cards and each player must complete his coding operation by putting the cards together correctly.
At the end of each coding stage, the player gets points that can be used to purchase different characters from the game market and add them to the game monitor.
The final stage of the game includes testing the game codes. Each player must measure the correctness and accuracy of the codes he used in his turn. In the meantime, some wrong codes may cause bugs or even glitches and cause serious problems in the coding process.
Finally, the game ends by completing the process of making 3 games (1 less than the number of players) and the player who has the most number of correct codes and characters added to the game monitor will win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Multiple Maps, Pattern Building

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Wave 3 Promo Cards
description:
A set of 3 promo cards sent to Kickstarter backers as part of the wave 3 deliveries of Forbidden Fortress. These cards include:

Bandit Sword: Gear, Hand Weapon, Blade. +1 Combat. Once per turn, take D3 Corruption hits to gain an extra +1 Combat. Single hand. One weight. $250

Takobake Katana: Forbidden Fortress Artifact, Hand Weapon, Blade. +1 Combat. Once per fight, gain Fury equal to the number of Corruption and Mutations you currently have. Single Hand. 3 Upgrade slots. one Weight. $550

The Fallen Shogun and 2 Takobake Samurai: Epic Threat Card. Honor Guard - These Takobake Samurai gain 2 free Elite Abilities.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mana Source
description:
For thousands of years nations have fought to control Mana Sources, which are now essential to modern life.
Each nation has unique weapons, talents, and battlefield-warping effects to emerge victorious.
But be careful, each opponent may have a few tricks they've picked up from another nation...

Mana Source is a combat card game of wits and resource management played cooperatively in a story-driven campaign or competitively head-to-head.

Players choose a primary and secondary class, construct a hand of 9 cards, and then utilize attack, talent, and unique nation card types to reduce their opponent's health to zero and win! Each round, players choose a card from their hand to play and resolve them simultaneously. Don't wait for your turn, strategize, coordinate, and act to secure victory!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Game System
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – Yup... That'll Kill You: Volume 1
description:
This expansion has everything that’ll kill you literally or emotionally. Whether it’s “a trigger-happy cop” or “terminal sadness,” you’ll find many tongue-in-cheek ways to die.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – Being Pop Relevant AF: Volume 1
description:
This expansion is for people who want to keep things pop relevant as-fuck... kinda. Pop stuff doesn’t age like a fine wine, so this covers anything that was at one point pop culture. After all, pop today, gone tomorrow...

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Game of HAM: Expansion – Depression Pack: Volume 1
description:
This expansion captures depression in a bottle, or in this case, within a bunch of cards. It's a pack that contains the essence of depression or things that would cause it... after all, if we don't laugh a little about it, we just cry...

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Voting

name: Starclash
description:
Starclash is a base-building battle board game for 1-4 players. Play competitively, solo, or cooperatively! Brimming with asymmetry, play as one of FOUR factions. You must collect resources to create structures and units so you can command your forces and conquer your enemy!

Delve into a lore-rich planatary conflict where you are Commander in your race’s fight to merely exist in a galaxy with few livable planets and many formidable factions vying to carve out a swathe of territory by which they may survive.

The Starclash gameplay experience is very rich, but it boils down to the 3 C’s each turn:
•Collect Biosteel for constructing units and structures. Gather energy to power skills and upgrades.

•Command up to 5 units per turn that can each move, build, attack, and use skills in strategic accord.
•Conclude your turn as you watch your buildings complete construction…and await your adversary’s attack.

Deep on your side of the various maps offered is your base. Balance your offensive strikes with your defensive efforts because you win if you destroy your opponents' base but lose if yours is destroyed!

-description from designer
categories: Economic, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Investment, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Climate Cooldown
description:
In Climate Cooldown, you and your fellow players are cooperatively playing as four regions of the globe to help save the planet from ecological destruction.

The main goal of Climate Cooldown is to cool down our impact on the planet before the Global meter reaches 30. Each region must invest in sustainable power, divest from unsustainable power and heal the land and ocean with climate solutions called “Cooldowns”.

Each round of the game, players begin by drawing their resource cards for their regions. Then, they draw a Disaster card for each region. Next, players go in a circle taking their turn for their region or regions. Players must strategize how to use their region’s energy, water and food resource cards. Players are able to freely trade with one another’s regions during their turns. They can use their resources to invest in Power cards, Cooldown cards, Diplomacy tiles, or divest from Unsustainable Power cards. At the end of each round the Impact meter either increases or decreases the Global meter. There are also land restoration and ocean health requirements that must be met by the end of each round.

To win the game, each of the 4 regions must invest in at least 2 Sustainable Power cards and then divest from an Unsustainable Power card type. Collectively, players must invest in Cooldown cards which can give them Land and Ocean tokens which help to fill all of the slots on the world map. Finally, the Global meter must be brought down into the blue. The Global meter can be lowered once the Impact meter is brought down below zero. If the Global meter reaches 30, it's game over. Players have up to 5 rounds to save the planet.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Corruptcity
description:
Welcome to Corruptcity! We're growing fast, and there are always opportunities for connected people to cash in on the boom. Invest in companies, deliver in-demand goods, and get your family hired into key positions. Can you stay on the right side of the law or will you succumb to the temptation of corruption and easy money?

Corruptcity is a card upgrading and programming game where players can earn money from deliveries, investments, extortion, and police corruption.

The flexible card upgrades and combinations allow for more agency than many programming games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Imperfect Job
description:
One room, multiple candidates, and the opportunity of a lifetime to get a professional hugger job. Do you have what’s necessary to sit through the weirdest job interview? Come on in, discover what strange position you’re interviewing for and answer Human Resources’ questions as best as you can.

In Imperfect Job, you’ll have 30 seconds to answer the questions and convince your fellow candidates that you’re the perfect person for the position. During your speech, you’ll also have to introduce a secret word and, if the other players guess it right, they’ll gain points.

At the end of the interviews you score points for the rounds you won and the secret words you guessed right. The player with most points wins.

Prepare your best elevator pitch and get the job!
mechanics: Player Judge, Questions and Answers

name: Dominion At Dawn
description:
Dominion At Dawn is an immersive two-player strategical print-and-play wargame, where each step is a gamble for survival and supremacy. Takes place in Asteria, a ravaged planet where a devastating conflict between two formidable factions, Tycho Consortium and the Kepler Corporation rages on. It is an extraordinary strategic game that challenges players to outwit and outmaneuver their opponents in a thrilling race for dominance.

Spanning across several battlefields, players take turns deftly positioning their battalions with precision, rolling dice to determine their strength in combat. The victor, who captures or eliminates all enemy battalions first, emerges triumphant from this breathtaking crucible of strategy.

With its intuitive mechanics and meticulously playtested balance, the game provides an engaging and challenging experience for two players, with each typical match lasting between 30 to 60 minutes. As you engage in this thrilling clash of strategies, every turn brings a new surprise and the ever-present risk of defeat.

Launch into this intricate spectacle of aggression and dominance, and decide the fate of Asteria. Let the battle ensue - may the best commander prevail in Dominion At Dawn!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Marajoara
description:
The Marajoaras is one of the names given to the people of the original Brazilian tribe that dates back to the pre-Columbian period, who settled on the island of Marajó and at the mouth of the Amazon River.

The Marajó culture has been known in archaeological studies due to its distinctive pottery.

In Marajoara, players will act as some of these scholars who excavate and restore this majestic art, managing a museum and its collection of Marajoara vases.

Over the course of 14 turns, carry out excavations, restore a large vase, display found vases, earning victory points for your collection. At the end of the game, whoever has the most victory points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Different Dice Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Tales of Myth & Legend
description:
Tales of Myth & Legend is a paragraph book game set in the time of ancient Greece. Players each control a fledgling hero or heroine that has their sights set on power and glory. The players compete not only with each other, but also against the Alexander the Great himself.

In each round of the game, players simultaneously play a movement card that determines how far they will travel. Based on the results, the turn order will be adjusted, with players traveling farther distances going last, and those traveling shorter going first. In turn order, each player visits a city or location and has an encounter there, choosing a type — e.g., political, religion, or strength — based on the types available. The encounter is read aloud to the player, then they have to choose how to proceed.

Tales of Myth & Legend features many surprises and hidden components that are unlocked only based on certain events! With thousands of possible stories and encounters, this is a game you'll be playing for years to come!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Potions
description:
Potions is a roll and write fantasy game in which you will have to create a Magic potion to save the city before the curse catches you.

You take the game sheet, a pen and 2 dice and optionally a character card that influences certain aspects of the game. The dice rolls to mark certain areas on the game sheet on order to generate the resources needed to create the potions and win the game. But certain rolls activate the Crypt Track that will ultimately make you lose the game when completed.

So, welcome, welcome to this epic fantasy game in which you will take on the role of a young magic apprentice who seeks to create a magic potion to save your city from an ancient curse.

The city of Mystical has been cursed for centuries and the only magician who knew the recipe to create the potion, Zoltar the Renegade, has been exiled by the King for refusing to make the potion.

Now you, like Magnus Novice or Aria Novice, must delve into the magic lake, investigate mystical ingredients and overcome epic challenges to find a way to break the curse by creating the King's potion. Will you be able to complete this dangerous mission and become the hero of Mystical?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Radiant: Roster Expansion #2 – The Haunting of Cruach
description:
This roster expansion contains three brand new heroes for Radiant: Offline Battle Arena. Enhance your game with a new teams, new strategies and a deeper, more challenging draft. Una, the Spectral Tyrant, is a Tank hero for whom death is merely a setback. Alyn, the Knight of Blood, is a Warrior hero who comes closer to his monstrous aspect the more blood is spilled. Aurelia, the Living Saint, is a Support hero who channels the power of the divine to heal and enhance her allies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting

name: Radiant: Roster Expansion #3 – Wardens of the White Forest
description:
This roster expansion contains three brand new heroes for Radiant: Offline Battle Arena. Enhance your game with a new teams, new strategies and a deeper, more challenging draft. Grandfather the Eldest, is a Tank hero who shares the blessing of the forest with his allies. Maka the Foundling is a Warrior hero who hunts enemies with stealth and guile. Brighid the Fae Enchantress is a Support hero who weaves enchantments and illusions to confound her foes and protect her friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting

name: Tank Leader: Eastern Front – Designer Signature Edition
description:
Tank Leader: Eastern Front, Designer Signature Edition is a tactical level, two-player game covering armored warfare in the Second World War where formations are activated by playing command cards. This edition is dedicated to the memory of the original game series designer, John Hill, and includes numerous system updates as introduced in later entries of the game series. We have assembled a top-notch group of contributors, including veterans of the game series along with the original designers of Western Front Tank Leader and Desert Steel to deliver numerous enhancements to the game series.

This edition of Tank Leader: Eastern Front is another Classic Reborn! by Compass.

Tank Leader: Eastern Front simulates a variety of tactical situations facing a battalion commander of armored forces on the Eastern Front. It is not restricted to any single battle, area of Russia, or time period, but presents the players with a host of differing situations. Command, control, and communications (C3) is the pivotal factor in the game and is simulated through the use of formation cards which rate units’ C3 abilities. The card play portion of the game is critical, for it determines tactical initiative — who will move first, and how quickly a formation responds to changing situations. Numerous basic and advanced game scenarios are provided.

The game system is reach in detail to recreate tactical armored warfare, and features formation activations and operations, movement and fire operations, morale, tactical doctrine, non-vehicle units, anti-infantry fire, indirect fire, transport, entrenching, overruns, close assault, forward observers, area of operations, German and Soviet tactical doctrine, artillery, random reinforcements, and much more.

This Designer Signature edition represents a culmination of the forward strides made with subsequent games published in the series; Western Front Tank Leader and Desert Steel. Both designers of those subsequent game releases, Leonard Quam and Peter Corless, are collaborating on this new edition of the game along with other veterans of the game series to incorporate advances and refinements to the game system. Expect to see this and future games in the series to be published in the future!

Product Information:

Complexity: 4/6 out of 10 (basic/advanced game)
Solitaire Suitability: 3 out of 10
Time Scale: 60 minutes per scenario
Map Scale: 150 meters per hex
Unit Scale: platoons – 20-30 men, 2-5 tanks, trucks, halftracks, and 3-5 tubes of artillery
Players: two
Playing Time: 3-8 hours depending upon scenario
Components:

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Splash Down
description:
Ahoy traveler! Welcome aboard the Shadow of Endurance, a replica ship based off Ernest Shackleton's pioneering vessel. We're setting sail for the Antarctic waters - hope you brought a camera and attentive gaze. This adventure will be full of animals that breach the ocean surface.

As seafaring guides, we like to up the stakes from time to time. Every trip includes a contest that challenges passengers to spot animals along the way and log them in a ship journal. Creatures earn different points based on rarity, from common species like Krill and Crabs to uncommon species like the mighty Blue Whale. The passenger who logs the highest scoring animals will have contributed the most sightseeing value to the trip, and thus earns the title of Breach Master.

Obtaining this title will not be easy! Animals don't surface predictably and your shipmates are looking for sneaky ways to claim your discoveries for themselves. It's all light-hearted fun until we enter the depths of the deck, where sea monsters dwell and environmental degradation is seen.

Think you have what it takes to win the battle of the breach? It's time to play Splash Down!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Progressive
